name: Royal Group
address: Royal Group, 150 Woodstock Ave, Rutland, VT 05701
category: ['Security system supplier', 'Fire protection equipment supplier', 'Glass & mirror shop', 'Locksmith', 'Safe & vault shop']
text: Had our lock jam at 11pm. Not knowing what to do I called Royal Glass. Agnes showed up within 20 minutes! She had the door open quickly, and my wife and I didn't need to sleep in the car. I would recommend Royal Glass' service to anyone who needs it. A note for Royal Glass, your after hours message says "remain on the line if you are a current customer" this is not very welcoming when you offer 24 hour locksmithing services. I actually hung up the first time and almost didn't call back.

name: Midas
address: Midas, 207 US Route 4 E, Woodstock Ave, Rutland, VT 05701
category: ['Auto repair shop', 'Brake shop', 'Muffler shop', 'Oil change service', 'Tire shop']
text: Had a coupon for an oil change and tire rotation. Made an appointment for 5:30 PM. Got there 10 min early and still had to wait until after 6 PM to get my vehicle in. After I left I noticed my "oil change life" indicator on my GM vehicle had not been re-set which is a nuisance as it's now showing I'm past due for an oil change. Also I thought they would check the air pressure in my tires.....they did not and I found the pressures were way low on two of my tires. Not impressed with the experience.

name: Keyser Energy
address: Keyser Energy, 77 Grove St Suite G102, Rutland, VT 05701
category: ['Heating oil supplier', 'Air conditioning contractor', 'Air conditioning repair service', 'Heating contractor', 'HVAC contractor', 'Oil & natural gas company', 'Propane supplier']
text: Keyser Energy was a horrible oil company to work with in the Rutland area. We were signed up for automatic delivery and we ran out of oil on the coldest weekend to date. We called the main number and did not get an answer so I called the parent company, Dollarwise Oil, and they said someone would call me within 20 minutes. I waited 2 hours and received no call. I called Dollarwise again and got a call an our and a half later. They filled our tank but when we got the bill, the price seemed inflated (called several companies in the area and they were at $2.80 that weekend and we were charged $3.49). I called Keyser during the work week to 1) see if we were charged more because it was an emergency order (even though it wasn't our fault) and 2) what were they going to do to make sure this didn't happen again. They admitted their prices are high and they are trying to work on it and they had given me a $25 voucher. The customer service representative said that to ensure it not happening again, I should watch my oil gauge and let them know when it got low. I told her I signed up for automatic refill so I would not have to watch the gauge, especially now that I have a newborn. After sharing this information with my husband, we decided we no longer wanted to work with Keyser so I called back later in the week to discontinue being a customer. The person answering said she would have someone call me back within the next two days to talk to me more about this. No one ever called. I called the end of the next week and stated my complaint and that I would no longer like to be a customer and would like them to send me a letter stating I was no longer a customer. When I did not get such letter within a week I called again to confirm I was no longer a customer because I did not get the confirmation letter and she stated she saw the note they were suppose to send me a letter, sorry I didn't get it and that in their notes it showed I was no longer an automatic delivery customer. I just got an email in the last couple days (this all happened about a month ago) stating it was confirming we still are an automatic delivery customer. I called and left a message today for someone to call me back concerning this because I do not want them to deliver. I have yet to hear back. Stay away from this company, they have horrible customer service and seem to be lousy managing their business.

name: Norwich University
address: Norwich University, 158 Harmon Dr, Northfield, VT 05663
text: Excellent MBA experience! Professors are challenging and top-notch professionals in their respective fields. Lots of substantive graduate-level APA writing per week. Be prepared to easily average anywhere from writing 3500-7000 words or more per week between separate discussions and challenging individual and team assignments. Don't let the work shy you away from Norwich! After the first few weeks of your first class, I PROMISE you will get used to the hefty workload and pace. Although, I'd be remiss not to mention that despite this, you will still have time for work, decent family life, and a few key friends within reason. Time management is key. However, rest assured over the course of the entire program, the workload will make you a much stronger researcher, critical thinker, and academic writer--you will be ready to "hit the ground running" in your chosen discipline well before graduation. I believe the rigor of Norwich graduate programs will prepare you for the next level of academia--a PhD. If you're not afraid of a few bumps and bruises along the way to higher learning (it will happen), I challenge you to give Norwich graduate programs a try.

name: Red Rock Mechanical, LLC
address: Red Rock Mechanical, LLC, 339 Red Rock Rd, Colchester, VT 05446
category: ['HVAC contractor', 'Air conditioning contractor', 'Air conditioning repair service', 'Furnace repair service', 'Heating contractor', 'Plumber']
hours: [['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: I had such a GREAT experience with Red Rock Mechanical! I literally contacted 6 other mechanics to service our broken AC unit and while others responded with an automated message, a suggestion to just install one of their $4000 units before even diagnosing our problem first, or not responding at all, a REAL HUMAN BEING from Red Rock contacted me within hours of my inquiry and advised they could have a tech to my house within the next 3 days. Tim was on time, efficient, and thorough. I've never had a technician give me so much information and was so appreciative that he took the time to ensure I understood why the AC was functioning the way it was. He had it fixed in no time. 10/10 will be using their services again if the need arises and will absolutely recommend to family/ friends. Thank you thank you.

name: Vermont Woods Studios
address: Vermont Woods Studios, 538 Huckle Hill Rd, Vernon, VT 05354
category: ['Furniture store', 'Art gallery', 'Bedroom furniture store', 'Home goods store', 'Kitchen furniture store', 'Lighting store', 'Office furniture store', 'Outdoor furniture store']
text: The furniture that I purchased (Lyndon table and headboard) has a defective finish. It became tacky and wax like after less than two years. I thought I was getting a high quality product, but the finish in my previous hard wood table that I had purchased from Target ten years earlier had held up better. Buying from Vermont Woods Studios, I thought that I was spending my thousands of dollars on a high quality product that would last a lifetime. I could not believe that the finish had become wax-like after only cleaning the furniture with water or nothing at all. If I could go back, I never would have purchased furniture from Vermont Woods Studios. I am completely disappointed and hope nobody else is duped into believing that their product will last a lifetime. Thank you for your response, Peggy. I would also like to know if the my headboard could also be repaired free of charge since it the finish also took on a waxy texture. Since both the headboard and table had the same issue and became defective, it only makes logical sense that it would be offered that they both be fixed. I had emailed Kelli about this on Sept. 4th at 3:17pm, but the only thing that she responded to me about was about a repair kit. I emailed her again at 3:32 pm that same day, and am waiting for a response.

name: Fiddlehead at Four Corners
address: Fiddlehead at Four Corners, 338 Main St, Bennington, VT 05201
text: I'm late on the reviews for the Bennington area and this is some that deserves a 5 star from me. The one that runs the Facebook page got me all excited about the place the way he comments about his customers so I FINALLY got to go there on September 28th of 2014 to have fun in the chalk vault & look around before cashing out. I don't know how the heck he knew what I was looking for, despite not being there that day but when I was cashing out, the cashier had what I was going to cash out with but it was completely in my favorite color. I was overly excited about it & I made sure to keep it in a safe place so if any friends where I live that likes it, I can easily say that I got it in a place 27-30 hours (1100-1200 miles) north from here. In short, I bought a soap that looked like a big rock & 5 years later, still in a bag surrounded by bubble wrap, and still smell the same as the day I bought it so hopefully it'll be a good way to get some Floridians up there. I cant wait to play (carefully) on the piano and buy something else from Fiddlehead. Thank you from Florida. :-D (Credit goes to: Joey for making me fall in love with Fiddlehead & Nina for being a great cashier that day.)

name: Rutland City Clerk
address: Rutland City Clerk, 1 Strongs Ave, Rutland, VT 05701
text: Awful. If you are lucky to get through or leave a message, they either snark at you or never call back. Dreadful community service.

name: Vermont Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu
address: Vermont Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, 55 Leroy Rd STE 35, Williston, VT 05495
text: Why choose VT BJJ Academy? VT BJJ is dedicated to the development of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu and producing true champions inside and outside the academy. VT BJJ has been developed as a way to communicate the message about the importance of proper and complete Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu instruction taught by IBJJF Certified 7th Degree Carlson Gracie Sr. Coral Belt Instructor; a 5-Times Brazilian National Champion and 2-Times IBJJF World Champion. Safe, Positive and Supportive martial arts training environment. Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu training builds and helps to instill courage and self-confidence. Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu is a lot more than fitness and exercise training. Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu enhances strength, flexibility, balance, coordination and cardio-respiratory resistance and endurance.

name: C L White Glass Inc
address: C L White Glass Inc, 105 Gage St, Bennington, VT 05201
text: Our Main St. shop was vandalized last week at 4 pm in the afternoon. Someone threw a rock and shattered our glass door. Call # 1 to police, call #2 to C L White. Within an hour and a half the door was boarded up and measured. Thanks to C L White for the quick response on a frigid day to make our shop secure and for having the replacement glass installed a few days later.

name: Fireball Transport, LLC
address: Fireball Transport, LLC, 382 Hercules Dr, Colchester, VT 05446
text: I wish I could leave negative stars. Horrible service, horrible attitude and very unprofessional! I was promised the 1st delivery of the morning and my son took off work to accept that delivery. No one called to let us know they decided to come later. When we called to ask what happen, the delivery person was extremely rude and said they would call an hour before the were coming. At 6:00 PM - 9 hours after the promised time they showed up and dropped everything in the garage. Rude, attitude and no apologies about being so late. My son wanted to check the delivery to see if everything was there and they were not waiting. UNBELIEVABLY HORRIBLE SERVICE. I will be contacting Amazon to let them know.

text: I have been under Dr. Michael Sommers Care since 2014-2015. For a year and a half after my horrific accident with an 18 wheeler, I was hunched over, right side of body was crippled. I shuddered, I could not use my right arm! His staff helped me fill out the initial paperwork. Today 2020, my entire life has changed. I have mobility beyond my imagination. My headaches went away. My immune system is healthy, my stuttering disappeared. I’m able to walk my dog. I could go on and on the blessings I have received from Sommers Chiropractic! I am so grateful for you and your staff. With great admiration, Brigitte [herb][hibiscus][herb]

text: This review is for the service and parts department. I have used this location for the last year for service and I have had issues every single time. Every time I call to schedule an appointment no one answers the phone, I leave a message and no one calls back. I request an appointment online, I get a response 2 weeks later. I text the service dept and get no response. I have even gone as far as calling the service and parts desk while sitting in the waiting room and NO ONE picks up the phone. I usually get stuck sitting in the waiting room for 2 hours because they have no loaners available.

name: Portrait Gallery
address: Portrait Gallery, 1500 Hinesburg Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: WOW! Geoff and Wendy did an INCREDIBLE job with our wedding photos!!! We are still in awe! From the start, we knew that great photos were the most important to us, mostly so that family abroad who could not attend would be able to share in our joy. I will be honest - I am a picky bride when it comes to photos! We searched for a photographer who would fit our needs on a limited budget, but who would also deliver high quality photos. We are SO HAPPY to have had Portrait Gallery for our wedding!!! We will be recommending them to all future couples! Not only was Geoff IMMEDIATELY responsive to our first message (and with every single email he replied within a few hours), he also showed us FULL 1500+ photo albums of previous weddings at our venue. This was important because we wanted someone familiar with the location and hoped to see photos in their original form. We were amazed at the albums he created for other couples and decided to book him and Wendy right away! Throughout the course of the year, Geoff was flexible, answering all our questions, and met with us to go over timeline for the day and photos we were looking for. Geoff and Wendy made sure we had every single photo we wanted. They even went to every table to take photos of guests! When we were ready for photos or guests asked to have their picture taken, Geoff and Wendy dropped what they were doing (even mid-bite) to take photos! Shout-out to Wendy for also helping us get ready in the bridal suite and keep everyone calm! A few (very minor) suggestions would be to ensure the background has items removed prior to photos. Our getting ready pictures had some articles of clothing in the background. In some, my hairpiece was falling out (though I am probably the only one to notice), and I do wish we had more photos of the two of us alone in front of our beautiful ceremony archway, but luckily we have hundreds of others to choose from! Geoff and Wendy will always provide photos unique to your wedding, which we are so grateful for! Thank you Portrait Gallery for capturing our memories!

name: ARIS Solutions
address: ARIS Solutions, 72 S Main St, White River Junction, VT 05001
text: Terrible payroll service!! They make mistakes (like don't direct deposit your check because of a computer glitch then send you a check instead that is unsigned) and don't bother to contact you to give you a heads up. They also don't go out of their way to fix the problems (i.e. I have to drive to THEIR office an hour and a half away to get a signature) they won't just cancel the check on their dime (they wanted me to pay to cancel the check!) and fix their mistakes. I have not gotten paid on time multiple times because of their mess ups and they NEVER go out of their way to make it right. This week not getting paid because I had 12pm on my time sheet for midnight instead of 12am. They are idiots. Obviously if start time is 12pm and end time is 7am and I worked 7 hours there should be NO confusion. 12pm is acceptable for midnight. Pm and am is ambiguous for midnight but both can be used. They are awful!!!

name: Lakeshore Hand Surgery Denise Durant MD
address: Lakeshore Hand Surgery Denise Durant MD, 120 Zephyr Rd, Williston, VT 05495
text: Saw Dr Durrant for treatment for my Dupuytrens. She did not offer the treatment I was looking for. In return for my payment, she indicated she would attempt to find the treatment at VUMC or perhaps Dartmouth. She then did nothing. When I inquired, I was told she’d made a call (and basically that was all she was going to do). My voice message from her staff, which I have retained, basically tells me to go find the treatment on my own. I think she’s very unprofessional.

name: Mi Casita
address: Mi Casita, 84 N Main St, St Albans City, VT 05478
text: My husband and I have been there several times now. The food is really nice, the place is kept very clean and the staff is awesome! We especially love the beef flautas topped with tomatillo sauce. But just about everything we have ever had there has been super good and very fresh. Maybe not "authentic" Mexican all the time, but the variety they put into their recipes can not be faulted. The food is simply delicious! So, if you can put rigid expectations on the back burner long enough to try it out, I think you will be very pleasantly surprised and richly rewarded for your openness to new experiences. My husband is a Southern California native who lived in CA for over 42 years and he loved eating Mexican food there. The Mexican food in CA is just like authentic Mexican food because there are many (!) Mexican natives living there. He says that Mi Casita's food is wonderful! Update 10 19 2013: Mi Casita has closed down and will be reopening soon as a sports bar! Big, huge, bummer!!! It was our favorite restaurant in St. Albans. What a letdown!

name: Green Mountain Plumbing & Heating Services
address: Green Mountain Plumbing & Heating Services, 91 Campbell Bay Rd, Swanton, VT 05488
text: I called Allen on New Year’s Day at 7pm. I had a burst pipe and water flooding the basement. I left a message and called four other companies, none of whom could come out. He called back within half an hour, came out promptly and had me up and running 45 minutes later. He was professional, courteous and calm in the face of my absolute panic. I appreciated him coming out so quickly when nobody else would. I would recommend him and plan to use his business for future projects.

name: Burlington Lakeside VA Clinic
address: Burlington Lakeside VA Clinic, 128 Lakeside Ave #260, Burlington, VT 05401
text: I was treated here for 3 years and as far as VA services go this is absolutely phenomenal, the white river junction location is great too. The location is wonderful and easy to get to, its new inside which is nice, and I have NEVER been treated so well as a military veteran. I cannot commend this place enough for its customer service and attitude, the people here really care about their veterans and do the best they can with what they have (often there are staff shortages and lack of funding, like most Veterans programs). It can be hard to get someone on the phone right away, but leaving a message ALWAYS gets me a return call same-day. That being said, like most Veterans clinics its hard to get an appointment. I am lucky enough that my doctor gave me her nurse line in case of emergency and for basic prescription refills, but I am sure that is an anomaly. The wait time is about 60-90 days depending on the season (winter is harder to get appts). Prescriptions can be a bit of a hassle as there is no pharmacy on location, so they have to contract out. This can be irritating as I frequently had the "we arent seeing it in the computer" conversation for my prescriptions. But usually it was remedied in 24 hours or less. I have been treated at 4 different VA hospitals and never received the level of care the Vermont VA center and its affiliates offer. Thank you!

name: Burlington Lakeside VA Clinic
address: Burlington Lakeside VA Clinic, 128 Lakeside Ave #260, Burlington, VT 05401
text: I've left a message every day for the past 4 days trying to get someone to call me back. Update - service has greatly improved.

name: Big Big on the Battenkill Kayak and Tubing
address: Big Big on the Battenkill Kayak and Tubing, 5827 VT-313, Arlington, VT 05250
category: ['Canoe & kayak rental service', 'Canoeing area', 'Raft trip outfitter', 'Rafting', 'Summer camp', 'Swimming lake', 'Water sports equipment rental service']
text: I had a reservation today for me and 6 friends at 1 pm and the owner told me on the phone to find their location pinned at the bottom of their website and I would be brought to a parking service road where they would shuttle us to rent the tubes. We all got there on time and couldn’t find her truck with the “sign” on it as it is a piece of printer paper with the words big big taped on her passenger side window. After waiting almost a half an hour I called her and left a voice mail as no one answered. We eventually drove down the road to where their actually located and caught the owner who said she had been waiting at the beginning of the parking area the whole time and we missed her and to either go back there to flag down her son or go to other place. We sat there contemplating what to do when not even 2 minutes later her son drives up and after I told him what she said he told us we could not get out there for another 45 minutes. Mind you this is now 1 1/2 PAST OUR RESERVATION TIME. The son then told us to make up our minds but they were bush and drove away. Basically we all drove over an hour and didn’t even get to go tubing. All I have to say is what is the point of a reservation if you don’t abide by it, why didn’t she have a better sign or at least a tent or table or SOMETHING NOTICABLE set up and not once did anyone apologize for the disorganization. Would never try them again!

category: ['Post office', 'Logistics service', 'Money order service', 'Passport office', 'Shipping and mailing service']
text: Can just somebody have a nerve to pick up the phone call? I need help for the change of the address! And nobody ever picked up the phone or call me back after I left the message to the answering machine. So terrible place.

name: River Road Veterinary Clinic
address: River Road Veterinary Clinic, 445 US-5, Norwich, VT 05055
text: When my dog got a marrow bone caught on his bottom jaw at 6:00 pm on Friday evening, the staff at River Road were unfazed to see him after hours. They were professional, caring and all was well by 7:30. We feel so lucky to have our dogs cared for - whether for a emergency or for general health check-ups - by the staff at this veterinary practice. River Road Vet Clinic is tops!

name: United States Postal Service
address: United States Postal Service, 495 Falls Rd, Shelburne, VT 05482
category: ['Post office', 'Logistics service', 'Money order service', 'Passport office', 'Shipping and mailing service']
text: Was in line at 2:45 pm for a passport photo and to mail out my application. I was told that the family of 4 in front of me was the last group for photos. Considering that the only passport hours are from 2-3 pm, I would've thought that my single photo would have made the cut. It should be if you're in between the hour you're in. Gosh forbid postal staff having to stay a few minutes later!

name: Trackside Wash & Dry
address: Trackside Wash & Dry, 109 Lake St, St Albans City, VT 05478
text: The only laundromat in town closed already..why? It's 5 pm. Nobody there is going to DO my laundry for me so why can't it be open for SELF SERVICE ?? What a joke. Just pick and choose what times you feel like being open ? A reply would be nice so I can understand the running of this business. I've experienced some rudeness from the one lady employee I ever see there but i just choose to avoid her at all costs but now this... some of us work 1st shift and must do laundry after work..

name: Trackside Wash & Dry
address: Trackside Wash & Dry, 109 Lake St, St Albans City, VT 05478
text: I get at this place at 3:45 pm and they don't let me do my loundry becose they are close

name: Gifford Health Center at Berlin - Primary Care
address: Gifford Health Center at Berlin - Primary Care, 2418 Airport Road - Berlin, Barre, VT 05641
text: As something important as healthcare I am shocked at the lack of reviews. I have been very satisfied with the quality of care my family has received from Gifford. We left UVM after our previous Primary care physician retired. When I call during business hours the front desk picked up maybe 90% of the time and returns your call if you leave a message in about 15 min.

name: Ryder Brook Golf Club
address: Ryder Brook Golf Club, 3266 Laporte Rd, Morristown, VT 05661
text: Very nice 9-hole golf course - rigorous with steep hills, water and bushy hazards. Beautiful views and very green! We went after 3 pm so got a discount on the golfing. However, pull carts were $5 to rent and only the clunky metal ones available. We wanted the exercise and walked (although we're told the a golf cart would only be .50 cents more than a pull cart). Be aware that there was no water to drink on the course, which is tough after climbing up to the third hole. Recommend that you bring your own or enjoy the canteen with very reasonably priced beverages after hole six. We enjoyed the golfing!

name: Vermont Sports Medicine Center - Rutland
address: Vermont Sports Medicine Center - Rutland, 5 Albert Cree Dr, Rutland, VT 05701
text: Excellent, the two therapists I worked with were very knowledgeable and worked hard to get me back to feeling better. They have an app that they use so I can make sure I’m doing my exercises correctly and also send a message to my therapist if needed. They were very responsive through the app to my messages and I appreciate that! Highly recommend!

name: Rutland Veterinary Clinic & Surgical Center
address: Rutland Veterinary Clinic & Surgical Center, 90 E Pittsford Rd, Rutland, VT 05701
text: I brought my cat there to be spayed and they did the pre exam and they where like ok all good we will call you tomorrow to pick her up. They called me the next day to let me know my cat was a male. Went through the whole exam and failed to identify gender. So poorly trained and I want to stress that this is the most expensive place in town. Do your self a favor and go to a cheaper vet that cares about your anamal and will treat you right. This is not the place. Update... i posted this review at about 1:30 pm 6\16th by 3pm they called me. More concern has been shown about this review than was ever shown for my pets.

name: Rutland Veterinary Clinic & Surgical Center
address: Rutland Veterinary Clinic & Surgical Center, 90 E Pittsford Rd, Rutland, VT 05701
text: We were driving through Vermont with no cell service and a very sick dog that had recently suffered an insect bite. She was having an allergic reaction at close to 5 pm. We got these guys on the phone and they were not only waiting for us, but gave wonderful care and called the next day to check on her. If I lived in Rutland I would take her here! Wonderful doctors and a great facility.

name: Rutland Veterinary Clinic & Surgical Center
address: Rutland Veterinary Clinic & Surgical Center, 90 E Pittsford Rd, Rutland, VT 05701
text: 12/6/14 We highly recommend trying laser treatments. We kenneled our two Standard Poodles, Jasper age 10 and Dudley age 6 for two days mid October 2014. Upon picking them up Jasper slipped a disk in his already arthritic back as he and my husband were walking towards the door and collapsed, All four of his paws curled in and he was in full paralysis. We feared he needed surgery or to be put down. Dr Crossman immediately administered a steroidal shot and calmly explained our options. We carried him home at 4:30 PM and hoped for the best knowing that anything we could do in the first 24 hours were critical to his recovery. We tried to get him to pee by holding him up, but he was unable. It was gonna be a long night. I slept on the floor next to him and at 1 AM he finally needed to go out and dragged himself to the door. I helped him walk and had to hold him up because he couldn't stand for as long as was necessary to fully empty his bladder. He also wanted some food and I gave him a Rimadyl. I felt these were good signs even though he was whining from the pain and walking on partially curled feet. The next morning I carried him back in for the first of six recommended laser treatments. Fearful he would fall, I carried him back out. Once home, I took him out of the truck and he hobbled over to a favorite spot and lifted his leg. Another good sign. That first week he went every two days for 8 minutes, after his 2nd treatment he put his front paws up on the desk to say goodbye and on his third treatment the technician assumed this was his sixth treatment because he was trotting out the door. I was elated. Week two brought two more treatments and he started wrestling with Dudley again. By the third week, he had his final treatment and we also noticed he could squat lower to poop than before he was hurt. He also has not needed his Rimadyl since this happened just under 2 months ago. Needless to say we are so thankful he responded so well and that there are alternative options to surgery.Thank you also to the incredibly caring staff who looked out for us and Jasper.

name: Twin State Ford
address: Twin State Ford, 8 Memorial Dr, St Johnsbury, VT 05819
category: ['Car dealer', 'Auto repair shop', 'Ford dealer', 'Truck dealer', 'Used car dealer']
text: Excellent customer services. Travelling down to Mont Washington with myRV I had to stop because of a loud noise. I went to the garage at 6 Pm, no more mechanics was there, the team there, helped me to found a campground for the night and the morning after, at first hour, they took my RV and fixed the issue. Not, excellent but an Amazing service. ( Btw my dog get welcome in thé lobby during the reparation) thank you !!

name: Chainsawr
address: Chainsawr, 1134 Stannard Mountain Rd, Wheelock, VT 05851
text: I needed a couple parts for an old McCulloch chainsaw, I used the contact form on their website to inquire if they had the necessary parts. I received a response within a half hour that they had the parts and they sent me the links to them on their e-commerce site. I promptly ordered them and received the parts in a week. One of the parts was not the correct one. I immediately emailed them and explained the situation and went so far as to send them an email of my old part and the part they sent me. A week went by and I didn't get a response, I emailed them two more times and heard nothing. I went back to their website and found their phone number to which they had a disclaimer stating that they only answer in state phone numbers. I left a voicemail explaining the situation and that I would like a call back, it has been a week since I left a message and still no response from the business. As a last ditch effort I decided to fill out the same contact form that they were so quick to respond to in hopes that someone would get back to me. Once again several days have gone by and I received no response from them. At this point I have given up on doing an exchange or getting a refund. I'm out $60 including the $15 they charged for shipping something first class USPS which didn't cost them more than $5 to ship as I ship stuff all the time. I highly recommend you don't order from this business as once they get your money they are non existent. BUYER BEWARE!!

name: Redstone Lofts
address: Redstone Lofts, 185 Davis Rd, Burlington, VT 05401
category: ['Apartment building', 'Apartment complex', 'Furnished apartment building', 'Student housing center']
text: I lived at the lofts for 2 glorious years between 2014-2016. The primary reason the lofts were a welcoming sanctuary from hectic school life was the property manager Richard McClain. McClain was always helpful, enthusiastic, and understanding of student life. What's more is that he took the time to know his residents personally and always had his door open. Having graduated and moved on into the real world of apartment hunting, I can honestly say McClain is the gold standard by which all other landlords fall short. I have heard recently he is moving on, and I just wanted to pass on a final farewell and good luck in your next job! The lofts will not be the same without you.

name: Benoure Plumbing Heating & AC
address: Benoure Plumbing Heating & AC, 34 Commerce Ave, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: I should have read the reviews first before calling BPH. The technician arrived on 4/4/18 to fix a problem with our furnace not shutting off. Shortly after the technician left, the furnace began making a horn blowing sound. We called BPH and the technician came back the next day to fix. My complaint isn’t with the repair or the technician’s competency, but rather with the fact that I was charged the $125 minimum service charge for both visits! I feel the $125 fee for the second visit should have been waived. When I called the office to inquire about the double charge, I was told I needed to speak with Mike (owner?). Of course Mike wasn’t available, so I left a message. In fact, I have left 3 messages to date with no response from Mike (it’s been almost a month since the initial service visit). If BPH owners are too busy to respond to their customers, they should at least empower those that answer the phone with the ability to do more than transfer a call; otherwise, with customer service like this, BPH may soon find themselves with all kinds of time on their hands.

name: Dicks Lock Repair
address: Dicks Lock Repair, 356 S Main St, Brattleboro, VT 05301
text: We recently moved to the area, we are glad we found Butch to do our work. I called Butch and left a message, he returned my call later that day and set up an appointment which fit my schedule. Butch arrived on time on the day of the appointment and assessed the work I had. He explained everything and quoted me a fair price. I agreed to the work, Butch did an excellent job in a very timely manner. Butch also gave me information on other work my wife and I are planning to have done. I will definitely use Butch again.

name: Bear Swamp Veterinary Services
address: Bear Swamp Veterinary Services, 107 E Bear Swamp Rd, Middlesex, VT 05602
text: Very Bad Experience. I'm new to Vermont and have a 13 year old basset who suffers from recurring inner ear infections. For the past several nights, he's been waking up with extreme discomfort, constantly rubbing and pawing at his ear. I called this vet on high recommendation from my neighbor, and left a message explaining my dog's trouble, and asked if they could see him on short notice. I received a call back several hours later from a young woman who seemed bothered to be phoning me back at all. She explained that Bear Swap was not currently accepting new clients, but they would be in the fall. "Ok. Well, thank you", I said. "Is there another vet you can recommend?" She named two vets, but said she didn't recommend one over the other. I thanked her and hung up. I was deeply disappointed. How can you call yourself a loving vet service when you refuse an animal clearly in need of your professional help?

name: Head to Tail - Professional Pet Grooming, LLC
address: Head to Tail - Professional Pet Grooming, LLC, 144 Grove St, Rutland, VT 05701
text: I have called and left a message twice to get a grooming appointments and they haven’t called back. Why bother to have an answering machine if you aren’t going to answer the messages.

name: Lee's
address: Lee's, 360 Dorset St, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: Good quality, flavourful, affordable, friendly service, lots of options, one of the few restaurants in Burlington open past 9 pm! Give Lee's a chance!

name: Twisted Wrench
address: Twisted Wrench, 60 Ethan Allen Dr, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Auto repair shop', 'Auto radiator repair service', 'Auto spring shop', 'Brake shop', 'Diesel engine repair service', 'Mechanic', 'Oil change service', 'Radiator repair service', 'Transmission shop', 'Wheel alignment service']
text: Twisted Wrench has always been a breeze to work with. Easy and fast appointments, honest and budget friendly quotes and fast high quality work. The new email and text message quotes and updates are absolutely fantastic and makes the whole process that much more convenient. Would recommend Twisted Wrench to all my friends and family!!!!

name: European Auto Works
address: European Auto Works, 1194 VT Route 5, Coventry, VT 05825
text: Day 1: I was told to contact these guys for a somewhat large job. I called and asked and even if a bit hesitant, he agreed to do it. I ordered the parts I needed (rack and pinion, PS pump, O2 sensor) dumped as much PS fluid as the basin would allow and drove my car to their shop. Day 2: Called to see how they were doing, was told he didnt want to do the job anymore but he was gonna ask his father to see if he wanted to do it. Called them again 4 hours later to hear that the father also doesnt want to do it. I asked why he would tell me he would do the job if this was going to happen. Apparently I guilt tripped him into rethinking the job and he was going to call me back. Got a phone call back this time! Only to be told that they really dont want to do the job at all... and to be told that the car isnt starting anymore either. Great! Lady said she drove it into the garage, but couldnt drive it out because the car wouldnt start. (this is where I totally lost all patience and trust in these guys) I asked them to find out where they messed up and to get back to me with a solution. Day 3: Called and left a message about my key fob being loose and comes apart with little effort (to replace the battery) to see if that might fix it. Got a call back 6 hours or so later to be told that they found the issue~! It was a broken wire (of course THEY DIDNT do it while they were messing around, RIGHT?) Was told it was 6 hours labor and 200 bucks for parts to have it replaced. I said I dont want them touching it anymore, that I felt I couldnt trust them and that ill have to get a tow truck to have it hauled out. FML, of course this was going to happen! Of all the things my car has been unreliable with, STARTING AND STOPPING was NOT ONE OF THEM. My car has always started and stopped, no problems, EVER. TLDR: Anywho, to sum it up. Was told work was going to be done, never got done. They broke a wire and wont fix it. Now im in the hole 250 bucks for towing AND replacing the part. Never in my life have I heard of someone driving their car to a garage, only to have it towed out. Thanks guys! Ill be sure to NEVER suggest your garage to ANYBODY. Well, ill be sure to suggest someone OTHER then you. Now I get to wait and see if there is anything else they did to it because they were mad or by mistake. YIPPIE. Ill edit later when I find out. Drive the extra miles and go somewhere with actual reviews, GOOD reviews. You will thank me later.

name: Domino's pizza
address: Domino's pizza, 33 Railroad Square, Newport, VT 05855
text: positve customer service and patient. food was delivered hot with my sauces and drink - EXTREMELY timely for a busy SAT PM. driver was very polite.

name: Wash n Dry
address: Wash n Dry, 169 Main St, Windsor, VT 05089
text: A good, average laundromat. (Though I wouldn't recommend using the side loaders.) Open 7 am - 9 pm Monday through Friday, 7 am to 7:30 pm Saturday and Sunday.

name: Arlington Village Farmers Market
address: Arlington Village Farmers Market, Recreation Park Rd, Arlington, VT 05250
text: The Farmer's Market in Arlington Vermont Is very diverse and well managed by Jessica Roberts and her merry crew of volunteers each Friday from 4-7 PM The vendors are friendly and courteous. with everything from fresh produce , delicious baked goods and many gift items and programs for the children as well. The setting is lovely with views of the mountains and plenty of parking. The live music each week is very enjoyable and gives a festive air to the experience

name: Wok N Roll
address: Wok N Roll, 275 Munson Ave, Morristown, VT 05661
text: I called this establishment twice, this past Monday evening, once at 5:00 and once at 6:00 to order for pickup. No one answered. I then called again, today, Tuesday at noon. No one picked up, so I left a message on the voicemail with my name, number and a detailed description. No call back. Wok N Roll can also be contacted by email via their website. I wrote an email, and again, no response. Supposedly their food is great, but howre you supposed to order anything if they don't pick up and their customer service is THIS bad. I'm sure they wont suffer, but I will gladly never give a penny to this poorly operated establishment.

name: The Dock Doctors
address: The Dock Doctors, 19 Little Otter Ln, Ferrisburgh, VT 05456
text: Ordered a Pond Dock from this "company". The Shipping Manager said it was shipping on the evening of April 7th, or the morning of the 8th. It was finally picked up on April 12th. Originally told that UPS was the carrier, when in fact the carrier was YRC. I tracked the shipment to Raleigh, NC, and received a call from the YRC terminal to schedule a delivery on Friday, 4/23. On Friday morning, the Fayetteville terminal representative called to say that they hadn't received the dock, and "didn't know where it was"!!!! Meanwhile, calls to Dock Docktors met with little response, so I spent hours checking with YRC. On Monday, YRC stated that they sent the shipment to their subsidiary in Raleigh, Holland Trucking., who would then deliver it on Wednesday, 4/28, between 2 and 3 PM. On Wednesday, Holland now says that the delivery is at the mercy of the driver, YRC claims that they have no control over Holland, and, last, but not least, the "General Manager" of Dock Docktors claims that it's all the fault of YRC. He also stated that if I cancel the order, they would charge a 20% restocking fee, which, BTW, my attorney indicated will not happen. Do yourself a favor and purchase from a responsible company, or build the dock yourself. Had I don so, I would have been enjoying it for the past three weeks!!

name: Bertha Church Intimate Apparel
address: Bertha Church Intimate Apparel, 61 Church St, Burlington, VT 05401
text: I never write reviews online, but I had a really bad experience trying to purchase a bra from Bertha Church. The first time I went in I asked to do a fitting and the sales girl told me to pick out some bras and she'd help me when I was ready. Once I had the bras on she came into the room and didn't check the band or adjust the straps or anything that they normally do at other shops that do fittings. In the end she suggested ordering the bra I liked best in a couple of sizes since they didn't have my size in the store, which was perfectly fine with me. They called me 3 weeks later when the bras came in and I went in the try them on and they weren't quite right, which didn't surprise me given that I wasn't actually fitted. One the band fit but the cups were too small and the other the cups fit but the band was too big. No big deal - we agreed to try ordering again the size that should be right this time. Fast forward 3 weeks and I haven't heard from the store, so I go into the store just to check because I am moving out of state in a few weeks and the sales girl finds my order card and is cagey about whether or not the order has actually been placed, but updates my card with the info about me moving etc. Fast forward another three weeks and still nothing. So I call the store on Monday and talk to a woman who wants to know when I came in, what the bra brand was, and what size it was. I didn't know any of this info because so much time had passed and the sales girl just wrote down the order so I never looked at the bra brand. The woman on the phone told me she'd have to look it up and call me back. I still hadn't heard from her by Wednesday morning two days later, but had figured out which day I had been in the store, so I called and left a message with all of my info and asked them to call me back. Again, no call back by Thursday afternoon and at this point I just want to know what bra I was trying to order so I could just go order it myself somewhere else. I call the store again and tell the woman that I am looking for information about a bra I was trying to order and she asks "Are you Jessica?" So apparently, they had gotten my message, but just chose to ignore it or something? She then asks me again when I had been in and what bra it was and after some digging she finds my card and tells me "They don't make that bra in that size." After all of this I could have been told that a month and a half ago! So I politely hang up and go online and lo-and-behold they do in fact make that bra in that size and I have ordered it myself directly through the manufacturer's website. It is safe to say that I will never attempt to give Bertha Church my business again.

name: Rick's Firewood
address: Rick's Firewood, 171 Locke Ave North, Hyde Park, VT 05655
text: Ordered wood...set a date for delivery....did not show up, left message for them but no call back.

name: MVL Wellness
address: MVL Wellness, 55 S Main St, Waterbury Village Historic District, VT 05676
text: Great place. Highly skilled message therapist (Forest). He targeted my lower back brilliantly. I went back again the next day. Sweet little spot. Quiet and comfortable

name: Bristol Park Dental
address: Bristol Park Dental, 6 Park St, Bristol, VT 05443
text: You wouldn't think that at 35 years old your wisdom tooth would suddenly become a fierce problem. Well that's what happened. I had called/driven to every dentist in the tri county area with no luck. Everyone was booking,out thru August. Then, when I was at the end of my tethers omeone suggested Bristol Park Dental. Not only did they reply to my message promptly-- they told me they would be happy to help. They accepted my insurance and got me in and out of there faster than it took me to fill out the pre registration forms online. So kind, compassionate and communicative, I felt respected and informed. Thank you guys forever. You're my HEROS [high voltage][high voltage][raising hands][raising hands][raising hands][glowing star][glowing star][glowing star][glowing star][glowing star]

name: Mount Mansfield Maple Products
address: Mount Mansfield Maple Products, 450 Weaver St, Winooski, VT 05404
text: Excellent customer service! I ordered some maple candy directly from the company and the first box was damaged, probably due to the Christmas shipping volume. I called and left a message and they sent out a second box right away even though they were on their holiday break! Amazing! Will definitely order more products in the future.

name: H&R Block
address: H&R Block, 1284 US Rt 302, Berlin, VT 05641
text: Never mentioned a forty dollar fee then they said they would refund it. Been over a month and I called today to ask about refund and then said can't do it. Manager left message on my cell phone informing me I was not welcome in her store and never come back. I just left a complaint with H&R blocks Corp office . I will never do business with them again.

name: Aspen Dental
address: Aspen Dental, 856 US-302 Unit A, Barre, VT 05641
category: ['Dentist', 'Cosmetic dentist', 'Denture care center', 'Emergency dental service', 'Pediatric dentist']
text: Was supposed to go in at 3pm. Got a call at 1:45pm (day of the appointment) and they cancelled it. I was very upset, and asked to speak with a manager. I spoke with Calie, who was rude and offered absolutely nothing to make up for my mistreatment. To make matters worse, they openly admit to filling my appointment for someone else. All because I didn’t “confirm” my appointment, but I never got an email, call, or even a text message. I even called again asking for a sooner appointment because my wisdom tooth is bothering me that much. So if you urgently need anything done dental wise, go elsewhere or you will be very disappointed.

name: Duane Merrill and Co Auctioneers & Appraisers
address: Duane Merrill and Co Auctioneers & Appraisers, 137 James Brown Dr, Williston, VT 05495
text: I had an appointment with Ethan Merrill for 3:00 PM. I called at 4:15 to ask where he was and left a message. He called back with no word of apology or explanation without being asked and wanted to reschedule. I declined. This is a terrible way to treat potential clients.

name: J & L Service Center
address: J & L Service Center, 216 S Main St, St Albans City, VT 05478
category: ['Auto repair shop', 'Car battery store', 'Car inspection station', 'Oil change service', 'Tire shop', 'Towing service', 'Wheel alignment service']
text: The alternator on our Honda Odyssey the day we were to leave for Florida. Took it in at 8 am and had it back by 1 pm. The staff was very friendly and the service done quickly.

name: Flowers By Olga
address: Flowers By Olga, 152 Overlook Dr, Jay, VT 05859
text: I have a friend that lives in rural Vermont. A number of delivery services don't deliver there. I had the good fortune to contact Flowers by Olga. I left a message and Olga called me back and worked with me on price and selection. I asked that the flowers be delivered the next morning for my friend's birthday. They were and my friend was delighted. I'm now glad that I couldn't order through other means. I truly got the personal touch.

name: Vermont Yankee Nuclear Power Station
address: Vermont Yankee Nuclear Power Station, 320 Governor Hunt Rd, Vernon, VT 05354
hours: [['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: Thanks to this plant shutting down New Englanders get to enjoy 100 cent per k/watt electricity for 2014-2015 winter. Yes its a nuclear plant and yes there is radiation, however if the plant had upgraded and fixed the issues New Englanders wouldn't be getting screwed by National Grid.

name: Franklin County Animal Rescue
address: Franklin County Animal Rescue, 30 Sunset Meadows, St Albans City, VT 05478
text: Busy day when I went, hopefully to adopt cat that was posted and had left message about. Staff hadn't listened to my voicemail &cat given to volunteer. Adopted a different cat. Staff info. and written info provided to me by staff from couple who surrended cat was very different. Shelter seems very understaffed, yet i was told that even volunteers with shelter experience cannot have scheduled hours or be trained in adoption process. Seems like they are more concerned about having all the power than REAL ANIMAL WELFARE.

name: Dollar General
address: Dollar General, 65 Northgate Ave, Morrisville, VT 05661
text: (Translated by Google) We found what we needed. My wife found what she wanted at a good price on July 7, 2019 a little after 4 pm. I took a picture of the business while I was waiting in the parking lot and I share it here with this notice. Reviewed July 12, 2019 at Salaberry de Valleyfield, Quebec, Canada. (Original) Nous avons trouvé ce dont nous avions besoin. Mon épouse a trouvé ce qu’elle désirait à bon prix en ce 7 juillet 2019 un peu après 16 heures. J’ai pris une photo du commerce pendant que je l’attendais dans le stationnement et je vous la partage ici avec cet avis. Avis écrit le 12 juillet 2019 à Salaberry de Valleyfield, Québec, Canada.

name: Putney Farmers' Market
address: Putney Farmers' Market, 17 Carol Brown Way, Putney, VT 05346
text: Great place to go, relaxed atmosphere, excellent foods and crafts, but if you're new to it don't be fooled by Google telling you the hours are 8am to 8 pm, they're actually 11am to 2 pm.

name: Southern Vermont Cable
address: Southern Vermont Cable, 62 Sylvan Ridge Rd, Winhall, VT 05340
text: I called 3-24-2016 endways told that someone would call back. No one did. I called once on 3-25-2016 and was hung up on. I called back and was told that a serviceperson would "stop by on his way" whatever that meant. We waited up till 10 pm. Obviously they are closed both Saturday and Sunday. Since I have to work all day Monday the first time when a service person can come is Tuesday morning. 3-29-2016. I have no assurance that will happen. This is service?

name: Chase Moving and Storage
address: Chase Moving and Storage, 1 Jackson St, Essex Junction, VT 05452
category: ['Mover', 'Moving and storage service', 'Moving supply store', 'Records storage facility', 'Transportation service']
text: I congratulate Wayne Michaud for his satisfying experience with Chase Moving and Storage. The experience my wife and I had this past August was slightly different. We got a binding estimate for our interstate move, and both parties signed the contract, which stipulated the cost and the dates when different phases of the move would happen. The ink was barely dry on the contract when Ron contacted me and asked me if we could change the dates of the packing and loading. Wanting to be cooperative, my wife and I agreed, even though it would inconvenience us a bit. A short time later, Heather in the office contacted us and asked us if they could change the packing and loading dates again. This change meant that they would pack us one day, load the next, and we would close on the house we were selling the day after that. Suffice it to say that on the day of the closing, there were still items in our house that needed to be put on the truck. They did accomplish this about two hours before we closed, but it was a white knuckle ride. Then, on the other end of the move about a week later, Heather contacted me and said that the driver would not unload our things unless we ponied up another $500+. When I got a bit upset and tried to remind her that Federal guidelines said that if I paid the full binding estimate,which we did, the movers could not refuse to deliver our load, she said I had a problem with my attitude and was being rude. I then decided to calm down and pay, or we were not going to get our stuff. On the plus side, everything did arrive, and nothing major was damaged. The delivery driver told us that we could make a call to Chase, and they would arrange a one time pick up the packing materials when we were done unpacking. My wife called Heather several times and tried to arrange this...and she is still waiting for a response. Finally, I ended up bringing all the packing materials to our county recycling center. That was our experience with Chase Moving and Storage. Some areas good, some OK, and some bad. Reply to Chase on Your Reply to my original post: It is not my intention to drag this out anymore, but I will address some of your points. 1) I told you that I wanted EVERYTHING packed, and I took pains to show EVERYTHING to you, including the storage unit. In fact, there was less to pack than what you originally saw, since we had a garage sale after we signed, and we threw away many more items before your packers ever got to our house. So this discussion of extra stuff beyond what I asked for rings a little hollow with me. You are the professional mover, so if your estimate was off it is not my fault. 2) You said it is was my responsibility to make sure everything was out of the house on loading day. Well, your crew chief on loading day, Duane I think his name is, told me at the end of the day that there was no more room in the truck, and he would have to return the next day to finish the last of the packing and loading. So, what was I supposed to do? Demand he go back to Williston at 8:30 pm and get another truck? Was it my fault that the truck sent to my house was too small? Believe me, I WANTED the house to be empty that night. 3) If I legitimately owed you more money for the move, I could accept that. But to hold my things hostage on the truck until I pay is not what the regulations say. If I pay you the full amount of the binding estimate, which I did, you cannot refuse to deliver my goods. I made sure that I researched all angles of interstate moving with the Feds before I even contacted you. I would have paid you what I owed you after our things were unloaded. Ron..I'm not saying that we were totally unhappy. Most of it went OK, and we really liked the guys you had at our house. If you had arranged to have the packing materials removed for us I probably would have let everything else slide. It was the proverbial last straw. 8/28/17. One final word: Do NOT sign ANY mover paperwork UNTIL all your items are on the truck(s).

name: Chase Moving and Storage
address: Chase Moving and Storage, 1 Jackson St, Essex Junction, VT 05452
category: ['Mover', 'Moving and storage service', 'Moving supply store', 'Records storage facility', 'Transportation service']
text: We have recently relocated to Pennsylvania from Vermont. I contacted "Chase Moving and Storage" SEVERAL months before moving day to have a clear game plan. The preliminary plan included having a custom made crate, by Chase. It was Chases' recommendation that a crate be made and I was told it would be brought to the house the day of the move. Along with this, we had made arrangements for the special packaging (in a special box made just for this) of my flat screened TV, wrapping and packaging of several picture/art pieces in glass frames and other odd shaped pieces being packed by them at my home. I also mentioned on the phone, prior to the move and then again twice on moving day, that I had a brand new Temper Pedic Mattress I wanted boxed as well as my other mattresses and was assured they ALWAYS box these. When Chase arrived on moving day at about 8:30 am, the crew included the owner, Ron LaFountain, and two other men. We had a 3 bedroom, 2300 square foot house, plus full basement. They estimated it would take between 6 and 8 hours to load the truck. I was notified early on they did not have the crate for my dollhouse. When I asked if he would get one, Ron told me they would have one brought to the house. Ron seemed very personable and stood in my kitchen, singing his own praises of integrity, character and how he had the best, most respectful employees around. The move was taking much longer than expected and Ron needed to leave because he was needed elsewhere. One of the other mover's, Mike, while bringing several (about 5) stacked boxes down our stairs from the second floor on a dolly, lost control and the boxes proceeded to fall 5-6 stairs from the bottom. One was marked "Fragile". Also, I was horrified, when I saw our new Temper Pedic Mattress being slid across the back of the truck without a box on the filthy floor. The time was getting very late, it was after 3:30 pm, and there was still about 1/4 of the house needing to be loaded. I stood ;in disbelief as my Weber Grill, piled high with snow was brought through the inside of my house, by the two movers in wet, boots tracking dirt all over my light colored carpet. I asked them at that time if they planned on doing the same thing with my patio furniture, sensing my disapproval, they said "no". The crate for the dollhouse and box for the dollhouse and screened TV never ended up arriving at all. With the truck PACKED full and still much to be loaded, I spoke to Mike and asked what the plan was for the remaining items and the dollhouse. I expressed my frustration at the late hour and told him that I needed to pick my daughter up very shortly. Mike became visibly irritated and expressed that "the only thing he was interested in was his trip to New York City the next day and how he didn't want; to be there". I finally snapped and stated to him that I paid a lot of money for this move and I did not care about his trip. He had a job to do. It was apparent he had no idea what to do with the rest of my items as the truck was full. Both he and I tried to get a hold of Ron; to no avail. Then, to my disgust, he started arguing with my neighbor as well, telling her he hated his job. Finally, I needed to leave at 4:30 to pick up my daughter and had to leave my house with these incompetent men with obviously hours left of work. Luckily, our grown son had arrived and my neighbor was still there to supervise. I was eventually called by Ron and was assured that another truck was on the way and the dollhouse would be loaded onto a van by itself, still no crate. He was originally somewhat apologetic, even though he stated that "moving was very stressful", implying, I felt, that I was possibly overreacting due to stress. I was told that apparently, they needed, at this point, to unload all our belongings at their site, and reload them on a larger truck for the actual move to Pa. Needless to say, things arrived at our new location badly damaged. I could go on and on but I have run out of room!! Avoid!!

name: Champlain Door Systems
address: Champlain Door Systems, 4182 Highbridge Rd, Milton, VT 05468
text: Called about a garage door opener and scheduled an appt for next day at 10am. Justin did not show until after mid afternoon. I was no longer here but he left a price and said to call him next morning. Which I did and he was not there. So left a message. 36 hours waiting and still no word. Guess we’ll go somewhere else.

name: River Road Electric LLC

text: RRE was quick to respond to my initial message and promptly scheduled me in. Scott was a pleasure to work with- he was prompt, quick, and communicative. I'd highly recommend RRE for all your electrical needs.

name: FuYam Buffet Sushi and Hibachi
address: FuYam Buffet Sushi and Hibachi, 199 US-7, Milton, VT 05468
text: Buffets aren't notorious for great reviews, and this restaurant cannot buck the trend. The food is never warm enough to make me feel safe about eating it. Not that is isn't cooked -- the last time I went there for dinner, the lunchtime fried rice was nice and crusty in the 1/4 filled 60 degree pan at 5:00 PM. There were few choices on the menu that looked like fresh food for the new meal. Of the roughly 10 to 12 choices that came with meat, only one had beef in it. How many chicken choices do we need? Craving Chinese? Drive to Joyce's Noodle House in Essex. The only reason I gave this restaurant 2 stars was because the wait staff are very kind and friendly.

name: Community Health Centers of Burlington
