text: My family and I are going through a crisis right now. I called to request something to help me with anxiety and help me sleep. I had to leave a message with Paula the nurse for Dr Pitcher and never received a call back. I have had other complaints about this practice in the past and unfortunately for me I have not found a new physician as of yet. There seems to be a bit of a shortage in Vermont.

name: Community Health Centers of Burlington
address: Community Health Centers of Burlington, 617 Riverside Ave, Burlington, VT 05401
text: I have been visiting this clinic for over 20 years still have the same doctor shes great . The amount of time i have to call to leave a message its disgusting they don't pass it on cos my doctor tells me. the dentist almost let me drown in my own saliva laying down i had to signal to her for help. Thats sad

name: Community Health Centers of Burlington
address: Community Health Centers of Burlington, 617 Riverside Ave, Burlington, VT 05401
text: The entire medical staff you encounter from scheduling to check-out is always friendly, welcoming, helpful, non-judgmental and sensitive to every patient’s needs, for every patient. Yes, at times it can be difficult to directly contact a provider depending on the call, but rest assured you will be triaged and they will receive the message and return your call. Yes, scheduling may be a few weeks out, but only for non-urgent routine checkups (and this is the norm for every primary care clinic in the country!) I have had nothing but good experiences here and feel they are exceptionally competent and patient-centered. Thank you CHCB staff for your unwavering commitment to the community!

name: Community Health Centers of Burlington
address: Community Health Centers of Burlington, 617 Riverside Ave, Burlington, VT 05401
text: If I could give CHC zero stars, I would. I'm a new patient there, and so far my experience has been disastrous. My doctor, Lauren Miller, seems competent enough, though she has repeatedly failed to call in prescriptions and needed follow-up calls to be reminded to do so, but the rest of the operation is a huge mess and incredibly frustrating. It took me three weeks to get a referral. The doctor ordered it but the "referrals department" took three weeks and multiple follow-up phone calls to actually arrange it, and then I had to wait another week for the appointment itself (which means it took three times as long for CHC to arrange the appointment than it took for the specialist to schedule it). I emailed the patient feedback people at Community Health Centers during this process and never heard back. Three weeks ago I had an appointment at which I had blood work done and, because my doctor recommended I see a specialist, signed a form asking for relevant records to be sent to that specialist. When I showed up for my appointment at that specialist's office, they had not received the records they needed for that appointment. When I called CHC from the specialist's office hoping they could send the records as soon as possible, I was transferred to the "records department," where I got their voicemail. In the meantime I have not received the results of the blood work that was done three weeks ago. When it hadn't been posted to the patient portal after a week I called and was told it should be posted in a day or two. When it still had not been posted a week after that, I called and was told I needed to contact "tech support," so I called and left a message for tech support. Three days later I got a call back from tech support telling me I needed to call my doctor and tell her she needed to upload the records. When I called CHC and asked about this, the woman on the phone told me she couldn't help me because she's "not a patient" there and doesn't know how the portal works. I pointed out that whether or not she is a patient there is irrelevant--it was her office that suggested I sign up for the portal and told me my records would be there, and it is her office that administers the portal. She said she would let the doctor know she needed to upload the results (how does the doctor not know that?) and indicated the results had also been sent via mail last week (two weeks after the initial appointment). I never received the results CHC supposedly mailed and based on their track record assume they were never sent. I had a very difficult time finding a primary care doctor in the Burlington area that takes my insurance and was accepting new patients, so I feel trapped at CHC, but if you can do anything to avoid it, I would.

name: Community Health Centers of Burlington
address: Community Health Centers of Burlington, 617 Riverside Ave, Burlington, VT 05401
text: If 0 stars were possible they get 0 stars. Poor service to say the least. Grievance system is a joke. Just so they can say they have one. That's where you get directed no one apparently is a supervisor or manager. Just Try to get a hold of a person to help you. Someone should sue for patient neglect. Communication is nil. They have you leave a message for whoever you need like nurse or doctor. They call back a week or two later. They said if it's bad enough go to emergency room. Can you believe that! Don't go here, don't say I didn't warn you.

name: Walgreens
address: Walgreens, 194 North St, Bennington, VT 05201
category: ['Drug store', 'Beauty supply store', 'Convenience store', 'Cosmetics store', 'Greeting card shop', 'Perfume store', 'Stationery store']
text: Great service! They recently switched from Rite-Aid which has had some complications that customers don't seem to understand and the staff has had to deal with a lot of angry people that just don't seem to have their paperwork in order. Always on time with my scripts and their text message service is wonderfully helpful to reorder.

name: Sugarbush Health & Recreation Center (SHaRC)
address: Sugarbush Health & Recreation Center (SHaRC), 148 Sports Center Dr, Warren, VT 05674
text: The shark has the most facilities around, however everything is very dated. I would give the shark more stars however after purchasing a year long membership they reduced their hours. Now the gym closes at seven pm during the week & 5 pm on Sunday's. Most people don't get out of work till five; I find myself forced to change my daily routines or skip the gym all together. The staff is pleasant again the equipment and overall faculty is very old and run down. I hope they fix their issues otherwise I don't suggest paying that high of a price.

name: BHAV SPA
address: BHAV SPA, 11 S Main St, Waterbury Village Historic District, VT 05676
category: ['Day spa', 'Beauty product supplier', 'Beauty salon', 'Beauty supply store', 'Facial spa', 'Massage therapist', 'Shopping mall', 'Waxing hair removal service']
text: I want to preface this by saying that this is not directed at any of the estheticians or services provided by the spa, but rather at the receptionist and her inability to effectively communicate with clients. My friend booked appointments for her and I this afternoon (July 1). My friend booked a Brazilian wax for herself and facials for both of us. My friend got her nose pierced a few weeks ago and realized that it was still healing, so she called a couple of days before the appointment to cancel her facial service, but kept her wax service and my facial service. She called during normal operating hours, but was sent straight to voicemail. She left a message and received a call back sometime later with a message stating that the facial cancellation was fine and that she could receive a massage instead if she wished. She tried to call back, but was unsuccessful and assumed everything was good to go. My friend and I drove separately and she arrived first at the spa. We both do not live in Waterbury and were unaware of possible construction around the spa. Because of this, she was two minutes late to her appointment. When she checked in, the receptionist (who I believe was named Danielle) was extremely rude and told her she should have been aware of construction. My friend apologized, feeling uncomfortable, and went in for her wax. I came in a few minutes later and was informed by the esthetician that there had been some miscommunication with the receptionist and my facial appointment had been cancelled. This had not been mentioned to my friend when she checked in. Having driven 45 minutes to Waterbury, I was a little upset, but the esthetician was very nice and apologetic about it. I sat down and waited for my friend to get out of her wax appointment. While I was waiting, the receptionist walked into the spa. Her attitude towards me was very rude and unprofessional. She lectured me about the cancellation policy and blamed my friend for the miscommunication, saying that it was her fault that the facials were cancelled. It felt extremely petty and uncalled for. My friend walked out of the appointment room and the receptionist started lecturing her again, blaming her for not calling back and being unclear about the services. My friend replied that she had tried to call back and was unsuccessful, even though it was during operating hours, and that the message left by the receptionist did not state that both facials were going to be cancelled. The receptionist then offered to book us facials on Saturday, but we declined. She then excused herself from the spa space. Needless to say, the whole interaction left my friend and I upset and offended. The poor communication and unprofessional conduct by the receptionist left us both feeling unwelcome. Clearly, this is not the spa for us.

name: Desabrais Laundry & Dry Cleaning
address: Desabrais Laundry & Dry Cleaning, 1232 Exchange St, Middlebury, VT 05753
hours: [['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: Desabrais Laundry & Dry Cleaning is hands down the best laundromat and dry cleaner in Addison County. They are located on Exchange Street in Middlebury, Vermont and are the only laundromat left in town. The laundromat is always open daily from 7 AM to 11 PM year round. Dry Cleaning may have separate hours. They also offer the wash, dry and fold service when you are on the go. Their super friendly staff are very helpful and will meet your needs.

name: Bicycle Express
address: Bicycle Express, 23 Commercial Dr, Waterbury Village Historic District, VT 05676
category: ['Bicycle repair shop', 'Bicycle rack', 'Bicycle rental service', 'Bicycle Shop', 'Used bicycle shop']
text: I had been researching trail bikes for years (Stumpy, Process, Trance, etc) and finally one popped up that was on my list from BikeExpress. Being that the ad was on PinkBike I left a message and my phone number and they called me the next morning during business hours. Noah the owner was very helpful and I ended up getting a great deal on what is now my bike! These guys aren't pushy in the slightest - granted I knew what I wanted - but I found the experience to be much more personable than the Burlington bike shops. He (Noah) even met me halfway from my house to the shop as I live north of Burlington. I highly recommend BikeExpress (or Bicycle Express)!

name: EZ-Probate
address: EZ-Probate, 50 Lakeside Ave Suite 560, Burlington, VT 05401
text: In my humble opinion no one should ever after to go through Probate. It is very stressful and there is enough stress already when a loved one dies. I would advise everyone to have a Living Trust. Having said that, my husband and I had had one set up when we separated. We never divorced. He revoked the Living Trust on his death bed which caused me many problems. I hired and attorney and for the first year it cost me $5,000 and nothing had been resolved. Before the year was up I had to file a claim against his estate to recover his half our home because he made up a new will and left his half of the house that we owned for 39 years to someone else and said I had to make any and all repairs and then sell it. I was declared the administrator of the estate. I was able to sue the estate because he broke our marital contract by not keeping a large life insurance policy with me as sole beneficiary. I broke away from my attorney because I wasn't satisfied with the amount of attention he paid to my case.Then I did some research online. I left a message for EZ Probate and they reached out to me immediately. I was convinced that they could help me and they did. They took me step by step through the process providing the necessary documents and helped me fill out forms that I knew nothing about. They made sure things got filed timely. And then the day came when I went to court and the Judge ruled in my favor. I couldn't have waded through all those forms without their constant and patient help. I would recommend them in a heart beat. They are far more reasonable with their fees. Unbelievably reasonable!! I saved thousands.

name: All Service Citgo
address: All Service Citgo, 212 Lincoln St, Bennington, VT 05201
category: ['Auto repair shop', 'Auto wrecker', 'Car repair and maintenance', 'Diesel engine repair service', 'Engine rebuilding service', 'Mechanic', 'Oil change service', 'Towing service', 'Trailer rental service', 'Truck repair shop']
hours: [['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: I have Toyota Tundra. Needs exhaust work. Getting job done at All Service Citgo for $650. Quote from Toyota was $3500-4000 ??

name: Greg's Auto Services
address: Greg's Auto Services, 74 Strongs Ave, Rutland, VT 05701
text: Great service, good honest people. Yesterday my battery warning light and a message the battery was no longer being charged came on. I parked the truck quickly yesterday and managed to get a tow truck in Killington this morning (AAA plus a great plan) and searched for a great shop based on reviews and reputation. I am from Long Island, NY. I figured the cost would be hiked looking clearly out of town with NY plates. When I called Gregg’s this morning, they told me they would diagnose and repair today once they receive it from the tow. They called me today twice, once to tell me it was alternator and minor wiring. The next call was to tell me it was ready today at 4pm. They charged me for the parts and minimal labor, much less than I even reasonably expected. These mechanics run a great shop. I will always use them when I am here. Best decision I made on this trip for the unexpected. Thank you for being hard working decent people.

name: The Roasted Bean Espresso Bar
address: The Roasted Bean Espresso Bar, 1 Prospect St, North Bennington, VT 05257
text: First, their online ordering site is absolutely useless. You can’t choose caffeinated or decaf; you can’t ask for a whip cream or extra chocolate; and you can’t even push the button to put it into your cart because when you push the button, what you want doesn’t show up in your cart. Secondly, they don’t answer their phone! I called and called and called for 30 minutes and I repeatedly received a message advising me they were on the other line and that I could leave a message but if I wanted to actually PLACE AN ORDER or PICK UP AN ORDER, I would need to call back! What the heck?!

name: Vermont Telephone Company, Inc.
address: Vermont Telephone Company, Inc., 354 River St, Springfield, VT 05156
category: ['Internet service provider', 'Cable company', 'Mobile network operator', 'Telecommunications service provider', 'Telephone company']
text: I’ve had vtel internet for the past two years and can honestly say it is the worst internet I have ever had in my life. Customer service is rude and the internet cuts out multiple times daily. I am a professional in our community and due to covid have had to transfer to remote work and it has been an hourly struggle to have meetings with people and provide the support needed to the individuals I work with. The company has repeatedly told me it must be something I am doing on my end that disrupts the service and have never offered “a free month” as their waiting recording so cheerily assured you. I’ve been working since covid began with them trying to find some resolution but all I’ve found is spend more money and blindly trust we will provide you the best service you’ve had sort of message. All very disappointing for a Vermont based company. I believe that because they know in rural areas it’s the only option we have they are able to ignore the terrible service and carry on with collecting an exorbitant amount of money monthly. Very disappointing.

name: Vermont Telephone Company, Inc.
address: Vermont Telephone Company, Inc., 354 River St, Springfield, VT 05156
category: ['Internet service provider', 'Cable company', 'Mobile network operator', 'Telecommunications service provider', 'Telephone company']
text: Great customer service from Tanya who was friendly, helpful, and informative to my wife and I this past weekend. (3-16-2019)

name: Casella Waste Systems
address: Casella Waste Systems, 408 E Montpelier Rd, Montpelier, VT 05602
category: ['Garbage collection service', 'Debris removal service', 'Garbage dump', 'Garbage dump service', 'Recycling center', 'Recycling drop-off location', 'Waste management service']
text: I own a local business and can’t express how disrespectful these people are. Waited all day after calling twice to speak a supervisor but apparently lunch was more important than us. Well that 10 AM and then again at 1 PM told the same thing now it’s the end of the week. Really bizarre why this company treats their customers this way when we pay them. All I wanted to do was speak with somebody and express my displeasure and how we can possibly fix and salvage this terrible big business relationship because I do not like having bad relationships with local businesses it’s not the way we work. Sad to say but from what they have shown us, no one should work with these people

name: Gecha Fuels
address: Gecha Fuels, 107 Gecha Lane, Pittsford, VT 05763
text: 10 STARS! I recently came home after a 13 hour workday to find my furnace had shut down. I called my Fuel company who offers '24 hour service', and got their answering machine. I called again....and yet again. I finally stated, on my final attempt to reach them after an hour and a half, that I cant let the house be unheated for the entire night and Im forced to call someone else. Now I am as loyal as can, I try to be a good customer and I send payment, in full within three days if I dont leave a check at delivery time. I had chosen 'MY" current fuel provider before Gecha was in business...conveniently right down the road from "MY" fuel dealer. Gecha had an actual Emergency number. I called it and it was not 2 minutes later I got a call from Mike, the owner himself. (Did I mention its now 10 PM?) I admitted my embarrassment at not being his customer, but I was really in a pinch and had not heard back from my fuel company. He was at my door with fuel in 20 minutes...again, Mike himself. The technician had to be woken up and he was there within the hour. I had a fixed furnace and fuel 25 minutes after the technician arrived. At no point did either of them make me feel less important because I wasn't a current customer. You can bet that changed after I heard from "My" fuel company the next morning at 6:50, who then asked me who I called and stated "OOOH I bet he got you for quite a bit on his emergency fee..." bad mouthing a competitor is nothing new, but at least his competition showed up. You can be sure Gecha has a new customer now. Oh and that Emergency fee ? Less than I paid 10 years ago with another company.

name: Mac's N Main
address: Mac's N Main, 145 N Main St, Rutland, VT 05701
text: Horrible service (0 stars). We went in tonight 8/12 10:20ish pm. The lady at the counter was yelling at pump 7 over the loud speaker and then when we entered she was being extremely rude to everyone in line and even refused to service people. It was so bad that we dropped what we had and got gas at cumbies. This lady should be fired or have an attitude adjustment.

name: TC's RVs
address: TC's RVs, 457 Swanton Rd, St Albans City, VT 05478
text: 2018 Shamrock Camper is WINTERIZED for 2020-2021... Bery efficient and helpful staff at TC's RV's in St. Albans,.VT

name: TC's RVs
address: TC's RVs, 457 Swanton Rd, St Albans City, VT 05478
text: Bought a 2016 highland 3910rl its a nice camper the buying experience went good. Then had problems with a window leaking and the AC dumping water out inside the camper. we took it in last fall when they said the had the window, so we drove 2 hours to bring it up with the window concern and AC concern also, they said should be done in couple of weeks well then when we called to check we got the excuse that the window ordered was the wrong one and they said 2-3 weeks to get the right one and install it. I can only go there every other Saturday due to work hours. so finally after snow was flying we get the call its ready but could not verify AC Concern, said it is sealed and drains are open!! Plus they wanted me to pay them for checking it when its a warranty item!!! First camping trip of 2017 on Tuesday may 16th in Bedford, Ma we were camping and i turned on the AC at 1:30pm with a setting of 74 degrees and at 6:30 pm it starting spitting water on the floor and counter of the kitchen so I immediately shut it off. I then emailed my salesperson, its now noon on the 18th of may and no answer or reply. next will be a phone call and if it doesn't go well.......................well we will see. Be cautious and document all your dealings. I have heard of another individual said he will never go back!!

name: GILLES SALES & SERVICE
address: GILLES SALES & SERVICE, 795 VT-14, East Montpelier, VT 05651
text: Great place with great customer service! I called at 4 pm on a sat when they closed and they worked with me on parts and made sure I got what I needed reguardless of their hours! I will continue to do business with them for years to come!

name: Stowe Country Homes
address: Stowe Country Homes, 541 S Main St, Stowe, VT 05672
category: ['Vacation home rental agency', 'Cabin rental agency', 'Condominium rental agency', 'Property management company', 'Real estate agency']
text: Never again will I rent through this company. Luckily Aribnb and Stowe mountain lodge were able to help me. When I checked it they didn't have my reservation. Being that I came in after hours I double checked and confirmed everything with my host stowe country homes. They confirmed that everything will be set to go. When I arrived I called the emergency line but there was no help. Eventually I was able to get into the room that I paid for. After the ordeal I was never called back from Alison the owner. I left a message for someone to get back to me and spoke with Nancy asking for someone to give me an explanation. I felt scammed that they never got back to me. When I finally requested a partial refund for my aggravation and embarrassment that was when I finally got a response from their “Airbnb Specialist” Aleks who told me to stop harassing her. All i was trying to get was a live person who can explain this. Wow! I was shocked and appalled how unprofessional this business was after I paid 4 months in advance and received no customer service whatsoever. In the end, they left me a bad review on Airbnb for being unprofessional, I did nothing wrong! I could not ever deal with these people again, it almost ruined my entire trip. I'd rather pay more and have the security that I won't be dealing with such amateurs. I hope this helps someone else avoid how terrible they are. They continue to diminish their blunder, by saying my stay was only delayed by 30 mins. This was in fact an accommodation the Hotel Stowe Mountain Lodge made to a long time customer since I've been visiting since 2006. They otherwise wouldn't of let me into the room. I had to explain I was sold a room and do in fact have a booking. Stowe Country Homes masquerades a legit company ,but never treated me with enough respect to discuss the event over the phone. They dodged my calls and messages and I had to take action directly through Airbnb since there was no response. I gave them plenty of opportunity to make it right ,but they accused me of harassment which blew my mind. If I could give them 0 stars I would. Their response to my initial review was an even more sorry apology it is just more excuses and insults me more and infuriates me exponentially.

name: Jam Fuels
address: Jam Fuels, 5087 U.S. Rte 5 N, Windsor, VT 05089
text: Disappointed used them all winter No problems. Dead of summer i ordered oil last Thursday and still not here. Called yesterday to check left message No call back called today No answer and No call back yet. Seems unprofessional.. Guess we will take our money somewhere else!!

name: Burlington Segway® Tours

text: Three sisters did a tour. We had lots of good training to enable us to feel confident before our tour. Went along the water for a 4 pm tour. Views were amazing, Rick was knowledgeable and very helpful. A wonderful experience!

name: Langway Chevrolet Volkswagen Of Manchester Center, Vt

category: ['Volkswagen dealer', 'Auto body shop', 'Auto repair shop', 'Car dealer', 'Chevrolet dealer', 'Used car dealer']
text: Below poor service. I was having mechanical issues with my Ford, went into the rental side of Langway. There were at Least Five people behind the counter, pointedly ignoring me. (this Tuesday around 3 PM) I waited Ten minutes with all staff less than twenty feet from me, and then asked the closest woman, "well is this a rental agency? I need to rent a car." She looked at me disdainfully and replied, " Oh, we don't have any cars to rent out". Never mind my rating might allow the outright purchase of such a vehicle, I would NEVER recommend these local hicks for anything.

name: Alamo Rent A Car
address: Alamo Rent A Car, 1200 Airport Dr, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: Long lines during pick up and staff is not interested in helping. Bad place to rent a car from. Do yourself a favor, before you book a car, call them and see if they answer, better yet when you call press zero and when they ask you to leave a message don’t expect a call back. Again try it out yourself.

name: Alamo Rent A Car
address: Alamo Rent A Car, 1200 Airport Dr, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: The person working the Alamo desk around 4 PM on November 17 was rude, and some shade of bizarrely passive aggressive. I’m sorry life didn’t turn out like you hoped, but please don’t take it out on the rest of us The airport officer who handles curb traffic couldn’t be nicer and when I asked about the person in question, and I quote, “he’s the next guy to make the 6 o’clock news naked firing an uzi”. Can’t put it better than that.

name: KW Vermont
address: KW Vermont, 68 Randall St, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: Martha Nowlan @KWVermont was great to work with during my home buying process. Being new to home ownership, I was unfamiliar with the process, but she guided me through the whole thing. Martha is very responsive and listened to my wants and concerns. Thanks again for helping me purchase my new home. :)

name: The Boardroom - Board Game Cafe
address: The Boardroom - Board Game Cafe, 3 Mill St, Burlington, VT 05401
text: This place is wonderful. I have visited here several times and each visit makes me like it more. - The staff is knowledgeable, helpful, polite, and friendly. - There are a wide variety of games - so something for everyone. - The food is iconic casual items like milk shakes and grill cheese. - The setting is a fusion of 30s speakeasy/rustic cafe/modern lounge. - offers special gatherings to meet new people - parking has been easy. - reasonably priced - good hours Great place for a relaxing date as well as hanging out with friends and family. They also offer D&D on Sundays. Justin is a great DM. #dnd #dndvermont #dndburlington #dnduvm

name: ESOX
address: ESOX, 194 Main St, Burlington, VT 05401
text: I have been going to Esox for over a decade...It was pretty much the ONLY bar I enjoyed going to downtown and now I hope they enjoy the last $40 they're gonna ever get from me. I was in there for 4 hours. Bought a fresh pitcher before going out for a smoke, (and I was right out front of the place), and the 2nd shift door man showed up and he almost wouldn't let me in, (now granted he didn't know I had been in all evening and they were at capacity but I didn't hold any ill will about the misunderstanding), and I explained I stepped out for a smoke and he said ok, just "next time have it over here"...and you know what, 25 minutes later I did exactly that and HE WOULDN'T LET ME IN! SAID "Sorry, there's a line"....I said "really?! We just did this whole thing 25 minutes ago!"...."sorry, gotta wait in line. It's what's fair."....forget the fresh pitcher I paid for, I guess if I was his phone or a college girl maybe he would of remembered me but SKREW THEM! *Now, they have sent me a message telling me to take down my negative review "as fast as the wind" cuz I had somehow called the establishment a "lure building"(WTFever that is), but I clearly never said anything about the building, (just the particular worker RUINING MY 1ST VACATION IN OVER A DECADE!). They threatened to tell Facebook about me...wow, My life is over buddy! I DIDN'T DO ANYTHING BUT WRITE A NEGATIVE REVIEW! Let it go and I will at this point.

name: Enviro Tech of Vt Septic Services
address: Enviro Tech of Vt Septic Services, 2061 Main St, Colchester, VT 05446
text: I scheduled an appointment to have 2 septic tanks at my rental property emptied on July 30th. I was told the service would be done in the afternoon. I get a call that afternoon that only one tank could be emptied because he was called to an emergency and that the other septic tank would be emptied by the weekend. I had to call half way through the next week to find out the status and he still DID NOT empty the septic. He had forgotten about my property and needed to look at his overly booked schedule to see when he could fit my property in. He first said it would be some time in October but then said he could squeeze me in for August 17th in the afternoon. He called me on the 17th at 6:30pm and said he couldn’t empty the whole tank because he miscalculated how much space he had in his truck and therefore couldn’t finish the job he had started. He said he was going to leave the tank uncovered but with the cap on loosely and that he was going to put a garden chair over the hole so no one would fall into it. (ARE YOU KIDDING ME!?) He said he would be back the next morning to finish the last bit of the pumping. HE DIDN’T SHOW UP!!! So now my tenants who have dogs were unable to safely use their back yard because of the septic tank being left open and uncovered.(Talk about a liability.) I waited all day and no show. I called again on August 18th and he didn’t have the time. I called on August 19th and he didn’t answer. He called me back at 8:30pm saying he was so busy and didn’t have time to take care of the open tank on my property. He insisted that he would be there on August 20th at the end of the day and would push his other clients around to fit me in. He has no problem not sticking to his word of scheduling and will bump people around without a second thought. I had to call again on August 20th at 5:00 pm to make sure he was going to still get to my property to finish the job. Thankfully he finally showed up. Overall, absolutely horribly customer service. I will never use EnviroTech ever again and I strongly advise anyone else to look elsewhere for service unless you don’t ever want to feel like your needs are not on the priority list.

name: Enviro Tech of Vt Septic Services
address: Enviro Tech of Vt Septic Services, 2061 Main St, Colchester, VT 05446
text: They never answer their phone. Called them 3 different days at different times of the business day. Left a voice message. No call back. Decided to call P&P, got an answer.

name: Polow & Polow, PLLC
address: Polow & Polow, PLLC, 125 Main St, Hyde Park, VT 05655
text: Davis Polow helped me tremendously in 2015-2016 when I had to sue my own insurance company due to the fact that I got hit by an uninsured motorist and my insurance company failed to cover my health and didn’t total my vehicle. I was young only 19-20 years old and I had know idea how to go about the legal stuff. He made me comfortable and was extremely professional. The accident left me with a permanent back complications till this day. He helped me to go against this big cooperation and I was able to get something to help with my permanent back issues, without having to go to court. I recommend this attorney because he is willing to fight for what is right and will stick with you until the end. I will certainly use this attorney in the future, and I recommend him to anyone who has gotten hurt in a collision.

name: Studio M - Hair Salon & Spa
address: Studio M - Hair Salon & Spa, 26 Hinesburg Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: The owners need to know their customers better and they need to learn to advertise better and become more organized. I have been a regular customer since they opened since I went there with the previous owner. The service is ok but they are not very organized. Since I work during the week, I prefer getting my hair done on weekends. I called on a Sunday to see if they had an opening which I have done previously and have mostly been able to get in. The website said they were open Sundays until 4. When I called at 11 AM it went to voice mail and said they were open Sundays until 5 and they would call back. I left a message that I was looking for a haircut and was wondering if I could get in. Two hours passed so I called again with the same result. I decided to go see if I could go as a walk in and there was a small unassuming 8 x 11 piece of paper on their front door that said they are now on fall hours and closed Sundays. So thanks for wasting my time Studio M. I have to go to Super Cuts now. Time to look at a new salon who pays attention to customers and details!!

name: Pure Envy Salon
address: Pure Envy Salon, 32 Depot St, Lyndonville, VT 05851
text: Called on one of their days off, got a responding call next day after leaving message. Great so far!

name: A-1 Gutter Cleaning & Repair
address: A-1 Gutter Cleaning & Repair, 189 Church St APT 102, Burlington, VT 05401
text: I left Bill a voice message on the Sunday of Labor Day weekend. He immediately acknowledged receipt of my message, then called the next day to schedule a time that day (yes, Labor Day) for an appointment. Bill arrived promptly as scheduled and did an efficient, thorough and tidy job cleaning the gutters, also checking for damage while he was up there. I would definitely call him again.

name: Carbone Auto Group
address: Carbone Auto Group, 751 N Bennington Rd, Bennington, VT 05201
text: This pertains to Carbone Honda/Toyota of Bennington: 751 N Bennington Rd Bennington, VT 05201-1611 When I wanted to test drive the vehicle they told me that it was not allowed because they did not pass Vermont inspection but assured me that they do a thorough inspection and all that was wrong was tires needing to be replaced soon, possibly low battery, and windshield wipers. I let them know i was worried if I took the car home to Connecticut and it over heated because I cannot test drive to see, would I have any recourse? I was assured that I had a day to return the vehicle and a month warranty. Once the paperwork was complete and I drove the car home the screen went black and it had a coolant leak! Within 15 minutes or so I brought the car back saying I am very concerned with the vehicle and the issues were not all revealed to me so I'd like to use the return I was promised for that day. I could not find the lady who sold me it so they called her, then said I signed the "as is" paperwork thus the car is mine, they will not take it back, and basically said to take a hike. I wanted to leave the keys there with the car and leave but they said the car is legally mine, they would simply have it towed and I would be responsible. This dealer lied to me and coursed me to sign the as-is paperwork, hid the issues with the car assuring me there were no other issues than what was listed as the reason they didn't pass Vermont inspection and conveniently using that as a reason not to allow any test drives. I've filed a complaint with the Consumer Protection Attorney General, am having to speak to a lawyer about a lawsuit, and I strongly suggest you stay away from this dealership. They do not sell just trade in cars, they buy these cars from auctions, hide the defects and sell them "as-is" without even allowing you to test drive them giving you false promises until you sign off the paperwork, then they tell you to take a hike if anything is wrong within minutes of driving it away!

name: Mary Maloney - State Farm Insurance Agent
address: Mary Maloney - State Farm Insurance Agent, 56 W Twin Oaks Terrace Suite 5, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Insurance agency', 'Auto insurance agency', 'Home insurance agency', 'Life insurance agency', "Renter's insurance agency"]
text: Super disappointing experience. We decided to go with a local agent to get a personal experience. We got the opposite as we have had to make numerous efforts to get someone from the office to call back. Lacking a personal response, we attempted online requests that typically ended in a message asking us to call the office. After a couple of years of frustration, we made the switch back to one of the online companies.

name: Clean & Clear Auto Detailing
address: Clean & Clear Auto Detailing, 18 Lincoln St, Essex Junction, VT 05452
text: We just got our car cleaned earlier this week and were *so* impressed with the results. It looked like a brand new car! We've had our golden retriever in our car for several years and even with seat protectors the hair eventually gets everywhere. They were able to get the entire car clean, including pet hair! I never could have imagined how great the car would look. Every cup holder and compartment. They even got off some water staining on our front seat from a water bottle spill. They were super easy to work with and had our car turned around in one day - drop off in AM and pick up in PM. Thank you so much for your service! We'll definitely be back.

name: The Wedding Barn at Kingston Place
address: The Wedding Barn at Kingston Place, 1293 Park Hill Rd, Benson, VT 05743
text: The venue is absolutely gorgeous and we loved the fact that we had the barn and homestead for the entire weekend. We were able to have a big BBQ rehearsal dinner that involved cornhole, volleyball and other yard games.on Sunday we had our actual wedding and partied from 3pm to 11 pm(we could have kept going but we were all tired from the intense volleyball the day before). Overall it was a perfect weekend wedding and the Barn was a perfect place for us. Here is a breakdown of my pros and cons of the venue to help. Pros 1) beautiful venue 2)entire weekend with little to no curfew 3)access to homestead 4) linens, tables and chairs for up to 150 people included 5) Plenty of Parking 6) Plenty of space in the barn 7) Day of wedding, venue staff helps with parking 8) very accomadating and accruing more and more decor that can be used by the wedding couple 9)Abigaile is friendly, prompt and willing to help with whatever was needed. Possible cons 1)It’s an active farm with cattle and bugs. They are working on controlling the flies but there will be some flies in and outside the barn. 2) You have to rent bathrooms - we used 802 restrooms, which had beautiful rentals 3) limited catering /vendor selection in the area

name: Old Brick Furniture + Mattress Co.
address: Old Brick Furniture + Mattress Co., 1371 Harwood Hill Rd, Bennington, VT 05201
text: My 92 year old father had a lift recliner that had broken. Stubborn and thrifty as he is, he was determined to try to use it, at the risk of breaking his neck. Being in Virginia it was (I thought) going to be a frustrating task to replace the chair. One phone call to Bennington furniture took care of everything. They had one in stock at another store, they were immediately going to ship it to the Harwood Hill location for me and promised it would be delivered this week. When I sighed and said that would be fantastic as I was worried about dad hurting himself in the old chair, I was told that they would find a way to deliver it that same day. I called my parents later to find that Bennington Furniture's two delivery drivers delivered the chair at 6:00 that night. I'm pretty sure those guys usually get off work at 5:00...and here they were lugging a chair through the door for my father at 6:00 pm. You simply don't see customer service on this level anymore...I can't begin to find the words to convey my gratitude. My father is resting safely and comfortably in his new chair...one call and done!

name: UVM Medical Center Emergency Department
address: UVM Medical Center Emergency Department, 111 Colchester Avenue Main Campus, West Pavilion, Level, 1, Burlington, VT 05401

text: I arrived with my mom In an ambulance after being hit by a car, I had broken my shoulder and collar bone. I was immediately treated, Because I was in critical condition. I was admitted to the ICU for 2 days. The nurses were so nice and same goes for every member of the staff there. I understand when you are having a stomach ache it is hard to wait for 5 hours but if someone comes in bleeding to death they need to help them WAY more. Just think about that, they are the doctors and nurses, and they know best. Also respect them because half of these comments are saying you showed up at 11:30 PM you are damn lucky these people are here. Thank you medical staff!! [heart with arrow]

name: United Airlines
address: United Airlines, 1200 Airport Dr, South Burlington, VT 05403
hours: [['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: My flight was delayed 1 hour and 55 min. When I tried to call United Airlines the first number I was given the first call I was hung up on after I told them my flight was delayed. The second call I was told this was for reservations and hung up on again. I then went to the United Airlines website and searched 20 minutes for a customer service number. It was automated and took another fifteen minutes to get to a prompt to speak to a representative. After all that the recording let me know it would be a 50 min wait to speak to a representative. After paying up to get a more direct and faster flight I am really annoyed. I have flown worldwide on some really small commuter airlines and this is the worst experience ever. Well my flight was delayed 1:55 minutes then again 5 hours then finally cancelled. I was at the airport from 10 AM until 4 PM when they informed me the flight was now cancelled and their were no flights out today. I had upgraded my flight from a Delta flight that arrived in Orlando at 8:30 to the United flight that arrived at 6pm. I will loose business tomorrow and have to pay a penalty because I am not there on time. United Airlines said there is no way to get me there. They also stated you can not stay in the air port, they do not pay for lodging or transportation to and from the hotel. Worst experience ever and the rudest way of saying I am sorry. The apology was dreadful. Basically I am sorry we don’t pay lodging, I am sorry were not going to pay your transportation to the hotel, I am sorry you are losing business because we can not manage or business successfully. Horrible experience I will never fly United again and will tell everyone about my horrible experience. Shame on you United for your poor customer service skills.

name: Massage Envy

text: I had a massage by Jared today and it was just a massage. I was disappointed because I was suppose to get a 90 minute massage. I understand they allow time for dressing and consultation. My massage started at 4:10 pm and ended at 5:21. I feel I should have had another 15 minutes of massage. He talked through most of massage and he complained constantly that massage therapy was a physically demanding job and he was tired. He explained that his girlfriend understood because she was a message therapist too. I felt he was not really interested in helping me personally.

She for sure nailed the color I showed her a picture of, and she touched up my super short cut and it is honestly so perfect. I highly recommend this place and Casey for a cut and color! You can follow her on Instagram @thehairchairbycasey. I wish I could give her 10 stars because she was super patient with me and made sure I was leaving 100% satisfied. Money well spent! Thank you guys!!

text: Got my nails done there and the owners were nice, however I paid 15-20 dollars more for a set of acrylic nails than I usually pay. Also they had me pay using only Venmo or Cash but didn’t tell me that when I made the appointment...one of my nails fell completely off after a week and some of them are just lumpy and uneven. I messaged the owner about this seeing if they could put it back on or give me a partial refund but they just read my message and didn’t respond. I never leave reviews but I was so upset about the quality of these nails for $60 dollars.

name: Cumberland Farms
address: Cumberland Farms, 20 Upper Main St, Morrisville, VT 05661
text: I was at this site at around 2 PM today, I was new in town and was looking for a local newspaper. The girl at the register was texting on her phone so I had to wait for her to finish. I asked if there was a local paper and she said "Oh I'm not sure but if there was it would be over there"(pointing to the back of the store). I asked her which one was the local paper and she went back to texting and ignored me. Then another custoner service rep came to the registier. I ask him/her if there was a local paper and I was told the same thing. I told them that I was new to the town and needed some help. Neither seemed intrested in helping me. I ask for help and they both said if there was a local paper it would be in the back. I said "Thank you I will go to a store that would be happy to help me!" As I was leaving I heard one of them say "What a b####!" I turned and said we will see!!

name: Essex Family Dental

text: I called in as a new customer on a Thursday afternoon at 3 pm with a broken tooth, they fit me right in and took care of me that day. My daughter also needed some work on her tooth, they took care of her immediately. The entire staff is so accommodating and friendly, they make you feel at ease even if you hate the dentist! The office is beautiful and welcoming. I highly suggest this dentist to anyone.

name: Essex Family Dental
address: Essex Family Dental, 11 Market Pl, Essex Junction, VT 05452
category: ['Dentist', 'Cosmetic dentist', 'Dental implants periodontist', 'Emergency dental service', 'Endodontist', 'Oral surgeon', 'Orthodontist', 'Pediatric dentist']

The DA had to instant message the front to let them know we were ready to check out. We then stood around waiting in our 'cube' for nearly 10 minutes! Our appointment was done why were we waiting? It would seem that although they have many 'cubes' there is only one person to funnel through for verifying payment and check out. This is not acceptable to me. This was more annoying than the constant beeps the computers made the last time I was there when the staff was being notified there was something needing attention. Even though it was not for the staff person in my 'cube'.

name: Shippee Family Eye Care - Montpelier, VT
address: Shippee Family Eye Care - Montpelier, VT, 114 Main St, Montpelier, VT 05602
text: I had the most wonderful eye doctor for my recent visit to the Montpelier office. She was kind and friendly and took the time to answer all of my questions. An A+ for the doctor! Unfortunately, the office staff has been very unresponsive and unhelpful in resolving a problem with documenting the money I paid for glasses for my healthcare reimbursement account. I've made several calls that have gone unreturned and nobody in the office seems willing to jot a two-sentence note confirming that the $292 I paid for glasses was, in fact, for glasses. Most recently, they needed to "talk to their accountant" about this, which seems silly. And, apparently that person is only there on Tuesdays. They were going to do that on Tuesday and call me back. No call Tuesday and no call Wednesday. Just left yet another message. At this point I am expecting to just be out this money, all because someone from the office is not not willing to take 30 seconds and write me a simple note. Again, my doctor was fantastic, but I'd definitely give a failing grade to the helpfulness of the office staff at this point.

name: Johnson Food Shelf
address: Johnson Food Shelf, 780 Railroad St, Johnson, VT 05656
text: Fresh vegetables from gardens!! I do not have a garden for lack of dirt to plant things, and the food shelf takes overruns and donations from gardens. So lovely for us veggie lovers! Today's haul was cucumbers, pickling cukes, red and orange peppers, tomatoes of all types, green and yellow beans, potatoes and lovely squash! Also, you can pick up bread without signing up. And, although I did write that the food shelf is open Tuesdays and Fridays, it is also open Wednesdays from 4-6 pm.I do want to add that in order to use the actual food shelf, one has to sign up and agree that they are needy financially. Not so for the vegs and breads.

name: Madadashcar
address: Madadashcar, 942 Mountain Rd, Stowe, VT 05672
category: ['Auto repair shop', 'Car detailing service', 'Car rental agency', 'Motorcycle shop']
text: Badly done repair work and a non-responsive owner. I had my vehicle's alternator replaced at Madadashcar. 10 days later the alternator belt split along the middle and the some minor damage was caused to other components as the belt flapped around. The belt did not look worn, but like it had not been aligned correctly. I had the car towed to Madadashcar to give them a chance to make it right. The mechanic swore the belt had been correctly installed, that there had been no signs of it looking ready to fail when he put the belt back on the car, and that the timing of the failure was coincidental. He did offer to do the labor for free if we purchased the parts - which now included a tensioner, even though he had not looked at that part when we returned. We were skeptical and did not want to give this business more money or have the same mechanic do any more work on the vehicle, so we had it towed to the dealer and the repairs done there. And thank goodness! It turns out the belt had been installed incorrectly, it was shifted over 2 grooves on one of the pulleys you could not see from the top. In addition, the adjustment head on the tensioner was snapped off. Since you can not correctly put on an alternator belt without releasing the tension, the dealer's service manager's working theory was that the original mechanic had snapped off the head accidentally and did not want to tell us, so being unable to release the tension they had just pulled the belt on the best they could, which was not all the way. We returned to Madadashcar with the broken part and the repair receipts. The owner, Kara, said she was told that the tensioner was broken when the car came in and the mechanic has chosen not to tell us about it to save us money. So either, the mechanic broke a part on our car and lied, or didn't know how to put on a belt correctly and neglected to inform a customer of a broken component on their car. She apologized, empathized with our frustration, and said to give her 2 days to determine what she'd do to handle it. 2 days came and went with no response. I stopped in to see her, she wasn't there and I left a message to have her call me. Again, no response. A few days later, I made one more try to stop in. The woman at the desk told me that she would not be calling me back. That the owner had decided to ignore me. So at this point I have spent $760 in towing and repair costs to fix the mistake made when they made the original $500 repair. I would like to be able to support a local business, particularly one owned by a veteran, but this experience has been extremely frustrating and expensive.

name: Frog Alley Tattoo & Leatherworks

name: CN Brown Energy
address: CN Brown Energy, 280 Portland St, St Johnsbury, VT 05819
text: I've been a customer for many years and I can PROMISE you you'll be much better off walking with 5 gallon gas cans in your hand, pumping your own fuel at a pump and doing it yourself. (Check out Butler's Family Auto instead if you're in the NEK, they're GREAT!) The customer service and solution to any small issue that could come up after you wait for a delivery for 2 weeks could cost you being easily left out in the cold for another full 2 weeks. I waited two weeks for a delivery (that's okay, businesses get busy and there's a lot of people wanting fuel.) When it finally came, I had a completely empty tank and the driver chatted with my landlord outside a bit. He put a whole 9 gallons in and rather than someone calling me to see what was going on, or even reach out to my landlord at the time, I get a slip (Full? No whistle). I had no idea when certain items were replaced that a whistle was not one of them, as this was out of my hands and I rent. The tank passed inspection that summer, by the same driver who was delivering. Rather than the driver who was at the house try and rectify a simple solution of making sure the delivery I've been relying on got taken care of, I get nothing but that slip and a phone call at 4:30 PM on a Friday. He was there that morning. I called and left a message and waited all weekend and did not get a call back. I had to stop in Monday morning and I was told I would get a call to see what could happen to fix the solution. I didn't get a call. I had to call, and was rudely questioned, "Yeah, did you get your whistle fixed?" By Georgia. So unhelpful and rather rude, especially since I have been a customer there for many seasons. I had no idea about this, and mentioned why something wasn't mentioned to the landlord that the driver was chatting with while pumping a whole 9 gallons in my empty tank. The solution was the get the whistle fixed and have to wait another 2 weeks when everything could have been solved right then and there if the driver asked one simple question, instead he wanted to move on to the next delivery immediately since he was stacked. Just do yourself the biggest favor and go anywhere else but here, even if you're stuck with doing it yourself.

name: Majestic Car Rental Group
address: Majestic Car Rental Group, 616 S Willard St, Burlington, VT 05401
category: ['Car rental agency', 'Airport shuttle service', 'Truck rental agency', 'Used car dealer', 'Van rental agency']
text: This is the first public review I've ever, ever posted -- and I'm doing so only because the reviews posted presently about this company are so contrary to the experience I've had with them. I've now rented a car from these folks probably about 6 times over the past couple years - when my car was in the shop for an extended period, when I was in-between cars, when I needed a larger or more reliable car for a special trip. EVERY time, my experience was 100% positive. They are very professional. Their cars are clean and nice (new). Their on-line reservations are super easy - and whenever I've requested a particular kind of car, they have always accommodated my request. They always have the car available when I asked for it - and their after-hours drop off makes the transaction seamless. They are located right on the bus route for the times I need to take a bus into town to pick up the car. They drive me into town on a weekday if I'm dropping the car and in a hurry to get to work on time. (Just let them know ahead of time that you would like this service.) And… the best part… they have the lowest prices, hands down. And, unlike lots of places, they will explain those multiple insurance options to you so that you can actually understand them easily. One other point, Majestic also does business with integrity. They have protocols in place (will put a hold on your card for higher than your total bill will be, will not take cash, follow under-age laws, additional driver, etc) that may be a bit of a pain in the neck but, if you think about it, are the protocols that ensure that they do not rent to anyone who might be renting a car for the anonymity that facilitates illegal activities. One other point - for Vermonters: I usually avoid renting cars during the winter months as I find that rental cars just don't have the same high-quality winter tires that I put on my own cars and that I like to drive with during winter weather. Rental cars usually go with all-seasons. Majestic informed me last month that they have a few cars with winter tires on them this year (2015-2016) -- which is something you just can't find anywhere else and which will give me peace of mind if I do need a rental car once the snow does decided to come this year. I like this company. The folks who work here work hard. The company does right by its customers. Really the only negative is that their little parking lot is tight - be careful getting in and out. I find it unfortunate that anyone can just get on-line and post a review against a company -- as who even knows if what the folks have posted is true or not. Reading what was already posted, made me take the time to record my experiences to date. The negative review about taking a rental car through an EZ Pass lane - without a pass - and then being irate that they were actually expected to pay for that…. huh? If someone took my personal car through an EZ Pass lane - without a pass - and I got a bill in the mail… I'd send them the bill! and a surcharge :) Geesh!

text: Their sales department needs to lay off. I got onto a list of theirs recently and I've received multiple calls from Erica. At one point she hung up on my bookkeeping manager who has taken several messages from her. Spoke with her today 40 minutes after she spoke with my team member. She was antagonistic for the entire call and she denied speaking with him, insisting that she had only left voicemails for me (which would bypass my manager completely and come directly to me). Rather than talking about it, she insisted that it was my problem and that she would have no reason to lie, and was sorry that I "was having a bad day". Perhaps someone else left the message under her name and logged it as a voicemail, but how easy would it have been to say, "it looks like our records might be in error" and talk through the issue? There's no excuse for poor customer service like this, but worse is the lack of accountability. Would not work with a company like this regardless of their services if you know they're going to duck for cover immediately when there's an issue.

text: We went there to look for engagement rings and ended up with both an. engagement ring and both of our wedding bands.We had the most amazing experience, everything was super tailored to us. We got. help from Collette who sat with us and before we even started looking just tried to get to know us a little bit. We had very little idea what we wanted, but she took her time as she showed us multiple different types of rings. Once we found the one. she made sure to get it sized the same day. My fiancé's ring ended up having to be sized by the ring maker due to the design, but she texted me as soon as it was on its way with the tracking number and a personalized message (We live out of state). I couldn't speak more highly of this jeweler- everything felt special about it and I felt very fortunate at how effortless they made the whole process!

name: B & B Auto Repair
address: B & B Auto Repair, 160 Benmont Ave #9, Bennington, VT 05201
text: Professional. Quality work .fantastic price. Called for an oil change and also stated that I needed rear brakes. Hearing awful noises from underneath vehicle. I stated that I work very early and could only come after work. They said no problem,come in at 4pm. So I show up and they proceed to perform the oil change and also the rear brakes that I requested. Jason calls me out to show me the vehicle. Not only did I not need rear brakes the noise was from the front of the vehicle. It was sway bar links and most importantly the outer ball joint was extremely bad. To the point that Jason would not let me drive the vehicle for my safety. I explained that I had to have the vehicle for work and that if he closed at 5pm and it was 3 hours of work, what could I do. He said he would just have to stay and repair it. Now first of all another repair shop would have started by just putting on rear brakes that I didn't need. That's how honest jason and his staff are.. So jason and his staff stayed and made sure my vehicle was repaired and that it would be safe to drive. They stayed until 900 pm for me. Try and find that kind of honesty and dedication to your customers anywhere. I guarantee you never will. My vehicle has never been safer or without noises underneath since it was new. I thank you jason and your staff Pam,Jeremy. You are all fantastic

name: Tire Warehouse Tires and Service
address: Tire Warehouse Tires and Service, 114 Pearl St, Essex Junction, VT 05452
text: I had a exhaust that I wanted to install on my car. After getting about halfway through installation I realized the rest of the bolts were far too rusty for me to get off by myself with just hand tools. I came into Monro Muffler in Essex near Wicked Wings hoping they could torch out the 3 bolts that were preventing me from getting the old exhaust off. I was told that the soonest they could get me in was monday at 1pm so I said that was fine and booked the appointment. I asked for an estimate how much it would be since it was only 3 bolts that needed to be removed the guy who seemed to be the manager quoted me 100 to 140 dollars to do the job. I felt the price seemed a bit high since half the job was already done but I reluctantly said okay since I was in a bind. I show up on monday at 1 and check in for my appointment. I look down at the schedule thing on their counter and I can clearly see my name is crossed out. Only I never cancelled and no one ever called me??? That strikes me as odd but I patiently wait in the waiting room. At about 1:15 a "tech" brings my car into the bay to begin working on it. After a lot of banging and loud noises in no time at all he has the old original exhaust off. I assume things are going well as I see he is fitting up the new exhaust well before 2 pm. I figured it would be about an hour job tops for any halfway decent mechanic. Except he was not. My car is rolling back out of the bay at around 2:10 and the keys are returned to the guy dealing with customers in the waiting room. He tells me my car is all set and attempts to charge me 180 dollars!!! I say okay well i was quoted 100-140 and that took barely an hour. He then decides to charge me 140 after he had admitted he had "made a mistake". Kinda shady especially since the dealership probably wouldn't of even charged that much but okay at this point I just wanna get outta here as the waiting room is dusty and uninviting. I hop in my car to leave and fire it up. Instantly I am staring at a nice bright orange CHECK ENGINE light. I am not dumb and I even took a picture of my cars dash the morning i left for Monro muffler with no check engine light on for this very reason. I instantly go back in and ask why I suddenly have a check engine light on. They give me this incredibly bullshit excuse that because its a aftermarket exhaust that its messing with the o2 sensor. Hmmmmm Only the exhaust mounts up to a flange thats AFTER the sensor. So there was no difference in the exhaust flow leading up to the sensor....That just didn't make any sense to me and a tech at the Automaster laughed out loud when i told him that what he had said. The guy at the counter of Monro says to drive around a bit and the ecu will adjust and the light will go off. Again I was skeptical when they told me that but was tired of being there so i left and headed to auto zone to have the computer scanned for codes. Sure enough the code coming up is for Primary o2 sensor. I am not dumb and I know that those sensors are delicate and my guess is the tech was very rough on the stock exhaust while removing it and the sensor was damaged in the process. I have driven around for two weeks now and to no surprise the light remains to stay on. I now am getting poor gas mileage due to the damaged o2 sensor causing the car to run rich. These guys are shady as they come. I regret not waiting a few days longer til Burlington Muffler & Brake had an opening

name: ClearChoiceMD Urgent Care
address: ClearChoiceMD Urgent Care, 1154 Putney Rd, Brattleboro, VT 05301
category: ['Urgent care center', 'Medical clinic', 'Occupational health service', 'Walk-in clinic']
text: This is a very large building and we entered on the backside, where there are NO signs. My husband dropped me off bc he assumed he couldn't go in with me. People show up to urgent care sick, not feeling well, often with fevers. With a fever, you can't think straight because you have a fever! Upon walking around to the entrance, I see signs that say wait in your car until someone comes out. 1, where I live it's not like this, so was unexpected. 2, I had to chase my husband down to have him come back, all while sick and with a fever. 3, In all of the online intake forms I filled out, it did not inform me to stay in my car. 4, No where in the text messages you sent me did it say to stay in your car. 5, When you texted me to ask me how long I had been in VT, no one mentioned to stay in my car. SO, as I am feverish and not well and confused, I call to say I have an appointment, should I come in or wait in my car, Heidi says "Doesn't the sign say to wait in your car?". I stuttered at the shock of someone being so rude, and again, Heidi says " the sign says to stay in your car". Ok, wow. Great compassion. Great patient centered care. Not really. How about, just answering the question and giving accurate information to the patient calling Heidi, the patient who is sick, has a fever, and is already struggling as a human to get herself to urgent care to get CARE. :/ As a healthcare provider myself, I would never treat my patients like that. Upon waiting in my car, someone comes to intake me. When I roll down my window, she says, "oh you are the one from New York?". Seriously? No, I have a name and am here for care. The PA was professional, she told me to call in 8 days for my COVID19 test results. I call and Heidi answers, I tell her I'm calling for results. She says when was your test. I say, 8 days ago. She retorts, "well, results come in 10-14 days" in a way that implies, why are you calling stupid? I tell her, the PA told me to call in 8 days. She replies, well no one is available to give you the results, they will have to call you back. Someone calls me and leaves a message to call back. I call back, and then someone says, oh they were negative. This place is just a hassle and Heidi and staff really needs some customer service training. Re this places reply: I had no issue with Quests delay in testing results, as this is happening all over the country. The issue is the lack of patient centered care and being treated badly.

name: Rutland Pharmacy
address: Rutland Pharmacy, 75 Allen St, Rutland, VT 05701
text: The staff is so helpful and they offer auto-refill, then they send you a text message letting you know that your order is ready. They give great advice on over-the-counter meds also. I have been a customer for 15 years and will never go anywhere else.

name: LensCrafters
address: LensCrafters, 155 Dorset St, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: I would give them 5 Star but there customer service is terrible over 2 weeks and counting I emailed them about a problem I had at this lanscrafters and I have not received a message back from them and I have emailed them multiple times and nothing. That is why I am give 1 stars because there is no negative stars. I don't like writing bad reviews but customer service need improvement. They are professionals and they are great but trying to get answer from a email that I have sent multiple times. The review may change but I guess wait and see.

name: Flooring America

text: Dave and Tyler have been the best to work with and when needed in a time pinch they came thru. Most appreciated and customer service the the nth level!!!

name: Lowell's Moving & Storage
address: Lowell's Moving & Storage, 6 Ethan Allen Dr Suite 3, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Moving and storage service', 'Mover', 'Piano moving service', 'Storage facility']
text: LOWELS is a first rate company. Bruce estimated the cost of our recent move from VT to NC. There were no surprises ....well maybe one. We didn't expect the experience to be so positive. The follow up from the office after the estimate was great and timely. The team arrived on time and worked tirelessly until both trucks were loaded. I was impressed with the manner that all of our wooden furniture was so carefully wrapped and loaded. The two trucks arrived on time in NC two days after leaving VT. The drivers worked from 12:30 until 8:30 pm to unload our goods. We still talk about how professional, polite and hardworking they were. When she asked what she could do to help my wife, Elizabeth, was told to find a chair and tell them where to put the boxes and furniture. This is a professional, well run business with employees that get along and have a great synergy. You will not go wrong having LOWELS handle your move. Jack Maloney

name: Bissonette Properties
address: Bissonette Properties, 100 North St, Burlington, VT 05401
text: My fiancé, dog, and I decided to make the move from Philly to Vermont now that we have the ability to work from home. We started our apartment search in early January and came across many Bissonette Properties. We opened up the conversation and were helped SO MUCH by Addy! She communicated with us via text message (which we preferred and over a whole month while we found the right space for us) to quickly answer any questions we had and informed us of property availability when told her what we were searching for. We have never signed a lease for an apartment without seeing it in person first, but we definitely trusted Bissonette Properties and Addy to give us the real laydown of the property via photos, video, and through the many questions we asked. We are looking forward to moving in June 1st and are hopeful for the relationship we will have with them over the course of our tenancy!

name: Halladay's Flowers & Gifts

name: jenkins auto repair
address: jenkins auto repair, 26 River St, Milton, VT 05468
text: Repairs are fine but they've tried to scam me, and another family member of mine. I was suspicious the first time but I know for sure now because the same thing happened to them as me. Really made me mad. Both me and my family member had "major repairs needed" amounting to $1000-2000 each. but when our cars were brought to multiple other garages, we were told that was not at all the case and our cars were fine with those two repairs. They can do minor repairs but they're probably going to try to scam you. Not a good place to go.

text: We called About some vines we were interested in buying. We wanted to know if they had them and how much. A guy said "Toby" would call us back after a meeting they were in. We never got a phone call. We called back at 4:15 pm and the same guy answered. We tried to get a ask about a price but he disconnected. We called back and a lady named Julliette answered. We asked how much and she said we will call you back. We are going to Gardeners Supply to buy all our plants now. Horrible serve with customers.

name: Blue Moose

text: I would say that the food here is mediocre. They have nice comfort food, but there isn't a main plate technically. The menu is really just pasta and salad. However, the deserts are outstanding. The cappuccino panna cotta is one of the best I've tasted. The restaurant opens at 5 pm and closes at 8, but they'll probably won't let customers in last minute. It's located right across the Latchis theater and you can park down the street.

text: I brought my car in for the normal maintenance. My service adviser did not seem to know the details of my maintenance package and had to ask another advisor for help. I asked about my car giving a message when maintenance comes due and he said he would have them check on that and reset it but that wasn’t done till I was leaving and asked if they had done it. I also asked them to not do a tire rotation since I recently had it done with an alignment yet the paperwork said it was done in one spot and not in another...confusing and not sure what was done. When I got home I noticed my paperwork said that I had a “6,000 mile maintenance” when it should have said “18,000” miles. Would it be possible to stay with the same service advisor over the entire life service of the car? That would help with the advisors getting to know the clients and the car’s history. My experience with previous cars I have owned this was the case and it seemed to work better. Thank you.

name: White River Subaru
address: White River Subaru, 429 Sykes Mountain Ave, White River Junction, VT 05001
category: ['Subaru dealer', 'Car dealer', 'Car finance and loan company', 'Truck dealer', 'Used car dealer', 'Used truck dealer']
text: My boyfriend had won ski tickets from Prime Subaru so I decided I would look into possibly leasing a car from them instead of going to my local subaru dealer. I spoke with a gentleman named Isaac Bocko on Monday and told him that I just pulled my own credit score and told him my numbers. I explained to him that I've only had my current car for almost 2 years and gave him the figures on what I owed on it. I thought with that information they would be able to tell me if I should wait till I get my current car paid down or not. He asked if they could pull it too as it would better assist them, so I gave them permission. I was told on Tuesday by Issac that I was approved but they were not sure for what the amount was yet. Wednesday comes around and Prime Subaru decides they will pull at the credit again 3 different times! I called and asked why they were pulling my credit as I was already told on Tuesday that I was approved. The gentleman I was on the phone put me on hold and asked his manager what was going on and came back on the phone and said I was approved and they would not pull at the credit anymore and someone should be contacting me shortly after they put the fugures in. Come 6:30 in the evening yesterday I hadn't heard from anyone so I called and spoke to a lady and explained what was going on. She informed me that I was approved and issac would contact me Thursday morning when he gets in. Well I was just told my issac that's wasn't approved and that he never told me that I was and not sure why anyone would tell me that so it must be a miscommunication on my part. I have the text message from issac that says I was approved. Bottom line of my story is this company tells everyone that they are approved to get your hopes up and then blame you for it being a miscommunication! I went to Manchester Subaru and that company went beyond expectations for me. I'm so thankful for Manchester Subaru for treating me the right way I should have been treated with you!

name: Chimney Savers
address: Chimney Savers, 895 VT Route 12 South, Randolph, VT 05060
text: I called Chimney Savers the day of a chimney fire. While it was a Sunday I did not expect an answer but I wanted to get in the queue. Monday morning I called in and the receptionist knew me from my message, and was able to schedule a same day inspection. The fire department advised me to get the chimney inspected and it's a good thing I did, the tech who performed the inspection found cracks in the tiles and was able to point them out to me. He as prompt and on time. Very professional and helpful. I would call them again.

name: KW Vermont - Kyle Adams
address: KW Vermont - Kyle Adams, 68 Randall St, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: As a single mother, I have to say that my home buying experience was both terrifying and a little like a fairy tale all at the same time. There are so many things that can go wrong, and often a struggle to find the right house in the first place. Kyle was my realtor and answered a ton of my questions. I was probably a high maintenance home buyer since I had never had a mortgage before, and for the first time, I was making decisions alone. I knew what I wanted, to some extent, and the school district that I wanted to be in, but aside from that, I was pretty much clueless about the process between agents, sellers, buyers, and banks. When I finally found a house that seemed to fit everything I was looking for, Kyle made the entire process easy to manage and walked me step by step through every detail. Through the entire process, he kept me level-headed, forcing me to weigh pros and cons, which was helpful, because sometimes when I get excited I tend to only focus on the positives. Kyle wanted to make sure that this was going to be the right house for me, both now, and in the long run. When it came time for home inspection, Kyle even made suggestions for people other buyers had used in the past and guided me through what I could expect with each of them. He scheduled the home inspection and kept me well informed through every step of the process. Kyle made sure to have the smallest details checked out, like having the septic inspected to try to avoid "surprise expenses" after buying my home. This isn't something that had to be done, but he knew my budget was tight, and he cared enough to be sure I wasn't getting myself into something I couldn't afford. Step by step, through the home buying process, Kyle gave me advice and his opinion based on past experiences. Even if the message was that we were waiting for one thing or another, I always knew what was going on. Not knowing and waiting between steps were the hardest parts for me, you are so excited, but constantly second-guessing yourself, and wondering if something might be going awry. Having Kyle there to always let me know what to expect and keep me on track, was one of the best decisions I ever made. Kyle even checked in with me after my purchase, to both thank me, and make sure everything was still going as planned and I was happy. Imagine that... Him, thanking me?! No thanks necessary, Kyle... Thank YOU, for being the absolute BEST agent that I could have asked for. And for caring enough to make this a positive experience. Nothing is ever perfect in life, but this home buying experience was as close to perfect as I think you can get. If you are looking for an agent to help you find a home, and guide you through the buying process, call Kyle.. if there was a red carpet in real estate, this is the guy who would roll it out for you.
