text: Steer clear of service here, unless your time is not valuable. Three times in 2 years, my car has been brought in for a service first in the am then needs to stay overnight after waiting around until after 4 PM. And they promised me a driver to deliver my car to work the next day but didn't alert me until noon that the driver was unavailable until the following day. 2 days without my vehicle for a recall and 40K check, then they had the audacity to charge me $9.43 for the gas I used in their loaner in that extra two nights they held my car hostage. They will never service my car again!!! (in response) I was texted by management Antony, with absolutely no assistance in resolution, only that the car would be delivered the next day (no help). I spoke with the GM who assured me he would look into it and credit the ludicrous fuel charge (which has not been refunded as of today, 3 business days later). I rarely leave poor reviews but the public should be warned.

text: We’ve come here as locals down the street for a couple of years. The staff turnover is very high for some reason so it is hard to bond with anyone before they are gone. Not sure whether the turnover is due to pay, or potential for tips in low season, or the structure of management control the Owners seem to have put in place. Many main dishes are excellent but we usually come for what might be the best pizzas in our sleepy town!! I always take a slice of Pepperoni pizza and my beloved spouse likes the fried Brussels sprouts to go with a good glass of wine. A truly delightful Montpelier experience!! Service can be very slow if the place is busy between 5 and 7 pm which is local feeding frenzy time. After that it is total peace and you can meditate over your slice!![thumbs up] Sit at the bar if you want fast and better service from the bartender who can serve food and drinks!!

text: 5 stars does not do this shop justice for their customer service. Called the shop to sign up for one of their mid week dives. Due to the travel distance ( coming from Buffalo NY) Johnathan offered to set up an extra dive on a weekend to help accommodate my schedule. Fall weather being as unpredictable as it is, our Saturday dive was blown out. But they offered to adjust their Sunday dive schedule to make sure our two Saturday dives could be done. If your looking for a special trip I recommend this shop. Thank you to Krieg (DM) and captain Larry for an amazing dives.

name: Men's Cutting Edge
address: Men's Cutting Edge, 150 Dorset St # 240, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: I give up. I've been a customer of MCE for two years. In that time, I've been through four stylists -- all four left the salon, vanished without a trace. That's some kind of signal. Now, their voicemail message says they've reduced their days down to Wednesday through Saturday. Last time I was in they had only two stylists, one of whom (my most recent one) was on vacation. Today I called four times for an appointment. Got voicemail all four times. If this business was an airplane, it would be trailing smoke from both engines and heading for a mountainside. Despite the good haircuts, it is simply too hard to try and be their customer. Enough.

name: UPS Customer Center
address: UPS Customer Center, 1028 Industrial Pkwy, St Johnsbury, VT 05819
text: 4 to 6 pm? Why even bother? Let alone you can't call anyone to help you they have no idea.

name: UPS Customer Center
address: UPS Customer Center, 1028 Industrial Pkwy, St Johnsbury, VT 05819
text: Employees at facility and drivers are all friendly and courteous, wish they could figure out the problems with my address and provide a local number so I wouldn't have to drive there every time something goes wrong. I can call 800 number and have someone in California forward my message and have them call me back after a couple hours, but number comes up as private, plus missed the call so would have had to go through same process all over again, so drove there and wasted a trip because package was rescheduled for delivery again and was back out on truck. Being able to call would have been and would be so much easier.

name: UPS Customer Center
address: UPS Customer Center, 1028 Industrial Pkwy, St Johnsbury, VT 05819
text: Out of the way, but easy to find. Short window to be open, 4-6 pm Monday -Friday

name: UPS Customer Center
address: UPS Customer Center, 1028 Industrial Pkwy, St Johnsbury, VT 05819
text: They are only open 2 hours a day for dropping off packages (4-6 pm M-F). I am glad they have some hours, just not enough.

name: LAND AIR
address: LAND AIR, 7 Kellogg Rd, Essex Junction, VT 05452, United States
text: Hey guys! Thanks for the Stacyc electric bike. My girl is loving it. How can I share a video with you of her ripping it up? Right now it is on Facebook and natively on my iPhone, if I can message it to you.

name: ArtsRiot
address: ArtsRiot, 400 Pine St, Burlington, VT 05401, United States
text: What a fun & affordable experience, showcasing what Burlington has to offer. Put it on your calendar, plan on eating affordable and flavorful dishes from local catering trucks. Enjoy a full menu from local breweries and top it off by listening to some great local live music, all wrapped up by 10 pm - catering to those that want to call it an early night and those that are looking for a " Second Act" for the evening.

name: ArtsRiot
address: ArtsRiot, 400 Pine St, Burlington, VT 05401, United States
text: I arrived in Burlington on hot summer Friday and kicked off my stay at the ArtsRiot Truck Stop, which is held in the restaurant's "backyard" every Friday night during the summer from 5-10 PM. It was a fun introduction to Burlington with plenty of food, drinks, and live music. It wasn't huge, but it was bustling with groups of friends and families (and their canine friends). I also loved that it was free to get in, and there was free parking in the lot across the street. Definitely a fun way to spend an hour or two on a Friday night.

name: ArtsRiot
address: ArtsRiot, 400 Pine St, Burlington, VT 05401, United States
text: First time visit to see friends performance "Broadway, Neat with a Twist". Had a fantastic time in this intimate space. I had soda, but looked like a good selection of beer and wine at the small bar in the back. Was told they start serving food at 4 pm at the other side of the building.

name: The Killington Group
address: The Killington Group, 10 W Park Rd, Killington, VT 05751
text: We rents a condo unit through Airbnb in Killington. When we arrived, there was mouse feces in every room, cobwebs, dead and alive spiders. It was obvious nobody had been in the condo for weeks and nobody had walked though to clean it before our arrival. When we spoke to a rep from the Killington Group, the response was "well it's Vermont and mice are a way of life". I'm sorry, we live in New England. We know there are mice here, we don't have mice in our living areas at home. At least they did not challenge a refund, but we were sent scrambling to find lodging during Columbus day weekend in Vermont with 4 young children at 6:30 pm 4 hours away from home.

name: Hop To It Towing LLC
address: Hop To It Towing LLC, 100 Cleveland Ave, Rutland, VT 05701
category: ['Towing service', 'Auto wrecker', 'Automobile storage facility', 'Car detailing service', 'Junkyard', 'Salvage yard', 'Used auto parts store']
text: I locked my keys in my car and it was almost 5 pm. I called and Hop To It came with in 5 minutes. The guy was friendly and I was thankful to be able to unlock my car and be heading home. They were great.

name: C.P. Dudley Store
address: C.P. Dudley Store, 2915 US-2, East Montpelier, VT 05651
text: Typical Vermont Country Store and gas station. Staff always friendly. Open until 9 pm. Really good sandwiches. You can puck up all your necessities and also what you thought you did not need[beaming face with smiling eyes]. Location couldn't be better. Right in town, close to main road. Bit to close, so drive in slow! Post office is right next to it. Well lit at night.

name: K & W Tire
address: K & W Tire, 222 Granger Rd, Barre, VT 05641
category: ['Auto repair shop', 'Auto tune up service', 'Brake shop', 'Car inspection station', 'Car repair and maintenance', 'Mechanic', 'Oil change service', 'Tire shop', 'Wheel alignment service']
text: Left message never called back

name: Stowe Veterinary Clinic
address: Stowe Veterinary Clinic, 1606 Pucker St, Stowe, VT 05672
text: After moving to the Stowe VT area I was in need of a vet for my ailing cat who is 17 years old. I called the clinic at 9am and explained to the receptionist that I needed to make an appointment to put my pet to sleep. She said that "Greg" would have to call me back and set up a time for when "no one was in the office". This was strange but I accepted it. She would not allow me to set up a time until I spoke with Greg. After waiting four hours for a call back and not receiving it I called again and asked if I should seek vet care elsewhere as this seemed to be an issue for them. I was told again "Greg" would call me back before 5:30 pm. I am losing a member of my family. This type of decision is difficult enough without having to jump through hoops from "Greg" who does not have the courtesy to call back or speak to someone without making them wait several hours. My animals can do without his kind of veterinary medicine. I agree with another post on this site that not everyone graduates at the top of their class. I think Greg is proof of that. I have since found more professional and caring vet care in my area.

name: Domino's Pizza
address: Domino's Pizza, 748 Main St, Bennington, VT 05201
text: Order was put in at 5:00 pm. 1 Sandwich and 1 stuffed bread. Done at 5:08 I called at 5:25 because it was not out for delivery and was told they were short on delivery people and they will get there as soon as possible. Out for delivery at 5:47pm. Almost one hour now. The order had better been redone! It was not; delivered at 5:55pm. Ridiculous!! If they didn't charge a delivery fee they would have more drivers I presume.

name: Eastern & Main Market - Deli
address: Eastern & Main Market - Deli, 1194 Main St, St Johnsbury, VT 05819
text: Throughout the 2020 - 2021 Coronavirus Pandemic, staff failed to wear masks. Sandwiches are good though.

name: P & P Septic Service, Inc.
address: P & P Septic Service, Inc., 543 Shunpike Rd, Williston, VT 05495
hours: [['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: Had a septic issue over the weekend, left a message and they sent Frank and Collin out first thing this morning to address - they had it fixed in under an hour and were great to work with. I've used P&P for over twenty years now and have found them to be consistently professional with a strong team - highly recommend.

name: Portland Glass of South Burlington
address: Portland Glass of South Burlington, 45 Green Mountain Dr, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Glass & mirror shop', 'Auto glass shop', 'Shower door shop', 'Window installation service']
text: On the last day of our vacation my car was broken into. I couldn't drive all the way back to Mass with a smashed window, in the rain! I called Portland Glass at 8:00 am when they opened. They had me in later that same morning and the window fixed by 1:00 pm. While I can't say that Portland Glass saved our vacation, they did more than I'd have expected an auto glass company to be able to do.

name: Essex Veterinary Center
address: Essex Veterinary Center, 4 Oliver Wight Dr, Essex Junction, VT 05452
text: They really go above and beyond to help you! If you just have some questions to ask about taking care of your pet, you can call them and leave a message and they'll get to answer them as soon as they have a chance! But even visiting for your scheduled appointments are very nice and informative! Great people work here [heart suit]

name: Sterling Motorwerks
address: Sterling Motorwerks, 615 Airport Pkwy, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: It was worth every penny I spent @Sterling recently to fix a confounding electrical issue another service provider could not. Rob, Scott and the crew were thorough, professional and good-humored in making the repairs, explaining them and following through for a ride to and from their impeccably clean and efficient operation. The won me over as a regular customer!

name: Harrison Concrete
address: Harrison Concrete, 1803 Skunk Hill Rd, Fairfax, VT 05454
category: ['Concrete contractor', 'Ready mix concrete supplier', 'Sand & gravel supplier']
text: Talked to a rep in person at local field days. Told what we needed. Said he'd get us a quote. Never heard from him. This year tried again. Called and asked for a quote. Said they'd call this morning and come by today to quote. Nobody called. Called office again and lady said she'd give them a message to call, but had no idea when. Pretty evasive not too dependable. Very frustrating from a consumer's standpoint.

name: Staples
address: Staples, 1375 Maple Tree Pl, Williston, VT 05495
category: ['Office supply store', 'Computer store', 'Electronics store', 'Office equipment supplier', 'Office furniture store', 'Paper distributor', 'Print shop', 'School supply store']
text: Great service. Even at 9 PM.

name: Bethany United Church of Christ
address: Bethany United Church of Christ, 115 Main St, Montpelier, VT 05602
text: This is a church in the center of Montpelier. I visited there for a recital but also picked up information on the church. They had a chapel that was beautiful. The church is very simple. They have a message of being all inclusive. They straight out make it know that they are a Gay Friendly church. The pastor is a woman. As I don't live in the area, I will never get a chance to attend a service but would love to see the church in action. Also they have a common meal once a week, how good is that... Common means anyone who is hungry.

name: Evergreen Family Health
address: Evergreen Family Health, 28 Park Ave, Williston, VT 05495
text: I must exercise my duty to warn others about considering Evergreen Family Health. Please consider receiving care at another practice. I regret ever having learned of this practice. All of my visits were in April 2021. This review is no reflection on the staff (Ms. C. and Ms. J were wonderful to me). This review reflects poorly only on the doctors with whom I was scheduled to see. My first visit with Dr. Salter was routine (a minor issue). The major problem I encountered was the last three visits to this practice (four in total). On my second visit scheduled with Dr. Salter, I left without having seen him due to having had to return to work. I chalked this second visit up to a "busy day" and rescheduled. On my third (unsuccessful) visit scheduled with Dr. Salter, I had to leave again because of having had to go to another doctor's appointment. I even asked the intake person to inform Dr. Salter that I was scheduled for another doctor's appointment during my third visit and it made no difference. I then requested to be rescheduled to see "another" physician other than Dr. Salter because I (incorrectly) assumed that the problem rested solely with him. The receptionist then rescheduled me to see Dr. Reiss. when I left without seeing Dr. Salter for a second time. I asked the receptionist if seeing patients later than 30 minutes past a scheduled time is "normal practice" at Evergreen, to which she replied "no." On my fourth and final visit, I was scheduled for April 30th at 4:40 pm and arrived early. I parked in the parking lot at 4:14 pm and waited until 4:23 pm to enter the building and checked in. The receptionist (Ms. C. - a wonderful lady), quickly escorted me to a room. I was then seen by the assistant, Ms. J (also wonderful), who took my vitals and gave me water. I waited until 5:15 pm to be seen. Dr. Reiss then entered with an assistant and completed the visit with me. I was hoping to have heard "Thank you for your patience in waiting" when Dr. Reiss introduced himself; however, no such luck. I did not mention my experience to Dr. Reiss during my visit with him because I simply wanted to get my results and treatment plan to follow up with another practice. I felt the need; however, to voice my concerns with Ms. J who walked with me to the door after my visit was over. Ms. J promptly asked me to wait while she notified Dr. Reiss of my concerns. I then relayed my concerns with Dr. Reiss and regretted doing so after he offered no apology for my inconvenience. The lack of a simple "acknowledgment" of my inconvenience - especially from a "founding practitioner" of this practice - is unacceptable. Dr. Reiss showed no concern whatsoever for my wasted time. I should not have had to visit Evergreen three times to complete a follow-up visit. I also detected a slight attitude of bemused condescension from Dr. Reiss when I relayed my concerns to him. What was most alarming was the fact that Dr. Reiss informed me that he, in addition to seeing patients, was required to "take calls." It's possible that there may be a high staff turnover - or even an "overbooking" - issue at this practice (which would come as no surprise). Please avoid this place, unless you do not mind waiting at least 30-35 minutes past your scheduled time along with others being able to hear your conversation with a doctor through closed doors.

name: Supercuts
address: Supercuts, 214 Northside Dr #4, Bennington, VT 05201
category: ['Hair salon', 'Barber shop', 'Beauty salon', 'Waxing hair removal service']
text: We called at 9am to make appointments for 3:30 pm we arrived 5 minutes early and they took 2 people in who were sitting there when we walked in. I asked one of the women working why she didn’t take us back since we had appointments, she said they don’t do appointments just call a heads. This was a total waste of time, they could have told us on the phone and we would have went somewhere that actually honors appointments!!! Rude and unprofessional don’t bother!!

name: Kipling's Restaurant & Pub
address: Kipling's Restaurant & Pub, 78 Elliot St #3269, Brattleboro, VT 05301
text: Kitchen closes at 8 pm and it is not expressed on the hours of service... I asked for a beer and a double shot and the drink slinger on duty said "Well the shots of Fireball are $6.00, so are you sure?" Umm, double shot

name: Jim Soriano - State Farm Insurance Agent
address: Jim Soriano - State Farm Insurance Agent, 57 Court St, Middlebury, VT 05753
category: ['Insurance agency', 'Auto insurance agency', 'Home insurance agency', 'Life insurance agency', "Renter's insurance agency"]
text: I have had 4 different insurance companies since I started driving, none were like State Farm. Jazmin has been amazing to work with. I hate having to deal with automated companies and that's not the case with her, anytime I need something changed or have a question I just send her a message and she always responds promptly. If you want excellent customer service, great insurance rates, and to be able to talk to real person when you have any question then I highly recommend State Farm insurance and definitely Jazmin.

name: Wendy's
address: Wendy's, 21 N Main St, Rutland, VT 05701, United States
text: With so many options on Route 7 service speed means a lot for fast food and Wendy's failed that test. I preordered on the app a $5 order and it took 10 minutes in the drive thru to get. This was Friday at 4 PM. On the plus side, the building has been recently updated, the staff was friendly, and the food quality was good.

name: Wendy's
address: Wendy's, 21 N Main St, Rutland, VT 05701, United States
text: Went there at 849 pm they were closing early the staff looked high and not really comprehending my order will never go back. Drug test!!

name: Roto-Rooter Plumbing & Water Cleanup
address: Roto-Rooter Plumbing & Water Cleanup, 998 S Brownell Rd, Williston, VT 05495
hours: [['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: I called rotorooter, and a polite lady has picked up the phone. She asked me what the problem was and offered me the available time slots. Before I called them, I called another plumbing office in Essex and left a message, and the other busniss did not even bother to call me back. While rootoroter picked up the phone and tried to get me the help I need. Before the appointment, Roto-Rooter called me and told me that the technician is in his way . Seth showed up on time geared with his tools. He was very professional he quickly discovered the problem and cleaned the pipes. Not only that, but he also redesigned the whole drainage system for the two sinks, so it will not clog again. He was very fair, quick and professional. For sure, I will refer my friends to Roto-Rooter. Seth was a great representative of the company. Thank

name: Roto-Rooter Plumbing & Water Cleanup
address: Roto-Rooter Plumbing & Water Cleanup, 998 S Brownell Rd, Williston, VT 05495
hours: [['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: Corey tech 35 was very prompt and got the problem rectified very quickly. Frozen pipes on a frigid Friday night at 10 PM. when I called the answering service said a tech would get back to me withing the hour. Corey called in 15 minutes. Explained that he had 3 other calls before mine and said he would be there by 11PM. He was here at 10:10 and thawed the frozen water pipes by midnight. He was extremely professional and courteous and knew exactly what he was doing. I should add that I live in a mobile home and NO ONE would take on the task. so FYI Roto Rooter DOES deal with MANY issues. The price was very reasonable and I will use them again in a heartbeat. I offered to fill Corey's coffee mug and he was very grateful. He went on his way to yet another call. Corey was an excellent tech and if I need any sort of plumbing needs again I hope I get him as a tech.

name: Roto-Rooter Plumbing & Water Cleanup
address: Roto-Rooter Plumbing & Water Cleanup, 998 S Brownell Rd, Williston, VT 05495
hours: [['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: Nothing but good things to say about CJ & RotoRooter. I noticed a wet spot on my kitchen ceiling on a Sunday morning. I called RotoRooter expecting to leave a message and hear back from someone the next business day. My call was answered immediately and I was told I could expect a call back from the tech on call. CJ called back within 30 seconds and told me he would be at my house 20 minutes later. Not only did CJ arrive exactly when he said he would, he diagnosed & corrected the issue (leaky tub in the bathroom above) within the first hour. Fast, efficient, friendly & knowledgeable. Great experience.

name: Roto-Rooter Plumbing & Water Cleanup
address: Roto-Rooter Plumbing & Water Cleanup, 998 S Brownell Rd, Williston, VT 05495
hours: [['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: I called a plumbing company about a leak in our basement and their response was that they could give us an appointment for mid January 2016. We decided to contact Roto-Rooter. Rita was our contact person. She explained that she could have a tech at our home between 11:00 am and 1:00 pm. She asked for our email address, all along explaining that if we showed the email to the tech, that we would receive a discount. I accepted the appointment. Within 15 minutes Rita called back saying that she had found an available tech and that he could be on his way to our home immediately and would this be acceptable to us. Twenty-five or so minutes later we meet John Tech 41. John access the problem and went to work. We are always interested in work being performed on our home. I had lots of questions and John was very willing to answer them. He explained what he was doing and why. His work was done in a timely fashion and he conducted himself in a professional manner. What a positive experience for us. Thank You Rita, John and Roto-Rooter.

name: Roto-Rooter Plumbing & Water Cleanup
address: Roto-Rooter Plumbing & Water Cleanup, 998 S Brownell Rd, Williston, VT 05495
hours: [['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: We were lucky to have Roto-Rooter help us during a previous emergency at our rental property. Beside going above and beyond on our plumbing issue they went into the realm of taking care of our tenant and advised us of an unsafe issue in the home. Yesterday when we had a clogged sewer line (of course it has to happen at 6 pm on a Saturday) we did not even have to think about who we would call. We received an immediate response when we called and within a couple of hours we could flush our toilets again. Corey was professional, knowledgeable and efficient. . Poor Corey had to come on his day off because someone else was having problems and made the right decision to call Roto-Rooter so the tech on call was already engaged at another home. But even with the emergency price it was worth having Roto-Rooter take care of us. I highly recommend Roto-Rooter.

name: Roto-Rooter Plumbing & Water Cleanup
address: Roto-Rooter Plumbing & Water Cleanup, 998 S Brownell Rd, Williston, VT 05495
hours: [['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: Very disappointed. I had previous good experience with them, but the last episode was unacceptable. I had them work on a leaky toilet 6 months ago. They put a new wax seal on the base and it seemed good. 6 months later I had them pull the toilet, but the new wax seal led to leaking again. Turns out there was a crack in the flange they must have missed the first time. I scheduled a 1pm appt for next week. No one showed up. I scheduled a 1 pm appt a week later. They showed up at 4:15, three and a half hours late. When I called to speak to the manager, he ostensibly apologized but was very defensive. He claims they have 2 hour appt windows. Neither his technician, his secretary, nor him actually told that to me. Anyway, they were well outside the 2-hour window they never told me about in the first place.

name: KFC
address: KFC, 126 Pearl St, Essex Junction, VT 05452, United States
text: Service was OK, food was dry, flavorless. The dining room needs some serious updating as well a thorough cleaning. Equipment for chicken was flashing warning signs of having no water and beeping like crazy. Bathrooms were disgusting. No butter whatsoever in store at 5 pm.

name: Green Door Pub
address: Green Door Pub, Building 11 Village Square Downstairs of Mulligan's, Stratton Mountain, VT 05155
text: Was in the area for a Spartan race and wanted to find a good place to watch NFL football on Sunday, the Green Door Pub was definitely fit the bill having NFL Sunday Ticket. However there seemed to be a lot of false advertising going on. We started upstairs at Mulligan's and saw in their menu that Long Trails Ales were $3 and free wings (5-7 PM) during Sunday NFL games. Yet when we went down stairs there were no free wings (we were down there during the time frame) and we ordered 4-5 long trails and a bucket of wings ($12.99) and the bill came out to be $49 and change. In addition the sign out front advertised that a bucket of wings were $10.99 which was contrary to all the signs in the actual bar. Outside of all this the wings were delicious and the atmosphere was exactly what we were looking for but probably won't ever be back despite the Spartan weekend being an annual event for us.

name: Original General Store
address: Original General Store, 3963 VT-100, Pittsfield, VT 05762
text: Really cute and quaint place. When we came on Sunday around 3 PM, there were only two employees, so there wasn't always someone at the counter. They bring the food out to you and have various sauces you can try with your order. Lots of merchandise and snacks to consider! Parking is in the front and the back of the store.

name: Forget Me Not Flowers and Gifts LLC
address: Forget Me Not Flowers and Gifts LLC, 214 N Main St #2, Barre, VT 05641
text: Amazing arrangement. There photo didnt do it justice. They put the exact message I asked for and delivered it right on time. I will definitely order from there again.

name: Forget Me Not Flowers and Gifts LLC
address: Forget Me Not Flowers and Gifts LLC, 214 N Main St #2, Barre, VT 05641
text: Don't ever order helium balloons from this place. Picked 40 of them up at 5:30 pm and by 7:00 am they were all on the floor. I was told that latex balloons don't hold air and the best thing they could tell me to do was 'sticky tape them to the ceiling.' Seriously?

name: UPS Customer Center
address: UPS Customer Center, 454 Harvest Ln, Williston, VT 05495
text: Worst Customer Service ever. Why do i have a tracking number if they can’t keep track of packages. I was told my package was in a sea of packages and they couldn’t possibly know where to look for it. Took an hour to get a live person on the phone and they were as helpful at the automated message system that keeps avoiding letting you speak to a person. A complete joke.

name: UPS Customer Center
address: UPS Customer Center, 454 Harvest Ln, Williston, VT 05495
text: I am sick & tired of UPS. Waited all day as I could see the package was on the truck out for delivery. Then get the message that it was delayed due to a severe weather event. We have a difficult driveway, to be fair, many a driver has driven up to the bend and walked the rest of the way, (not far), but more often, if it is late, we get the message "weather delay". The rest of the time I see a package is on its way, then it gets transferred to USPS, which delays the package 2 more days as the post office leaves a little pink slip and then we have to go pick it up. FedEx doesn't seem to have this problem, they get to us just fine. Person on the phone, in who knows where, was less than helpful. Same old, same old... Another package not delivered. Same old excuse, emergency situation or severe weather delay after getting the notice it is on the truck and will be delivered between 10:15 & 2:15. Chatted with someone once at 5:30 and again at 8:30pm Still assured over & over it would come today. Midnight now - no package. They need to hire more folks, clearly unable to handle their deliveries. Don't use UPS - go with FedEx or USPS

name: UPS Customer Center
address: UPS Customer Center, 454 Harvest Ln, Williston, VT 05495
text: Received a message my package was delayed due to weatherwhen it hasn't snowed in days in the roads are completely clear. Not impressed

name: UPS Customer Center
address: UPS Customer Center, 454 Harvest Ln, Williston, VT 05495
text: Waited all day for a package that was suppose to be here today. Called ups several times to ask of it was delayed due to a storm and they assured me I was getting my package today. I waited until 730 pm and no package. Do not use UPS..... I asked for my package to be held and they are now saying it is back on a truck! All this while I am trying to move and drove a hour and a half to get my package with no delivery

name: Best Appliance & Kitchens
address: Best Appliance & Kitchens, 120 Woodstock Ave, Rutland, VT 05701
text: Our purchase of our dishwasher was a very good experience. Sales person was knowledgeable and helpful, and the dishwasher (a Bosch) has been great. Until now. It stopped mid-wash, and gave me an error message: E-24. Having tried what I knew to do, I siphoned off the water, called Best and set up a service visit. I just left the filter sitting in the dishrack as I figured they would remove it anyway. I was not able to be home, but my husband was present when the technician arrived. He said the technician reset the dishwasher, checked the filter, listened to it drain, and said it was working fine. All things I had already done. He went off leaving the filter where I had put it in the dishrack. My husband reported that he had been there approximately 10 minutes total. That evening, I replaced the filter, loaded the dishwasher and turned it on. About 20 minutes into the cycle, the same thing happened. Dishwasher NOT fixed. Best played fair and did not charge for the diagnostic visit, but I really got the feeling that the technician was phoning it in.

name: Christos' Pizza and Pasta
address: Christos' Pizza and Pasta, 4931 Main St, Manchester Center, VT 05255, United States
text: We stopped here when everything else was closed. Regardless the wait time of getting 3 slices or regular pizza at restaurant's closing hours 8:40 pm on Saturday, I was deeply disappointed by price/quality/value of the slices. 1 slice at $4.14 w/tax. Look yourself. NEVER AGAIN and definitely will discourage others from getting ripped off here too.

name: Safelite AutoGlass
address: Safelite AutoGlass, 371 Memorial Dr, St Johnsbury, VT 05819
text: So your repair isn't guaranteed. And if the fix wasn't effective you'll need a new windshield. Why not just fix it and if you can't let me get a windshield with this first appointment. Also moved my appt from afternoon to morning at 7 PM the night before via text. Number in text for reschedule was a joke. They disconnected 2x, wasted an hour just to be told there was nothing they could do. Local store said tried to call cell but man answered? Had the same number for 20 years soooooo.... Just 3 star experience.

name: Norse House Ski & Sport
address: Norse House Ski & Sport, 31 VT-30, Winhall, VT 05340
text: Situation: My wife and I walked in with a pair of ski and a binding (a gift from me to my wife ;-) ), asking for binding mounting service. A lady was nice and welcomed us, then asked a guy (probably named Tom after reading recent reviews posted here) for price. Tom said "we can do it for $125". I told the lady that "that was way more expensive than I thought, but fine I will do it." (see pic 1 for receipt) Complication: We went to pick up the ski, there is a price menu sitting at the counter (see pic 2), which clearly states "2019-2020 season price" for "Ski mounting is $75 ($100 on another list) and $30 for skis bought in-house". So I asked a representative why was I charged $125? The representative girl was nice and asked me to provide receipt, some other information, and finally had a cashier refunded me $25 (so at the end they charged me $100 for mounting a pair of skis, see pic 3). Why 1-star rating? Mounting a pair of skis is never expensive and I knew it. When I was charged $125 in the morning, I knew I was ripped off, but since my wife didn't know its normal price range, I just wanted her to have a great day and NOT feel the same as I was. When we went back to pick up her skis, she saw the price menu, and immediately realized that I was ripped off after some simple googling. Why does Norse House rip me while posting its price on their counter???? Do they think I'm not able to read???? I felt the price menu is so ironic that it's almost like a joke laughing my stupidity. Final recommendation: For customers - you should always do your own research and never trust what Tom told you. If you buy a pair of skis and binding without getting a 50% off (normal price of ski mounting is ~$60, and yet Tom charged me $125), you are being ripped off. I mean it is OK sometimes not to get the best price, but make sure you understand it, and don't let them laugh at you. For Norse House - If you can fire Tom, do so immediately. If Tom is one of the owners, well, good for you since you are definitely generating tons of profit. Just don't ripping customers off while posting a price menu in front of their face. You are not smarter than anyone.

name: The Country House Restaurant
address: The Country House Restaurant, 663 US-7, Pittsford, VT 05763
text: First time eating here and will probably be my last. We arrived around 7:45 pm and they close at 9 pm. There were 2 other tables seated and eating. The menu was uninspired and pretty basic. We ordered within 5 minutes 8 wings and then a calzone and a philly cheese steak for meals. About 10 minutes later we overheard the waitress just barely entering our order into the computer! Apparently she was too busy talking to the other guests as they were leaving. We got our wings about 20 minutes after ordering. The problem was there were only 7! We ordered 8! We let it slide and figured we will be eating soon so why bother making a fuss. Stuff happens. Finally after a full 45 minutes of waiting we got our very simple order, and as I said it was uninspired. The food was ok but nothing to bring me back. At least the waitress was attentive, but she should have been as we were basically the only ones there!

name: Domino's Pizza
address: Domino's Pizza, 167 Route 7 S, Milton, VT 05468
text: Terrible customer service. I placed an order at 7:20 pm. I received all confirmation that it was received amd the order had been processed. It had stated 15-25 minutes for delivery. Its now 9:00 pm amd I do not have my order, and they will not answer the phone.

name: The Filling Station Bar & Grill
address: The Filling Station Bar & Grill, 70 Gates St, White River Junction, VT 05001
text: They are great people . They close at 8 pm. Google has them open until 12 am not true also no outside setting. Nice place !!!

name: The Filling Station Bar & Grill
address: The Filling Station Bar & Grill, 70 Gates St, White River Junction, VT 05001
text: Didn't like the fact that the kitchen was not open and could not get food at 430 pm walked in sat down no food left

name: Randy's Auto Service Center, Inc.
address: Randy's Auto Service Center, Inc., 1049 N Main St, White River Junction, VT 05001
text: I live locally, but never went to this place based on the consistently bad online reviews. However, a friend recommended Randy's when I needed my alternator replaced quickly. They fit me in the next day, which was great. The price was a bit higher than I expected, but I did not complain. Today I went in for an inspection and to top off my front differential fluid. I arrived on time, but waited 15 minutes for them to get started because the workers (I'm not sure I would call them mechanics) were laughing and joking around. Thirty minutes later I learn that I failed inspection due to worn upper ball joints. I ask if they checked my differential fluid. They had forgotten. Another thirty minutes later "James" is back to inform me that they added 1/2 quart of fluid and he had an estimate for the ball joints. He starts explaining the different options based on the quality of parts and I see the estimate is over $1100. I stop him mid sales pitch and tell him that I am not going to spend that much on ball joints. He loses his cool, crumples up the estimate, throws it in the garbage, and tells me that I wasted his time. I explain that I know how much ball joints cost (retail $150), about how much time it takes (~5-6 hours with a lift if you know what you are doing and do upper/lower at the same time). I tell him I expected the price to be closer to $500. I also tell him the price for my alternator last fall was too high, and that I would fix the ball joints myself. That was about all he could stand. He angrily tells me that they don't want customers like me, anyway. He billed me $60 for the failed inspection (this is standard), $21 for 1/2 quart of fluid (retail is $14/quart, so 300% markup); and 1/2 hour labor for adding the fluid. I paid and told him I would not be back and would be writing a review about his unprofessional behavior. I called about an hour later to speak to the owner. He wasn't there so I left a message. I also emailed him, no reply yet. I never yelled or raised my voice during this strange encounter. I was just firm and not intimidated by his angry reaction. Luckily I only had to deal with them on the estimate, I could only imagine how things would go if I agreed to $1100 worth of work with these guys. Like many other reviews warn, stay away from this place!

name: Valley Artesian Well Co. Inc
address: Valley Artesian Well Co. Inc, 6248 US-5, Ascutney, VT 05030
category: ['Well drilling contractor', 'Water softening equipment supplier', 'Water testing service']
text: I scheduled an appointment with Ken and he never showed up. I called him twice on his cell and left a message with the answering service- no return phone call. I emailed the owner. No response. I am starting to wonder if they are no longer in business.

name: Valley Artesian Well Co. Inc
address: Valley Artesian Well Co. Inc, 6248 US-5, Ascutney, VT 05030
category: ['Well drilling contractor', 'Water softening equipment supplier', 'Water testing service']
text: These guys just turned a nightmare into a great day. Started the day with no water. Called at about 8:30 and left a message with the nice lady who answered. Within 10 minutes I had a call back and a promise to have a crew on site by around 11:00. They showed up on time, neat, personable and presentable, with everything they needed to do the work we needed done. By 1:00 everything was wrapped up, picked up, and back to normal. Patrick and Kyle did a great job and their nice attitude and professionalism was much appreciated. Why can't every business operate like this?

name: Champlain Valley Equipment Inc.
address: Champlain Valley Equipment Inc., 453 Exchange St, Middlebury, VT 05753
category: ['Farm equipment supplier', 'Dairy farm equipment supplier', 'Equipment supplier', 'Lawn mower repair service', 'Lawn mower store', 'Machine maintenance', 'Machine repair service', 'Repair service', 'Tractor dealer', 'Tractor repair shop']
text: I wouldn't do business here. My parents bought a backhoe for their Kubota that they bought here. They were told that the backhoe would be installed within a week. Two weeks later no backhoe. They called and were told it would be another week or two before their tractor was picked up to get the backhoe installed. When they stated they needed it for a construction project the message was "we'll pick it up in a couple of days" and it would be "a week or two" for them to install the backhoe. Again when my parents stated it was needed for a project, they were told they'd get the tractor back in 4 days. 4 days later no tractor. When I stopped in to see what was going on, I was told "oh no we said it would be at least 5 days".... Terrible business practice.

name: UPS Customer Center
address: UPS Customer Center, 8 O'Bryan Dr, Brattleboro, VT 05301
text: I appreciate the job that UPS workers do. But they keep leaving my packages next to the gate at the end of my driveway!!! This makes me very irritated!!! I have a good driveway and usually more than enough room to turn around up near my house. My package yesterday was ripped and left outside. The only reason I knew that it was delivered was from the text message I received from Amazon. TOWNSHEND, VT driver please take note!!! Thank you.

name: UPS Customer Center
address: UPS Customer Center, 8 O'Bryan Dr, Brattleboro, VT 05301
text: Jeff, from Brattleboro UPS, just delivered my table saw in his own personal car. I was expecting the shipment from Amazon, yesterday, but then it was updated that it would be here by 1:30 today. I did express shipping because I have a project I need to complete under a tight timeline, and I was stressed about it not being here. At 4:00 pm, Jeff drove up the driveway in a blue Subaru and my wife and I wondered, "Who the heck is that." But that's what is so cool. He told us how his truck had broken down on 89 for three hours, and he decided to deliver it himself, because he wanted to make sure he got us the shipment today, no matter what. Thank you Jeff, for your commitment to customer service, and the UPS company, and for making my day. Jeff deserves a raise! A+++++ service. Thank you again. I'm going to go finish my building project right now.

name: TJ's Fish Fry
address: TJ's Fish Fry, 100 Depot St, Bennington, VT 05201
text: I wish to eat here someday. TJ know I want to go there badly but it's a 27-30 hour drive (1100-1200 miles) north from here. The food he post on Facebook looks delicious and it's conveniently located near the heart of Bennington, within walkable distance from Gamer Grotto, FIddlehead, & South Street Cafe. With construction going on if I understand right over on the old Greenburg lot, I hope the construction workers will stop here to eat when they go on their lunch break. I don't care what the results were on the game show he was on at the Food Network, he'll always be a champion to me as he was representing for Bennington, VT. Hopefully I'll get to see you the next time I'm in the area. :-D

name: Friendly's
address: Friendly's, 5876 Williston Rd, Williston, VT 05495, United States
text: Not a great experience. I no longer live near Friendly's as I am located in North Carolina, so when I am near one I try to go. Whenever I explain Friendly's to friends that have never been, I say it's similar to Denny's but with more of a focus on ice cream. When we walked in around 8 PM on a Saturday night, it was fairly empty inside. I ordered a grilled cheese sandwich that comes with a tomato soup. My friend ordered some kind of chicken tender meal. The food came out in a fairly reasonable time frame, though it might have taken a tad bit long. My grilled cheese was lukewarm, but I proceeded to eat it. This new grilled cheese seems to be different than the classic one I would order a few years back. The soup was way too thick, so I only ended up eating a few spoonfuls. It was almost like something you would put on a pasta. My friend was displeased with the chicken meal as it was quite cold, so that went back. A replacement meal came out about 5 minutes later. I think the mistake was ordering a meal here. We each had a small sundae, that was fine. Come here for ice cream, maybe use the take out window, but I don't suggest ordering a meal. It was disappointing.

name: Friendly's
address: Friendly's, 5876 Williston Rd, Williston, VT 05495, United States
text: One of the things I miss about moving away from Vermont and New England was going to Friendly's for lunch or dinner. It was always the same, and you this was one of the best things about the place. On this most recent visit, it was probably at least 3 years since I had been to a Friendly's restaurant, and at least 5 since I had been to this specific location. To my surprise, the interior had been renovated, and the 'classic' Friendly's decor had been replaced with something more modern. The dining room seemed smaller - but this was because the kitchen and scoop shop were walled in during the renovation. The food was good and the service was great - if really slow. They need to have more than a handful of waitstaff to handle the lunch rush. The place was slammed when we arrived at 1 PM on a Friday afternoon, and it remained that way throughout our visit. Tables were taking a very long time to be bussed, and the line waiting to be seated was out the door. Overall, I was very happy to be back at the restaurant, and the food was the same as always.

name: Costco Gasoline
address: Costco Gasoline, 218 Lower Mountain View Dr, Colchester, VT 05446
text: Prices are good but sometimes you have a long wait to get to the pump. Also being closed from 1:30 pm to 6 pm really makes it inconvenient to get gas when already out and about.

text: This is a fraud place. Hi Team, I am not rude or I am not disrespectful, I am going to just state that facts and honest truth about your scam in the name selling products. Again contacted weekday, in the phone line it gives you 3 options in IVR, even if you select Customer service it will go to the same person and again she said customer service is very busy they will contact you when they got time.

name: Petco
address: Petco, 214 Northside Dr #7, Bennington, VT 05201
category: ['Pet supply store', 'Bird shop', 'Fish store', 'Pet store', 'Reptile store', 'Tropical fish store']
text: I previously worked here as a apprentice for this grooming shop, I loved what I did an did a great job as told by my customers but the other ladys who work there are very unprofessional an if they don't like you your gone. They also have a sanitation issue as well, i witnessed a dog put into a crate full of pee underneath the grate the dogs sit on. This pee spot was there forever over 3 days. They like to treat the new people as there bath an clean up lady. They even went to the point of trying to get me out where they would change my number of dogs from 3 to 2 meanwhile my paperwork was actually saying I was to do 5 dogs a day at that point. They would also try to limit the types of coats I could do to certain days an try to make me take way more time for certain dogs depending on their coats an size, wasn't reasonable at all if you do the math on how many dogs I am to complete per day. Doesn't take no 3-4 hours for large dogs ever. I also proved myself to them days before this by doing 7 dogs in one day because the other lady jen scheduled them for me cause she was booked for the day. I also had problems getting customers cause they never wanted to give me any dogs that were just baths an brush which was required for my apprenticeship, so I would make bath special calls until I got clients. But then I would come in an check my schedule, dogs would be missing an in the computer it would show them switching my dogs to them. An once they switched my dog to another lady cause they insisted is would come in matted meanwhile the dog came in unmatted but they still had the other lady do it an paperwork printed out shows she did the dog but in the computer it was switched back to me, looking like I did the dog an that's because the rabies was expired an that's ground for immediate termination. Doesn't sound like a accident to me. Jennifer Jennings seems all nice a friendly but watch out she says some very rude things about customers who aren't rich or about their dogs an complaining about when people don't tip. Not to mention she was very rude an inappropriate when she told me Infront of a customer that I was too young to be a mom that she had hers at 29, if you ask me that's unprofessional. She has been the only one there since they opened 4 years ago an within the 4 years they have gone thru 7 groomers, she talked badly about alot of them an from what I can tell if she don't like you then you don't last an they will find the tiniest mistake to let you go. She was also setting a bad example for apprentices doing things against policy that gets other fired or written up for but she only gets a verbal warning. It's all on who you are there. I contacted the DM of this store to bring major issues to her an instead of the DM getting ahold of me she got ahold of the manager in the store an within a week of that happening they let me go. I was looking out for the animals who were being put into dirty crates an being force dried even tho they were clearly showing obviously signs of stress an should've been placed into a crate to be dried. I even witnessed Christa Jacobs, the manager of the grooming salon, force dry a labordoodle on the floor in the bathing area then finish the drying in the bath tub with a hip restraint in place while the dog flalled it's arms everywhere. I'd like to conclude this with how disappointed I am in how this company works, I was really looking forward to a career as a dog groomer with this company. I'm young an motivated an came to this company with over a year experience with my aunt who owns her successful dog grooming business, she an many others who vouge for how much of a loving caring animal lover I am an how great I've done with grooming their dogs. This is petcos loss all in all. They should consider new management in that store, playing favorites isn't professional an the concern for the animals welfare should be their top priority cause I would be disgusted knowing my dog was put into a dirty crate. Everyone should be sure their dog is being placed into a sanitized crate with fresh water always!!

name: White River Junction VA Medical Center
address: White River Junction VA Medical Center, 163 Veterans Dr, White River Junction, VT 05009
text: I'm not a big fan of White River Junction VA. If you're not familiar with My Healthy Vet beware of something called "Secure Messaging". What happens is you might see the name of your Primary Care Provider listed in the messaging system. You might think any message you send would be sent in private since the system is called Secure Messaging, but you'd be very wrong to assume that. It's clinic staff that read your messages. THEY sometimes reply adding their two cents regarding something you wrote to your doctor about. NEVER write anything private using Secure Messaging. Your provider or doctor may reply to you, but staff read the messages as well and forwards them and there's nothing secure about that! You've hardly met these people and they come out of the woodwork un-introduced to make comments! They think it's o.k. to just stick their noses-in! Secure messaging is a joke. It's more like means for harassment. Veterans and VAs would be better-off if My Healthy Vet offered private messaging.

name: Church of the Rock
address: Church of the Rock, 1091 Fairfax Rd, St Albans City, VT 05478
text: Great Church focusing on God's message of love and service.

name: Brock's Heating, Air Conditioning & Gas Services, LLC
address: Brock's Heating, Air Conditioning & Gas Services, LLC, 167 Brick Church Rd, Fairfax, VT 05454
hours: [['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: We were referred to Brock's by good friends who had highly recommended their business. Our inspection for heat pump installation was promptly scheduled and professionally conducted, and we were made aware of the rebates available to us from the state when we were quoted for the work. The two gentlemen who performed the installation were on time, worked very hard, and overcame any obstacles they encountered. Some heavier items needed to be moved for accessibility in our basement, and they didn't hesitate to offer to move them themselves as part of the job. Overall, we were very impressed with their work ethic and professionalism, and we were cool and comfortable by 3 pm that afternoon!! We are happy to recommend their services to others!!

name: Dollar General
address: Dollar General, 53 E Main St, North Troy, VT 05859
text: The store used to be open till ten pm. Then reduced to 9pm. Tonight I got there shortly after 8 and the door was locked. North Troy Vermont is a border town with no grocery store. Except for the Dollar Store. Was a supporter and shopped there at least twice a week. Website says open till nine. The hours in the door said 9pm. The poor lady behind the door said it’s closed. Please update the folks. We don’t have the money to spend on wasted trips. I work for local media. This will make a great story.

name: Puro's Coins & Jewelry

text: Good honest coin dealer. Got a lot of deals buying and selling PM.

name: Glamour Nails
address: Glamour Nails, 166 Sycamore St #150, Williston, VT 05495
text: I’m sort of new to this whole nail color thing- Ive tried a couple other places but always leave having to touch up. NO MORE - Glamor Nails has hooked me with their friendly and meticulous finish!! Nice job ladies:) Oh yes and the hand message is such a nice finish!![two hearts]

name: Archer Dental
address: Archer Dental, 303 US-5 S, Norwich, VT 05055
category: ['Dentist', 'Cosmetic dentist', 'Dental clinic', 'Dental hygienist', 'Pediatric dentist', 'Teeth whitening service']
text: Just as with Dr. Kravitz' practice before, Archer Dental consists of a very friendly team of people whose top priority is to keep their guests as comfortable as possible. They know you by name when you walk in the door and everyone is always very welcoming. They do great work and their personalized service is excellent. I had a filling become de-bonded on a Saturday night the weekend before Christmas. I noticed Archer Dental had a Facebook presence, so out of curiosity I sent a message at around 9:30pm to see what the earliest they could get me in would be (expecting that I would have to call on Monday anyway and wait until after the holidays for an appointment). To my utter surprise, I promptly received a response just before 10:00pm saying they could get me in that Monday. I am extremely grateful to Dr. Will and the team at Archer Dental for their friendly personalized service, and I highly recommend this practice.

name: Enterprise Rent-A-Car
address: Enterprise Rent-A-Car, 131 S Main St, Rutland, VT 05701
text: I've been renting from Enterprise for 15 years without a problem until now. I am conflicted by my recent experience. When I rent, I sometimes drop my rental off at a different Enterprise location without a problem. Recently, I rented from the Bangor, Maine location, booked my rental by phone. It was supposed to be a one-way trip (6 hours). I checked the rental agreement for the returned time a couple of days before returning the car. I noticed the return location said Bangor, Maine. So, I called the Maine location. The assistant manager I spoke to told me, sorry; you have to bring it back to Maine. I explained the situation, and she said that I had requested to drop it off at my destination. She told me I would pay a fee, which was not a small fee if I drop the car at a different location. The situation was perplexing. I dropped by the place where I usually rent. The assistant manager there, Jason Lofaro, tried to help, but he couldn't do much on his end. However, he helped me understand that they had waived the charges for drop-off at a different location in the past since it was not for personal use. I appreciated his explanation. On Friday, April 23rd, around 2:00 p.m., I tried to call the Bangor location, but the call went to a call center. I ended up speaking to someone for almost an hour without a resolution. We went around in circles. She finally connected me to a "mediator or resolution specialist" who has no business mitigating. She was offensive, scolded me, and insinuated that I was trying to get something for free. I could not believe what I was hearing. She said I shouldn't expect to get something for free. When I rented the car, I put down a $300 deposit. I was trying to get back my deposit. All said, I called the local Bangor number and spoke to another assistant manager, Lauren. She was as sweet and professional. I'm a very busy man. I took the time to post this message because it's necessary. It's not a reflection negative reflection on the company, but a reaction of my aversion and a commendation to Lauren and Jason for their professionalism. I don't remember Lauren's last name, but I hope she knows I appreciate her help.

name: Enterprise Rent-A-Car
address: Enterprise Rent-A-Car, 131 S Main St, Rutland, VT 05701
text: These people are great! Friendly outgoing but most importantly professional. They kind of feel like family to me. Been renting from them since 1999-2000.

name: Baird Farm - Organic Vermont Maple Syrup
address: Baird Farm - Organic Vermont Maple Syrup, 65 W Rd, North Chittenden, VT 05763
text: Wonderful experience. We called and asked Jenna and Jacob (on very short notice at 12:30 pm) to take a guided tour of their farm and the maple syrup making process at 2:00 pm. They cheerfully accommodated. Was a amazing and personal tour, and Jacob happily answered what was probably 30-40 questions me, my wife, and my 4-year old daughter asked. We saw how they tap the trees, collect the sap, boil it and filter it, store it, and bottle it and sell it. Then we got to do a tasting of their 4 different types of finished syrup and each one was delicious. Walked out of there with 5 bottles of their mint-infused syrup and a half-gallon of their dark amber syrup. Was a fun, very interesting, and rewarding afternoon. Highly recommend it to anyone passing through the central Vermont region!

name: Baird Farm - Organic Vermont Maple Syrup
address: Baird Farm - Organic Vermont Maple Syrup, 65 W Rd, North Chittenden, VT 05763
text: Amazing farm! Had such a great (free!) tour of how they produce maple syrup and bought by far the best maple syrup home to NY. Love love love their peppermint syrup as well. This farm definitely worth visiting! @prettybalancedrd

name: Chimney Sweep Fireplace Shop
address: Chimney Sweep Fireplace Shop, 3113 Shelburne Rd, Shelburne, VT 05482
text: I am in the market for a pellet fireplace insert and since I had done business with the Chimney Sweep Fireplace Shop more than 15 years ago, I went back expecting the same wonderful experience I had them. Boy was I wrong. When I arrived, two vehicles were occupying five parking places between them, forcing me to park at the very back of the building and negotiate my way between icy patches to get to the front of the store. Once I entered, there was one employee visible who was behind the desk, facing into the showroom and visiting with a customer to his right. As soon as I walked in, he turned his back to me, clearly sending a message that he wasn't to be bothered. I wasn't greeted. There was no, "I'm with a customer, let me find someone to help you." There was nothing except a pointed, unspoken message that I was not going to get any assistance from him. I saw a second individual, speaking with a couple who were asking questions about the various models on display. That individual looked right at me and as his co-worker did, turned away. I continued browsing, hoping to find someone, anyone, to help me. One other person eventually appeared in the section with a bunch of inserts. He at least said "hello," but turned immediately away, his body language also making clear that he was not to be disturbed. Finally, after a good ten minutes, and unable to find anyone willing to speak to me, I left, very disappointed. I've checked, and I don't see anything on the website saying that an appointment is required to get information or to discuss making a purchase. I also don't see anything saying that only men or accompanied women will be served, but clearly that was the message that was sent to me today.

name: Chimney Sweep Fireplace Shop
address: Chimney Sweep Fireplace Shop, 3113 Shelburne Rd, Shelburne, VT 05482
text: Couldn't keep their appt. and then said they had it as a different date. Store Mgr Randy didn't call back, didn't call back then called and said the issue was resolved. No it wasn't. Left another message and still hasn't called back 5 weeks later. Shelburne snobs.

name: Blackfork Towing
address: Blackfork Towing, 920 W Main St, Richmond, VT 05477
hours: [['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: After a four hour drive from Massachusetts, our truck died on the highway less than 30 minutes from our destination. Searched for "tow truck" on my cell phone and called the first number which was answered by a machine with an out-of-date message referring to June (it's August). Called Blackfork. The phone was answered by a human who gave me a quote, a time and a couple of garages where we might get the truck fixed. The driver arrived on time, charged less than the quote, delivered me and my truck to the garage - and he was personable! No one likes getting stuck and calling for a tow, but Blackfork made a tough situation much easier. If I have to call for a tow in this area again, I'm calling Blackfork first.

name: Corner Stop Mini Mart
address: Corner Stop Mini Mart, 2336 VT-14, South Royalton, VT 05068
text: Anyone know proper store etiquette?? Only at this place my presence prompted them to call the police at 7am! I work PM shift as a nurse so I grabbed coffee, breakfast and scratch tickets on my way home...after maybe 10 mins Trooper Harvey was at my window "someone said...well that you're sitting here..." yea awkward lol he knew it was ridiculous and just told me to have a nice day but I had to wonder why and who actually called them and alerted to someone being parked there for 10 minutes like it's abnormal or a crime lol maybe they have too much time on their hands ! Not a bad spot though it's location is the money maker, convenience and all the lies and gossip you can ever listen to. Dominic and a couple of the crew are awesome but the drama is petty af so I get a premade ham salad or tickets or ice cream and bounce, no hanging around now folks hurry up! Lol. Did I mention I've been going there my whole life ? So about 30years, its not like I'm some foriegn creepy weirdo. Makes no sense.

name: Rutland Beer Works
address: Rutland Beer Works, 41 Center St, Rutland, VT 05701
text: We were so excited to try this place for dinner after reading great reviews. We tried to call at least four times to do call-ahead seating, but each time, no one would answer, a recorded message would come on, and the line would disconnect. We were a little concerned, but decided to head there anyway. When we got to the restaurant, we were turned away for a table because they were too busy and weren’t seating any more tables for the night that hadn’t done call-ahead seating (this was about an hour before they closed). We explained that we had tried several times to call, even showing the hostess our call log to confirm we had been calling the correct number. She told us that they probably hadn’t answered the phone because they were busy that night. How on earth is anyone supposed to get a table if you have to do call-ahead seating but no one answers the phone when you call? We were SO disappointed. Luckily, we found Strangefellows Pub a minute away, which completely saved our evening- highly recommend going there instead.

name: White River Toyota
address: White River Toyota, 303 Sykes Mountain Ave, White River Junction, VT 05001
text: I called up for an appointment and the woman offered me an appointment for the following Friday...I said I'd really like to come earlier and suggested Tuesday. She said that she would schedule me for Friday and check to see if she could approval for me to leave the car on Tuesday instead of the following Friday..She said she would call back in an hour. I waited three or four hours and then called back and was routed to her voice mail. I left message to ask her to let me know whether I could come in or not because I needed to negotiate work and a ride...She never called me back. Then I called two days later and got someone else who checked to see if I was scheduled for Friday, and the previous service person had not scheduled me at all. The second person I spoke to was very nice and scheduled me for a 7 am appointment for the next day, which worked out great. So I'm not happy with the fact that the first person I spoke to just kind of ditched me, but the second person was great, and the service department is also polite, friendly and efficient.

name: White River Toyota
address: White River Toyota, 303 Sykes Mountain Ave, White River Junction, VT 05001
text: Dave Bennett was great I called him at 3:00 pm and was walking home at 8:00 p.m. the same day with a car. Everyone was helpful.

name: White River Toyota
address: White River Toyota, 303 Sykes Mountain Ave, White River Junction, VT 05001
text: 4:30 pm appointment. Taken in right away and reviewed service requested. Was kept updated about concern and was done in one hour. Problem solved! Thank you WR Toyota.

name: 802 Toyota
address: 802 Toyota, 30 Berlin Mall Rd, Berlin, VT 05602
text: Want it bad? Get it bad! Let me first say that Amber did a good job of dealing with me and my frustration. She was very professional and seemingly sympathetic to my situation. I would not want her job. Do I think 802 Toyota could have done better? Yes. My truck is a 2004 Toyota Tundra with 218,000 miles. I do expect its going to have some problems once in a while. I was in Vermont to pick up a U-Haul trailer and take back to Virginia. The top of my radiator blew right off! I had it towed to nearest Toyota dealership. I called to tell them I was having my car towed there. Lucky I called when I did, they were closing in 10 minutes. I explained that I was broke down and that I needed to get back to Virginia ASAP! Amber explained that they were very busy and that she wouldn't be able to even look at my car until late Monday or Tuesday. Closing at 2:00pm on a Saturday? And only open until 5:00 during the week. If they are that busy, I would think that it should be open longer. (Only 2 Stars for service department hours) Amber explained the $90+ per hour fee for diagnosing the problem. I told her that would not be necessary because as soon as they opened the hood it would be obvious that I needed a radiator! I'm not sure if she could have ordered a radiator on a Saturday at 2:00 but that would have been a big help to getting me on the road sooner. (Only 2 stars for not ordering a new radiator until late Monday). Monday morning I was expecting a call first thing to at least hear if they would be able to get my truck looked at or not. A 10:00 am, I finally called them. I got voicemail but Amber did call me back an hour later. Again I explained that I was from Virginia and really needed to get back. I also explained that if it was not going to be ready soon that I would get home another way and come back to VT to get my truck after it was repaired. At nearly 5:00 PM, I finally got a call saying I needed a radiator and that she would have to order one. (Only 2 stars for communication and not ordering a radiator earlier) Tuesday when I had not heard from amber by 1:30 pm I decided to get a ride and just go there. At 2:00pm, Amber explained that they were just now going to pick up the new radiator. I was very frustrated at this point and not very hopeful that my truck would be ready. Again I explained that had I known it was not going to be ready I would have gone back to VA and come back to get my truck at a later date. I stayed in the area hoping to hear from Amber if my truck would be ready or not. Either way, I had to leave for VA Wednesday morning. 30 minutes prior to closing I still had not heard from Amber so I went back to the dealership and sat outside. 5 minutes prior to closing I walked in. She saw me waiting in line and said that she thought we were good. My radiator had been replaced and there were no indications of any other problems. Ok, that's good, but why did it overheat and explode to begin with? Amber explained that I should drive it back to Randolph where I was staying and if I had any problems I should bring it back in the morning. When she brought my truck out I said I wanted to see what a new radiator looked like. She said she wanted to see too. If you have never seen what a mess an exploded radiator makes, I could show you. Most of it is still on my truck and inside the engine compartment. Really? (Only 2 stars for returning my truck in such a mess) As I'm driving my truck away I notice that the heat is on but there is no heat coming out of the vents. Really? There are no indications of any other problems? I'm not going to need heat for a while so no big deal right? My truck did not overheat again for nearly 300 miles. Worse possible place ever! Yep, George Washington Bridge in NYC! Seems as if the thermostat would have been a no brainer to at least look at or replace while you're waiting for the radiator. (2 stars for not really fixing my truck and sending me to VA in a ticking time bomb) Want it bad? Get it bad!

name: Verizon Authorized Retailer — Cellular Sales
address: Verizon Authorized Retailer — Cellular Sales, 1542 US-302, Berlin, VT 05641
category: ['Cell phone store', 'Cell phone accessory store', 'Telephone company']
text: Posting as Jessica, not Thomas: Advising people to find another location, everyone I tried to work with during this did not keep to their word to get back to me, and were entirely unhelpful, which is putting it nicely, seeing as I've had 4 months to cool down and write this in a calm manner. Had I written this right when it happened, this would have been a much harsher, more scathing review. I upgraded my phone 7/4, and my initial interaction with the sales rep there was fine. I left my old phone there because I didn't need it, we reset the phone and logged out, and I assumed everything was fine. A week later I get a text at 9 PM from the sales rep I worked with asking for my Apple ID password because he had forgotten to perform one more step with my phone. Which I felt very sketchy about, because it was a late night text asking for a password that gives access to credit card/personal information and we had taken care of everything in re-setting the phone when I upgraded. I went back to the store the next day to tell them I was not happy with how it was handled, and they assured me it was indeed the wrong thing for this rep to do and assured me they would find out what was going on, because when I went in they had no record of the phone being there and couldn't get a hold of this rep to talk to him. Fast forward a week later and I haven't heard from the 2nd rep, so I call, and he's out of town, so I talk to another rep and explain the situation and he assures me he will call me the following day to let me know what's going on. Fast forward 4 days later and I haven't heard anything. So I call again and the person I talk to then assures me she will "shove the phone down the 3rd reps throat" when he got back from his lunch and have him call me back. The next day I haven't heard anything so I call to report the whole incident to Verizon, who assure me that everything they have done up to this point in handling this has been entirely inappropriate, but unfortunately they can't do anything beyond emailing the store supervisor to ask them why they have such a problem getting back to me like they keep promising. I check in with Verizon a few days later and of course the supervisor hasn't given them any update, so I stop back into the store to find out why I'm being ignored. I explain everything again to this 4th rep, who keeps insisting he understands why I'm upset, and then proceeds to ask me exactly what I expect him to do, in a condescending tone, and keeps talking to me like I'm being hysterical, which is entirely frustrating. Finally, after having been promised by all these other reps that they would contact the first rep, he calls the rep I originally worked with to ask what's going on, and the 1st rep apologizes for contacting me inappropriately and says he'll bring the phone in the next day so we can address the issue in the store. The next day, 3 hours into his shift that he's already been there for, then texts me again (somehow still doesn't understand that you do not text customers to their personal phone, you call them from the business phone???) to tell me that he couldn't find the phone and didn't know where it was. At which I point I threw my hands up and said "f' this", this is ridiculous, and no one there has been helpful and I am advising everyone to stay away from this location.

name: Young's Furniture & Appliances
address: Young's Furniture & Appliances, 2 Chester Rd # 14, Springfield, VT 05156
text: After purchasing several items from Youngs and waiting 2 long arduous long months to get my dishwasher installed it finally gets to be put to use only to have it give me an error 2.5 weeks later. Called Youngs on Monday morning as soon as they opened. It is now Thursday 5:11 pm and I am beyond irate waiting for “their” plumber to show up. I did have a 9:00 AM appointment today called Jay 9:15, then again @ 10 asking where we is this “phantom” plumber? Was informed that as soon as they reach him they’ll call me. Well. I spent an entire day yesterday at Dartmouth in the most imaginable pain (for a few weeks) was up the entire night in pain with no relief at home to take so I ran to rite aid to get my much needed rxs to come back 30 mins later that this phantom person came and went!!!!! So I am livid as I have been a prisoner in my home when I still need to run a few more errands if I want to hopefully get maybe an hours worth of sleep tonight! So this phantom shows here 2 hours late I’m in a pain scale of 10. Purchased several items from YOUNGS only to have a product work for less than 3 weeks. Call on a Monday (it’s been broken since Saturday) had no choice but to wait until today then phantom plumber doesn’t show I’m in dire pain and now I’m sitting 7 hours waiting???????? If his day is this crazy busy then I want to know more about the quality and reliability of the products YOUNG sells

name: Snowmobile Vermont - Stowe
address: Snowmobile Vermont - Stowe, 823 S Main St, Stowe, VT 05672
text: Fabulous experience in every way! I booked my tour with Pete a week in advance, and casually mentioned that I was going on a snowmobile trip in Quebec so wanted to practice a bit. When I showed up a week later for the excursion, the excursion organizer Steve -- who had been up until 4AM the night before grooming the trails -- pulled me out of the group and hooked me up with a phenomenal guide named Jason, and they planned my tour specifically to help me prepare for my upcoming trip to Quebec. I could not believe that the message of my trip had even gotten passed along, but these guys truly went above and beyond to give me a great experience that would help me be ready. Jason -- who was also there until the wee hours the night before grooming the trails -- was an amazing guide. He's obviously a great rider with a ton of experience, and he gave me an incredibly tailored intro to snowmobiling. This is a truly professional outfit that puts safety and preparation first, but still offers an all-around amazing time. I could not recommend these guys any more strongly. You will absolutely not be disappointed.

name: Hudak Farm Stand & Greenhouse
address: Hudak Farm Stand & Greenhouse, 599 St Albans Rd, Swanton, VT 05488
text: Bought 6 ears of corn today (can’t check ears -Covid 19) all six wormy , buggy and deformed. Called to let them know and they we’re unbelievably rude. NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!! 8/17/20 called at 5:30 pm.

They also refunded my security deposit super quickly. Great business!
