name: Champlain Valley Fuels
address: Champlain Valley Fuels, 185 Exchange St, Middlebury, VT 05753
text: Not happy with the plumber, as he took the the connecting hose, which was good...put the part in his bucket along with bad toilet seal..and denied that he took it to his employer. Roto Rooter came and reset the toilet and wanted to know why the plumber took the hose..i had no answer, as this man had to check the flow of the toilet, so we both did a bucket brigade to do the testing. I paid Champlain Valley Plumbing for the work that was done and asked for the part to be returned. I was told he left it here..lol..what a joke. Called and left a message for them to return part, and they have not gotten back to me. 3 or 4 days later the Company called to say the connected hose was leaking, that's why plumber threw it away...it Wasn't leaking, there was NO water on my floor...had to go purchase the hose elsewhere..oh well

name: M.J Electric
address: M.J Electric, 8247 VT-116, Hinesburg, VT 05461
text: Mike came out at 8:00 pm on a Friday with essentially no warning to fix us up after a lightning strike fried a circuit. He got my tenants electricity back on quickly. I will be saving his number in my phone.

name: Hinesburg Hair Studio
address: Hinesburg Hair Studio, 22 Commerce St #10, Hinesburg, VT 05461
text: I had an appointment on Friday 8/19 for 5pm. I arrived about 4:58 pm and was told "I will be right with you". There was a customer in the chair and the hair dresser was cutting her wet hair. Then she was blow drying her hair. She was finished with the blow dry and the customer asked if she could get her hair curled with a curling iron. I was getting upset as it was now 15 minutes into my appointment time. I got up and walked out. I was a NEW CUSTOMER and I felt as if I was not important enough for your establishment to keep a timely appointment. I felt maybe this is a pattern and If I were to get any other appointments in the future I would be kept waiting and not important as a customer. I will not be returning and if someone should ask me what I thin of your establishment I will tell them to go elsewhere.

name: KFC
address: KFC, 363 Swanton Rd, St. Albans Town, VT 05478
text: So why does your online hours say you’re open till 10 pm but the lady at the counter Turned us away at 9:05? What a joke.

name: Midstate Hyundai
address: Midstate Hyundai, 1415 US-302, Barre, VT 05641
category: ['Hyundai dealer', 'Auto repair shop', 'Tire shop', 'Used car dealer']
text: The Android Auto program stopped working message #8 came up on my phone indicating that the car needed a computer update that dealt with getting past a security block. While my car was in the shop the Service Writer told me my car was due for an oil change and a cabin filter. They did that work and all the updates. Still the Android Auto didn't work Bob who was the Service Writer called the local Verizon dealer who suggested I come in with my phone which I did. The issue was with my phone and and Darcy at Verizon did all the necessary updates on my phone and then everything worked fine.

name: Asian Gourmet
address: Asian Gourmet, 911 Western Ave, Brattleboro, VT 05301
text: I was looking for a place that would be 1: Open; 2: have inside seating; and 3 have a bar. I made an online reservation for 7 pm. We arrived and there were about 5 groups of people waiting for to go orders. I went to a woman answering the phone and a waiter passed by me. I told him we had a reservation, do I speak to her? He said "yes, but let me talk to the man in the kitchen." The woman on the phone said "I'm sorry, I know you have a reservation, but this isn't going to work tonight." Everytime I've eaten hear the waitress always seems like she's in panic mode. My first clue should have been that both Scorpion and Mai Tai were spelled incorrectly. Get your act together!

name: Wheeler Farms
address: Wheeler Farms, 36 Woffenden Rd, Wilmington, VT 05363
text: I travel often and most recently I was in Wilmington, Vt and passed by a "Jersey Cow" farm and was inclined to stop and show my 1.5 year old son the cows. Upon my surprise, as we exited our vehicle the farmer John was driving at the cows with his tractor and yelling aggressively at the cows. This made for a very uneasy experience for me and my son. I then preceded to explain why that was wrong to my 1.5 year old son. We went and saw the tractor that was parked and I explained some other things that we saw. After interacting with the cows I noticed several things that made me feel quite uneasy. 1. Some of these cows have bulging eyes, which upon further research exhibits high anxiety and stress. 2. There was no shade for them and after talking to a worker there named Ben, I discovered they stay in the field all day after getting milked at 4am. Not to return to the "barn" until approx. 3p to get milked again and then locked in. I noticed each day as I passed or stopped the cows were clearly asking for shelter. 3. No access to water Just yesterday I felt a need to return to the farm while my son was napping. I parked close to where they drink water and stayed here for at least 30 minutes it was close to 85° There were 2 cows that entire time at the water trough making it impossible for the other cows to drink. Everytime one would get close one of 2 said cows wouldn't let them pass. I tried my best to communicate this but was aggressively met by a woman who I have video of, in addition I have almost of this documented and recorded. 4. These cows are clearly malnourished. We decided to go public with this information due to the response we received from this woman, as she wasn't willing to hear the message I was simply trying to relay. Upon further investigation, I saw they were a producer of CABOT cheese. Which is why I'm writing this review. I'm worried that this may be happening at several farms and would like to join hands to correct this type of situation with proper support for the animals.

name: Black Dog Sports
address: Black Dog Sports, 133 E Mountain Rd, Killington, VT 05751
text: Awesome service! Great equipment! probably my best ever experience renting skis. Open till 11 PM on most days too! Highly recommend!

name: Yankee Wine & Spirits
address: Yankee Wine & Spirits, 126 Main St #1, Montpelier, VT 05602
text: Terrible, inconvenient hours. Why on earth do they close at 7:30 PM Monday-Thursday? I can't tell you the number of times I work late or grab dinner downtown and then try to go to this store only to find them closed. When all bars and restaurants in town are full of people, this liquor store is closed? Is it really that difficult to remain open past the dinner rush so people can buy a bottle, some beer or wine on the way home? Closing at 9:00 PM on Friday and Saturday is also inconvenient. If anything they should be open until at least 10 PM. Ideally 11 or midnight so people can get supplies on their way home from late dinners or bars. Lastly, why does a liquor store need to open at 9 AM? Is anyone really buying beer, wine and liquor at 9 AM? If this business were run well they would shift their hours to open at 10 or 11 AM everyday, close at 10 or 11 PM Monday through Thursday. Then stay open until 11 or midnight on Friday and Saturday. Know your customer base, Yankee Spirits! We're not buying booze at 9 AM! We're trying to buy it at 10 PM when you're closed!

name: Noyes Automotive & Tire
address: Noyes Automotive & Tire, 777 Pine St, Burlington, VT 05401
category: ['Tire shop', 'Auto repair shop', 'Brake shop', 'Car detailing service', 'Car repair and maintenance', 'Mechanic', 'Oil change service', 'Small engine repair service', 'Vehicle inspection', 'Wheel alignment service']
text: Here is another poor review from a brake job. I so wish I had read these reviews before I took my car in. I had a noise in my brakes, so I had it checked out. I received a text message to look at pictures and to call them. I looked, and no pictures, but told my brakes needed pads, rotors, etc.. Being as I needed my car back I had the work done. I paid, and asked about the front brakes, since they replaced the back. I was given a lengthy story about brakes in general, that rotors aren't as thick anymore, since manufacturers are shrinking them down for better fuel economy. I'm told they never replace just pads anymore, and that they haven't used their lathe in years.. Oh, and my front brakes will probably need to be done before years end. Unfortunately, I didn't get to even see my rotors to try and justify replacing, and I have no idea what aftermarket rotors they were replaced with (not specified on the bill, so who knows?) Oh, did I mention - I still have noise in my front brakes? I'll look around as others have posted here.

name: Stone House Antique Center
address: Stone House Antique Center, 557 VT-103, Chester, VT 05143
text: Do you buy silver plated silverware? How could I show you it before bringing it to you? Do you have an e-mail address to show photos of it? Please send to me at soertly@gmail.com Thanks

name: Willard Street Family Dental
address: Willard Street Family Dental, 27 N Willard St, Burlington, VT 05401
text: I had such a great experience with Dr. Keeton. He was kind and knowledgeable. The rest of the staff was also very helpful and friendly. I was able to be seen at 7:00 PM which is a great bonus for me as I can't miss work generally for non-urgent issues.

name: Earthycars
address: Earthycars, 4580 Williston Rd, Williston, VT 05495
text: I just bought a used car here (February of '21), and overall I had a great experience with Earthycars. I came in only having a rough idea of what kind of car I wanted to buy, and the owner was quite helpful in presenting some options and giving me some info on various cars I could get to fit my needs. When I ended up finding a car I liked and brought it to a garage, the mechanic there said that the vehicle was in great shape, and told me that Earthycars is the best/most trustworthy place to buy used cars in the Burlington area. That definitely made me more inclined to buy from them! Buying from the owner there was great, he was very down-to-earth (no pun intended) and respectful throughout, and was never pushy with sales at all. The website is also great, features all the necessary information about the vehicles, has great pictures, and perhaps most importantly includes a free Carfax report on all the vehicles (this definitely made them seem more trustworthy and made me more interested in buying from them). Some of the vehicles may seem priced slightly higher than competing used car dealerships, but I genuinely think that's because they tend to be in better shape than the competitor's vehicles. I'll update this review if I have any issues with the car in the next 6-12 months; if there's no update by then, then my car's still running great! (Also he doesn't always answer the phone immediately, as he seems to sometimes be busy working on the vehicles there, but if you leave a message he'll get back to you.)

name: CVS
address: CVS, 35 Church St, Burlington, VT 05401
text: Great price on milk. Good variety of packaged groceries. Friendly staff. Good hours open late till 11 pm. Downtown Church Street location.

name: Granite Design USA
address: Granite Design USA, 124 Quarry Rd, Newport, VT 05855
text: When trying to replace countertops in a NH bathroom and kitchen, a Covid-19 lockdown is not what you want from your VT installer. I greatly appreciated Stephanie's (aruf@granitedesignusa.com) communications about delays. Certainly not what I wanted to hear, but she coordinated updating me about both NH and VT lockdown changes, giving me updates without being requested and we survived having a refrigerator in the middle of our living room for multiple weeks. The template (oops- forgot his name) was very professional and walked me through all the nooks, crannies and edges questions with clear explanations of options. The installers, Jeremy and Ritchie were professionals and the countertops look wonderful. The project was purchased through Home Depot and I'm grad that Granite Design was the countertop installers of our Ridgegate Cambria Quartz.

name: Granite Design USA
address: Granite Design USA, 124 Quarry Rd, Newport, VT 05855
text: I was to have a countertop install today. No call, no show yet confirmed by them yesterday with no given time other than "we will call 30 mins to an hour prior to arrival". I attempted to reach them earlier in the afternoon to be told that it was "showing as scheduled in their system and that they are likely just running late. At 3:30, I called again to be told that I needed to speak to the PM directly. He was not available. At 4:10, he called me back to tell me that the technician had called in sick and his jobs had been pushed to another tech. BUT, that tech didn't have enough glue to do the job. When I demanded that they still come to do the install, I was told that couldn't happen because they were "already back at the shop". Now, they want to do the install next week. Contractors that i cancelled today and rescheduled for Friday could have worked today! My arrangements for my kids up in arms now. This has totally been an inconvenience! All while they should have been aware this am! It's bad enough that I have been without a kitchen since April. Now, the delay's just keep on coming. I am so disappointed! The only good thing is that they admitted to their shortcomings!

name: East Warren Community Market
address: East Warren Community Market, 42 Roxbury Mountain Rd, Warren, VT 05674
text: For 25 years, we have been patrons of the Warren Store, which is a great place, but does not hold a candle to the East Warren store which, due to its location, incredibly friendly staff, covering all bases from breakfast, lunch and dinner (steaks!) and great selection of beer and wine hits the mark. Did you know they stay open until 7:30 PM ? You will walk out of that place with a big smile.

name: AutoZone Auto Parts
address: AutoZone Auto Parts, 68 Pearl St, Essex Junction, VT 05452
category: ['Auto parts store', 'Car accessories store', 'Car battery store', 'Tool rental service']
text: It is GREAT to have an auto parts store open till 8 pm like they are. We had a situation where we needed to replace a headlight ASAP and thanks to Auto Zone I was able to do what I needed to do. I have a minor issue that I ran across. I snapped a picture of the bulb that I needed to show my wife, who was on the road, and she got the bulb that I told her too, which says right on the advertisement that the bulb was the LOW BEAM bulb . When I got the bulb and tried to install it I found this bulb only fit into the HIGH BEAM connector. Something got crossed somewhere in the literature or something. Well as it turned out I pulled the bulb from the low beam side and luckily I happened to have a spare bulb for that side. There is no way that bulb 9005A would fit the low beam connector so something is wrong in the ad. I wish I could paste a picture too show what the ad has but I can’t add a pic in here apparently. Just thought I would share this information! Now I have two spares for when needed!!

name: SmartHome
address: SmartHome, 83 Pearl St, Essex Junction, VT 05452

text: Closed at 2 pm on a Wednesday. Maybe everyone was at the fair.

name: Aspen Dental
address: Aspen Dental, 62 Merchants Row Ste. 104, Williston, VT 05495
category: ['Dentist', 'Cosmetic dentist', 'Denture care center', 'Emergency dental service', 'Pediatric dentist']
text: Very poor customer service... Only the first visit went well, after that it was downhill. The second appointment I waited more than an hour to get in the room and today I had an appointment booked from 3 weeks ago and I took off time from work to go there and I received a voice message 2 hours before the appointment that the doctor has left and your appointment has been cancelled. When I called, Matthew who was the person that left the message picked up the phone and answered in a very unfriendly voice that "We do not have a dentist so we can not see you..." No apology nothing... Im done with this place. If you want good customer service and thorough examination do yourself a favor and find another practice.

name: Aspen Dental
address: Aspen Dental, 62 Merchants Row Ste. 104, Williston, VT 05495
category: ['Dentist', 'Cosmetic dentist', 'Denture care center', 'Emergency dental service', 'Pediatric dentist']
text: I took my mother to Aspen Dental in March. The first appointment went well, but after that, it's been terrible. She paid thousands of dollars up front, told her she'd have to get her implants surgically removed. When she went in for the surgery, the doctor said that they could do it an easier way. So, she didn't have the surgery but they need information from the dr. that did her implants. I got them the information and they were supposed to order the parts and set up another appointment. I never heard back from them and called several times leaving a message for them to return my call, which they never did. At one point I kept calling during office hours and the phone system responded to call back during office hours. Finally, I called a different number and asked them to get in touch with the front office and have them call me. Which they never did. Finally, the phone system was back in order and I got through. I asked them if they'd ordered the parts yet and they told me they didn't have all of the information that they needed. This was 8 weeks later and after arguing with them that they already had the information, they said "Oh, we do". So, I asked them to order the parts. They ordered the parts and I took mom in for the work. They said that they were going to give her a refund because she didn't have the surgery that they originally said she needed. It's been two more months and she hasn't gotten the refund yet. Also, I've called again to ask about the refund, and I am getting the "Please call during working hours" phone call again. So, I even sent an email to the office manager last week and haven't heard back from her. Called two more times and am getting the "Call during working hours or call the emergency number." So, I called the emergency number and they wouldn't even pick up! I would not recommend this place to anyone. My mother is 83 years old and doesn't have much patience. Their customer service is terrible. I have never seen such a disorganized place.

name: Aspen Dental
address: Aspen Dental, 62 Merchants Row Ste. 104, Williston, VT 05495
category: ['Dentist', 'Cosmetic dentist', 'Denture care center', 'Emergency dental service', 'Pediatric dentist']
text: BEYOND disgusted with this company!!! I got a referral from my Primary Doctor to go to Aspen Dental (Williston Vt) to get my Wisfom teeth surgically removed. I sched the appt. Got in the office for the Dr. to tell me that I need to have my wisdom teeth Surgically removed........ “ok I understand, that is what I am here to do” the dr looks into the paperwork and informs me “the ladies at the front desk had sched me wrong” (mind you this is the SECOND time I sched an apt with them and they messed up) yes I was a bit frustrated I took Time off of work and was ready to do this. They also insisted on taking a panoramic X-ray again even tho my Primary Dr sent them copies. I specified that if this was at there own decision that I won’t be charged, the nurse said she would have to ask, comes back and says there will be no chargr. As I am looking over my insurance info in full detail to re-sched my appt again (3rd time) I see there is a bill processed on my ins. From them for the “exam” mind you that they sched wrong, and the X-ray! This isn’t even the worst part, so I call Aspen Dental in Williston VT to speak to them to see what’s going on white that charge! I am told the person who handles that is busy and will call me back later that day, we’ll 6pm rolls around no phone call. Ok they will probably call tomorrow......nope no call by 530 pm the 2nd day so I call them at 530 again the person I need to speak to is “busy” and will call me first thing in the morning. 9am rolls around no call AGAIN so I follow up for the 3rd time, the person who answers says the lady I need to speak to is on the phone with my ins company right then and she will have her call me after. It is now 12 pm on the 3rd day still no call. I call them on my lunch break and NO ONE would talk to me said I would get a letter in the mail!!! Unfortunately I will NEVER recommend this office to ANYONE. They are VERY Rude, Unprofessional, and in able to apply Customer Service!!

name: Pentangle Arts
address: Pentangle Arts, 31 The Green, Woodstock, VT 05091
text: Nice, small venue. No bad seats. Lots of street parking, free after 4:00 pm.

name: Domino's Pizza
address: Domino's Pizza, 266 N Main St, St Albans City, VT 05478
text: Picked up a pizza I didn't order and after leaving a message online I received a phone call from Dominos apologizing and made things right. Very good of them to take the time on a busy friday night. In general, I've had very good results at Dominos. Thanks guys!

name: Birds of Vermont Museum
address: Birds of Vermont Museum, 900 Sherman Hollow Rd, Huntington, VT 05462
category: ['Natural history museum', 'Bird watching area', 'Hiking area', 'Sculpture museum', 'Tourist attraction']
text: We visited the Birds of Vermont Museum a few weeks ago and highly recommend it! Even though the museum isn't officially "open" right now, we were able to visit by calling to arrange an appointment. The museum curators are very respectful of Covid-19 guidelines and people shouldn't be shy about calling, leaving a message, or emailing the museum during the off season to arrange a time to go. The beautiful grounds are also open year round with a nice network of trails to hike through and enjoy nature. One of our favorite parts of the museum was sitting at a tinted viewing window to watch dozens of birds fly down and feed at their well-stocked feeders. Bring binoculars when you go!

name: Key Honda of Rutland
address: Key Honda of Rutland, 211 US-7, Rutland, VT 05701
category: ['Honda dealer', 'Auto parts store', 'Auto repair shop', 'Auto tune up service', 'Car dealer', 'Used car dealer']
text: We were visiting Vermont this past weekend, on Saturday the 6th of January we realized our windshield wiper lines were frozen. Nearest Volvo dealer was closed assuming because of bad weather, even though they were supposed to be open and no message on the answering machine.. Honda dealer’s service department took us in and worked on our car to get the lines going so we can get on the road. We appreciate everything you have done for us ( I believe names were Ed, Adam and the mechanic that I didn’t have his name) were awesome. If you are in the market to buy or get your car worked on, go to this location, they are the best. Thank you all again.

name: Capital City Farmers Market
address: Capital City Farmers Market, 133 State St, Montpelier, VT 05602
text: Now on State Street in Montpelier the farmer's market hosts many local farmers offering fresh food from their farms. Also local artists, bread makers, bakers, local spirits, crafters and live music! Open 9:00 am to 1:00 pm throughout the summer. Parking is free in town on the weekends :)

name: India House Restaurant
address: India House Restaurant, 207 Colchester Ave, Burlington, VT 05401
text: Most of the items were almost finished when we went for Sunday buffet around 1:45 pm , could nt find desert also.food taste is average. Charged full price for my 3 year old son. Totally disappointed

name: Smitty's Chester Market
address: Smitty's Chester Market, 526 Depot St, Chester, VT 05143
text: I was headed out of town with a 2.5 hour drive ahead of me and I stopped at Smitty's for a sandwich at 7:00 pm. I didn't realize that that's when they close. They cheerfully made two sandwiches for me and my wife. We never felt rushed and everyone was very friendly. Nobody even hinted that they were trying to close or acted put out. That kind of service is rare and appreciated. On top of that the sandwiches were great. They are reasonably priced and they have a great menu. I looked around a bit and it's a well stocked store. Great looking meat, wine, and groceries. Thank you, you guys are great.

name: U-Haul of Burlington
address: U-Haul of Burlington, 460 Riverside Ave, Burlington, VT 05401
category: ['Truck rental agency', 'Moving and storage service', 'Moving supply store', 'Packaging supply store', 'Propane supplier', 'Self-storage facility', 'Trailer rental service', 'Trailer supply store', 'Used truck dealer', 'Van rental agency']
text: The owner manager is the RUDEST man I have EVER dealt with. TERRIBLE customer service. The woman I spoke with was friendly and helpful, but I would advise everyone to steer clear of the Riverside U Haul location. Mr. Holcomb yelled at me on the phone and left a threatening voice mail message because he wanted to re route my truck to his drop off location, but I wanted to stick with my original drop off location. I plan on filing a complaint with U Haul, but they probably don't care. Do yourself a favor....rent from somewhere else.

name: UNCLE TONY'S PIZZA
address: UNCLE TONY'S PIZZA, 360 Dorset St, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: Uncle Tony’s Pizza You have to look for it because it won’t see it from the road. It’s next to Lee’s Chinese on Dorset or just past Van Phan Billiards on San Remo if you come that way. Uncle Tony’s is well worth the effort to find. They offer what I consider what the best pizza in South Burlington is and can easily go head to head with other pizza places, even those wood fired establishments in Chittenden County. First the crust. Not too thick, not to thin, it is just right. It’s got flavor and is cooked evenly. You won’t find any soft spots on their crust. Next the toppings. Whatever you like on your pie you’ll get plenty of it here. The Italian word abbondanza immediately comes to mind. It reminded me of years ago when Pi Express operated in Essex Junction. Staff there would make crew pies for themselves and there were no weighing or portion packs for toppings. Uncle Tony’s is a to-go operation only. Even the staffs that I interacted with were both respectful and courteous. After placing an on-line order (yes, they do that too!) I arrived several minutes early for pick up. After paying, the counter person said that she had just put my pie in. As it would take several minutes to cook she offered to bring my order out to the car. In addition to pizza, Uncle Tony’s offers pasta, desserts and canned soda. They are located at 360 Dorset Street and open at 3:30 PM.

name: Tim's Cycles
address: Tim's Cycles, 28 Clapper Rd, Milton, VT 05468
category: ['Auto repair shop', 'ATV repair shop', 'Motorcycle repair shop']
text: Tim was great. Our ATV worked one day, wouldnt start the next. Turned out to be corrosion fron ethanol gas. I brought it down in the AM and by the PM he diagnosed the issue and had it running better than ever a couple days later. He is very knowledgeable, walked us through the problem and suggested a variety of preventative maintenance.

name: Williston Economy Motors
address: Williston Economy Motors, 687 Industrial Ave, Williston, VT 05495
text: I test drove a Chevy Van that I was interested in buying. I noticed two items that were broken, miner issues. I wanted a extra set of Keys. a trailer hitch plug that was broken, and a broken glove box latch. I was told to go to my local credit union to get financing. The sales Manager was not very friendly I must say and was very unprofessional. When I returned to get sales agreement for the credit union, I was told he had to let me know on fixing the issues. I got a returned phone call message after I had already bought another Van at 4:00 pm Friday the following day.

name: Williston Economy Motors
address: Williston Economy Motors, 687 Industrial Ave, Williston, VT 05495
text: Long story short: My experience with this business was better than I could ever expect from a used car dealership. Quality vehicles, honest sales (no sneakiness), and really great service. Low prices, excellent value, and I would recommend Williston Economy Motors to anyone I care about. I recently bought a car from Williston Economy. It was my first time purchasing a car on my own, and I was feeling very overwhelmed with the process - shopping around at dealerships, private listings, internet, etc., and trying cut through the salespeople's B.S. to find a quality used car I could really feel good about buying. Let me start by saying, I was apprehensive about this dealer at first because I hadn't heard anything about their reputation, and there were no reviews online to give me an idea of people's experiences buying here. They had a small lot, only about ten vehicles for sale, all of which appeared to be in great condition. My other concern was the surprisingly low prices - I was looking for a used Subaru Outback, and this place had a really nice-looking 2009 for about the same price as most of the 2003-2005 Outbacks I had been considering. I assumed it was too good to be true, that there must be some kind of major hidden flaw to explain the low price. I talked to the sales manager, and he assured me that this was not a scam. I asked for a vehicle history report, and he was happy to provide it for me. The title was clean, accident-free, and the vehicle had been well-maintained. I took it for a test drive, had my boyfriend come check it out, and looked it over head to toe. Everything looked really good. The salesman never appeared to be sneaky or hiding anything, and encouraged me to do whatever I needed in order to feel comfortable buying the car. I ended up buying it, and I felt really confident that it was a good decision. The guys at Williston Economy were very helpful throughout the process, I got the car at a really great price, and they also included a 3-month warranty. There was a minor issue I noticed when I got the car home (a vacuum hose had come loose, causing the car to stall out when idling), but I called the owner that night on his cell phone and he had it taken care of first thing in the morning. After that, everything was perfect and it has been running great ever since! I am very happy with the car I bought, the people I bought it from, and my entire experience with Williston Economy Motors. I rarely write reviews, but considering the lack of other customers' reviews on this business I wanted to share my good experience.

name: Body Art Tattoo Studio
address: Body Art Tattoo Studio, 178 Main St, Burlington, VT 05401
text: Joe was amazing and was very attentive to Tony getting a 5 hour piece. He made the experience and time well with sitting there. The shop was clean and all staff was Amazing. Offering drinks and snacks to clients when they where doing a run for employees. Thank you @Josephbodyart

name: Little Harry's
address: Little Harry's, 121 West St, Rutland, VT 05701
text: My husband and I were looking for a place to eat out in Rutland the weekend before last that we had not been to before. We decided to go to Little Harry's on a whim. We walked in and there was no one around to seat us. After waiting about 7 minutes to be seated someone came out to the bar from the back. This individual was very heavy set and had a very unkempt beard and was not wearing a beard net. This individual did not even acknowlge that we were waiting to be seated and began to help the customers at the bar. There were only 2 people at the bar and 2 tables of customers in the resaturant at the time that we went. Finally after about 10 minutes of waiting as we were turning around to leave a woman came from in the back and I asked her if they were closing (it was about 6 pm or so) she said that they were not and she continued walking past us.I asked her if we were supposed to seat ourselves as there was not a sign to indicate either way. She said very sarcastially that no we didnt have to seat ourselves and that she could seat us but would have to clean off a table. Of all of the already clean nicely prepared tables in the resaturant (about 10) this woman chose to put us straight across from the door in an old uncomfortable wooden booth with very thin ratty cushions. There were crumbs and food particles all over the floor and all she did was wash off the table. The smell of urine in this area was overly strong especially when all you should be smelling in a restaurant is the food they are serving. Because of the uncleanliness and the foul odor paired with the terrible service initally (our 10 min wait) and the snotty waitress who seemed very uninclined to make our first visit pleasant my husband and i decided to get up and leave. We went to another restaurant down the street. When I go to a restaurant intending on paying for and eating a quality meal that I could probably cook at home for half the price, especially a resaturant with a quality reputation, I expect to be treated with respect. I also expect to find the premisis clean and ready for service. This restaurant was not only dirty but smelled terrible and the waitstaff was less than pleasant. We will not be returning to this establishment ever again.

name: Cara Mia's
address: Cara Mia's, 50 Strongs Ave, Rutland, VT 05701
text: This place is awful. I’m a visitor to Rutland. It’s 917 pm. Thursday Jan 25. They say they can’t deliver to me at hotel. I’m here with 12 people wanting to eat. Terrible customer service. Im very close. At Quality inn. We have no rental car. It says online open til 10. It’s only 917

name: Brix Bistro
address: Brix Bistro, 118 Merchants Row, Rutland, VT 05701
text: This is the first time that we ate there but we will eat there again. The food was excellent as was the service. The staff were very friendly. Extensive wine list and a very large variety of bourbon. We didn't have room for desert but they told us that the deserts were to die for. The desert menu changes weekly. They do stop serving a little early at 9:00 pm so make your reservation early enough to enjoy your visit.

name: The Edge Sports & Fitness
address: The Edge Sports & Fitness, 115 Wellness Dr, Williston, VT 05495
text: I'm a lap swimmer and belong to the Edge in Williston. This is one of the better lap pools that I've swam in over many years. It is always very clean, the aquatic staff are excellent, there are HUGE two-story windows that make up most of one wall, and the pool is kept at the perfect temp for a workout. The on-line reservation system works well and you can get a dedicated lane almost any day. Locker room, hot-tub, showers, sauna -- all pretty darn good. I go during the afternoon most days and it is full of swimmers, water-walkers, and people trying to stay fit who are happy and friendly. The warmest place to be during Vermont winters! Note that the swim-team takes over the pool most days from 4 to 8 PM and the pool is yards, not meters. Dive in !!

name: The Edge Sports & Fitness
address: The Edge Sports & Fitness, 115 Wellness Dr, Williston, VT 05495
text: I signed up last month and I was told that pool hours are until club close hours. 8pm is what shows up as pool closing hours on their flyers. I went there with my kids at 525 pm on a Sunday night. Signed in at the reception and no one reminded me that pool is about to close. It took 5 mins for my kids to change and when we were about to get in the pool a guy came over and said pool is closing. I was surprised and I showed him the flyer. Then he said- oh we close 30 mins before pool closing hours. That really confused and annoyed me as I had helped my kids change already. Why couldn't they remind me at the reception at the first place? Why do they have to close 30 mins before club closing hours? Why does the flyer say the pool is open until 8 PM. Is it that difficult to prepare a clear communication method for your members?

name: Wings Over Burlington
address: Wings Over Burlington, 150 Dorset St, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: So, you can call these guys... but 4 out of 5 times they'll be inexplicably closed. You'll get a message describing their business hours which basically reassures you they're open for another 120 minutes... doesn't mention why THIS Thursday, say, they didn't make it. Food is pretty greasy and god help you if you order anything other than meat.

name: Wings Over Burlington
address: Wings Over Burlington, 150 Dorset St, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: Worst service ever, I ordered food at 11 am to be delivered at 5 pm. At 8:30 I received a call saying they were on their way. 3 and a half hours late, so I told them I wasn’t going to pay for it and they decided not to bring it but didn’t call to tell me. So I called a couple minutes ago and they informed me they weren’t bringing it. Terrible service, poor management, not even worth the 1 star I was forced to give.

name: Wings Over Burlington
address: Wings Over Burlington, 150 Dorset St, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: Where do I start. Didnt think it was possible for a restaurant to make me feel worthless, but congratulations wings over Burlington on doing so. I ordered at 1130am and was told it would arrive at 500pm. I was also told I would receive a phone call prior to arrival to notify me, as I was at work. At 530 PM I tried to call and no answer. Here I am at 930 still trying to call, and await a good reason why it should take 10 hours to drive two miles down the road. Now the best part. I finally manage to figure out why. Apparently the manager decided under his own power that he was gonna cancel the order that I already paid for. He also failed to notify me about it as I found out from my coworker who also ordered and did not receive it. So here I am about 11 hours since my order and still no call or any sort of reasonable explanation as to why. So whoever the manager was tonight, you were successful in ruining my night, and making me go 13 plus hours without any food. I hope you feel good about not even being able to make a 20 second phone call at some point in the evening to let me know about what was going on. Wings over doesn't even deserve one star, however I'm unfortunately forced to give it to them so I can write this review. But if being treated like garbage and going hungry is what your looking for in a restaurant, than look no further than wings over Burlington! They'll be willing to provide such service everytime I promise.

name: Wings Over Burlington
address: Wings Over Burlington, 150 Dorset St, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: Website says they are open until 1 am I call at quarter to 11, guy answers "pick up or delivery. " I place my order and ten minutes later some female employee calls me from her personal phone asking if I was on my way because they are closing. I had someone else picking up the order which they we're in route to get. I called the number to the business and not the personal number that called me and he again answers with "pickup or delivery. " I asked why he would be taking orders of they are in such a Yank to close at 5 of 11 pm. He stated he wasn't told they we're closing.... I didn't find this place very professional what so ever and I am not likely to order through them again.

name: Community National Bank
address: Community National Bank, 116 VT-15 West, Morristown, VT 05661
text: Love the bank and the employees, just wish Friday hours were open until 6 pm and atleast open until noon on Saturdays.

name: Hollyhocks Flowers
address: Hollyhocks Flowers, 5 Green St, Vergennes, VT 05491
text: My husband and I worked with Diane at Hollyhocks Flowers for our wedding in Middlebury, VT 8/7/20. From the start, Diane was incredibly easy to work with and flexible. We did not have a specific idea of what we wanted our flowers to look like- we gave her our colour scheme and talked briefly about a price range, and she then emailed us her ideas for centerpieces, boutineers, and bouquets so we could envision them. I feel that the quote she gave us was well priced for the area and for what she had designed. Our wedding plans were altered due to COVID, but Diane took it all in stride and was incredibly flexible with not only a possible change of date, but also a change in venue with only 1 month to go before the wedding. The bridal bouquet was exactly what I had wanted, and her and her team designed a sunflower piece for an archway that our guests (all 10 of them!) were in awe over. What really stands out to me about Diane and Hollyhocks Flowers is how easy they were to communicate with: the only time I did not receive an email response from Diane <24hrs after sending her a message was due to an error on my part, and she called me the next day to confirm that everything was taken care of. We will absolutely be working with Hollyhocks Flowers in 2021 for our wedding reception!

name: Clark's Truck Center
address: Clark's Truck Center, 6 Orr Rd, Jericho, VT 05465
text: I have been a customer of Clark's Truck for close to two decades now, and have always found them to be helpful and courteous, and competent. I recently had a major PM service done on my front line truck and they were great at communicating and helping me get my truck in shape and ready for the winter and beyond. I recommend them to anyone who wants the job done right.

name: Hannaford Supermarket
address: Hannaford Supermarket, 277 Swanton Rd, St. Albans Town, VT 05478
text: (See update below) Hannaford's in St. Albans is a really nice place to shop. The store is very clean and bright with nice wide aisles. They have a nice selection of organic produce and a decent natural/organic food section. They don't make you play "card games" by making you sign up for "memberships" in order to give you discounts. Their prices are good right off the bat - no membership required or even available. They have a wonderful, polite, responsive staff and management. They are also very supportive of the community, selling used books and giving the profits to various charities. They also have fund raising drives where they will give the proceeds to animal shelters, or soup kitchens, or needy locals. The drives are conducted in a fun, low-key, yet effective fashion. Often with people posting favorite snap shots of their kids or pets on a bulletin board at the front of the store, and patrons can "vote" on their favorites by putting some money or change in jars that have numbers corresponding to the photos, which are also numbered. These displays are fun and eye-catching, but in no way do they pressure anyone to participate. They also sell food boxes to feed homeless and needy people. Again, arranged in such a way that there is no pressure at all. The patrons can see that the boxes are available to buy (donate for) and they can bring up the subject if they choose to. All in all, this is a really nice store, with really nice people and a really good selection of products available to the shopper, including awesome bakery products. Their daily fresh-made croissants are amazing! 2017 11 07 - After many years of promoting our local Hannaford with a 5 star review, I must now dock them two stars. Alas, they too have started playing the dreaded "card game". In order to get extra discounts, I would now have to sign up for a Hannaford card. Very disappointing! These card requirements are an invasion of privacy (how many systems have been hacked in recent years, exposing customers' private information?), and also result in a needless waste of time spent on signing up for the cards, then groping for them every time you check out. Total nonsense! Why can't I just get their best prices like before without having to play these demeaning, repulsive games? Guess I won't be shopping at Hannaford quite as much as before now. I don't do cards and that means their prices to me will be higher. Pity.

name: Hannaford Supermarket
address: Hannaford Supermarket, 277 Swanton Rd, St. Albans Town, VT 05478
text: Not my favorite place. Was in there today trying to buy a couple heads of cabbage. Express lane was not open at 3:30 PM. The self checkout lane had no one around to help, and as you may know you do not swipe a bar code on a head of cabbage. Not going to stand in one of the two lines open for 15 minutes. The large women manager told me to go to Price Chopper, if I did not like it.

name: Wild Fern
address: Wild Fern, 1703 VT-100 N, Stockbridge, VT 05772
text: Sunday brunch is great. Don't be in a hurry. Rick Reddington shares the stage with other local artists between noon and 2:00 PM. Warm atmosphere and homemade baked goods. Perfect escape from the daily rat race.

name: Spiral scoops
address: Spiral scoops, 21 Bonnet St, Manchester Center, VT 05255
text: Supposed to be open until 8pm.....its now only 5:30 pm and they're closed....

name: Dunkin'
address: Dunkin', Jolly's, 725 Fairfax Rd, St. Albans Town, VT 05478
category: ['Coffee shop', 'Bagel shop', 'Bakery', 'Breakfast restaurant', 'Donut shop', 'Fast food restaurant', 'Takeout Restaurant']
text: ....This place closes at 9:00 PM....I rushed to get there and arrived at 8:05 PM to be abruptly told by the girl that "They weren't serving food....it was all put away!"...get a grip...

name: Heritage Deli & Bakery
address: Heritage Deli & Bakery, 642 VT-103, Chester, VT 05143
text: Best cup of espresso we could find in Vermont. Gluten free, dairy free & vegan options! Terri the barista was so friendly and welcoming. The cafe is definitely a location I would sit in to have a meal. The treats and meal menus is extensive and delicious! Their hours are also fantastic, Open 7am to 6 pm and breakfast is served till noon! Thank you Terri!!

name: Burlington Emergency & Veterinary Specialists
address: Burlington Emergency & Veterinary Specialists, 1417 Marshall Ave, Williston, VT 05495
hours: [['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: We brought our dog here we registered at 10 AM our vet for our dog recommended we come here because our dog had a SEVERE ear abscess. to the point where when he shook his head pus came out! It is now 3:20 PM and the only thing that they have done is take hour dog in to LEVEL 1 and sedate him to put him in a cage. I called to check up on his progress they were understanding but thought that what was happening to my dog was not us as important as other dogs.“ an infection is not life-threatening” last time I checked sepsis was a thing!! The NERVE.

name: Burlington Emergency & Veterinary Specialists
address: Burlington Emergency & Veterinary Specialists, 1417 Marshall Ave, Williston, VT 05495
hours: [['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: This Message is for Elizabeth Zenger. The first week in November I very VERY sadly because of so many tests from our dogs vet and referral to BEVS and no longer being able to afford more testing, I signed our beautiful baby Darcy,mini dachshund,red long hair over to you to foster care. I was in a state of total stress at the whole situation and felt I no longer had any options just wanted to help her the only way I knew at this point. Please please let me know how she is and what has become of her not a day goes by that my husband an I don't miss her. PLEASE give us peace of mind she was like our child. I can tell you that my state of mind was very poor and I will hope you'll let us know.PLEASE

name: Burlington Emergency & Veterinary Specialists
address: Burlington Emergency & Veterinary Specialists, 1417 Marshall Ave, Williston, VT 05495

text: My little Malshi mix, a rescue from Korea when I was stationed there, is the love of my life. She came from a horrible place, abandoned and was almost picked up for dog meat. She lived in squalid conditions (a pig farm with no heating and human interaction once a week, weather permitting). Despite her awful beginnings, she is the sweetest little girl. One morning, she had the most horrible breath (smelt like rotten flesh) and would not eat nor drink. I took her to our vet and they administered pain killers and antibiotics for a horrendous infection. 5 days later, she looked worse and on death's door...she couldn't lift her head and she pleaded with me with those big brown eyes. I rushed her to BEV, a 2 hour drive for me, and we arrived close to midnight. When I got home around 3 am, there was a message from BEV letting me know what protocol she will be on. Come Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday, I got constant updates from the vets on call, in particular Dr. Bryan Harnett, who was AWESOME. I was always updated and never ignored. Millie is now home and has a long ways to go. We have yet to know what caused her such pain and discomfort, but she has a light in her eyes telling me she is on the road to recovery. I can't thank BEV enough for the consistent updates and their calm demeanor explaining things to me. I really appreciate everything they have done.

name: Burlington Emergency & Veterinary Specialists
address: Burlington Emergency & Veterinary Specialists, 1417 Marshall Ave, Williston, VT 05495
hours: [['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: First, let me say that the bedside manner (if you will) of the two vets we interacted with was very compassionate and I appreciate that. I found one of my daughter's seven month old bunnies lying in a strange manner in his habitat. I called almost every vet in central Vermont (we live south of Montpelier). No one could squeeze him in so they recommended I take him to BEVS based on availability and the fact that they see rabbits. We called en route and then again when we arrived. They took him right in. The vet called to let us know there wasn't anything they could do and invited us in to a room to say goodbye. They sedated our little guy (to stop the seizures and make him more comfortable), wrapped him in a blanket, and brought him to us. They told my daughter several times to take as long as she needed, got us some water, and checked in on us regularly. I really appreciated the care with which they treated my 12 year old's devastation. As I sat in the room with my daughter holding her bunny and saying goodbye, I received a phone call that I wouldn't have answered, but it was BEVS' number. It was the front desk calling me to settle the bill. I was shocked and let the woman know we were still there with our bunny. Her response was, "I know." Completely taken aback that I was being asked to settle the bill for an euthanasia that hadn't even occurred yet but still trying to comfort my distraught daughter, I provided payment information. Again, to the staff's credit, they gave my daughter all the time she needed and her bunny passed in her arms. They kindly put her bunny in a box and brought him out to us with their condolences. I called the office the next day to ask for a refund of the charges for the dose of euthanasia medicine since our little guy died in the room with us. The woman who answered my call told me she needed to check on it and would call me back. She called while I was in a meeting and left a message thay they could not refund the charges as sometimes the vet administers the euthanasia "just to make sure." First, I have no medical background and I could tell our little guy died in the room with us. His body let go of his waste and his temperature had already started to noticeably drop (it took my daughter quite a while to say goodbye). Additionally, the message did not say the bunny was still alive but instead stated the vets administered the drug as insurance. While I appreciate their compassion in the moment, I will not return to BEVS in the future. The inappropriate focus on the bill before they completed their service made me feel like they took advantage of the situation and charged me for services I didn't need.

name: Burlington Emergency & Veterinary Specialists
address: Burlington Emergency & Veterinary Specialists, 1417 Marshall Ave, Williston, VT 05495
hours: [['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: Brought our Great Dane 2 year old there on a Sunday due to a swollen toe that was only getting worse and starting to swell into the leg. He couldn’t even put any weight on it. We arrived around 7:30 AM and was told we would have to wait 1 hour before they came out to the car to retrieve him. About 30 minutes into our wait we received a call that the wait was going to be longer, about 10 AM due to an influx of Life saving procedures (which is completely understandable as my dogs life, to my knowledge, was not in jeopardy). They were also the only Pet ER operating and only had one Vet on duty until 10. They told us they would call prior to coming out to get him. Then it was radio silence until 10:50AM. They Vet Tech came out unannounced and took him inside and there we waited until 12:45 PM. We received a call advising us to get an x-ray as they can’t feel any sort of fracture or find a puncture which made sense to us. They gave us an initial price of $450.00 for the initial exam and X-ray, but we did not care about the money as we just wanted to figure out what was wrong with our dog. We waited until 2:00 PM, when we received a call from the Vet stating the X-ray showed nothing and they weren’t quite sure what was going on with him, but they were sending the x-ray to another certified radiologist (which cost another $80). They finally released our dog around 2:50 PM, gave us some antibiotics, anti-inflammatory steroids, a bill for $600 and directions to follow-up with our primary vet. We were initially relieved as we thought the meds would kick in and help him. The swelling only got worse until Monday morning when our primary Vet examined him for less than 5 mins, told us it was an abscess and drained it. He told us we were lucky that it didn’t burst as it would’ve made the situation worse. I am absolutely disappointed in the care that was given to my dog and will never ever go there again. It is unknown to me why these emergency vets could not give us a diagnosis or remedy the situation in 7 hours when it took our primary Vet less than five minutes to assess that it was in fact an abscess. I feel our dog was neglected and we were charged 6x what our primary vet charged us for nothing. The only good thing I will say is the staff was friendly.

name: Burlington Emergency & Veterinary Specialists
address: Burlington Emergency & Veterinary Specialists, 1417 Marshall Ave, Williston, VT 05495
hours: [['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: I brought my American bulldog, Brooklyn, here because she was seriously ill and my vet in NY wasn't sure what was wrong and suggested BEVS. BEVS diagnosed her the first day they saw her. I brought her here for several weeks to be treated for a severe case of inflammatory bowel disease with protein losing enteropathy. Unfortunately, we ended up having to put our beloved dog down but no fault of BEVS. Everyone here was terrific! Professional, kind, helpful and obvious dog lovers! I called them to inform them that I had put her down and I received the nicest hand written sympathy card with notes from everyone that helped care for her. Dr. Zinger was amazing. She called me at home several times to answer my questions as well as the vet techs. This is the most amazing vet clinic I have ever been to and I never even got to see the inside!! Everything was done over the phone due to covid-19 but I never felt like that interfered with the professional, loving care they gave to my dog or me. I recommend this vet hospital to anyone who requires their type of service. Absolutely nothing but the best here! Thank you all so much for taking such excellent care of Brooklyn and me!! My deepest appreciation to you all. Jill Parent I would like to add a comment about price. This is an emergency vet. Not once did I feel that they charged too much. It would have cost me just as much at any other energy vet. In fact, one week I brought Brooklyn there, she wasn't doing well at all and instead of encouraging me to keep treating her and spending more money, Dr. Zinger suggested putting her down. They are NOT at all about the money. The vet I took a dying dog to in Plattsburgh, NY, after hours to have put down, who kept asking me if I was sure I had $450.00 in my bank account on the phone, was all about money! BEVS charges a reasonable price for the amazing work they do. My dog was in their ICU unit for three days and the bill was only 3000.00. To bring her weekly for a ton of bloodwork and check up, it was 150 - 200. Nothing expensive about that.

name: Burlington Emergency & Veterinary Specialists
address: Burlington Emergency & Veterinary Specialists, 1417 Marshall Ave, Williston, VT 05495
hours: [['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: Can't say enough good things about BEVS. It was time to put my dog down Monday after 10+ good years. Heart breaking, gut wrenching experience, but they were total pros. The vet tech said she remembered our boy, Chester, either from the porcupine incident, or the time he swallowed a deer antler and couldnt quite pass it. She said you can't forget a good Chessie, and even cried with us. The vet himself was a total pro. He had such a calming tone when he explained the procedure, that even I stopped bawling and was really put at ease by his bedside manner. The best part was that we went late at night, about 11pm. We were able to enjoy a beautiful last day with Chester. He went for all the walks he could handle, waded in the pond, we napped together in the sun, people came and visited with us until dark, we grilled him up all the venison tenderloin he could eat. There was absolutely no rush. I hadn't eaten all day so I even stopped for a burger before heading over, not worried about making a stupid appointment and watching the clock on what was already a really difficult day. We could take it entirely naturally and make sure we didn't miss a thing. We got there at about 11 pm and he was already tired. We asked to do the procedure outside, he walked and peed on all the trees, and then laid down on his blanket when he was tired. We rapped him and and cuddled with him until the vet came out, chester was sleeping naturally after a great, long last day. The needle was so smooth he didn't even wake up or whimper from his slumber, and it was over in minutes. It really couldn't have possibly gone any better, the procedure there, or the day we were able to get in before heading over. Personal service, professionalism, great bedside manner. To those balking about price: this is an emergency service, and so it is higher priced. TBH I wish that they could treat me if I had a medical issue, the level of care that they offer, when you analyze what is really being provided, seems like a tremendous value for the price. Owning animals is expensive if you plan on treating them like members of the family and providing them care, bear that in mind when considering utilizing these services. But the staff is all pro, tbh I have had better experiences with BEVS than my regular vet.

text: I have a 21 yo maine coon that suffers with arthritis and has been on PM for alittle over a year, I pick his medicine up from his regular vet every 10 days. I feel emergency vets should be able to have access to medical charts from all local vet clinics of there patients for emergency purposes! I work full time as a nurse at UVM and got called in last minute and being the holidays I have not been able to refill his pain meds because there closed till Tuesday and I can't leave my sick patients. I have never forgotten to fill his medicine or make sure my boy has everything he needs, Until today! It was out of my hands!They said I had to come in because it's a pain med . ... for what to tell me he has arthritis... as I already know and charge me outragious prices! I also can't leave work to do that. It's the Holiday season and everything is closed and my cat will suffer, because of there polices on pm for a cat! I'm aware of rules and regulations but to make a old cat suffer is bull! They need to understand it's ones loved one and be able to take care of needs like a refill on medicine without a appointment. Page a doctor on call or something. To top it off the tech I spoke with was rude and not compassionate at all, of the situation. This isn't the first horrible exp I have had.

name: Burlington Emergency & Veterinary Specialists
address: Burlington Emergency & Veterinary Specialists, 1417 Marshall Ave, Williston, VT 05495
hours: [['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: My dog Sam was quilled by a porcupine last night, a first for both of us. After removing 1, I was not able to control him enough to remove the rest by myself so I was forced to travel an hour and 15 min to BEVS (my normal vet used to have 24 hour service but apparently does not any more). By the time we arrived it was ~11:30 PM (~2 hours since the incident), Sam was breathing heavy the whole way and unable to lie down/relax due to the quills in his mouth, he was clearly in pain and very anxious. We were the only ones there but the priority when we entered was not care for Sam but rather paper work, which prominently asked "how will you be paying". After 10 plus mins we were taken to a exam room where the tech listened to his heart for ~10s then left us for another ~15 mins before the doctor came in for the "exam", which took about 2 mins (at a cost of $110), and she told me it should be an easy removal but they would need to use a reversible sedative. At this point the doc left to prepare an estimate, 10 mins later another tech came in and informed me the cost would be ~$325-$425 depending on how it went. This seemed very expensive for the severity/duration of treatment, but I of course said OK. Finally, after being there for over 45 min, they took Sam for the procedure, telling me it would take 45 min or so and if I wanted to leave they would need a deposit.... This left me with a terrible feeling that this place was all about the money and that something bad might happen during what should be a routing procedure. After 20 min in the waiting room they came out and said everything went great, they had administered the reversal agent and we should be on our way int 10-15 min. After another 30 min a tech came out and said Sam had not woken up yet (my heart stopped) and that he is a "light weight" (90 lb lab) and I should tell any future vets this when it comes to sedatives... This is seriously what they said they to me. After another 20 mins or so they bring him out, he could hardly stand, kept lying down when not being actively walked, looked like he was barely conscious. This is almost an hour after they administered the reversal agent that was supposed to take 10-15 mins. After lifting him into my truck we headed home, I stopped every 10m to make sure he was still breathing, that's how bad it was. Even after the 90m ride home (with all the stops) he was no better. I had to carry him in the house and put him on his bed. I barely slept all night but thankfully he was better in the morning, only about 50% back to normal, but enough to know he should be ok. Almost 24 hours later he seems fine but still not quite back to normal, I am sure he will be at this point, but it was not a pleasant experience for either of us. Bottom line the vet clearly overdosed the meds, I have had other dogs receive reversible sedatives before and it was nothing like this. The quill removal was trivial, it was the medical procedure at BEVS that was the true incident. Added to this is the outrages pricing: $110.00 - Exam $29.86 - Butorphanol $34.33 - Dexmedetomidine $30.94 - Atipamezole $36.00 - Quill Removal $87.00 - Outpatient Monitoring ------------------------------------------------------ $328.13 - Total They clearly realize they have a monopoly on 24 emergency vet care in Northern VT and are taking advantage of it. The overall experience was terrible and I would NEVER go there again unless absolutely necessary. I question the credentials of any vet/tech working at this place. I am sure the issue is from the top down, they likely employ questionable/cheaper staff to increase profits. Beware. I am just glad Sam is OK.

name: Old North End Vet Clinic
address: Old North End Vet Clinic, 57 N Champlain St, Burlington, VT 05401
text: I have been taking my pets here for around 15 years and there is no one I trust more to care for my animals than ONE Vet Clinic. They are so practical with their care and keep costs low for their clients. They take time to listen and get to know their 4 legged patients well in order to provide them with the best care. Although they are not full service they have resources for their clients in case the animal needs more care than what they can provide at the Clinic. I had Dr McMillan come to my house when it was time to say good bye to my dear sweet cat who was in active renal failure. It was a traumatic experience watching my sweet girl decline, but the support I was shown during the ordeal is something I will never forget. She went peacefully at home. Days later I received a card from them offering condolences with the most heartfelt and sincere message, and also a donation to the Humane Society was given in her name. No-frills, experienced, practical, compassionate, and kind...this is The Old North End Vet Clinic!

name: Robert Frost Stone House Museum at Bennington College
address: Robert Frost Stone House Museum at Bennington College, 121 VT-7A, Shaftsbury, VT 05262
text: Lovely little house with beautiful grounds. Timed visits and masks are required during covid- email frosthouse@bennington.edu to make your reservation! We had very good service from the attendant and even though the "tour" is self-guided and there isn't necessarily much to see, it's still special to be there and read all the history about the Frost family in their own house. There's an informational half-hour film in the lobby/tiny gift shop and then 2 rooms you can walk through to see some of the poet's belongings & read tons of info on the walls. Senior discount for those 60+.

name: Exile On Main Street
address: Exile On Main Street, 94 N Main St, Barre, VT 05641
text: This is a local record store that you can never find time to visit. There are gems to be found in Exile on Main Street but you have to look very hard. Don't expect to find things on your want list. Staff is friendly but overbearing and way too talkative. Prices are above market value esp for used LPs based on condition. The store is overdue for a MAJOR clearance sale to rid the stacks of crusty old 70's and 80's butt-rock albums. If you like that stuff - please go buy it all. Suggested promotion - a 25%/30%/50% off sale? Run the sale for a 2 months or longer. Advertise the hell out of it! Reason - the inventory does not change. Just more LPs stuffed into the stacks making it impossible to flip through the titles. Move that damn inventory! Records collecting dust does not pay the rent and annoys customers...me and others with money to burn. Also investing in contemporary (Rock, Hip Hop, Electronic etc) would bring new life to the offerings and maybe new customers. Play music in your story that relates to a younger and cooler demographic. Dare I say play some hip-hop and do so all the time. This is easy to accomplish if you hire someone who a young with some knowledge of music and the music scene at-large. Not the Vermont music scene. Better lighting would be greatly appreciated. While mentioning such complaints and trivialities, the weekly hours of 10am-5pm are incredibly inconvenient and a deterrent for those who have a job. Would be great if they were open till 7 or 8 pm. Who buys an LP on a Tuesday at 10 am? The unemployed? Trust fund kids? (now in their late 60's) I don't know how this place stays in business but I glad that they do....for my bemusement and ire.

name: Faith's Toyota Ford
address: Faith's Toyota Ford, 6896 US-5, Westminster, VT 05158
category: ['Toyota dealer', 'Car dealer', 'Car finance and loan company', 'Car leasing service', 'Car manufacturer', 'Ford dealer', 'Truck dealer', 'Used car dealer', 'Used truck dealer']
text: I have not physically been to this dealership for starters, my husband has. The emails and text messages that I am getting are intrusive. I even stated that I was at work twice in response to texts that I received today. That is not how customer service works - being pushy. When I said that I was at work something like 'Let us know if we can do anything for you. Come in, call or message me directly.', would have been a better reply. I think the general mgr needs some lessons in etiquette and customer service while texting potential clients. ***Response to the reply*** Let's state facts...... First text message was trying to get me to come in today. Email today was trying to get me to come in Friday or Saturday. Then a continuous trail of texts after the first time I said I was at work and gearing up for surgery this Monday. Not once in the beginning was there mention of your competitive prices, that came at the end. I said to contact my husband - since he was the one that went there and gave an offer via email. His offer was refused. Don't try to save face with only part of the conversation (which was at the tail end). You should apologize for not listening or reading thoroughly since I said that I was a work twice and the second time I was on a conference call. Also, when you are told to contact the original party that was physically there, took a test drive and made an offer- maybe you should do so. Badgering the 'fairer sex' in this case will not work. Remember that there are plenty of dealerships out there. You are just a grain of sand on a dirt road.

name: Faith's Toyota Ford
address: Faith's Toyota Ford, 6896 US-5, Westminster, VT 05158
category: ['Toyota dealer', 'Car dealer', 'Car finance and loan company', 'Car leasing service', 'Car manufacturer', 'Ford dealer', 'Truck dealer', 'Used car dealer', 'Used truck dealer']
text: Yesterday I went to Faiths Toyota and Ford to see if there was anything they could do for me in my current unfortunate situation. Two years ago I purchased a car with full trust in a company I had been with for 3+ years. They sold me the wrong car, which not only caused me extreme anxiety but financial stress as well. I won’t go into detail, and I won’t name the business, but I will say I asked for AWD and got FWD....in Vermont. We all know how much snow effects our everyday lives. So just use your imagination. Fast forward two years and two winters of being stuck, terrified to drive, $10,000 upside down and hopeless, I decided to try again. I’ve had my eyes on the new Ford Escapes since the summer. Their sleek and chic look, and not to mention; the AWD for a pretty affordable price? Perfect car in my eyes. I went in yesterday with small hopes. I’ve been turned down by dealerships my own personal friends work at. They wouldn’t touch me because of how upside down I was in value. From the moment I stepped in Faiths Ford (stay with me here, because if you look at my other reviews, you’ll realize, I don’t say great things if I don’t wholeheartedly mean them) Bryce, this young, happy go lucky guy was right there to greet me. I sat down and told him about my situation, and eventually we went for a test drive of my dream car. Almost done, stay with me. From the get go, Bryce was kind, funny and over all, exactly what I needed that day. He worked so hard to find an option that would make me happy while ensuring my safety. 45819486184 hours and one hangry Mari later, the financial adviser Brunell came out to bring me into his office. He realized Bryce and I were complaining about being hungry and took his card out, told Bryce to get lunch for us and brought me in to chat. When I say Brunell was an amazing soul, I mean it. Us millennials stick together and it shows. He sat down and told me what the deal was. He didn’t sugar coat anything. I very understandably was upset that my payment was going to increase so much, but sitting there and talking to Brunell convinced me that I owe it to myself to make myself happy. Who needs Chipotle every week, when it could go towards a payment on your dream car? Easy choice. SO TO END THIS; my experience with Faiths showed me basic human kindness, during a pandemic. Those two really did everything they could to make sure I was happy. I honestly felt listened to, never over stepped, never invalued, worthy and comfortable while making a huge decision. And I can say with 100% confidence, I’d do it all again. So to Bryce and Brunell, and all the other Faith members that helped pull through for me yesterday, thank you. You’d be crazy not to do business with such kind human beings.

text: I went to look at a 2019 tocoma. Fell in love with a 2021 tocoma. Put 400 down as a deposit. Told that I was gonna end up with the truck. Waited 2 days. Then get a message from them saying. They accidentally sold the truck. And might be a week till they get more in cause every single tocoma they have they sold... asked for a refund and now I have to wait how ever long for a check.. very unimpressed.. lost my business. And I do not plan on going back or sending any of my freinds or family there.. wasted 1 whole day. And wasted money pretty much that I could have used else where if I was just told stright up from the begining.. very unprofessional.. the person I was working with on buying the truck is named colby..

name: Faith's Toyota Ford
address: Faith's Toyota Ford, 6896 US-5, Westminster, VT 05158
category: ['Toyota dealer', 'Car dealer', 'Car finance and loan company', 'Car leasing service', 'Car manufacturer', 'Ford dealer', 'Truck dealer', 'Used car dealer', 'Used truck dealer']
text: Every other week, I received emails from Faith Toyota regarding their wish to buy my car or trade it in. I so wanted to get a new vehicle. I contacted the manager who contacted me. I was clear about my conditions to purchase a new vehicle and the price value for my car. Well yesterday, I arrived at the dealership at 5pm as planned. The manager who I negotiated over the phone with was not even there, but he texted me saying " check in we are here to help you", and then said that " I'm at our other store but our sales reps and managers will assist you. I manage them all." I was not alone and I decided to wait for them to take care of "me". Well, it was a busy day for them but I wanted to purchase the car and I decided to wait. At 8:50, they were able to see us. The salesperson ( C.J), who, has sold 5 vehicles to my husband and I combined, was taking care of us. He has been amazing, and was always kind to us. The finance manager came out to us without introducing himself, saying that he was tired from the long day; and he made sure to complain about the fact that, he was still there at work because of us. Well, I thought we should be furious at them for having us wait for almost 4 hours when they scheduled me to come in at 5pm. I did not accept his offer for my car because it was joke for the night, and it was not as it was planned earlier. I said NO, and this manager named Jim MCmurchy had a fit. He threw my car key on the desk towards me, and walked away. He was extremely rude, and showed a huge lack of professionalism. It was a nasty/ ugly scene to watch. We all were embarrassed by his treatment. But today I got a text message from the manager, offering me his best offer of 500 dollars more for my car without mentioning how offensive his finance manager was to me. No apologies from him. Well, at this point. Faith Toyota lost a costumer for life. Thanks for nothing!

name: Handy's Downtown
address: Handy's Downtown, 39 S Main St, St Albans City, VT 05478
text: This is my 4th vehicle buying from Handys, but my first time going to their downtown location(Terrance&Oliver). I just purchased a vehicle from them and got it delivered to me in New York, I went to go start it for the first time the following morning and there was no A/C so immediately called and emailed the manager Oliver about getting it fixed and that I assumed they would pay for it considering it had been less than 24 hours since the purchase; he was off that day. He followed up with me the next day and gave me the service departments number but did not correct me by telling me that it would not be covered by them! Instead I called a couple days before the appointment to verify everything and that is where I learned I would have to pay for the repair! I want to state before they delivered the van or I guaranteed the purchase I told them there where 4 things I wanted to make sure where good; break pads, roders, tires, and A/C. They sent me a video of the flaws, a minor cosmetic piece was missing down by the tire nothing major but they did not tell me anything about the A/C. Now they are telling me "you bought a pre-owned vehicle" basically saying oh well tough luck even though I specifically asked if it worked and they responded everything should be good because it goes through the service department and if something does not work or goes wrong they will take care of it after the purchase! I have purchased 14 vehicles 4 of which I have purchased from them, we have a business where we require a lot of driving and I do a lot of repairs on vehicles because of it and I understand things happen but this was less than 24 hours after I purchased the vehicle I would expect them to fix this repair and might I add it's only a $400 fix for me, probably less for them but it is now principal and business ethic on wether or not they keep to their word before the paperwork was signed or if they just say what needs to be said to get the paperwork signed. One last thing this vehicle was delivered to me on a 80 degree day and the sales person was in pants and a polo, please try and tell me they didn't at least try to turn on the A/C. Why would I buy a vehicle during one of the hottest months in the year without A/C? And I just purchased another vehicle and typically would have gone through them but have decided to go to another dealership that has gone above and beyond for me in the past and recently! It's called good business. Also in the last 4 days I have called and left a message each day and have not gotten a call back! I wonder why? Handy Toyota downtown is a joke!

text: This restaurant has been only open for 1 week. The Cooper Fox was excellent. The atmosphere was pleasant and right from the start we felt very welcome.
