Right now they are only open for dinner 5:30 - 9 PM Sunday, Monday and Thursday's. 5:30 - 10:00 PM on Friday and Saturday's. Closed on Tuesdays and Wednesdays. It will be worth your time to stop in.

name: Apple Island Marina
address: Apple Island Marina, 6 Featherbed Ln, South Hero, VT 05486
text: Made a pontoon boat reservation over 3 weeks ago for a family day on the water to celebrate my youngest son’s 10th birthday. Reservation was for Sunday afternoon. A woman called 5:00 PM Saturday afternoon to inform us she had bad news: mechanical issues with the boat to which we were (arbitrarily) assigned meant that our reservation was cancelled. No empathy. No apology. You’d think I was talking to a NYC Taxi dispatcher from 1979. Every question was met by: “I’ll ask the manager to call you;” her only goal to get off the phone. I hate to say it, but all-too-typical Burlington, VT area smug, arrogant, never-heard-of Customer Service attitude. Called back after a while looking for that manager with whom I was supposed to speak — apparently he was too busy gassing boats or something (she reported) — you can’t make-up this stuff!! This woman just couldn’t care less how she affected my son’s 10th birthday plans. To quote: “we’re a small marina and that’s just the way it is.” And oh yeah... “speak to the manager” was repeated at least 10 times — easiest way to get off the phone, right? Avoid this place like the plague - like the Cyanobacteria all over it anyway. Still waiting for that call... just hung up with another rental place that said, quote, "This is the 5th call we've had that said Apple Island Marina cancelled our reservation."

text: So I decided to give my local store a try and ordered a fridge. They delivered on time but we had folks staying at our camp (and using the fridge) reporting issues. I finally figured out the problem - the door was installed incorrectly. I was quite perturbed and called on a Saturday afternoon and left a message, thinking to myself I should’ve gone with one of the big box stores. Well first thing Monday morning I got a call from an extremely friendly service rep (Chris). I explained the problem and he went to our camp and had it fixed in 15 minutes. Issues are a part of life - it’s how the issues are handled is what matter. THC stepped up big time and provided EXCELLENT customer service. Would one of the big box stores have been able to do that? Unlikely. Very impressed.

text: We used to frequent this place a couple years ago - lobster rolls were excellent back then with a large roll overly stuffed and reasonably priced. Went back there 08-26-2018, and we were so deeply disappointed in the same food item! It was $13.50 for just a hotdog roll with barely enough lobster to cover the bottom, and no chips or pickle or anything else offered with it. The "meal" was a cup of French fries, a couple tablespoons of coleslaw and a pickle. Furthermore, the lobster was either overcooked or warmed up too many times. We paid $32 for this meal! Very, very disappointed! There were 3 local people there who got just the hotdogs, and I wish we'd done the same thing. Definitely not "home cooking!"

name: Hayes Ford
address: Hayes Ford, 439 E Main St, Newport, VT 05855
text: Thank you @jesse for the amazing quick experience in buying my 2016 Ford Fiesta. I wasn’t sure the vehicle I wanted at first but was set in my ways on price and trade in. I found the perfect care that fit what I needed. Jesse was on it he got my into the car quick. I talked with Jesse over the phone told him what I wanted and what I wanted the price and payments about. Jesse worked his magic and went above and beyond had me in the car that afternoon. The car is perfect and the kids absolutely love the changing of the lights in the inside. Jesse took the time to set up my Bluetooth go over all the features of the car. I can’t thank Jesse and Hayes ford enough for the amazing experience and quickest car buying experience with no hassle.

name: Golden Fortune
address: Golden Fortune, 287 Rockingham St, Bellows Falls, VT 05101
text: A friend and I had lunch today (2-14-2018) at the Golden Fortune, formerly Joy Wah Restaurant. Very disappointing! I ordered chicken with cashews and vegetables with fried rice, egg roll, and wonton soup. First off, the food was warm, not hot. Rice and egg roll were ok but not the best tasting; wonton soup was the tastiest but just warm. The chicken was in small chunks with no flavor and tough; very few and small cashews and carrots and celery (only veggies!!) were in uncooked chunks and no flavor. My tea cup had dried food on outside and teapot had enough tea for a little more than two cups each. While waiting for my friend to use the restroom, I noticed the carpets looked like they need vacuuming (this was a lunch time; they had just opened!!); the place was not clean. On top of that, it was chilly in the restaurant and the heat was off in the restroom! Joy Wah was consistently good for the past 13 years that I have gone there; very clean and warm in the winter. The new owners have shot themselves in the foot; if something is working don't change it!!!

name: Farm & Wilderness Foundation
address: Farm & Wilderness Foundation, 401 Farm and Wilderness Rd, Plymouth, VT 05056
text: There are lots of good things about the F&W camps. They do promote a sort of free-spirited self-confidence in children and young teens, they get kids away from their phones/ipads/laptops, and when things go well (good counselors, good peer group, good weather) it can be a wonderful experience. On the other hand ... each year the "identity politics" gets more and more calcified and all-encompassing. The pressure on kids to conform to the camp's identity-politics ideology is relentless (though, to be fair, this can vary a bit from year to year and from camp to camp). In particular ... I would be very cautious about sending my daughter to F&W nowadays. It's an epicenter of Rapid Onset Gender Dysphoria. Many girls this age are (understandably) unhappy about how female persons are treated in society, and are nervous about their upcoming puberty/period/bodily changes. At F&W, there is a lot of peer pressure on these girls to declare themselves transgender, "non-binary", or anything else that is Not A Girl. Its a weirdly anti-feminist message. Lots of girls who go to F&W are not into stereotypically "girly" things (makeup, dresses). Ideally, the message they would get at F&W is "That's OK, girls can do and be whatever they want; ignore the stupid stereotypes". Instead, the message now seems to be "If you don't fit the stereotype, you might not be a girl. You can be trans, or non-binary, or anything else as long as it isn't a girl." My older boy saw a bit of this, and from what I'm hearing from the younger one it's gotten worse. I've spoken with three parents of girls who went to F&W camps and when they returned home told their parents that they "didn't want to be called a girl". In all three cases they eventually got over their ROGD and eventually became comfortable with their own biology, but in one case the girl spent a year being stressed-out and anxious about what it meant to be "non-binary" before she finally decided that she was OK to be female and she didn't need to change. So. Lots of good things about the camps, but all the (well-intentioned) focus on "identity!" can be overwhelming and distressing to children ... and some of the counselors seem to think it's their mission to convince as many kids as possible to adopt a new and different and more "woke" identity.

text: I have gone to the village pizza in ludlow for lunch and dinner for a long time! Last night they lost a customer. name: Gold Crown Lanes
address: Gold Crown Lanes, 212 Hastings St, St Johnsbury, VT 05819
text: I had my son's birthday there the space was good and the kids had fun so all in all a success! But as a suggestion, or advice to the employees, it's one thing to confirm the time that the party will go do because there is a league night. But we said the part would end at 6:15- 6:30 they said that was fine because league starts at 7. But when we came in the man pushed up for 2 lanes so it would " go faster" and kept re asking and reming us that we had to be done by 6:30 ( the anyways agreed time) them came over and suggested 3 lanes to speed up mind you IT WAS BARLEY 5 PM AT THIS POINT ! And there were only 5 kids! At this point I feel more rushed out than helped we we're out by 6 so as not to give said employees heart attacks. Because of this a 5 star experience of exactly what I expected became a 3 so [glowing star] as I was annoyed by the time it was made clear we we're a concern and possibly inconvenience [unamused face]. If they didn't want us there they could have said so.

address: LISTEN Thrift & Furniture Store, White River Junction, 42 Maple St STE 2, White River Junction, VT 05001
category: ['Thrift store', 'Non-profit organization', 'Second hand store', 'Used clothing store', 'Used furniture store']
text: Pulled in at 12:01 PM to donate at miracle mile location. Informed by a LISTEN staff member with walkie talkie - blocking the line of cars with his car - pulled his SUV in front of me in line to make donations - that donations closed at noon and he was not allowing me in line. I mentioned that I was disabled and just drove 80 miles to donate,. Would be very difficult to unload and reload full car of donations at home. He mentioned that "they are very strict" about end time. I mentioned that "you are being very strict", don't pass off to "they". Shrugged and walked away. Found a thrift store down road that happily took my donations. Bad attitude at Listen.

name: Myles Court Barbershop
address: Myles Court Barbershop, 25 E State St, Montpelier, VT 05602
text: Found them on Google which sent me to their Facebook page. Noted they were open into the evening (7PM) and I could "message" the business. I asked if they took walk-ins and within 30 seconds I had an answer - YES - and an appointment for 30 minutes later! I met Todd and got a great haircut which took about 15 minutes start to end and was $15. Very pleased with the service, price, and ease of getting in. Thanks!

name: George and Koch Dental Associates, PC
address: George and Koch Dental Associates, PC, 6 North St, Barre, VT 05641
text: Nobody likes to go to the dentist but, these people are great. The most pleasant experience I have ever had. My name is William Carrien and I approve this message.

name: TD Bank
address: TD Bank, 111 Main St, Burlington, VT 05401
text: Terrible customer services. Just a large banking institution that treats individuals as cattle. They make claims such as service excellence while keeping you on hold for 20 or 30 minutes. See the irony? Not helpful with questions or issues, only care about how much you have to invest or deposit no personal customer service for more details relating to negative experiences at the bank I am more than willing to relate this information via email. Just send me a message and will give specific details on why you should avoid this banking institution

name: Upper Valley Grill & General Store
address: Upper Valley Grill & General Store, 2967 Scott Hwy, Groton, VT 05046
text: My wife ordered the prime rib special. It arrived with cooked carrots, mashed potatoes and gravy. Cooked as she requested it. Seasoning was perfect. I ordered a small meat lover's pizza. More than I could eat by myself. We arrived around 6 PM and the seats were full. Locals look forward to prime rib night. A bargain at $14.99. Friendly atmosphere. A lot of discussion amongst the patrons. Cook and wait staff were friendly and very busy as they also cover the store at this location.

name: Central Vermont Medical Center
address: Central Vermont Medical Center, 130 Fisher Rd, Berlin, VT 05602
hours: [['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: I went here for a total hip replacement. The surgical team was great. I was admitted to the floor, met all the staff, who promptly vanished. The compression leggings were left not hooked up to the pump, there was no attention for a long time and although my legs were supposed to be kept on a compression pump and iced constantly, it was not done , no one came in to do it. I had to tell the staff to do this for me, even though it is mandatory for the patient to have this done after surgery. By 11 pm, after being admitted to the floor at 4, I was crying about pain, about the ice, and about the leggings. It took 3 aides who took my pain report and left to "go tell the nurse". The third LNA did go and tell, but again, did not receive pain relief for an hour and a half after the first request. I was newly post operative!!!!!!!! After many apologies, and my doctor addressing this, the pain medication was promptly given and the treatment was better. I did a lot of self care and ambulation, and the PT and OT department were great. The overnight staff was loud, in the hall,while doing personal care with the lady in the next bed, even though she was not hard of hearing. If I had to have surgery again, I would not go there. There were too many things missed immediately post op.

name: Sprint Store
address: Sprint Store, 235 S Main St, Rutland, VT 05701
category: ['Cell phone store', 'Cell phone accessory store', 'Electronics repair shop', 'Electronics store', 'Mobile phone repair shop']
text: When I was dealing with Thomas at the store, he bent over backwards to help. Now this girl Amanda is there and she cannot even give him the message to return a phone call. She is horrible at customer service and should not even be working there! It brings the overall store down to a very poor rating!

name: McGillicuddy's Alehouse
address: McGillicuddy's Alehouse, 28 Walnut St, Williston, VT 05495
text: This has been one of the only restaurants during this past year that we have gone to where we have felt safe and not only enjoyed the food but the employees. We had a completely different experience last night . We walked in at 8:20 and immediately felt like they didn’t want us there (they close at 9)I understand that they have to shut the kitchen down and we offered to order for everyone early before our party arrived and they assured us it was fine . We ordered quickly and were enjoying our dinner (it was my husbands birthday) and exactly at 9 pm they turned the lights on, shut all the TVs and the music off . We weren’t the only party left in the restaurant. I’ve never experienced anything like it and will never go back, the bartender was rude , and when asked if he would like it if this happened to him, replied that he would have to stay an extra 10 minutes if they didn’t do that. Terrible customer service .

name: Vermont Gaming Academy
address: Vermont Gaming Academy, 155 Dorset St Suite J-3, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: Visiting from Florida where I DM, had to stop in when I saw D&D adventure league. Matt the manager was friendly and informative. If I was local I should definitely play here.

name: Tavola Italiana
address: Tavola Italiana, 68 VT-100, Ludlow, VT 05149
text: I was given a gift card over the holidays and decided it would be a good time to use it. We arrived around 6:45 pm and sat in the bar area. The bartender was friendly and attentive. We ordered an Appetizer to share along with some warm bread. The entrees came and were quite good. This was our second time at La Tavola and will definitely go back.

name: MountainOps Outdoor Gear
address: MountainOps Outdoor Gear, 4081 Mountain Rd, Stowe, VT 05672
category: ['Ski shop', 'Bicycle rental service', 'Bicycle repair shop', 'Bicycle Shop', 'Camping store', 'Outdoor sports store', 'Rock climbing', 'Ski rental service', 'Ski repair service', 'Snowboard rental service']
text: Mounted my bindings and got my skis good to go in less than 24 hours! Dropped off at 3 pm and picked up at 8 am on Thanksgiving.

name: Ranch Camp
address: Ranch Camp, 311 Mountain Rd, Stowe, VT 05672
text: Vermont is really strict on their Covid rules which is so cool because everybody stays safe. However, it makes dining somewhat of a challenge, most restaurants in Stowe, Burlington, and Waterbury don’t open for breakfast, don’t open for lunch, and they only open at 4 PM for dinner service. We luckily found ( after looking at four other restaurants) This little gem called ranch camp. It’s right off of Highway 100 and it really has the most bomb appetizers and salad and burgers and burritos and tacos. I got the Cobb salad, we had the fried chokes as an appetizer, and my husband got the buffalo chicken sandwich, all of which were huge portions and really delicious. I don’t know what they put in that special artichoke sauce but it was on point; the most delicious sauce I’ve ever had with a fried artichoke. I highly recommend this restaurant and will return.

name: DR Power Equipment
address: DR Power Equipment, 800 Hinesburg Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: DR Power Pro 26 14.5HP Review On 10.14.2020, I was browsing the DR Power website and saw that there was an October Sale along with free shipping. So, I ordered the Pro 26 14.5 HP Field and Brush Mower saving $300 and free shipping. Initially, I had an unfavorable experience with the shipping company, Averitt. Called and set my delivery appointment for 10.26.2020 between the hours of 12 to 5 PM with an agreement I’d be called with the driver’s arrival time. 12, 1, 2, 3, 4 o’clock passed without a call … and I was getting a little concerned. At 5 o’clock no call or delivery!! I waited until 5:05PM and called Averitt’s customer service and was told that my mower did NOT go out for delivery! No explanation was given, but was told that is was inappropriate for shipping not to have notified me and received an apology from the CSR. My delivery was rescheduled for the 27th and it arrived approximately 3:45PM and the driver’s attitude was well above and beyond my expectations and turned a negative into a positive. It actually took me longer to snip all the zip ties, a good thing, than to mount the mower deck, fill the gas tank, and fill the oil. I can say that after using it about three hours it I found that it worked flawlessly. On May 3, 2021 I ordered the 3.5” Chipper Attachment. Once it arrives and it is put to use I’ll write an initial review. I’m very impressed with it and will attempt to up date this review in approximately one year and again after five years.

name: DR Power Equipment
address: DR Power Equipment, 800 Hinesburg Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: I specifically requested in instructed this order to be shipped to the repair facility of my choice (UPS) delivers to business locations earlier than to houses! I received the parts at my home at 8:30 pm due to non-attention to details by picker/shipper at your facility. I didn't want anymore delays than needed in getting machine up and running as it is needed! By arriving Friday night I now have to drive to service center in morning as they are only open 1/2 day on Saturdays! I guess this is okay in DR mind as they are done with taking my money and sending parts out to wrong address as it isn't their problem anymore! My schedule is in their mind not important and inconsequential so I can do their job on getting part to correct address!

name: DR Power Equipment
address: DR Power Equipment, 800 Hinesburg Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: Purchased a Trimmer Mower Pro XLSP. 1. Prior to actual purchase, I was borderline scolded by the sales person because I told them I would use it on a slope (it's self propelled). Their YouTube videos and write-ups take pride and show the "ease of using self-propelled units on slopes", and the slopes shown in the videos and photos are far greater than what I have. They would not sell it to me because it won't work on slopes. I was then told by another staffer that I was 'allowed' to purchase the unit without fear of voiding a warranty, and then got an email from someone else that said "I will void the warranty". After the sale, they said it is only usable on a 'gentle' slope. 2. The unit arrived well beyond the expected delivery date, but I do not fault DR. They sent it promptly. Variable Speed Drive handle is limp and the cable will not retract nor will it pull back. I have yet to put oil and gas in unit and thought I should call DR first. Which I did. 3. After a total of 3+ hours of holding and listening to their 'Pls hold' message every 30 seconds, I am told that I cannot return the unit and they will send a replacement part for me to install. Or they will arrange someone else to put the part on for me, however will not guarantee how long that will take. I can do it with my eyes closed, but why should I? Further, I am losing more and more valuable time. After telling the call taker that I would like to elevate this concern, he said "Sure. I will put you on hold." It is at this point that I resigned myself to the fact that DR has me on the hook, they know it, and there is nothing I can do but allow them to send me the part and I will do the installation. 4. I called later (as though to place an order...thus immediately they answered the phone). Robert (quite nice) offered to take the unit back and replace it, however they are out of this model and there is a long- long lead time. Thus another effort to make it sound like I am getting the deal of the century by getting the part and fixing it myself. When I ordered the unit, it took three minutes to place the order and pay. Thus, once they get your money, it's all over with customer service. Their telephone recordings say " you have been chosen to take a survey immediately following your telephone call. Push #1 to take the survey", and I always do. However they immediately disconnect you once your call is over. And I typically wait in excess of 60 seconds just to be sure they disconnected the call. I do not recommend DR / Generac as a result of this situation. Being a former customer of DR Power Equipment who was extremely pleased (it is a great leaf vacuum), I am qualified to state that once they were bought up by Generac, their post-purchase customer service appears to have decayed considerably. I just proved it. So if you buy something from them and it fails (in my case, before it is even assembled), it may be your burden to furnish labor. And if you must call Tech Support, pack your patience and a lunch.....and a charger for your phone. Respectfully submitted.

name: Crate Escape Too
address: Crate Escape Too, 1364 Marshall Ave, Williston, VT 05495
category: ['Dog day care center', 'Dog trainer', 'Kennel', 'Pet boarding service', 'Pet groomer']
text: This was our first time ever boarding our seven year old lab. We were grateful to find a well reviewed place that would board Murray over the holidays. They screen every dog thoroughly and they worked with us through any snags along the way. However, our experience was not the greatest after we actually dropped him off. He unfortunately shredded his bed due to stress but they were able to provide him a replacement, which was great. I was really bothered with the fact that we were told there would be picture message updates every day. I called on the fourth or fifth day to voice my concern that this wasn't happening at all. They sent me a few pictures a few hours later, but they were all from the same outdoor play session. My thoughts immediately went to a dark place and I was worried that Murray was being left alone too often/neglected. When we got him home, he was super thirsty and he had two new open wounds on his body. One on his nose and the other on his rear end. Luckily, they healed without issue but Murray now has a scar on his nose. Based on their website, prices and reviews, we expected better.

name: The EDGE Sports & Fitness
address: The EDGE Sports & Fitness, 75 Eastwood Dr, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: This is a great location if you plan on using the pool or basketball courts. As for the gym area, it's really small and limited. I frequent here just because of its proximity to where I live, but even just more than three people in the gym area at a time makes it feel crowded and fighting for space/equipment. It feels very outdated and stuffy, and closes pretty early-- 5 pm on a Saturday! There's also a lot of activities in the club like classes where young kids are hanging around, and I sometimes see them playing around on the equipment without attendance (which is both unsafe and distracting). The staff is always nice but maybe could be more attentive in this aspect.

name: St Augustine's Catholic Church
address: St Augustine's Catholic Church, 16 Barre St, Montpelier, VT 05602
text: Attended here when I was in college back in 1997-1998. Fr. Gaudreau, my 4th cousin, was here for the first few months of my stay in town. Fr. Danielson was there to spiritually guide me during a much needed confession. It was a great place to go on Sunday and is missed.

name: Safelite AutoGlass
address: Safelite AutoGlass, 1246 US Rt 302, Unit #2, Barre, VT 05641
text: Called for appt in the AM, scheduled for the PM, fixed in half an hour, on time, no cost to me because they work directly with my insurance company. Can't ask for better.

name: The Wellness Collective
address: The Wellness Collective, 875 Roosevelt Hwy Suite 120, Colchester, VT 05446
category: ['Wellness center', 'Acupuncture clinic', 'Alternative medicine practitioner', 'Chiropractor', 'Holistic medicine practitioner']
text: VERY DICEY! I recently purchase a Groupon certificate online. I had to call and "leave a message" on a cellphone to make an appt. I scheduled for Valentines Day (which one would think would be a very popular day). I put in address that was listed on Groupon certificate, which led me to a very LARGE parking lot and to what "appeared" to be a vacant building. NO CARS in parking lot. NO SIGN on building. Clearly thought I had the wrong address, so called phone. NO ANSWER! Called several times.....nothing. I finally decided to go back to what appeared to be a "vacant building without any signs". Turns out it was "open for business" after all. Very dicey......I would NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE! He stated he did not have his cellphone with him that is why he didn't answer. Website seems as if it's a booming business. NOT ......don't be fooled by website and I do NOT RECOMMEND. Does not appear to be a safe environment.

name: Heritage Ford
address: Heritage Ford, 1600 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: As a transgender customer, I did not appreciate the sales associate who contacted me assuming that I was not Jack because of my voicemail message. I was looking forward to looking at the selection they offered at Heritage since it’s close by. However, I was disappointed by how I was treated and will not be using their dealership to buy my new car.

name: Heritage Ford
address: Heritage Ford, 1600 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: Service department does not have their act together. I dropped a car off early in the morning because of a recall notice. I made the appointment prior week. I told the service department about the reason for me bringing it in when I made the appointment. Asked for an update early on. Never got an update. I called to check the progress and all I got was an extremely long wait (25 minutes) to TALK TO SOMEONE. Or an option for somebody to call me back. Left a message for somebody to call me back BUT NO ONE CALLED ME BACK. Kept calling but just got long waits and voice mail. FINALLY GOT THROUGH TO SOMEONE. The person who answered in the service department could not find me or my car in the system. I requested to talk to the person we spoke to when we dropped off the car. He said, oh yeah we don't have the part we will have to order it. It will probably be middle of next week we will call you. Never got a call! Most importantly when we made an appointment to fix the recall issue wouldn't you think they would have already ordered the PART!!!!????!!

name: Heritage Ford
address: Heritage Ford, 1600 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: Great sales experience with @katielyon, thanks for your help!

name: Heritage Ford
address: Heritage Ford, 1600 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: They are terrible at helping via phone. No one picks up the phone. You leave your message and no one call you back.

name: Sears Appliance Repair
address: Sears Appliance Repair, 155 Dorset St, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Appliance repair service', 'Air conditioning repair service', 'Furnace repair service', 'Refrigerator repair service', 'Washer & dryer repair service']
text: On June 18, 2016, a Sears repairman showed up for my lawn tractor issue under warranty. He confirmed my diagnosis that it had no reverse gear and needed a new transmission. He ordered the parts and said three deliveries would come as parts for his installation on new date July 2, 2016. He told me one box would be a large, heavy box which would be the transmission and to call in when these arrived. I called in when I received three parts, all small, and no transmission. I called into Sears and told the lady who answered that no transmission had been delivered as stated by the technician on June 18. The lady insisted I had all the parts needed and did not check/confirm with the technician as scheduled for July 2. Sears would not give the technician's name or phone number to alert him to the issue. So he arrives on July 2 and there is no transmission there and I repeat him the issue with Sears Service about all the parts are there. He is ticked. He has to use my phone since there is no cell service and stays on the line for about 30 minutes to get it cleared up and the transmission correctly ordered. I am now rescheduled again for July 12. The transmission arrives a few days before July 12 and again I call it in. The technician arrives and installs the transmission on July 12. So finally it gets installed, at no fault of the technician in over a month since my first call. The technician was excellent! Unfortunately, he had to make three trips to my house over 24 days because Sear Service who answered the phone, transferred me all over the world to people who barely spoke good English and could not and would not report what I told them about the transmission not being there, nor would they let me pass the message on. So customer service on the phone was horrible, whoever sent the parts was horrible, but the actual technician was great. Too bad Sears can't get their back end customer support back in the U.S. where it belongs to RESOLVE ISSUES, rather than just trying to get you off the phone and credit for taking a call. Bring support calls back to the U.S.A. where we buy our products. Five stars for the technician and none for Phone Support (average 2 since I could not do 2.5)

name: Sears Appliance Repair
address: Sears Appliance Repair, 155 Dorset St, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Appliance repair service', 'Air conditioning repair service', 'Furnace repair service', 'Refrigerator repair service', 'Washer & dryer repair service']

name: Alpine Shop
address: Alpine Shop, 1184 Williston Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Outdoor sports store', 'Bicycle repair shop', 'Bicycle Shop', "Men's clothing store", 'Ski rental service', 'Ski shop', 'Snowboard shop', 'Sportswear store', 'Swimwear store', 'Tennis store', "Women's clothing store"]
text: The prices were very good and beat the competition, gave free shipping (which is required in my book), and shipped my order promptly. My skis were shipped via FedEx. FedEx delayed the shipment 3 times until it finally said "Information Not Available". I sent a reply to my order inquiring about the shipping status. I received a reply from Hillary right away. Most people would have said to call FedEx, but not Hillary. The message said they are looking into it and will get back to me. Shortly after, she said they spoke to FedEx and the package will be delivered within 48 hours. The next day, much to my surprise, I got another email from Hillary with an update for the shipment. Loved the attention. Thanks Hillary!

name: Alpine Shop
address: Alpine Shop, 1184 Williston Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Outdoor sports store', 'Bicycle repair shop', 'Bicycle Shop', "Men's clothing store", 'Ski rental service', 'Ski shop', 'Snowboard shop', 'Sportswear store', 'Swimwear store', 'Tennis store', "Women's clothing store"]
text: Very disappointed with the “hand waxing” and customer service provided. Both snowboards were put back together incorrectly and sloppily. Bindings we’re mounted backwards and stances were not adjusted correctly. I called to speak with a manager to notify them with how my experience was. An employee took my message, I received no call back. I do not recommend going there for waxing services.

name: Heritage Toyota Service
address: Heritage Toyota Service, 1580 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Auto repair shop', 'Auto tune up service', 'Brake shop', 'Car repair and maintenance', 'Muffler shop', 'Oil change service', 'Tire shop', 'Transmission shop', 'Truck repair shop']
text: First time service: Brought my Tacoma in at 7:30 am for an oil change and quick fix on a fuel door. Received a text at 5:07 pm that the truck was ready to be picked up, paid for the service at 5:09 then headed out to pick up the vehicle. Keys weren’t in it and all the doors locked, service department was closed. Called this morning and I was told that when I paid at 5:09 the service rep handling my truck had already left so he didn’t leave the keys. Service department closes at 5:30... not happy to have to make another trip out there. There was no directions or mention of how to properly set up picking up the vehicle from anyone or any email/text communications. They gladly took my payment through their express checkout but apparently did not care to provide any other information to complete the service and ensure my truck was actually available to be picked up.

name: Heritage Toyota Service
address: Heritage Toyota Service, 1580 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Auto repair shop', 'Auto tune up service', 'Brake shop', 'Car repair and maintenance', 'Muffler shop', 'Oil change service', 'Tire shop', 'Transmission shop', 'Truck repair shop']
text: I received a text message stating my car was ready for pick up, but when I arrived an hour later the car was not ready. Very disappointing.

name: Convenience Plus Redemption and Deli

name: Capitol City Buick GMC

Someone answers the phone maybe 1 time out of 20 tries and its usually the front desk. Don't bother to leave a message because they will never call you back.

name: Capitol City Buick GMC
address: Capitol City Buick GMC, 1162 US Rte 2, Berlin, VT 05602
text: update, just found out the truck I bought in July, used won't go into 4 Low..called at 8 a.m yesterday and left a message to make an apt to have it fixed... under 12,000 miles , 12 months. NO CALL BACK..probably pissed because of my review...even tried to trade this truck in to Toyota but I owe more than it's worth....OMG... salesman showed me a truck I KNEW I couldn't afford but promised me he could find financing..... well after 5 days of driving this truck I brought it back... knowing it wouldn't happen.... so surprise they had the perfect truck for me.. a truck that had obviously been traded in the day before.. smelled like an ashtray.( still does when it's damp). burn hole In drivers seat... parts missing ( oh and ordered. NOT). no manual... that is another nightmare... so 2 weeks after buying it I had to spend 100 bucks to get the tailgate to stay shut... did NOT want to deal with them anymore... so mad at myself for not going to Toyota..oh and then I talked to the sales manager about getting a manual and was told he would find me one but to check in with him in a week... surprise !!!! never heard from him... and now my check engine light is on and it's due for inspection.. AND I have NO frigging manual to check .... I will be visiting this terrible place if I have to pay more to get it inspected.. oh and salesman made me think I was getting this extra coverage for parts etc as part of the deal well guess what .. it cost 2000 bucks... I owe 10,000 more than it's worth.... don't go there especially if you are a woman....

name: Town Fair Tire
address: Town Fair Tire, 162 S Main St, Rutland, VT 05701
text: Why do you offer appointments when you don't honor them? I made an appointment for a tire changeover online. It said there may be a 30 minute wait for an open bay. Ok. When I confirmed my appointment via text message it said there may be a 45 minute wait for an open bay. Annoying but ok. When I got to Town Fair a few minutes before my scheduled appointment I was told by the guy that took my keys that it would be about an hour! I should have just taken my key back and walked out then. My car wasn't taken to a bay until 11:34. I checked out at 12:11 after asking the only guy behind the counter if someone could check me out. This was after waiting a couple minutes for him or someone else to acknowledge me after my keys were brought in and hung up at the counter. On top of that, I was charged $53 for a service that is supposed to be free. The charge was for a balance and valve package that says on my receipt is an option. I was never given an option. I was asked if I wanted an alignment. Nothing else. Terrible service. Never again

name: Town Fair Tire
address: Town Fair Tire, 162 S Main St, Rutland, VT 05701
text: They were really busy due to the ongoing snow but took my work van and swapped my tires while I worked. Got a text message letting me know the second it was done. Great service and helpful staff. Brandon was really helpful. Thanks!

name: Town Fair Tire
address: Town Fair Tire, 162 S Main St, Rutland, VT 05701
text: made an appointment for 11:30 am, took 15 min to get to the front desk finally the guy found my tires and took my keys and told me give us 2 hours so I went to the store down the road came back about 1 hr later and my car was still in the parking lot where I had parked it, I ask the guy when it was going in and he said should be soon, my car didn't get in the bay till 2:30 pm and my car was done and I left town fair tire in Rutland around 4:00 pm. no one came up tp me and said that they where behind or anything I had to keep going up to ask what was going on and they had no clue. then I wake up the next morning and both front tire are flat I fill them up with air and there is leaks around both value stems . first and last time I go to this place. I do not recommend town fair tire to anyone !!!

text: Second post It's now been 9 days since my purchase. The payment came out of my bank account but my products are still on hold and I haven't gotten an update via email (which has another company name, Black Horse Art Enterprise) or even a return phone call. I call nearly every day and no one answers or calls me back. I am going to have to contest the charges. I just wish someone would let me know what's going on. First post I ordered some paints and got an email stating that my order is on hold. I'm wondering what that means and when I might expect them to ship. They have after all already processed my payment, pending. I called the 800 number which doesn't work and then called the local number and left a voice message which hasn't been returned . I called again today and each time I call the message says all circuits are busy. I can't even find an email to contact on the website. What's going on?

name: Vermont Art Supply
address: Vermont Art Supply, 277 Pine St #1B, Burlington, VT 05401
text: Well I was super excited about trying them out as a new supplier for my gouache paints. Their prices were a littlw cheaper even than jerrys and dickblick (where i usually buy my gouache). My order from April 25th was originally lost in their system and I had to email questioning my order confirmation. John emailed me back fairly promptly and assured me the order would go out the following Monday. However my order arrived and their were some items on backorder. Fine, no big deal. Well it is now June 8th and 2 emails, a facebook message and 4 voicemails later I am still sitting here wondering about my items on back order. No one has returned my calls or emails and I am quite frusterated at this point As an artist I buy a lot of art supplies and I am not sure I can trust this company's customer service.

name: Midstate Chrysler Dodge Jeep Ram

text: We were looking for a used Jeep and sent a message of interest. Cody Barclay contacted me within a very short period of time and my husband and I decided to make the 2 hour trip to look at a used Jeep and boy are we happy we did! The vehicle was spotless and Cody and the gentleman at the dealership were very patient and attentive. They made sure everything went off without a hitch and we drove our Jeep home the same day. Thank you Cody, Craig and everyone else at Midstate that made our buying experience a pleasure. We will return!

name: Midstate Chrysler Dodge Jeep Ram
address: Midstate Chrysler Dodge Jeep Ram, 1365 US-302, Barre, VT 05641
category: ['Jeep dealer', 'Auto parts store', 'Auto repair shop', 'Car dealer', 'Car repair and maintenance', 'Chrysler dealer', 'Dodge dealer', 'Ram dealer', 'Truck dealer', 'Used car dealer']
text: I was in the market for a new all wheel or 4 wheel drive vehicle. Two I happen to be looking at were at Midstate. I sent a message on their website and Meghan Luther responded almost immediately. She emailed me a couple vehicles they had available and I headed over for a test drive. She met with me and we took the cars out. She was super knowledgable about both vehicles (a Hyundai and a Jeep). She also made sure to find out exactly what was important to me in a new vehicle. She made sure I understood all of the features as well. I appreciated the fact that she was clear and was able to anticipate many of my questions and concerns. After the test drives I chose which make and model I wanted (Jeep Compass) but the particular vehicle I test drove did not have all of the features I wanted. No problem, she looked and found three on the lot that did. We went and checked them out...we found the perfect vehicle for me. She gave me several options regarding financing and leasing. There was never any pressure, she made it quite clear the choice was mine in what I wanted to do. You don't find that with every sales person and every car dealership. I found that with Meghan and Midstate. I have bought many new and used vehicles and I must say my first experience with Meghan and Midstate was top notch. Fair, transparent and friendly. Even if you are not in the immediate area it is worth the drive.

name: Midstate Chrysler Dodge Jeep Ram
address: Midstate Chrysler Dodge Jeep Ram, 1365 US-302, Barre, VT 05641
category: ['Jeep dealer', 'Auto parts store', 'Auto repair shop', 'Car dealer', 'Car repair and maintenance', 'Chrysler dealer', 'Dodge dealer', 'Ram dealer', 'Truck dealer', 'Used car dealer']
text: Careful shopping here at Midstate Dodge. Car deal was ok, but one of the things I asked for was snow tires at the dealer cost. "sure thing" just call when you are ready. Sooooo.....I recently called....I can have them on sale price, but not for cost. ....buy a car here, but have a lawyer review your paperwork. getting everything in writing, signed in blood, notarized and ask your church to pray they will keep their word Sad.....3 cars in a row I bought from here, you would think I could trust them....now because of the dealer being cheap, I wont buy here again :( ...oh and I looked online for 235 65 17 snow tires....everything I found other places was cheaper (and good name brands) than the sale price of the snow tires at Midstate!!!!!

text: This restaurant, their owner and the waitress Misty are amazing. I deal with Special Needs people. We spent Thursday February 4 th touring the state of Vermont. My clients were starving. name: Smokey's Low n' Slow
address: Smokey's Low n' Slow, 7 Fayette Dr, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: We were so excited for this place to open, and I hate that I have to give this a 1 star review because we had high hopes for this restaurant . We got the restaurant around 6:45 pm on 6/14/ and there were 1 other large party and us a party of 6 and not many other people in the restaurant so it wasn't that busy for us to have the experience we did. We got seated and a guy took our drink order and then came back with enough time to let us decide what we wanted. ( good start right ?) We placed our order and he came back 15 min later saying there was no mac attack left, and that the table behind us had the last order... the party of 6 or maybe 7 had been sitting long before we had.. Don't you think the waiter would have known this prior to taking our order... So we chose something else, and then he came back and said they were out of the roasted cauliflower , but we didn't order it and it was the party of 2 next to us... Fast forward to when we got our food 8pm !!! Seriously an hour wait .... Never did our server ever check on us, and we tried to get his attention to get another drink not once but 3xs, and he ignored us. When we finally got our food one of our parties food didn't come with it so we had to flag someone down who wasn't our server to get this persons order, and also ask her for drink refills since our server never came over. It seemed like our waiter didn't want to be there.. Maybe there needs to be better communication with the waitstaff and kitchen when it comes to running out of food, and for it being a Friday night it seems like it would be weird to run out of food and to take an hour to get a meal.. I don't think we will be returning

name: Pizza Hut

I figured they were still figuring things out and decided to give them another chance.. 2nd time was a quiet night, no wait and the food and service was great. This last weekend, though, I had a reservation for 6 pm...and they didn't seat us until 7:15! The place was crazy noisy, too. I like the food, but I'm never going back there. If they can't honor a reservation, I can't plan the evening. Completely ruined our night.

text: I walked into this store to find not one but BOTH employees not wearing masks. I actually did a double-take because I couldn't believe what I was seeing. We're not talking "accidentally left it down around their neck" - there was no mask to be seen. I walked right back out and took my business elsewhere. I would recommend buying gas elsewhere until this station gets the message about basic decency during a pandemic; there are plenty of other options within a stone's throw. Anyone not wearing a mask or even just a face covering after nearly a year of knowing they're effective is just giving the finger to everyone who walks into their establishment.

name: Saint J Subaru
address: Saint J Subaru, 664 Memorial Dr, St Johnsbury, VT 05819
category: ['Subaru dealer', 'Auto parts store', 'Auto repair shop', 'Car dealer', 'Used car dealer']
text: This refers to the sales department, not service or parts. This is a nice store, clean and easy to get to, displayed well and an attractive showroom. I want to preface I am in the automotive business and have been for 20 plus years. With that, I train dealerships on sales products and understand the mentality of the majority of car dealers: get the customer in. I inquired about a used car I saw online via email. This stores process uses a BDC department (call center) that handles incoming sales calls and internet leads. Typically an inquiry will lead to an “auto responder” message. It simply fills in a template and the BDC agent fills in your name, his name and sends it back with a quick message inserted. It’s simple. My reply was missing several fields, such as the name of the person I was dealing with and other small details. No big deal; BDC agents are not paid much and they answer lots of leads so I was not expecting the red carpet treatment. After the auto reply, I got a phone call telling me the car was still available, it had a clean Auto Check or Carfax, and he invited me to come in. The next morning I showed my wife the car online and we made arrangements to drive up and see it. I called the person who left me a message and told him I could be there at midday. He told me the car was there, he would pull it up front and call me if anything changed as it takes me 40 minutes to get there and my wife took time off work. We arrived and the car was out front. The BDC agent came out to meet us and handed us over to a salesperson. The salesperson asked for our licenses and filled out a worksheet, which was sort of odd as all the information he asked was already on a sheet of paper from the BDC agent. Again, no big deal. So after our brief interview and giving him our licenses, he said he would get the keys and be right out. 5 minutes later he came back and said “sorry but we took a deposit on the car last night and it is being sold right now.” My issue with this is the BDC agent, or someone, had the opportunity to tell me this information beforehand, actually the night before and throughout the day. The internal policy they have is what I mentioned earlier: get the customer in no matter what. Their logic is that it would be easier for them to have this conversation with me while I was in the store in hopes I would just pick another car and not leave. I can tell you that this is not a good way to run a business. Yes, 1 out of maybe 15 people this may work on, but the other 14, I would estimate that at least half would not only not do business with them in the future, but they would also write a review and tell others their experience. If I was told we have a deposit on that car but if it falls through I can let you know, I certainly would be more inclined to consider this store in the future. I spoke with the GSM and explained I was in the business (they typically don’t care) and my frustration with how I was treated. He acknowledged their process is to get the customer in and worry about it when they are there. Prior to the internet and all the information the consumer has access to, I could sort of understand this thinking while not agreeing with it. But in this marketplace and the competiveness within the industry, he who treats the customer the best usually wins. St J Subaru does not share this mindset and because of this, I will not only not buy a car from them in the future, they actually put me off of going there again for the service on my Subaru. I prefer to be treated professionally and have someplace that recognizes my time and business is valuable.

name: Key Chevrolet Buick GMC Cadillac of South Burlington
address: Key Chevrolet Buick GMC Cadillac of South Burlington, 1675 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Chevrolet dealer', 'Buick dealer', 'Cadillac dealer', 'Car dealer', 'GMC dealer', 'Truck dealer', 'Used car dealer']
text: This was my first experience bringing my car to the dealership. Neither of my heated seats worked. While I was there the Service Adviser asked if I needed my wipers replaced. He asked if I needed the back one replaced as well. I asked if the rear one needed to be replaced even if I don't use it as much. he said it was a good idea to replace them all at the same time. I agreed and left my car for the day. I never heard all day any updates. I called once for information and so did my husband. Both times we had to leave a message. When my husband, after work , went to pick up the car they gave him the quote for the seats, and found out that we were charged for a piece that YOU broke. I could believe it. Everyone I told said "that's why you don't go to the dealer". I really would like my heated seats repaired but I will need to think twice. I know that the dealership was EXTREMELY busy and everyone seemed rushed. The service advisers were kind and professional. Thank you for your time.

name: Key Chevrolet Buick GMC Cadillac of South Burlington
address: Key Chevrolet Buick GMC Cadillac of South Burlington, 1675 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403

text: I have never had a problem at shearer, an the service dept. until this last service. I brought my truck in on a Friday for a recall issue and was told it may take up to 5 hr so I left it at the dealership. Well the issue was I never heard from anyone all day as to the status of my truck and I called multiple times and just got a automated message to call back during normal hours. I was able to finally leave a message and no one ever called me back that day. So I had no Idea the condition of my truck and it messed my family’s plans up for the whole weekend, late Saturday morning I received a call saying it was done and I could pick it up. When I called the dealership to have them possibly just put my keys in the truck so I could pick it up after hours, I was told “Well there is no one here to do that so no”. It sacs me to say that the customer service here is awful, because I came to Shearer for the customer service but it has been awful.

name: Key Chevrolet Buick GMC Cadillac of South Burlington
address: Key Chevrolet Buick GMC Cadillac of South Burlington, 1675 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Chevrolet dealer', 'Buick dealer', 'Cadillac dealer', 'Car dealer', 'GMC dealer', 'Truck dealer', 'Used car dealer']
text: I was contacted by text to meet with a salesman whom we had done prior business with. When I arrived they said that he wasn't in and brought out a different salesman who didn't seem to know or care why I was there. The appointment was set to appraise my current vehicle and see if they could get me into something new "at the same or lower price." I told the salesman what my goal was same price newer crew cab. He told me that they had 2 options. Both well more than my current terms, but I have a growing family and needed more room. I explained that my vehicle is essentially a mobile office. He proceeded to tell me about how this thing is loaded and has everything that I could need. I am not a negotiator so I assumed that this is the only vehicle on the lot that will fit my needs and I needed to get back to work we did the deal. One hour after delivery I realize that this "loaded" truck does not have XM radio which I need to run my business from the road. I am frustrated with myself and the salesman for not asking or disclosing this specific detail to me. I assume that I just can't find the XM, so I go on the Shearer website and find the they have about 90 crew cabs on the lot and most of them have XM, and many well below the price of the options I was given. So I call the dealership and leave a message for the salesman. While I am waiting to hear back I receive a generic email from him asking me to give them all great reviews and if I have anything other than great reviews to call them. I called 2 more times over the next day attempting to reach the salesman. on the third day I get another email asking me again to give them great reviews and to call if I had anything other than great things to say. This time I reached another salesperson who asked what the problem was, when I explained the situation he recommended that I go to Best Buy and buy a portable XM radio to install. This really upset me, as at first I was not told that the vehicle didn't have it, then am told that the fix is for me to go buy something else after just purchasing a $53000 truck. Now I decide that I am going over the salesman and going to deal directly with the General Manager who clearly would want to keep my business as this is the 3rd vehicle in 4 years that I have purchased from this dealership totaling roughly $150000 not counting all of the years of service on those vehicles. Apparently the General Manager returns calls just like the sales team. After never hearing back from the GM and growing more angry and frustrated by the day, I finally get a text from the salesman asking my to come in because he has a solution. When I go in his solution is for me to download an app to my phone and use my cell plan data to get XM through my phone. This sends me over the edge. I tell him that if they do not put an XM radio in the vehicle that I will never do business of any kind with Shearer Chevrolet ever again and will tell everyone who asks not to go to this dealership after the way I was treated. The salesman goes inside and calls the GM who tells him that they can install the XM radio which is a $450 job and only charge me $350. I will never do business with Shearer again and may never buy another GMC is this is how all dealerships treat customers.

name: Key Chevrolet Buick GMC Cadillac of South Burlington
address: Key Chevrolet Buick GMC Cadillac of South Burlington, 1675 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Chevrolet dealer', 'Buick dealer', 'Cadillac dealer', 'Car dealer', 'GMC dealer', 'Truck dealer', 'Used car dealer']
text: First impressions are everything... and this place sure didn't leave a good one. I called the service department to see how much they would charge to "trigger" the TPMS (Tire Pressure Monitoring System sensors) on my late-model vehicle (not purchased from here). I called the service department and the lady who answered seemed okay at first. She had no open appointments today, but said I could come in next Monday at 2 PM. I told her I'm starting a new job on Monday and asked her what the service department's hours were, and she immediately got very rude, saying "the hours of the service department are very different from the available appointment times". I explained to her that I simply wanted to know so I could get a rough idea of options. She said she'd make me an appointment for 2 PM, and I explained to her again that I don't think I can make that, and she said to call and cancel if I couldn't. This is where it gets worse... I asked her if she knew roughly how much it'd cost, and she said, "well, it'll be about the same as reprogramming a key... so $50 for the service, plus we charge $90/hr for labor, and it will take about 30 minutes". WHAT? $95? The tool to trigger the sensors costs $75 on Amazon, and it literally takes 5 minutes. You put the car into the training mode (easily done using the DIC buttons), and hold the tool next to the tire, press a button, and the horn chirps. Repeat the process for the other 3 wheels. A 4 year old could do it. I explained to the lady and she became very agitated, saying that this was the cost of the service and that was that. I told her no thanks and that I'm not interested. I understand that dealerships need to make money, but her attitude was an immediate turn-off. My car had other service needs, I was hoping the dealership would just take care of the TPMS sensors as a courtesy, but forget it. $95 for a 5-minute job that requires no "labor" other than walking around the car is just asinine. I'll buy the tool myself so I'm not paying $95 every time I switch my tires (which I do myself). If you want my advice, stay far away from this dealership. They won't have a positive attitude with you when you talk to them on the phone... and they clearly don't want your business.

name: Routhier Quick Lube & Auto Center
address: Routhier Quick Lube & Auto Center, 181 S Main St, Barre, VT 05641
category: ['Auto repair shop', 'Car detailing service', 'Car inspection station', 'Car repair and maintenance', 'Oil change service', 'Tire shop', 'Used car dealer', 'Wheel alignment service']
text: So I went there about 5-6 weeks ago for a oil change. Got there got right in.. As I'm waiting the owner came out and said that they had a mishap with my car. Explained to me that there is a new tech and when he went to back off the lift the front tire went off and broke my front bumper. I was glad he was truthful to me and told me. He said that they would fix it and that I would not have to pay for my oil change. They did do that. Well Thursday my car started to make a ticking noise (mind you I have owned my car for 2 years always had my oil change done and NEVER had a problem) so today we took it for a oil change.. We were told that there was only about 1/4 of a quart of oil left in my car and the oil filter was never but on tight. It had to be them they were the last ones to do a oil change and mind you that the oil change wasn't due for another 500 miles. We go every 3000-4000 miles for a oil change NOT once has anyone of came out to tell us the car was low on oil..except this time.. If we had not taken the car in today for a oil change ( not here either) the motor would have blown up.. And we would have been left with no car and a payment still. I believe if you have a new tech maybe you need to check there work. We have gone to Walmart in Woodsville for years and NEVER have had a problem... Sorry but I will never go there again and if I were you I wouldn't either...

name: Cyclewise Inc.
address: Cyclewise Inc., 130 Ethan Allen Hwy, New Haven, VT 05472
category: ['Motorcycle dealer', 'ATV dealer', 'Ducati dealer', 'Motorcycle repair shop', 'Store', 'Suzuki motorcycle dealer', 'Used motorcycle dealer']
text: Worst customer service I have experienced at a dealership, would not recommend. Had a flat tire on my FJ-09, recently moved to the area, decided to give this place a shot. Called them and told them specifically which tire I wanted, told me they had it in stock and I had them install it. During pick up I didn't look too much at the tire besides the fact it was the brand I wanted and not flat. Once getting home I inspected the bike and realized they had not installed the tire I had asked for. I then called Patrick in service at cyclewise and he instantly told me this was not something he could help me with and this was between me and one of the owners Tamara, he refused to offer any help in the matter. I then asked to speak with Tamara, who he said was busy, so I left a message. After no response I called the next day, was told Tamara was available and then left on hold for a half hour. Called two more times leaving a message both times, never got a call back. The whole experience came off as unprofessional and the staff immature, I will not be returning.

name: Chris Prushko Master Plumber

hours: [['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: We had 6 separate appointments (four of which they were late stating emergent calls and two no-shows). On Saturday 6/27/2020, I was told I was a priority 1, since my old on demand system croaked, but he didn’t show up until 4pm (texting me at 12:47pm stating he had an emergency call even though I was priority). They installed our on demand hot water system and I paid in full on 6/28/2020 thinking they were done, but they still have yet to come back to finish the PVC work outside and exposed insulation (picture shown). Also, we were to have an appointment on Thursday 7/16/2020 at 9am, which he no-showed, never contacted us until the next day, but read the message at 4:40pm that Thursday (picture shown). On Monday 7/20/2020, we called asking when he was going to finish his work and give us an invoice, at first he said I was breaking up, but called back and said he would be here Tuesday 7/21/2020 at 9am, but he no-showed (both calls were recorded)... and he still hasn’t responded. Lastly, they are withholding my invoice that I need from the install on 6/28/2020 that I need to submit to Vermont Gas for a rebate. They also knew at the time of install that I am looking at being furloughed in August. So, yes, I do not recommend this company.

name: Rutland Free Library

text: Closed to the public. I am a hard worker tax payer and I was denied acess on 4/27 at 1:30 pm.

name: Garvey Nissan
address: Garvey Nissan, 78 Rte 7b N, Clarendon, VT 05759
text: Bought my 2020 rogue there on 12/31/19 and had to resign finance papers 3 additional times because initials were in wrong places everytime and bank would send back. Last signing was on 2/6/20, made me lose a little faith in them. Then had to get my sensor recalibrated because I had to get windshield replaced. Called, they said they could do it, take a couple hrs. I live 1.5hr away so I had to get time off of work to do this. Got there and they said it might take more time, never offered me a courtesy vehicle. Was there for 4 hrs, right up until they closed, it was a Friday, told me they couldn't figure it out and had to wait for IT to call them back. Once I left all my sensor warning lights were on, which weren't on before. Called and left message that I was worried could they call back on Monday. No call Monday. Called them Tuesday, had to get called back and was told I could bring it in but would have to leave car there overnight and it would take several hours, so I would've had to take 1 to 2 more days off to do that. Ended up going to a different dealership took an hour and a half. This past Friday went there to get the rust, paint and fabric protection done. They left wax unbuffed all over my car. About 1/3 of my car still had wax on it and they got it all over the plastic trim. Called and talked to receptionist and was told it's easy to get off with a towel, but I paid for them to do it AND it doesn't come off of plastic that easily and I don't think she realized how MUCH was left on. Said she'd leave a message with GM, haven't heard from anyone yet. Really hope I can just go to a different dealership for all of my warranty stuff. Hate to complain but doesn't seem like they care anyways: /
