name: Middlebury Chevrolet
address: Middlebury Chevrolet, 510 US-7, Middlebury, VT 05753
category: ['Chevrolet dealer', 'Auto parts store', 'Auto repair shop', 'Car leasing service', 'Used car dealer']
text: I dropped off my Chevy Aveo at Shea Motors, Middlebury, VT, at 8 a.m. to have the A/C looked at; it was blowing warm air instead of cold. The Service Repair Shop did not notify me of an estimate of costs. Nevertheless, they proceeded to work on the A/C, without my consent. The very same day, around 4:30 p.m., I called the dealership to inquire about the status of my vehicle. I was not put through to the service consultant. Instead, the phone operator relayed that my car had been ready to be picked up since 12:45 p.m. I raced down to the garage right before they closed at 5 p.m. The service consultant insisted that he had tried to contact me, but my phone had gone directly to an "out of service" message. His story did not convince me in the least, as my phone had been on that day. Giving him the benefit of the doubt, he never tried to place a second phone call, which suggests some very suspicious activity on Shea Motors' part. One alleged call sufficed in their customer service department. It was left up to me, the paying consumer, to get in touch with them. I never succeeded in reaching the service technician via telephone; his secretary gave me the okay to come down and claim my car. The $200 odd-bill was completely excessive: $140 for labor, $70 for parts. I strongly recommend that one avoid Shea Motors in Middlebury, VT at all costs. I most definitely feel taken advantage of, and totally kept in the dark. The strange part is that I was sent into an isolated office to submit my payment. Money was never discussed between the Service Department and me. It gave me the impression I was being "shooed" away, so they wouldn’t have to witness my reaction to such an exorbitant bill. To any one that is considering taking his or her automobile to Shea Motors, think it over twice. Only later on did I discover another Google review about Shea Motors, which contained many of the same negative experiences: no notification whatsoever on Shea Motors' behalf, shady business/customer service practices, etc. In summation, take your automobile to a different garage. The Service Department will feed you every excuse in the book to make up for their numerous faults. I can declare, with the utmost conviction, that Shea Motors in Middlebury, VT will take advantage of the customer in the end. Never again will they receive my patronage. From now on, I’ll take my business elsewhere.

name: Twin City Subaru
address: Twin City Subaru, 142 Berlin Mall Rd, Berlin, VT 05602
category: ['Subaru dealer', 'Auto parts store', 'Auto repair shop', 'Used car dealer']
text: From the moment I sent a message to inquire about a used vehicle on the lot they had at Twin City, Paul provided stellar customer service. His communication was prompt both with email and phone calls. He was forthright with all questions asked about the fees included when purchasing. He was able to schedule me an appointment to come test drive the vehicle - the dealership is safe and sanitary and provide plenty of social distancing space for potential buyers. The purchasing process as been straight forward, honest and transparent. If you are in need of a new or used car reach out to Paul Walsh at Twin City Subaru. He has alleviated the stress involved in a car purchase and has made the process simple and smooth.

name: Twin City Subaru
address: Twin City Subaru, 142 Berlin Mall Rd, Berlin, VT 05602
category: ['Subaru dealer', 'Auto parts store', 'Auto repair shop', 'Used car dealer']
text: I brought my Subaru to Twin City Subaru due to a recall on my airbag that I needed fixed. They were the closest Subaru dealer to me. After picking my car up I noticed a large crack in my passenger side speaker cover. I didn’t notice until the next day. I called them and was told to come in. I went in and pictures were taken I was told I’d be called the next day after the guy spoke with his manager. I never heard back. I gave it two days. I was told once again that they’d have the manager call me. I waited a few more days, nothing. I called back not once but twice was put on “hold” just for the phone to be disconnected. I’ve called the manager directly and left a detailed message with my name and number...still nothing. I’ve given up at this point and I do not plan to ever bring my car back there. I spend a good amount of monthly on my car and I refuse to let more things get broken on my car with no explanations or plan to fix it for me.

name: Twin City Subaru
address: Twin City Subaru, 142 Berlin Mall Rd, Berlin, VT 05602
category: ['Subaru dealer', 'Auto parts store', 'Auto repair shop', 'Used car dealer']
text: Looking for recall repair?? I have just had a horrific experience at Twin City Subaru. I have a 2012 Impreza which I waited six months for my recall appointment, three of which the car was not driven. I understand that they are very busy in regards to these repairs. I was asked the morning I arrived for my long awaited appointment that I may need to reschedule because there were no loaner cars available. After I was told I would be pushed back out until December I simply asked if they could make some sort of loaner work or reimburse me for a rental. This was handled within a half hour of my arrival. I explained to the administrator I worked with that my car was being sold as soon as the recalls were performed and that my original plan of repairs was no longer valid. I requested a new battery and the recalls to be addressed. I had to follow up 4 times to figure out when I would need to drop the loaner back off. I was not rushed to receive my car but was concerned with the lack of flexibility in my schedule for a 2.5 hour round trip to come up last minute. My original quote was for 2 days. I dropped my vehicle off Thursday morning and I picked it up- Monday night. I would rather have it done right than rushed, plus I had a loaner in the meantime. I was told that my car was able to be pulled into the shop Monday around 12:30 and received notification that the vehicle would be ready to pick up that evening by 3. The same short notice scenario I was trying to avoid. There was work done that I did not ask for. After negotiating with Paul I was forced to pay for a portion of these charges for services I did not request. I left the dealership feeling taken advantage of but hopeful that the work that was done was done well. I noticed the smell of oil on the drive home and pulled over. By this time the service department was closed. After inspecting the car I have 2 new chips in my windshield, the a/c was left unhooked, partially drained and I did not receive a battery replacement. I came specifically to Twin City instead of Burlington Subaru because of reviews. As of right now I have nothing but horrific things to say about this outfit and my experience with their GM. I have never been so irate in my life. I am in the market for a 2018- 2019 vehicle but after the way I was treated I don't have any reason to purchase a vehicle from this establishment nor will I allow them to "fix" their mistakes.

name: Twin City Subaru
address: Twin City Subaru, 142 Berlin Mall Rd, Berlin, VT 05602
category: ['Subaru dealer', 'Auto parts store', 'Auto repair shop', 'Used car dealer']
text: I booked my car in for service weeks in advance. Using their website I had to enter a TON of information including VIN#, etc. After all that it said I would get a message confirming it. A day later I got an email saying a certain service manager would be contacting me soon. After a week I emailed back and got a response that someone would contact me soon. After another week I called and was told I was not on the schedule. Since it was for a weekday and I was planning to drive over an hour to get there, I'd already blocked the day out. I was told they were very sorry but this has been happening with others who used the online booking - so why are they keeping the online booking up? And rather than rescheduling on the spot, I was transferred to a service manager's voicemail. I left my name and number, but she never called back. They don't want my business? Fine.

name: Twin City Subaru
address: Twin City Subaru, 142 Berlin Mall Rd, Berlin, VT 05602
category: ['Subaru dealer', 'Auto parts store', 'Auto repair shop', 'Used car dealer']
text: I was in the market for a car for my mother and ended up leasing a 2021 Subaru Impreza. Sales guy was very personable and knowledgable. Go see Frankie Candido @Twin City for your next Subaru!

name: Mad River Taste Place
address: Mad River Taste Place, 89 Mad River Green, Waitsfield, VT 05673
text: On Saturday starting at 2 PM you get free samples of cheeses and apple cider’s. They are delicious. Prices are surprisingly reasonable and this is a wonderful cozy environment. I highly recommend to stop by if you are in town.

name: Gbg Indian Kitchen
address: Gbg Indian Kitchen, 471 Riverside Ave, Burlington, VT 05401
text: Haven't had the food yet... It might be good, but I will not eat here again until after the pandemic is sorted. They're terribly disorganized, the person at the counter didn't have a mask when I arrived. Eventually she did put one on, but kept pulling it down. Maybe the food is good... Maybe not... Regardless I just wouldn't feel comfortable or safe ordering from here again at this moment in time. Additionally... We ordered in advance and were sent a message saying our order would be ready at 4:45... It wasn't. It took a while to talk to someone and then was told it would be a bit longer. One other customer was also waiting and they had their food spread out. Not sure what the exact issue was, but there was a lot of confusion and uncertainty. All signs point to a lack of organization and attention to detail... Not what you want when ordering takeout during a pandemic. Update... Don't eat here. Employee at the counter was not wearing appropriate protection while handling food. At first no mask... Then wearing a mask but pulled down., Additionally, their pickup system is terrible. No one's food was ready when they said and this lead to everyone waiting for food to be clustered together in close proximity inside an enclosed building. PS... The fact that enough time has passed for me to post an update and I still don't have my food should be sign enough you shouldn't eat here. Update... The food was very good. I hope they can figure out a better system for takeaway, and that their staff realize that wearing a mask is a necessity these days and shows that they respect their customers and care about their safety and health.

name: The Men's Room
address: The Men's Room, 106 Main St, Burlington, VT 05401
text: Disastrous experience. I went in at 2 pm and asked if they accept walk ins. They said yes. I made appt for 3pm for beard trim and hair cut. When I showed up the female barber was flustered saying that she couldn’t do a shampoo or a beard trim because of her next appointment. I asked her if she was stressed and she exclaimed yes. Afger she spent 2 minutes trimming my beard line with no razor. She checked me out. I told her I wanted to leave because she was not relaxing nor was the experience. I thought an expensive men’s salon would be a nice treat but I was wrong. Just because they charge a lot of money does not mean they have great barbers or management.

name: Soulfully Good Cafe
address: Soulfully Good Cafe, 67 Central St, Woodstock, VT 05091
text: Really upset with my experience here today. I got there at 11 am and ordered an iced latte and pastry. Noticed the place was empty except for a family of three who were getting breakfast, so I sat at one of the many open tables. I was sitting down with my laptop for maybe 5 minutes, when the cashier walked over to me and asked me to move to the couches because she couldn't have me "occupying the four-top when it's busy." The place was basically empty. I was upset at this request, but moved because I didn't want to cause a scene. I stayed to finish my pastry. When I left, the place was still empty except for two women who were chatting at one of the tables. I left to go to Mont Vert Cafe just down the street and got food and worked there instead. When I drove past Soulfully Good, on my way home (around 2 pm), it was just as empty. When I have been at Soulfully Good in the past, I have stayed for 3 hours and usually ordered a drink or two, a pastry, and a lunch sandwich. I use my own hotspot to work. I'm new to the area, so I was careful to see if people worked at this cafe or if it was a dining-only place. I had seen a college student only get coffee and work there for 2-3 hours. I had seen an older man take a virtual zoom meeting where he was learning French. He was there before I came and was still there when I left, so he was there will over 3 hours too. This was on a much busier day than today. Had it been actually been busy and seating was limited, I would have understood the cashier's request, and gladly moved or left immediately. But given how empty it was and how others had not been asked to move before, this exchange was quiet upsetting and embarrassing. While the pastries and sandwiches are good, needless to say, I will not be returning to this place. For those who want a more welcoming experience with equally good food and drinks, I recommend Mont Vert Cafe down the street.

name: Creek House Diner
address: Creek House Diner, 1837 River St, Jct of Rte 12 & 107, Bethel, VT 05032
text: Great food, excellent service. Very busy on Sunday night at 7 pm, luckily they are open until 8pm. Great comfort dinners, Salsbury Steak,w/real mashed potatoes, Zucchini & Summer Squash with life left in them! The waitress was all by herself but handled the full house very well. Definitely going back, so glad they reopened after the fire last Winter. Well worth the wait. Also had Liver&Onions, Mashed Potatoes and veggies, Super!

name: The Meltdown
address: The Meltdown, 83 Washington St, Barre, VT 05641
text: It’s been a while since I’ve left a review for a restaurant because I hate leaving bad reviews and I’ve been very disappointed lately. That streak of bad luck has officially ended at The Meltdown. We ordered: The Philly, The Margarita, The Classic and the poutine. Even after my 17 minute drive home, my family was all very pleased with the meal. The Philly was delicious and they didn’t, at all, skimp on the meat, which was of good quality and taste. The Margarita tasted like a wonderful bruschetta in sandwich form and the garlic aioli on both added a welcomed flavor addition. The Classic was about as good of a grilled cheese that I’ve ever had and the maple dipping sauce was a uniquely Vermont surprise that was delightful. The poutine was also very good, even after the drive, which is rare. I ordered over the phone and the gentleman was very patient and kind. Upon my arrival, I was impressed with the indoor cleanliness and ambiance. Everyone was very helpful and enthusiastic and my food was ready right when they said it would be. In my case, at 5:00 pm on a Sunday, it took 25-30 minutes for my order which tells me that they are making everything fresh and to order. Overall, I’m very happy with our choice tonight and we’ll certainly be going back. Thanks for the great food, Meltdown crew!

name: The Spot
address: The Spot, 210 Shelburne Rd, Burlington, VT 05401
category: ['Eclectic restaurant', 'Bar', 'Fast food restaurant', 'Takeout Restaurant', 'Restaurant', 'Salad shop', 'Sandwich shop']
text: OMG, great food, delightful menu, great place to bring visitors to impress them--get there early to beat the locals! Breakfast till 3 pm!

name: Eastwood Animal Clinic
address: Eastwood Animal Clinic, 298 US-4, Rutland, VT 05701
text: Our dog needed emergency care while we were at a campground 45 minutes from Rutland. Dr. Bruce saw us at 8 PM, instantly made the correct diagnosis and instituted appropriate care. He is the very definition of excellent, compassionate patient care. Same goes for his staff. He is one of the best vets we have seen in the 40 years we have had canine family members.

name: Mad River Veterinary Service
address: Mad River Veterinary Service, 637 Mill Brook Rd Bldg A, Waitsfield, VT 05673
text: I’m very disappointed to have to leave this review after such a spectrum of experience with Mad River Vet & Boarding. While visiting the area, we used their services to board our dog while skiing on a Saturday and Sunday at Sugarbush. Saturday was a great experience – our dog was walked and care for wonderfully. However, on Sunday we coordinated a morning drop off and when we returned 5 hours later, found our dog had not been check-in on, had his pen area tightened because a gate came loose, and had been sitting in his poop during the visit because he wasn’t taken for a walk. Evidently the Boarding team only visits the pets at 8:30am and 4:30pm on Sundays. The team at Mad River Vet & Boarding was responsive the next day when we called to find out what happened but hearing a “we told you this on the phone”… nothing in writing or on the website was very disheartening and gaslighting. Advertising “first rate care” and only visiting animals twice with an 8 hour span in between doesn’t match. It’s also worth noting that there was no “boarding” number to call, so we left a message confirming drop off with the main line, which appears to be ignored on Sundays. For this group to say that “your pets’ health and well-being are very important to [their] whole team and [they] take every possible measure to give your animals the care they deserve”, I hope serious consideration goes into how weekend boarding is treated moving forward.

name: Tops Friendly Markets
address: Tops Friendly Markets, 12 S Main St &, Norton Pl, Rutland, VT 05701
text: Was not too happy the last time I was in the store on 12 3 2019. The store stunk inside! It stunk bad! Plus, I thought the store was on the dirty side

name: Five Guys
address: Five Guys, 5 N Main St, Rutland, VT 05701
category: ['Hamburger restaurant', 'American restaurant', 'Fast food restaurant', 'Hot dog restaurant', 'Hot dog stand', 'Restaurant']
text: Poor follow up on mistake. I got a to go order in late March. One regular burger was missing the second patty and the other one was missing the onions. I sent a comment/complaint at the website (id 14505668), and eventually got a response apologizing and promising a gift card. No card after 3 weeks so I sent another message with my address just in case that was the problem. Got another response from district manager saying he would get right on it. That was over a month ago. Still no gift card. It’s not the gift card that disappoints me so much as the lack of commitment to make a situation right.

name: Vermont State House
address: Vermont State House, 115 State St, Montpelier, VT 05633
text: Not good treatment of m'ikmaq , Native american veterans and abeneki . wabanaki are also part romani. in 1991 -1996 I attended some state school scouting programs/ st Boy scout troop 111 in Brandon . and law enforcement explorer post 111 at brandon district court. They were also using indian scouting programs at industrial schools. They were for early forms of indian education in vermont. they were though the brandon state school ( supposedly for the feeble minded indians) Recently i learned about orange shirt day . it is a day for survivors of residential and industrial schools. a few Modern day industrial schools still exist to day such as job corps in vermont and maine

name: China City
address: China City, 654 VT-22A, Fair Haven, VT 05743
text: Says they are open Monday online. As of 6:30 PM they are not.

name: Hannaford Supermarket
address: Hannaford Supermarket, 456 S Barre Rd, Barre, VT 05641
text: Great selection, great produce better than price chopper, meat section is great, good prices freindly staff Stocks locals VT based bakery products, The higher end Cheese section could be better Never seen crack heads hanging out there like some people claim and I've been there at 5pm and 9-10 pm

name: Goss Dodge Chrysler Ram
address: Goss Dodge Chrysler Ram, 1485 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Dodge dealer', 'Auto body shop', 'Auto parts market', 'Auto repair shop', 'Car finance and loan company', 'Chrysler dealer', 'Jeep dealer', 'Ram dealer', 'Used car dealer']
text: I just bought a 2013 grand caravan from goss dodge in shelburne VT signed the sales agreement at6 pm on Halloween night and was home in time to take the kids trick or treating. Will Ferguson was the salesman absolutely awesome and not what you would expect from a salesman.at least not what I expected anyway. The whole sales team and service department were nothing short of miraculous. I can't say how refreshing it was to deal with the people here . I helped my mother in law buy a car at a dealership up the road and I can tell you I would rather pull my own teeth before going to the "competition" if you can call them that.it took less than 2 hours to get the car detailed,papers signed, and get me and my family back on the road. Amazing team work thank you guys

name: Goss Dodge Chrysler Ram
address: Goss Dodge Chrysler Ram, 1485 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Dodge dealer', 'Auto body shop', 'Auto parts market', 'Auto repair shop', 'Car finance and loan company', 'Chrysler dealer', 'Jeep dealer', 'Ram dealer', 'Used car dealer']
text: I bought my new Dodge Charger 1 month ago from Goss Dodge. I would like to say, I couldn’t be happier with my choice of vehicle, or the treatment I received from the dealership! My salesman was Ben Trevail. He guided me long distance from Boston with my purchase. He expedited the deal perfectly according to my schedule. He always took the time, patiences and care to make me feel assured, and welcome to hear from me. He even went the extra mile to message me the additional photos of the car I asked for. He is terrific! My boyfriend is so impressed with the Charger, that he is thinking of the Hellcat version! You know we’ll be calling on Ben Trevail again.

name: Shaw's
address: Shaw's, 127 VT Hwy 12s, Randolph, VT 05060
text: Don't go here between 4 and 6 pm. You will spend more time in line than you did shopping.

name: Keene Medical Products

text: Horrible service!! I wish I didn’t have to give any stars! I went in mid December to order a boot for my foot and was told it would be in within 5 days, never heard back from them. I emailed them and found out their email doesn’t even work so I called and left a message then got a call back with a message telling me the boot will be ordered and again expect it within 5 days and here I am still waiting way past 5 days. This place sucks don’t bother with them.

name: Rotisserie Restaurant
address: Rotisserie Restaurant, 1355 Williston Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: 0n 8-21-2016 @ 5 30 pm.. visiting burlington,vt and staying nearby - we stopped in for dinner. we were met with poor service ( we sat in the bar room area ). the 2 female wait staff saw us, and walked away- for @ 20 mins.. the bartender tried to help us, but was busy behind the bar. ordered prime rib , 10 mins later told the prime rib was sold out. i ordered the broiled scallops. we also had a seafood stew. when dinner came- i was given a prime rib. ( ?). it was quite salty, quite fatty, not very warm. the seafood stew was horrible. the server was told of the seafood stew, offered another dish- we refused, he did delete it from the bill. good c/s. overall - not a good experience. i would not return. the two females working the area returned @ 20 mins later to the bar/ pub area. good luck if you elect to try this place. august 2016. ids

name: Midas Auto Service Experts
address: Midas Auto Service Experts, 60 Midas Dr, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Auto repair shop', 'Auto body shop', 'Auto parts store', 'Brake shop', 'Car repair and maintenance', 'Oil change service', 'Small engine repair service', 'Tire shop', 'Transmission shop']
text: Darrin is a GREAT tech who helped me out BIG TIME. I'd like to thank him for dealing with my dramatic reactions in stride. You, sir, are a titan. There's a bit of a story here so buckle up (haha car puns): I got my car state inspected at midas 7/24/19. I was concerned about the tires, and my state inspection was due in a couple months so I though "hey, i'll just do it all in one go" cause scheduling around work is a bit nightmarish for me. I passed the inspection with flying colors aside from the tires, which I expected of course. No problem. I scheduled an appointment to have new winter tires stuck on 9/7/19. Everything worked out. BUT THEN, About a week later that Thursday, the oil light came on and there was some... substance... leaking from the under part of the car. I freaked out a little since I just had the oil changed 7/3/19 and so I called Midas. They werent open, so I left a message saying I'm just gonna drop it in the parking lot and I'll be there right when they open the next morning to have it looked at. I wanted to limit driving as much as possible. Used my partner's car to get to work. When I got to Midas on friday I told them the issue and they said they would look at it over the weekend. It was labor day weekend so I was totally comfortable picking it up tuesday. I was going camping in NH anyways! I got a call saturday from a tech, I believe it was Mark, who told me that he didn't find anything. He said the oil light was on and asked me if it was on when i dropped it off and I said yes. He said it's probably just a malfunction with the light because the oil level was fine and there were no leaks. I was relieved and they sent me home saying it really was nothing and implied that I overreacted. That's fair. I'm always a little paranoid about my car. It happens. I drove around in it all week, oil light blinking all the way. I figured I'd make a plan to fix that after the tires get replaced. My appointment for tires was finally here this past weekend! And LO AN BEHOLD! They put my car up on the lifter thingy and it WAS leaking after all. AND the oil levels were OVERFILLED. Hoo Boy. I wasn't mad. I just wanted some answers. How did this happen? Overfilled? How did extra oil manifest in my tank after I had it changed 7/3. I took action as soon as I noticed the oil light was on and I was sent home to drive with it like that..... I was also sent NO pictures of any of the inspection work they did that weekend.... Big Yikes, Midas. BUT LUCKILY! There was no damage to the engine. Darrin priced me out for a new oil switch and an oil change. On TOP of the new tires and tire change ($425). $585. I admit I misunderstood the price at first and thought it was $585 + $425 = $1010 and I REALLY had a panic attack. Sorry Darrin. I mean it. Then he explained that it was gonna be $585 TOTAL. Okay I can live with that!!! He even gave me a bit of a discount after the fact for my troubles of being jerked around the past week. With the tire disposal fee, I paid $535 total out the door. tires+tire change+oil change+oil switch and all the work. Pretty good I think!! TLDR: I knocked off a star from the stress of the oil light debacle, but over WONDERFUL service and good work on my car.

name: Cantina Di Gerardo
address: Cantina Di Gerardo, 378 Railroad St, St Johnsbury, VT 05819
text: DO NOT GO HERE. We went last year for dinner while we were staying in St. Johnsbury VT to visit the Great Vermont Corn Maze and other nearby attractions. We walked in and no one approached us. There was a cook in the back that looked right at us and said nothing. He turned around and just walked into the back. There were two tables with customers. We stood there for almost 10 minutes and still no one approached us so we left and went to another restaurant. We visited St. Johnsbury again recently and we decided to head into town for dinner. Anyone who has been to St. Johnsbury knows that it is a nice little town but there aren't a lot of options for restaurants. We didn't want pizza or Chinese or McDonalds so we weren't left with many options so we decided to give Cantina Di Gerardo another chance. We walked in and there were more people inside this time. There were five employees. Two cooks in the back and three women (hostess / servers) out front. One girl greeted us and said she would be right back. We stood there for 3 minutes. The other two woman looked at us and didn't say a word or even smile. The first girl that greeted us came back to us and said that they closed at 8pm and they didn't have any tables available and that we should leave and come back at 7:30 and maybe we might get seated. Yes she said "MAYBE." It was 7:10 pm at this point and there were at least 5 - 7 tables available. Who says that??? Why tell us we should leave and come back in 20 minutes??? Whynot just say that it will be about a 20 minute wait???? Before I left this review I read a lot of the reviews already left by different customers and after reading so many wonderful reviews I actually had to double check to see if this was the same restaurant we visited because it didn't sound like the same place but it was the same. I'm going to assume that the majority or all of these reviews were left by local residents and not by tourists. It's obvious that the owners and staff at Cantina Di Gerardo DO NOT like tourists. I am a clean cut, professional 45 year old white man and I eat out a lot and I have never ever had an experience like this anywhere before in my life. This is the first time in my life that I have been discriminated against. If you are traveling to St. Johnsbury VT for a weekend getaway etc and are looking for a restaurant to have dinner at DO NOT GO HERE. There are other restaurants in town with very friendly staff and are eager to serve you during your stay. They did this to the wrong person because what they don't know is that I operate a New England travel Facebook page that currently reaches over 500,000 people a week throughout all of New England and they will all here my story about my terrible experience at Cantina Di Gerardo. SHAME ON YOU!!!!

name: Burlington Subaru
address: Burlington Subaru, 351 Shelburne Rd, Burlington, VT 05401
category: ['Auto parts store', 'Auto repair shop', 'Oil change service', 'Subaru dealer', 'Used car dealer']
text: Purchased a new 2021 Outback. The car is great. Unfortuantely I didn't have a great experience at Burlington Subaru. The remote start on the vehicle did not work, so I called service the next morning and they took my message and told me the salesperson would give me call later that day to help. Never recieved that call. So the next day I emailed the salesperson, he told me that service would give me a call. Again, never recieved a call. So I called service again, explained the whole situation, they couldn't get a tech to help me troubleshoot it over the phone and asked me to bring the vehicle in. So I drove the 2+ hours to Burlington to get it serviced. After a couple hours of waiting, I was told they would keep the car, meaning I'd have to make the 4 hour round trip again to pick up the car when it was fixed. The car itself is great, the people are friendly and very helpful. Just unfortunately not a great experience there for me. Edit: Just as an update, the dealership offered to drive my vehicle up to me for the inconvience. It's a long drive, so I appreciate it. Hard to beat that, given the situation.

name: Burlington Subaru
address: Burlington Subaru, 351 Shelburne Rd, Burlington, VT 05401
category: ['Auto parts store', 'Auto repair shop', 'Oil change service', 'Subaru dealer', 'Used car dealer']
text: If I could give a zero start review I would. Purchased a used impreza with 50,000 miles from them in feb of 2018. Immediately after purchase I had to take it back 3 times in order to correct horrible shaking after driving over 50 MPH. Finally on the third visit, after waiting a while, they completed the alignment on my car. While walking out to my car to finally leave, I noticed someone had backed into something or someone else had backed into my car, large scuff in the middle of the rear bumper. After informing the staff of this, they let me know they were not accountable for anything that happens in the parking lot. I WAS ONLY THERE BECAUSE THEY DID NOT FIX THE ISSUE THE FIRST TWO TIMES. Fast forward to April 2019, barely a year past purchase. I begin to feel a binding/clunking noise after operating the car for longer than 30min at a time. Turns out that the middle differential/viscous coupler is shot and will need replacement, somewhere in the 600-1000+ range depending on the shop. The car now has only 64,000 miles on it. In less than 15,000 miles I am already running into a huge issue with the car. On top of that, I am also informed by my mechanic that while looking into this issue, that a small laundry list of other issues will need to be taken care of including but not limited to replacing rusting brake lines. In short, they sold me a ticking time bomb with a smile on their face. I do not have enough money to cover these continued issues (only reason I purchased a car with low miles was to avoid such issues) on top of the car payment. I called and left a message for the service manager explaining what had happened and hoping they could maybe help me out on the parts side (hoping they could at least let me pay factory cost without mark up). THEY NEVER RETURNED MY CALL. This place is a joke and they will not be receiving my business any further. To think that I planned on trading this car in and purchasing a new subaru from them in the next 2-3 years would be laughable if I wasn't so aggravated. Guess they don't need my money!

name: Burlington Subaru
address: Burlington Subaru, 351 Shelburne Rd, Burlington, VT 05401
category: ['Auto parts store', 'Auto repair shop', 'Oil change service', 'Subaru dealer', 'Used car dealer']
text: My recent service experience has been terrible. During a large service (it cost me about $1,800) they broke a non-critical part of my car. This was not brought up to me, I discovered it myself on my way home from the service appointment. They had forgotten to put a screw in and also broke off a plastic tab. They said they would order the part and let me know when it was in so I could bring my car back in to have it replaced. They estimated the part would arrive in 4 business days. After multiple phone calls and messages over the course of 2 weeks, I finally connected with someone who said the part hadn't been released by Subaru yet. 2 days later I got a phone call saying the part was in. I asked when I could bring my car in to have it replaced and he had to transfer me to another person. They said the best they could do was another 2 weeks out. I asked to speak to my service assistant because I was told I would be able to bring the car once the part was in. I was transferred to my service assistant and left another message. Another 4 business days go by and I haven't heard anything. I called again and was bounced around to a few different people and the "best" they could do was still a week and a half out. By the time I bring my car in again I'll have been driving around with this broken part in my car for over a month, with Burlington Subaru making zero effort to own and fix their mistake. They have been treating me in manner which screams "don't bother us, we don't care about your business nor our quality of work." In addition to this terrible customer service, how can I ever trust this service center again when they FORGOT to put a screw in. What if it was a critical component? What if I found out by means of a crash rather than pushing a button on my dash?

name: Enterprise Rent-A-Car

text: We needed a pick up for a car at a repair shop. Amazing we needed a 1 PM and it was 12:59. The rep was friendly courteous and showed me all that was needed for day use. Definitely will call them again if a rental is needed. The car was neat clean and ready to go.

name: Enterprise Rent-A-Car
address: Enterprise Rent-A-Car, 1891 Williston Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: The picking up process was great, I was happy the agent went over the features of the car and did a walk around prior to me taking the car. The system let me put in a return time of 2:00 PM on Sunday, even though that was after hours. I was very surprised when I received my e-bill to see an extra day charge. Since the car was not officially logged back in by Enterprise it was assumed I had the rental until Monday, though it was in your lot and keys in your drop box by the rental return time on contract. I forgot to ask and the agent did not mention what to do because my drop off time was after hours. We called the Enterprise office on Sunday and they said to bring it to the pick-up location and leave keys in drop box. I had to go to the office to correct extra day charge. The office did a great job of correcting and were very pleasant!! Gail

name: Panera Bread
address: Panera Bread, 62 Merchants Row, Williston, VT 05495
category: ['Cafe', 'Bakery', 'Breakfast restaurant', 'Caterer', 'Coffee shop', 'Delivery service', 'Takeout Restaurant', 'Salad shop', 'Sandwich shop', 'Soup restaurant']
text: My husband and I go to the Williston one quite often. It has always been great. Not this last time. We went Saturday, November 2nd and it was terrible. It was 6 pm and there were no baguettes, they stopped having root beer as a fountain soda option. There’s plenty of Pepsi options. The soup was hot on the top and cold on the bottom. The grilled cheese sandwich was cold and the cheese wasn’t even melty. My water had a hole in it and their solution was a cup instead of a new water. The meal was over $30 and we were very disappointed. I tried contacting Panera first and haven’t got a response. We will not go back anytime soon!

name: Eco Car Wash
address: Eco Car Wash, 530 US-7, Milton, VT 05468
text: We just stopped by to wash our 2020 GMC Sierra truck. Apparently this car wash isn’t set up to wash a truck complete. The water or brushes never made it past the rear tail light. Also it scratched the left side fender skirt. We are leasing this truck and will be responsible for any damage incurred by us. I would like to be able to send you pictures but it isn’t a option on this message. I do have pictures should you require seeing them. We stopped today at 15[40]45, 11-7-2920 Our approval number is 711124 Sequence number 123886 Don’t know if that helps or not. I would like for the person running or the owner to see the results from our wash today before it gets dirty again. We can be reached at 528-5697 Or e mail at bushey33@comcast.net Thanks for any information you can provide. LenBushey

name: Jessica's Restaurant at the Swift House Inn
address: Jessica's Restaurant at the Swift House Inn, 25 Stewart Ln, Middlebury, VT 05753
text: We had a reservation for 8 pm and were expecting a romantic dinner at the Inn. We were seated in the "library", a side room with an uncoordinated mix of second hand thrift store books, at a table in the far corner, with harsh lighting and no ambiance or music. We were the only couple in that room for the entire evening. When trying to select a bottle of wine, the somelier told us to go ahead and read the list that was on the table. In the meantime he went to the dining room and spoke at length to other couples about his recommendations and pairings to food options on the menu. Then the waitress entered and told us to put our masks back on even though we were the only couple in the room. On the porch and the main dining room nobody was required to wear their masks, this made us feel discriminated against. The crab and corn bisque was good and the fried green tomatoes were mostly breading and just laid flat on the plate without garnish and not arranged as you would expect at a high priced restaurant. The peanut pasta was drowning in butter and difficult to finish. I had asked for no peppers due to me being allergic to it, yet the chef made no effort to accommodate my wish and the plate was full of peppers. The waitress said "you can just pick them out". My wife ordered the vegetable stack which was delicious and made well, however it was accompanied with rice which was the wrong grain pairing, farro or polenta would have been a better compliment. When we were finished eating we were forgotten in the "library" and had to wait for 15 minutes to get the check and pay for our meal. Our experience was not that of a 5, 4 or even 3 star restaurant and I cannot recommend dining there.

name: Haircuts Plus
address: Haircuts Plus, 1260 Williston Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Hair salon', 'Barber shop', 'Beauty salon', 'Waxing hair removal service']
text: Had an appointment at 2:00 pm. Stylist refused to take me after arriving at 2:03. She was cutting another customers hair while also answering phone calls and said she had a 2:15 and would be unable to cut my hair until 4:30. Had a wedding to go to that day. Highly disappointing experience when it is usually a solid place.

name: Peak Performance Ski Shop
address: Peak Performance Ski Shop, 2808 Killington Rd, Killington, VT 05751
category: ['Ski shop', 'Clothing store', 'Ski rental service', 'Sporting goods store']
text: This shop is top notch in every way. I have only been there in person a few times but I still order all of my race skis and whatever else I can from them. I recently placed an online order for goggles and SL poles. I had contacted them via email prior to placing the order to make sure my account was set up correctly to receive racer discounts. The response from Fred was blazing fast. Side note: I called the shop a few years ago asking for an opinion on GS skis and Fred helped me pick out the perfect setup over the phone. I placed my order on a Sunday morning, MLK weekend no less. Within an hour I had gotten a message from Mary to let me know that they had just sold out of the goggles and to see if I still wanted the poles and the 2 day shipping I had requested. I called back and we adjusted the order. Poles arrived today. Great selection, tons of knowledge and exemplary customer service from anyone I have dealt with.

name: Shaw's
address: Shaw's, 27 Mad River Canoe Rd, Waitsfield, VT 05673
text: Friendly staff, but comparatively expensive to other grocery stores and always always always a long line at checkout. "Sales" sometimes feature "Buy X number of items" to get the sale price, one time it was buy 20 small containers of sour cream to get the special price. Visually and layout needs to be updated to the 21st century - it's straight outta '88. Oh, and the tomatoes (and rest of the produce section) are usually overpriced and janky. Another personal favorite is when the store alarm randomly goes off while standing in the checkout line, which seems to happen quite frequently during the 5 PM rush.

name: Upper Valley Haven
address: Upper Valley Haven, 713 Hartford Ave., White River Junction, VT 05001
text: Very helpful. Resourceful. Food in your stomache in the cafe . Morning, noon and then grab a food shelf from the pantry. Warming shelter starts usually in November 5:30 pm to 6am you sleep on cots, provided dinner, snacks drinks.. such a lovely place.

name: Mooselook Diner
address: Mooselook Diner, 1058 Main St, Concord, VT 05824
category: ['Restaurant', 'American restaurant', 'Breakfast restaurant', 'Brunch restaurant', 'Diner', 'Down home cooking restaurant', 'Family restaurant', 'Lunch restaurant']
text: Beware if you're a senior couple: We were seated next to the cash register - the only twosome seating we could see. Waitresses etc spent lots of time at the cash register within a foot of my 82 yo husband's face while he ate. Glad Moose Look is open and trying, but it sure isn't what we fans of yore were expecting in terms of friendliness (say Hello before you ask if we have a reservation); service (don't forget the soup); or menu (no senior menu til 4 pm). We wish them well but we recognize it ain't what it was. Sad.

name: 371 Restaurant
address: 371 Restaurant, 371 River St, Springfield, VT 05156
text: We are from out of state, we have been in Sprigfield before but we didn't get to try this place before until last night. We had a hard time finding the place because they turned off all the outdoor lights and sign lights! The review site said they are open until 10 pm and when we got there it was 8:30 and the manager said they were closing at 9:30. We ordered and got our food fairly fast. I had a small tuna grinder with parmasian cheese (toasted) and it was delicious, I had already had a bowl of clam chowder and it was quite good. But that was the end of the good. My BFF ordered a Greek salad which was good but her eggplant parmasian was nasty. It was getting late so she just sent the entre' back and she ate half of my delicious grinder. When we were paying and getting ready to leave the manager came up and said that she had tasted the entre' (wierd) and said it tasted fine and that she makes good eggplant parmasian. Well she may but this one wasn't good, it tasted old and had a funky odor. Manager was very confrontatial about it. All while this was going on, my daughter, also in town from out of state told me they had ordered food from there to be delivered to our hotel and it took 3 hours to get their food. My daughter and her 2 kids were starved and quite upset about the delay! Not a good night at the 371!

name: 371 Restaurant
address: 371 Restaurant, 371 River St, Springfield, VT 05156
text: There delivery is slower than I could walk . I ordered at 5 pm an its 805pm and still NO food at all .

name: Verizon Authorized Retailer - Russell Cellular
address: Verizon Authorized Retailer - Russell Cellular, 242 River St, Springfield, VT 05156
text: Terrible way to do business. Door says Open Monday-Saturday 10-7.came in at 5:15 and the show room lights are on, handwritten sign on the door says knock if no one opens door. Door locked due to Covid. We knocked no one answered . I googled the number it rings you get a voicemail telling you to leave a message. The mailbox is full! This is why I will remain a US Cellular customer.

name: Verizon Authorized Retailer - Russell Cellular
address: Verizon Authorized Retailer - Russell Cellular, 242 River St, Springfield, VT 05156
text: I do not normally leave bad reviews, but this has been one of the worst experiences I have ever had. I was trying to get a phone for my elderly mother, was talked into upgrading my phone to get a buy one get one and to transfer to a business account, as a business account was supposed to save us money. By transferring, we lost the buy one and ended up paying more. When trying to get this fixed I had to call numerous times to get any information. I called yesterday and made an appointment to meet in person at their office for today. However, when I arrived I found the place locked up and dark. When I called their number it rang multiple times and then went to voicemail that was full and subsequently would not allow a message to be left. I would definitely not go there again, nor would I recommend them to anyone. In further web searching it is clear that similar service has happened at other Russell Cellular locations.

name: HB Energy Solutions
address: HB Energy Solutions, 132 Bridge St, Springfield, VT 05156
category: ['HVAC contractor', 'Air conditioning contractor', 'Air conditioning repair service', 'Electrician', 'Fireplace store', 'Furnace repair service', 'Heating oil supplier', 'Plumber', 'Solar energy equipment supplier']
hours: [['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: I had a meeting on May 21 with Brian Hernon from HB Energy Solutions concerning A/C upgrades at my business. Brian did an inspection of the building and indicated that he would be in touch in 2-3 days by email with an estimate and a couple of working ideas for solutions for my shop. I hadn’t received any information by May 27th, so I gave him a call to see where we were in the process knowing that Memorial Day weekend could have slowed things down. There was a bad connection so I asked Brian to give me a call back. He said he would that afternoon. I never heard from him. On Thursday, May 28th, I called again with no answer and left a message and received no call back. On Friday, May 29th I called Brian again and he indicated that he was on the road but he had some information worked up and would send it to me via email. I received no information. On Tuesday, June 2nd I still had heard nothing so I called Brian again, again he indicated that he would email me the estimates that afternoon and follow up with a phone call to discuss options. No email came. No phone call came. On Wed, June 3rd I called Brian once more and left a message asking if he could please call me and give me some sort of indication of the estimate, or if not let me know that it would be better to look elsewhere. I received no call back so I called the HB Energy Solutions office and explained the events up to that point and asked if someone could find out if there was an issue or get me the estimate information. I cannot remember the name of the individual I spoke with, but she said that she would check into it and get right back to me. I received no call and no email. On Thursday, June 4th I called Brian once more and left a message indicating that I no longer wanted their estimates and that I didn’t wish for them to contact me any further. Today, Friday, June 5th, Brian called my shop to speak to me (I wasn’t in) and asked for my email to send the info. It’s 9:25pm, I still haven’t received the info. The monumental lack of communication and lack of professionalism displayed by this company makes me wonder how they continue to stay in business. Certainly businesses become busy and follow-ups can fall through the cracks, but for a potential customer to have to maintain that level of persistence to even get an email or phone estimate is astounding, particularly when I STILL haven’t received anything. I recommend looking elsewhere for your HVAC needs.

name: Cajun's Snack Bar
address: Cajun's Snack Bar, 1594 VT-100, Lowell, VT 05847
text: Please update Google services with the correct hours. Here Monday May 6th at 5:00 pm. Been here for20 mins. Phone is ringing non stop and you have had atleast 25 cars pull in. Thank you St

name: Sports Odyssey
address: Sports Odyssey, 238 VT-100, West Dover, VT 05356
text: I’m not one to write bad reviews but in this case it is deserved... we have been to this store several times over the past few years for various ski equipment and have had a decent experience. We recently went to rent skis for our children on a Friday and were helped by a friendly staff who recommended we rent for 1 day since the weather was iffy for our second day of skiing and that we should keep an eye on the weather and return their skis by 8:00 PM the following day if we decided to only ski the one day. Saturday night my husband went to the store to return the skis at 7:20 PM and found that it was completely dark and closed. I checked the website (which said it was open until 8:00) and tried calling to see if anyone was still there... no answer. The next morning my husband went back to the store first thing at 7:30 AM to return the skis and was told that we would be charged for 2 day’s because the rental was due back by 6:00 PM. He explained that we were told to have them back by 8:00 PM and their worker said their policy was 6:00 PM so there was nothing they could do. My husband asked to speak to a manager and they called the owner. When my husband explained the situation to the owner, he said that their policy was clearly stated on the paperwork but when he told him that his workers told us 8:00 PM his comment was that he knew this because he was there when they said it!!! He also said that even though they closed early at 7:00, it would have given us an hour grace period to return the skis. My husband explained to him that we have shopped at this store many times in the past but with this experience he would not be seeing his face again. The owner’s reply was “We don’t want to see your face again”. We are beyond shocked by the way an owner would treat his customers. Clearly he could care less about customer service and is only looking to collect your money. Do yourself a favor and keep driving. There are several other ski shops in the area that are more deserving of your business!

name: Dollar Car Rental
address: Dollar Car Rental, 1200 Airport Dr, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: i will never rent from you on 3/7/2021 at 7;10 pm the lady at the counter was so nasty to me when i turned the car back she was nice to her co worker the car was trashed i was so un happy with my rental i thank that was so rude my kids and the person behind me seen how rude she was to me i really thank this should be address this issue as soon as possible

name: Stratton Adventures
address: Stratton Adventures, Sun Bowl Rd, Stratton, VT 05360
category: ['Recreational vehicle rental agency', 'ATV rental service', 'Paintball center']
text: PAINTBALL: So much fun. Make sure your group is ready for what they're getting into and grabs the day by the horns. Layer up. We got after it and had an absolute blast. The refs were great, the course felt like we were defending our lives in the New England wilderness with huts, barrels, tires and fallen trees to hide from our enemies. Couldn't have had a better time - the water/gatorade & fast replenishment of paint were a great touch. The vibes here are unbeatable. BOOKING: First touch with Stratton Adventure was super easy, with a great booking staff (April!) to assure our group was in good hands. The text message communication kept things incredibly quick & smooth.

name: Revolution Kitchen
address: Revolution Kitchen, 9 Center St, Burlington, VT 05401
text: I haven't eaten in your restuarant yet .. i am headed there now. Yes! I am pre-rating it. You are the only restaurant in Vermont to serve vegetables after 7 pm and your one bad review was obviously a fluke, jeesh, what a load of bs she was! #provemeright @revolutionkitchen

name: Myers Container Services Corp
address: Myers Container Services Corp, 218 Red Can Dr, Colchester, VT 05446
text: After being with Meyers for 13 years I cancelled them. My CC expired and they needed a new CC expiration date on file. They claim that my voice mailbox was full so I never received a message so the decided to charge an extra 10 dollar....and they will not even give that back after I updated my card. So they rather see a loyal customer leave then keeping my business over 10$..... BTW my decision was also based on the response of the lady on the phone she is extremely rude, not helpful and unprofessional, but I have seen more comments about that as well

name: Myers Container Services Corp
address: Myers Container Services Corp, 218 Red Can Dr, Colchester, VT 05446
text: Terrible customer service. Canceled my pick up because a payment was not by the tenth. Bill was not even postmarked until the tenth and then received on the 14th. Was told they would check on the problem and would call me back. Have still not heard from them. Even left message with the son of the owner.

name: Preston’s Pizza
address: Preston’s Pizza, 291 Pleasant St, Chester, VT 05143
text: We've been twice. The first time waitstaff was very rude. First one star review I've ever done. The second, we drove 45 minutes for lunch based on their website and Google hours. I tried to call ahead but the message said they might have phone/internet issues so to come order takeout in person. Showed up, closed. Someone came out to say "we open at 4". I replied they should really update their hours on Google and website, he rudely replied he would pass that along to the manager. The food is good, but not worth the inconvenience and rudeness. Won't be back.

name: Burger King
address: Burger King, 2729 N Main St, Rutland, VT 05701
text: Clean, friendly are the two things I would call this BK. Whopper with cheese was a tad below par as the burger wasn't hot enough to melt the cheese a little. My kids didn't like the chicken tenders and fries as they were cold with a funny taste. My onion rings were toasty and delicious. Not bad for 1 pm on a Sunday.

name: Burger King
address: Burger King, 2729 N Main St, Rutland, VT 05701
text: Too close to closing time for me, I guess. It was 8:45 pm, 15 mins before the place closed. I'm the ONLY one there in the lobby besides the couple already eating. 3-4 employees all seen me & none helped me the whole ten minutes I waited. I walked out. Later. This is why I don't like small town fast food joints.

name: Harbor View General Store
address: Harbor View General Store, 33 E Creek Dr, Castleton, VT 05735
text: Went for a quick gone Today, noticed sign says closed at 2 pm. Ice cream side was still open and was excellent even though the shape was off a bit. Lol. All good. Very friendly individuals which I believe we're the owners. They're only getting started and playing with hours to see what they need to have for open hours. I highly recommend !!!!! Thank you again for being open late.

name: Advance Auto Parts
address: Advance Auto Parts, 861 Williston Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Auto parts store', 'Car accessories store', 'Car battery store', 'Tool rental service', 'Truck accessories store']
text: Hours wrong only open till 6 pm

name: Hatchet
address: Hatchet, 30 Bridge St, Richmond, VT 05477
text: A restaurant with a focus on the decor, atmosphere, and beer selection while not delivering on two important products: simple, flavorful food and customer service. My party and I went to Hatchet in May, 2016 for a 5:00 PM dinner. We were expecting a "uncomplicated and down-to-earth" meal as advertised on the restaurant's website. The prices were on the higher side for a simple menu, but when a restaurant can pull off such an advertisement successfully, then such prices can be justified. Unfortunately, the meal we had was something most customers can replicate at home with a run to the grocery store, fryer, butter, salt, and pepper. $8 for roasted cauliflower, $11 for a summer salad, $13 for 3 tiny tacos... The flavors were uninspired and my guest and I left feeling the same. We would return to play a rowdy game of shuffle board or chug some beers, but not to enjoy a nice meal with family and friends. To cap the experience off, the waitress (who was very nice) ran two of my party's credit cards twice. A look at our credit card statements showed the error, which would have otherwise gone unnoticed. We promptly called the restaurant and left several messages with the staff, but our calls were never returned. Running out of options, we revisited the restaurant to speak with a manager. We spoke to Gabriel Firman, the owner, who assured us he would take care of the matter the next day and would give us a call (stating he was too busy, yet nobody was in the restaurant at the time - just opened). Three days went by, the charge remained, and we never received a call from Gabriel. Being persistent, we finally spoke with Gabriel on the phone. It took three weeks for our funds to be returned. A look at the owner's condescending responses here in the previous reviews shows what kind of management can be found at this establishment. There are better options in the town and a few miles away.

name: Two Brothers Tavern
address: Two Brothers Tavern, 86 Main St, Middlebury, VT 05753
text: Food was alright. I had a salad. But service was quite slow although there wasn't a big crowd in there after 2 pm. Took them about 40 minutes to serve us our order. So.. I guess an advice is to go there only if you are not in a hurry:)

name: Two Brothers Tavern
address: Two Brothers Tavern, 86 Main St, Middlebury, VT 05753
text: (Translated by Google) They have Gluten Free options! The food was fine, and they have many gluten-free options. The waiters are friendly and the place is curious. A celiac can eat well here. The richest dishes are from 5:00 pm, but there are several options of sandwiches with gluten-free bread. The best thing is the chocolate mus, the Gluten Free dessert but very good, although you have to ask for it special without gluten and without cream! (Original) ¡Tienen opciones Gluten Free! La comida estaba bien, y tienen muchas opciones sin gluten. Los camareros son amables y el sitio es curioso. Un celíaco puede comer bien aquí. Los platos más ricos son a partir de las 17:00h, pero hay varias opciones de sandwiches con pan sin gluten. ¡Lo mejor es la mus de chocolate, el postre Gluten Free pero muy bueno, aunque hay que pedirlo especial sin gluten y sin nata!

name: McDonald's
address: McDonald's, 1332 US Rte 302, Barre, VT 05641
category: ['Fast food restaurant', 'Breakfast restaurant', 'Coffee shop', 'Hamburger restaurant', 'Restaurant', 'Sandwich shop']
text: Closed the whole town went black in all store at 8:11 pm

name: McDonald's
address: McDonald's, 1332 US Rte 302, Barre, VT 05641
category: ['Fast food restaurant', 'Breakfast restaurant', 'Coffee shop', 'Hamburger restaurant', 'Restaurant', 'Sandwich shop']
text: Slow service inside. Lots of flies flying around. They skipped my order to give a employee food. Worker had his hands all over large cup and then put back,tried to give it to me. Food all over kitchen floors. Was there just before 9:00 pm.

name: Our House Bistro
address: Our House Bistro, 36 Main St # 1, Winooski, VT 05404
text: Stoped by at 1:30 pm and was received very coldly by a lady that just wanted to go home. Told me only brunch menu. No mac and cheese and asked do you still wanna stay. She had in her face don't stay. And then she says they close at 2 and reopen at 3. So the unwelcomed face was there... We had just driven from Montreal and so wanted that mac and cheese. Never going back for sure...

name: Our House Bistro
address: Our House Bistro, 36 Main St # 1, Winooski, VT 05404
text: Outside the front door is a list of the specials. When you walk in the restaurant there is a list of their weekly specials. When you sit down at the table there is a list of the weekly specials. When you order from the list of weekly specials you were told that you are not allowed to order from those until after 3 PM on weekends. A year or two ago it was impossible to get a table but now there is plenty of room in the restaurant. At the end of the day the staff could not have cared less. If you were happy or unhappy it did not make a difference to the wait staff that we encountered.

name: The Great Northern
address: The Great Northern, 716 Pine St, Burlington, VT 05401
text: My wife and I were passing through town and picked The Great Northern based on google reviews. We stopped in for a late lunch at ~ 3:00 PM. They were serving their menu b/w lunch and dinner. We were disappointed with the quality and price. I ordered the chicken sandwich. The bottom of the bun was soaked in the runny sandwich sauce and was pretty much goo. My sandwich was luck warm at best. My wife had the hamburger which was not much larger than a slider but carried the price of a full sized burger. The decor was very modern and it looked like a fun place to hang out. We wondered if we had stopped during the "normal" dinning times if our experience would have been better.

name: The Uncommon Market
address: The Uncommon Market, 1 School St, Montpelier, VT 05602
text: Closing at 8 PM is inconvenient. I always thought corner convenience stores were supposed to be... you know? Convenient? During the summer they close before the sun even sets. Seems a bit ridiculous to me. I want to give this place my business but I can't because they aren't open late enough.

name: Grunts Move Junk
address: Grunts Move Junk, 122 Morse Dr #3, Milton, VT 05468
text: These gentlemen know their jobs and are fantastic! More than 5 Stars! Showed up right on time, took a walk inside the house as I told them what was going, what was staying – that took just a few minutes, and there was a lot of stuff. They worked hand-in-hand like a well-oiled machine, so I was surprised when they said they hadn’t worked on the same jobs together before. This was a household move from one state to another (3.5 hour drive one way). Showed up at 8 AM to load the truck and were finished unloading at the other end by 2 pm. If I ever have to make a move again (and I hope not!), Grunts Move Junk are the guys for the job hands down. Making a move? Call the Grunts! The cost is more than reasonable. It’s the best money I ever spent.

name: Grunts Move Junk
address: Grunts Move Junk, 122 Morse Dr #3, Milton, VT 05468
text: 111000000% recommend. Up front cost information. Quality customer service behind the scenes. Awesome and professional teams that show up.

name: Grunts Move Junk
address: Grunts Move Junk, 122 Morse Dr #3, Milton, VT 05468
text: Grunts need to stay away from packing moving trucks. We were upfront at what was going to be loaded. My husband had already left for NC the day the Grunts came and loaded the truck. Same exsperiance as the other move posted. They loaded the box of moving blankets after I had seperated them from the other boxes in the garage. The trailer was equipted with drop down shelves, which I had already pulled down 3 and loaded some delicate items on. They disregarded any suggestions that I made. They would remind me that they do this all of the time. Maybe if the one in charge wasn't on his cell the entire time worried about another job he could of been more effective on exacuting this one. We are re'tired USMC and moved with 3 children all of there stuff in a 23 ft truck and never left anything behind. Was to be 4 hours turned out to be 7 hours.The one in charge constantly complaining when he thought that I wasn't aware of it. 5 pm they were ready to leave represented me with an $800. Bill $300 more than what was quoted. I questioned it and I was charged 700. I wish I could down load picture. It was a mess, the only thing I kept hearing you have a box that can't have anything stacked on it. Remember the shelves that pulled down. My brand new wash machine turned on it's side on top of a TV cabinet, water dripping out of it onto the cabinet. We do not have cheap stuff never the less our property was disregarded and handle very poorly.There's more they left me with a poorly loaded truck which my concerns were disregarded even when I called and explained that the trailer was being picked up early in the morning and it's wasn't packed correctly several items weren't loaded. First I took pictures then my friend and I pulled out the mess off the truck to get to the wash machine that was dripping all over our tv cabinet I will put a brand name to this cabinet the ladies will understand my pain Broyhill tapistry which is pretty much all of our collection. I called Grunts several times to get them back and they wouldn't return my calls. Our daughter called one of her friends to help me unload the trailer and reload it. I am 5 ft under 100lbs and in my 50's. Our daughter's friend left school early which was over 30 miles away at 730 at night to come help me. When she seen what I was left with she called the owner ASAP and sent him the pictures that I had taken. That's when a crew came back and tried to reload the truck again, I had suggested reloading the entire truck since we had 3 pieces that wasn't loaded and since the back was a mess nothing pointed to the rest of the truck being loaded correctly of course I was disregarded. I even had pulled down more shelves before they arrived to help guide them. There was one of the loaders that did make a comment on the trailer he liked the set up. The back of the trailer did get reloaded with disregard of our property. The mattress had slipped out of the plastic and now an $1800. Destroyed the dryer was stacked on top of the wash machine (glass top) destroyed the glass didn't shatter brand new. Antique roll top desk that has servided many moves huge scratches down the drawers which I pointed the scratches out to the original loaders. We still left items behind. My advice to you is when a 20 year VET is telling you how to load a large piece listen to them. If any time this review has a request to review pics of the mess I Will be happy to share.

name: Snowfire Auto
address: Snowfire Auto, 100 US-2, Waterbury Village Historic District, VT 05676
text: I brought my new car to them for the first time last year. It was during covid so I had to write out a note with what I wanted done, which was mount and balance the rims and tires I had in the trunk of my car but to not install them on the car since I did not have the correct lug nuts yet for the winter wheels. When I picked up the car (after hours) I saw that they had dismounted my brand new OEM wheels and installed the snow tires on them. So instead of having 2 functional sets of wheels, I now have my winter tires on my OEM wheels and my summer tire not mounted at all. I checked the bill to see what the service writer had requested and they had correctly interpreted my instructions. So I figured it was just an honest mistake made by the tire tech and I could pretty easily have it corrected. I called them a few times in the next couple days trying to get through to them and left a message that they didn't follow up on. When I finally did get them on the phone they were initially very understanding and said that they would correct the mistake but that they were very busy at the time and they were hesitant to schedule an appointment since they were so backed up. I figured since at least had my snow tires on that I could wait a couple months and schedule something then. Ever since then they have either not answered the phone or said they were too backed up to schedule an appointment. Most recently I called and explained the whole story again and then asked when I could schedule an appointment, they said they really weren’t taking any new appointments and said “it sounds like you might want to call around to some other shops”. No... I wanted you guys to correct your mistake and I shouldn’t have to beg and yell for you to fix it. I’ll never take my car there again and I would never recommend them to anyone. Mistakes happen but it is how you handle them that shows your true nature.

name: City Market Onion River Co-op
address: City Market Onion River Co-op, 207 Flynn Ave, Burlington, VT 05401
text: Same store, same products, not as crowded, wider aisles but lost the cache of the original store. Better parking. Not happy at all that you can't get a sandwich after 2 PM. Getting the premade sandwiches is not the same.
