name: Pizza Hut
address: Pizza Hut, 207 Northside Dr, Bennington, VT 05201
text: The restaurant was very clean! Not a single fly in the place and in this heat, that's amazing! $17 and some change for myself and my daughters to have lunch (all you can eat salad bar and pizza) buffet! The help was amazing, very kind and sweet and very thoughtful to the point where our waitress even sent us out with courtesy cups of ice water and lemon which was what we had with lunch. Lunch buffet goes from 11:30 am to 1:30 pm. Best deal in town!!!

name: Shearer VW of South Burlington
address: Shearer VW of South Burlington, 1030 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Volkswagen dealer', 'Car dealer', 'Car finance and loan company', 'Truck dealer', 'Used car dealer', 'Used truck dealer']
text: My very first car was a 1967 Vw bu g. I recently purchased a 2013 Vw bug/convertible from Shearer VW. I asked a friend who works at a dealership close by to connect me with someone that can help me with my purchase. He gave me Chris O’Connells number at VW and said he’ll take care of you. When I reached out to Chris he already had my name and knew what I was interested in. Chris was happy to help me. Chris has owned many VWs and was able to answer all my questions about that year and model bug.. He took his time familiarizing me with my new vehicle. Helped me with my trade in and really went the extra mile to make sure all my needs were met during this process. He is very personable, knowledgeable, and genuinely friendly. He let me know I could call him with any questions or help anytime. Whenever I left a message he always returned my calls immediately. It was truly a pleasure to work with Chris at Vw Shearer.

name: Shearer VW of South Burlington
address: Shearer VW of South Burlington, 1030 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Volkswagen dealer', 'Car dealer', 'Car finance and loan company', 'Truck dealer', 'Used car dealer', 'Used truck dealer']
text: Had 9 am appt for service and was told it would take “a couple hours”. Car was not ready until after 1 pm. They also did not notice that my inspection had expired. Therefore I needed to take it elsewhere to have that done

name: Shearer VW of South Burlington
address: Shearer VW of South Burlington, 1030 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Volkswagen dealer', 'Car dealer', 'Car finance and loan company', 'Truck dealer', 'Used car dealer', 'Used truck dealer']
text: This was my first experience with the sales department and I have to say I was blown away with their customer service; most notably my sales woman Kristin. My car was about to be paid off and after browsing vehicles locally, I decided to hang onto it rather than upgrade. However, the car had other plans. After discovering my car required service dept. in a loaner car and in tears. Not long after arriving to work, I received a text from Kristin asking if I still planned on keeping my car or trading it in. Talk about perfect timing! I had expressed interest in a 2015 Passat a couple weeks before, but I never followed up. She made me an incredible offer on it. Unfortunately, I was on the first 12 hour shift of 3 at the hospital and wouldn't be able to make it into the dealership until Tuesday at the earliest. Having worked at the hospital before, she understood my scheduling dilemma and OFFERED to take the loaner back and drop off the Passat I wanted in the parking garage to test drive for the weekend! Talk about service! I came out of my shift to my future new car waiting for me :-) Did I mention all of this was done via text message too!? I fell in love with the car (obviously) and I was sold. Went into the dealership on Wednesday to sign the paperwork and finally meet Kristin. She was just as sweet and bubbly in person. My mom had to sign some paperwork for the old car but she lives in Newport. She offered to take the day off of work to drive down and finalize things. NOPE. Kristin drove the 2 hours to Newport the next day and brought the paperwork right to my moms doorstep! After my mom tried to feed her dinner and sent her off with homemade cookies, she turned around and came right back to Burlington. Kristin turned an incredibly stressful situation for me into such a fun and unique experience. She made me (and my mom) feel so special. I would HIGHLY recommend Shearer VW to anyone looking to buy a new or used car. You won't be disappointed.

name: Shearer VW of South Burlington
address: Shearer VW of South Burlington, 1030 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Volkswagen dealer', 'Car dealer', 'Car finance and loan company', 'Truck dealer', 'Used car dealer', 'Used truck dealer']
text: This place is amazing one of the best car buying experiences of my life. Krystin@shearervw was so helpful in the sales process it truly made it effortless. At no point did i feel i was being led in any direction i wasn’t comfortable with and even when i was unsure about a decision at no poi t did i feel pressure from Krystin or any other member of the sales team. Since my purchase Krystin has continued to help me coordinate all of my automotive related concerns in a quick and timely manner. ( well beyond her responsibilities as a salesperson ) I will definitely be contacting Krystin and Shearer VW first for my next vehicle and plan on referring them to everyone i know. It is rare in this buisness to feel this comfortable with a dealership and because of that i plan on sending my business here for years to come!

name: Freedom Nissan of South Burlington
address: Freedom Nissan of South Burlington, 1095 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: My experience with Freedom Nissan and my sales person. Christie Villa was a hoot.went in at 1230 pm and drove away with a new used vehicle in less than 3 hours. Would recommend anyone wanting a great deal and personable help into a new vehicle, remember Freedom Nissan their there to help. Thank You Christie

name: Freedom Nissan of South Burlington
address: Freedom Nissan of South Burlington, 1095 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: Called to schedule an appointment. Sat on hold (my choice) for 15 min. Then asked to have a call back before they went home. No one called that day or the next 2 days. Called again and the person answering the phone did a good job. She said she'd give them the message and she followed up with me 2 hours later. Still no call from service. Not even over the next week. Followed up one more time. The got me in ...not the best experience on the phone but your tech did a good job trying to do best by me to fix my headlight issue and I appreciated that.

name: Freedom Nissan of South Burlington
address: Freedom Nissan of South Burlington, 1095 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: Update: We did hear from Mort. He had left a message on my husband's phone and sent me an email for follow up. I was too quick to post a negative rating. This was the first time I'm 3 years we had a bad experience with customer service. Mort has taken steps to fix the situation from happening again in the future. We are very satisfied with Freedom Nissan and we will indeed be going back. They certainly do take care of their customers. We left our number for a call for the manager, no one called.

name: Freedom Nissan of South Burlington
address: Freedom Nissan of South Burlington, 1095 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: 2017 June, I have visited Freedom Nissan Burlington to find out how much my car worth. At 2016 summer I bought Nissan Quest 2014 from them, Freedom Nissan with $20 K I paid. In this visit, the lady was not in charge as far as I understood and she was working like a messenger to the owner's room to her cubicle. And directing his (owners) question to me, such as how much I want, I do not know how much my car worth after a year, and was really not nice this kind of communication. Since this treatment to her and to me is unacceptable, I was talking with manager via her as a postman. And later she said, he will pay your Nissan Quest $9K, that means, get the hell out of here, message. I wanted to talk him in person, he came with an attitude, I told him you should not treat your customer like this, this is not nice, he said to me "I am the customer now, you are the seller now, I don't want to buy your car", and repeated this several time, and said "there are bunch of Nissan Quest out there, to be sold", I got frozen, that moment, I understood whom I am dealing with. Last year when I was there I was a customer and did not behave like that. Such a customer experience was really made me upset. Nissan is over, this is my last Nissan. People are not deserved such a treatment, and also Nissan should not let this kind of people represent them, even this could be owner of that institution.

name: Freedom Nissan of South Burlington
address: Freedom Nissan of South Burlington, 1095 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: Absolutely sickening, a crooked dealer and a shady operation. I only gave them one star because I couldn't post without a rating, and there isn't a Zero. From the ownership down, there is a total lack of professionalism and integrity (as was noted in a previous review). They talked us into an extended warranty on a used Honda, with the caveat that if we did not use it before it expired, we were eligible for a full refund of the $2300+ cost. After jumping through all of the hoops to get the refund, the dealer told us "I've never heard of such a thing"!!! Yet, we have the original contract that EXPLICITLY STATES the whole process and promises. Now, the dealer is refusing to give us the refund we are owed, instead telling us he will give us $2000 off if we buy another car!! Are you kidding me??? Why on earth would ANYONE buy another car from these dishonest people just to get SCREWED again?? Well guess what Mr Freedom Nissan owner, i guess we'll just have to see you in court with our official warranty contract in hand, THAT WAS SIGNED BY YOUR REPRESENTATIVE. UPDATE 12/1/16 – one might notice that this dealership posted a response the day after I put up my one-star review. Notice also the words “I would like to remedy this issue for you”, “Please reach out to me at 802-846-3757”, and “Sincerely, Amber Kaplan, Owner Loyalty Manager at Freedom Nissan”. Well I did reach out to her. I called her the same day. Lo and behold, just like the false sentiment behind her response, the phone number was FAKE! Yes, that’s right…it was someone’s FAX number (call it yourself; you’ll get an earful of squealing like I did)! After calling the dealership directly and navigating through their excruciating phone system and directory, I finally reached Amber Kaplan (notice the last name, it’s the same as the president of Freedom Nissan…there’s a clue to the rest of this story). She pleasantly took my information and promised to call me back “within an hour”. Well guess what…after 8 days without a response I had to call her again and I left a message to call me. I did the same thing on days 9 and 10. Finally, today she called and basically said ”There is nothing we can do for you; it’s out of our hands”. And then had the audacity to say that THEY were in the same boat as WE are! Excuse me, YOU aren’t out $2,250, WE ARE. Well I beg to disagree with that response. There IS something they can do, but they just WON’T because of greed and indifference to their customers needs. Don't tell me that a car dealership can't afford $2250, they made much more than that on the original $30K sale (plus the $2250 warranty). And I wrote the check out to Freedom Nissan, not a third party. But once you have signed those papers, you are on your own. Caveat Emptor.

name: Dunkin'
address: Dunkin', Irving Gas Station, 5190 US-5, Westminster, VT 05158
category: ['Coffee shop', 'Bagel shop', 'Bakery', 'Breakfast restaurant', 'Donut shop', 'Fast food restaurant', 'Takeout Restaurant']
text: I go there nearly every evening, get the same things every time...Robert saves out my multigrain bagel and butternut donut in the morning, so if they run out during the day, I'll still get mine. And Stan, who works in the evenings always has my order ready for me. He even remembers my second favorite donut in case there are no butternut ones...is a french driller. Then there is Jason, who also always makes sure my order is set aside for me. And all the staff is friendly and efficient. I have on- the-go ordering, which is Great! The one thing that I wish were different is the closing time. They're only open til nine though the convenience store is open till eleven. Wish it were open at least until ten pm.

name: Best-Dressed Laundry
address: Best-Dressed Laundry, 112 Rockingham St, Bellows Falls, VT 05101
text: Nice clean laundry mat. The owner has books available to read. They have a drink machine inside. Restroom available. This place is next door to a gas station if you needed to grab something real quick and come right back for whatever reason...maybe just to waste a few minutes or grab a coffee or just gas up. If you are in need of a laundry mat Definitely check this one out. They close at 10 pm on the dot. If you don't finish in time you gotta go.

name: Dunkin'
address: Dunkin', 195 Main St, Ludlow, VT 05149
category: ['Coffee shop', 'Bagel shop', 'Bakery', 'Breakfast restaurant', 'Donut shop', 'Fast food restaurant', 'Takeout Restaurant']
text: It’s ridiculous stores closing at 7 pm .

name: Marigold Kitchen Pizza
address: Marigold Kitchen Pizza, 25 Main St, North Bennington, VT 05257
text: We were here in December, and we came during a Friday lunch (it is only open for lunch hours on Fridays and Saturdays, only dinner hours for the remaining weekdays). The chef/waiter/DJ was nice and discrete with a great taste in music :)! The place was empty at 3 PM, so there was no wait whatsoever for our meal. The pizza was excellent and very different (we suggest the delicious "Vermont" crust)! This is your go-to pizza place for locavores, vegetarians, vegans, and organic-lovers. There is even a gluten-free crust. Tasty for everyone!

name: Willie's Village Auto
address: Willie's Village Auto, 100 Weeks Hill Rd, Stowe, VT 05672
text: Great service! We brought our car in at 8 AM on a Friday with a flat. Willie’s ordered us a spare tire which arrived at 2:30 PM and they had us back on the road by 3. Highly recommend Willie’s if you have any issues while in Stowe.

name: Petco
address: Petco, 168 Ames Dr, Barre, VT 05641
category: ['Pet supply store', 'Bird shop', 'Fish store', 'Pet store', 'Reptile store', 'Tropical fish store']
text: I have called 5 times today to try and get an appointment for tomorrow as Barre is the closest location and it is still an hour drive from my home. I finally called the customer service line as the groomers would answer after the fifth time and they told me to leave a message. Now i understand if your busy not answering but seriously they could have at least answered my quick question.

name: Lamoille Valley Chevrolet
address: Lamoille Valley Chevrolet, 868 VT-15, Hyde Park, VT 05655
text: My recent experience with the Service area was, in a word, phenomenal. We were visiting from out-of-state when the Mt Mansfield Toll Road proved to be too much for the transmission in our 2014 Traverse. With the car stuck in first gear on Route 108, we pulled over and made a call to Lamoille Chevy. It was already getting late on a Friday afternoon, so we feared that we would be "up the creek without a paddle" till Monday. Our roadside call was handled by Monica in the Service Area, and from that moment forward she and the Service staff provided the very best of service and support. We limped into the dealership about 3:00 pm where we were immediately greeted and the car was promptly brought into a service bay and diagnosed. Once we learned that there would be no quick fix, Monica jumped in with help to locate a rental car and then when that proved untenable, we were offered a free demo vehicle for the weekend. We opted for a GM factory rebuilt transmission, which needed to be shipped in from Texas. Once the repair was completed (in less than a week), the Service folks again went above and beyond and delivered the vehicle back to our home in NY. We immediately took the Traverse on a 700 mile road trip to attend a wedding. The transmission worked flawlessly. A big THANK YOU to Monica and the Service staff - definitely 5 stars...

name: Stowe Laundry Co.
address: Stowe Laundry Co., 44 Park Pl, Stowe, VT 05672
text: Distasteful customer service for my first visit there ,how would I be aware that the staff needs two hours to close ?They need to specify their hours better . I paid an uber to get there knowing that they said they close at 5:00 pm but the last wash was at 3:00 pm. Yet the hours state 8:00 am- 5:00 pm. I'm furious because I work really hard and I don't make that much to be paying for rides twice when it could have been only been once.

name: Porkys Place & Backyard BBQ
address: Porkys Place & Backyard BBQ, 7404 Ethan Allen Hwy, New Haven, VT 05472
text: Arrived about 2:30 pm on a Thursday, sign by road said Breakfast Lunch & Dinner, sign on the door sounded like they only did takeout, went in anyway, no ribs left, one other couple in Restaurant, I ordered Bacon Cheese Burger and fries, took longer to get than I'd have thought, fries were overdone, burger tasted gamey, bottle water was a mini bottle from Costco. Meal was server in a plastic basket lined with paper. During checkout System went down 3 times, after 10 minutes we gave up, and I left with the info that it would probably show up on my account later. Folks need to pick up their game. It's a restaurant not a food truck anymore.

name: Pizza Hut
address: Pizza Hut, 1009 Memorial Dr, St Johnsbury, VT 05819
text: We arrived here at 8 pm they close at 10 pm we were the only customer in the place the food was great and the service was good as well.

name: Union Baptist Church
address: Union Baptist Church, 932 US-5, Waterford, VT 05819
text: Great Church, Friendly People. An Independent Baptist Church. Great Sermons. I highly recommend coming here. They also have a youth group for 12 & up that meet from 4:00 pm - 6:00 pm on Sunday. Same as a Children's Youth group. They have Game Night once a Month for anyone to attend as well, and all are welcome. Sunday School is from 9:00 am - 10:00 am. Church Services start at 10:00 am and go to 11:30 - 12:00 am.

name: Lyndonville House of Pizza
address: Lyndonville House of Pizza, 93 Main St, Lyndonville, VT 05851
category: ['Fast food restaurant', 'Italian restaurant', 'Takeout Restaurant', 'Pizza restaurant', 'Sandwich shop']
text: I called at 9:30 pm to place an order as their website says they were open until 10pm and the phone rang but nobody would pick up. So I waited 3 minutes to tried again to only get it to be busy. It preceded to be busy until 10:00 pm when they were ‘closed’. Disappointed.

name: Electronic Hospital
address: Electronic Hospital, 258 Shunpike Rd, Williston, VT 05495
category: ['Appliance repair service', 'Audio visual equipment repair service', 'Electronics repair shop', 'Electronics store', 'Microwave oven repair service', 'Refrigerator repair service', 'Small appliance repair service', 'Television repair service', 'Video duplication service', 'Washer & dryer repair service']
text: New Dishwasher, wouldnt work. Was told by Samsung, my appointment was a certain day. Didnt hear anything from them. Called at 4:45 pm the day before. Oppps you are not on our list. Guess it will be another day. Not good customer service. Service guy came out said he didnt see anything wrong with the machine. First full cycle...leaked all over. having the whole machine replaced by Samsung.. So much for nothing wrong with it..

name: Orkin
address: Orkin, 446 Avenue D Ste 20, Williston, VT 05495
text: Chris the technician was very friendly and competent, once we actually connected. The scheduling side for this home visit was poor, however. I first had an appointment for between 2:00 and 4:00 on a certain date. When the technician hadn't shown up by 4:30, I called the Orkin office, only to find that the appointment had been canceled, with no notice to me. I rescheduled for another date and was told that the appointment needed to be late in the day, between 4:00 and 6:00, so my wife and I planned our availability around that time window. At 4:00 on that date, a message was left on my office phone saying they had been trying for hours to contact us, even dropping by the house (my wife happened to be home at the time, so not sure how the technician missed her). The message said that the technician was now at the end of his day and would need to reschedule if he couldn't get in soon. This voicemail message was the first to be left that day on any of my three phones (office, home, or cell), and, as you will note, was left at what I had been told was the _earliest_ time I should expect the technician. Furthermore, I would not even have been in the office at that time because I was supposed to be waiting at home. Luckily we did connect with the technician, but I was not impressed by the way the Orkin office managed our appointments.

name: Dunkin'
address: Dunkin', 100 Rt 131 In Sunoco Gas Station, Ascutney, VT 05030
category: ['Coffee shop', 'Bagel shop', 'Bakery', 'Breakfast restaurant', 'Donut shop', 'Fast food restaurant', 'Takeout Restaurant']
text: Girl working was out in parking lot hanging with friends.... No sandwiches or just wouldn't make one, coffee old, muffins and donuts old. Asked questions and got.....totally and without and explanation...no, no as if that was her only vocabulary. Nothing worse for a business than a useless employee at 8:00 pm when you want to get a pick me up on a road trip. That's my second try here... won't go back. Management take note

name: Safelite AutoGlass
address: Safelite AutoGlass, 669 N Main St, White River Junction, VT 05001
text: Price was significantly higher than @Portland Glass which is maybe a mile away.

name: Three Needs
address: Three Needs, 185 Pearl St, Burlington, VT 05401
text: Enjoyed the crispy crust $1 slice pizza special (i think served only between 4-5 pm). Creative vegetarian calzone options include ingredients like beets, carmelized onions and kale. Open atmosphere with pool tables, music played at a decent volume, plus card and board games to relax with friends.

name: Snap's Restaurant
address: Snap's Restaurant, 24 Main St, Bristol, VT 05443
text: Good food, breakfast until 2 pm and reasonable prices

name: Snowflake Chocolates
address: Snowflake Chocolates, 81 VT-15, Jericho, VT 05465
text: Always the best!!! McKenna deserves a raise and promotion to promotions dept!!! HappyHalloween!!! With Great Cheer&Respect for all @SnowflakeChocolates!!!

name: UVM Medical Center Family Medicine - Milton
address: UVM Medical Center Family Medicine - Milton, 28 Centre Dr, Milton, VT 05468
text: If you're even bitten by a tick that has been confirmed to have Lyme disease by a facility that tests ticks for Lyme, don't go here. They will do absolutely nothing. Sorry, I didn't mean nothing. They'll ignore you, they'll be really short, have an attitude and want to get off the phone as quick as possible, cut you off while you're talking to them and leave you frustrated and pissed off. On top of that, it's impossible to talk to an actual doctor. You have to call and talk to a receptionist, who will then talk to a nurse, who is supposed to talk to the doctor, who will tell the nurse what to say and then the nurse is supposed to call you back. I called at 10:00 am and didn't hear back from the nurse until I called 2 more times and then it was at 5:30 pm that I finally heard from them. This place has the worst customer service I've ever seen! If there was a way to take away stars in the rating, I would take all of them. They deserve less than nothing. I'll be searching for a new doctor and I strongly recommend that you find somewhere else to go. Unless you like to be miserable. Do yourself a favor and drive the extra miles to anywhere else. Even the sketchy shack in the middle of the cemetery with the guy that the local kids call "The Ax Murderer" would be a better option. He'd probably listen. Ugh, in order to post this I have to give a star. Just note that this star counts as the most negative star that a star can be!

name: Milton Diner
address: Milton Diner, 514 US-7, Milton, VT 05468
text: Had a local delivery and checked out for breakfast came up quickly. Lots of parking staff friendly and polite helpful I took the special of the day sunrise special with ham and home fries really good tasty I enjoyed a lot. The Diner while I was there has a great flow of locals that had meet up there was certainly a very interesting breakfast. Yes would recommend to anyone it’s a diner good home prepared food. Prices are very reasonable and they are open 7 days a week from early to 8 pm.

name: AT&T Store
address: AT&T Store, 213 Swanton Rd, St. Albans Town, VT 05478
text: **Update** The day after I wrote this review the "store manager" John Burke, called me. He said they were issuing a $700 credit. 10 weeks has passed since and nothing. So, it appears he only called to troll me for writing the negative review. "Store manager" John Burke, instead of trolling your previous customers and surfing the internet during work hours maybe train your employees, oversee things at the store, and provide a respectable service. My wife and I went into this location last November to ask about the FirstNet program. We were met by Alissa. She told us a bit about the program. My concern was that we were Verizon customers and had bought new phones within the past 6 months and had a payoff of $1,000 still left on them. She told us that if we signed up with AT&T and traded in our phones with them we would both get $700 each over 30 months, which would pay off our phones. We were also told as new customers with AT&T we would qualify for new phones with them and receive the reduced rates of $5 and $4 per month for each phone. Great deal I thought. Then she added if you do autopay your bill would also be reduced by $10 per month. Even better. I asked for copies of all deals we would receive. She took our Verizon phones, submitted the paperwork for the trade in reimbursements, then issued the new AT&T phones. She said you will see the credits applied on your accounts over the next 2 billing cycles. We paid off the Verizon phones, which was $1,076. After 3 cycles we received notice from AT&T that we were not eligible for the trade in credit. We called AT&T and they said we had to address the issue with the store as you can't "piggy back" offers. Something I knew nothing about. I called the store and talked to Alissa. She asked for some info, to include my account password so she could go into my account. She then said she would call me back. After a week and no call back we went into the store and asked for the manager. We were greeted by Todd who refused to get a manger and asked to assist himself. After 20 minutes of explanation with him he finally requested a manger. We were finally allowed to speak with John Burke - Retail Store Manager. At first we explained what we were told by Alissa when signing up and what had happened. He defended his employee, of course, stating she's been doing this awhile I cant believe she wouldn't know how it works. We then showed all receipts, paperwork we received and a deeper explanation was given to him. Specifically if we weren't entitled to the trade in why did she apply for them. She applied from the store. We didn't. The final confirming point was when he called her over and told her what happened and she once again stated yes we are entitled to all that she offered and why weren't we getting the promo's and trade ins. At that point John the manager dismissed her and was at a loss for words. I said you see she just said the exact same thing again. All he could do was say I believe you now, but what can I do. I'm just a store manager. I asked that he give us what was offered or at least a part of it. He said it wasn't up to him and would have to run it up the chain to his superiors and that he would call us on Monday with an answer, that was on a Saturday. A week went by with no response. I called left a voice message on his personal cellphone. He did not reply. I called a week later, left a message and received no reply. After 2 months, numerous calls and messages he has not replied. I suggest you avoid this store. If they are not willfully giving misinformation and basically stealing your phones then they are wholly incompetent in their own policies and promos which ultimately cost me over a thousand dollars and will and most likely has hurt others.

name: Table 24
address: Table 24, 24 Wales St, Rutland, VT 05701
text: nice restaurant, we appeared to have perfect timing. soon after we sat it got crowded again. 2 pm for lunch

name: Table 24
address: Table 24, 24 Wales St, Rutland, VT 05701
text: This is such a cute little place. Traveling from CT we stopped around 730 pm on a Saturday and were seated right away. Tastefully decorated, great menu and drink specials. Waiter was very nice and attentive. Had the beer cheese dip for an app- it was different, but delicious! We both ordered the Shepard's pie for an entree, It was SO GOOD made with chicken such a fun twist on it. We parked on the street and had a short walk to the door. Great experience.

name: J.A.S. Auto Body
address: J.A.S. Auto Body, 1193 VT-14, White River Junction, VT 05001
text: These other good posts must be from employees or friends. I don't know anyone who has had a good experience here. I took my care here because Geico uses them for repairs. My car was dropped off on Friday for repairs to start on Monday. It was "guaranteed" to be ready Wednesday. It wasn't finished, so it was promised to be really done on Thursday, it wasn't. they left a message saying it was totally going to be ready Friday instead. I called them back, talked to a manager who was a rude prick, and argued with me and raised his voice, and didn't offer to do anything to try and fix the situation. They have rental vehicles, they could have easily offered me a one day rental at no charge to try and make it look like they gave the tiniest of shits, but nope. Terrible customer service, don't deliver what they "guarantee" and don't care that they don't. I called Geico to lodge a formal complaint that they shouldt be using this place. They guy told me it wasn't the first time he's heard stuff like this about JAS.

name: Big Lots
address: Big Lots, 303 US-4 E, Rutland, VT 05701
text: Joe the DM is awesome

name: McDonald's
address: McDonald's, 112 Northside Dr, Bennington, VT 05201
category: ['Fast food restaurant', 'Breakfast restaurant', 'Coffee shop', 'Hamburger restaurant', 'Restaurant', 'Sandwich shop']
hours: [['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: Don’t waste your time trying to get their mobile app to work. If it doesn’t work straight up then it’s probably not supported. Even though when downloading the app there is the message “this works with your device” don’t believe it. After 30 minutes screwing around with the app and talking with customer service (mostly on hold) the rep finally came on and informed me they no longer support my phone. Very frustrating that I was misinformed about the app working on my phone, and waiting soooo long for customer service to answer the call.

name: St. Johnsbury Chrysler Dodge Jeep Ram
address: St. Johnsbury Chrysler Dodge Jeep Ram, 220 Memorial Dr, St Johnsbury, VT 05819
category: ['Car dealer', 'Auto repair shop', 'Chauffeur service', 'Used car dealer']
text: Great people to do business with. They helped me get my 2019 3500 Ram.

name: St. Johnsbury Chrysler Dodge Jeep Ram
address: St. Johnsbury Chrysler Dodge Jeep Ram, 220 Memorial Dr, St Johnsbury, VT 05819
category: ['Car dealer', 'Auto repair shop', 'Chauffeur service', 'Used car dealer']
text: I was working short term in this area and experienced the 5th "Check Engine" light related to emissions in the last few months in my still-under-warranty Dodge RAM. Except for the last time this happened my truck was serviced at a RAM dealership in another area. Since I was near St. Johnsbury when the 5th CE message popped up, I gave St. J's service department a try. I was amazed at quickly they were able to give me an appointment and how hard they worked to resolve this problem that had stumped the other dealerships. Service personnel Rich and Mike were great.

name: St. Johnsbury Chrysler Dodge Jeep Ram
address: St. Johnsbury Chrysler Dodge Jeep Ram, 220 Memorial Dr, St Johnsbury, VT 05819
category: ['Car dealer', 'Auto repair shop', 'Chauffeur service', 'Used car dealer']
text: After filling out a Kelley Blue Book 'Instant Offer' form, I was called the next morning by this dealership and told they wanted to buy my car. We were told both in writing and over the phone by Ariel, the internet sales manager, that 'St. J Auto Chysler Dodge Ram' wanted to buy my Mitsubishi Lancer and would pay between $3000-3700. We drove all the way up from Montpelier, in 2 cars and waited. After sitting and waiting, we were told that they would pay a maximum of $300 (!) And that really, they didn't want our car in their inventory after all. Ariel was apparently there, but never even bothered to show her face, despite the fact that we had an appointment with her. I believe the whole thing was a scam and classic case of bait and switch to get us in the door and try to upsell us something. Don't waste your time here if Kelley Blue Book sends you here with their 'Instant Offer'!

name: KFC
address: KFC, 100 Northside Dr, Bennington, VT 05201
text: Very hit or miss. If you go there early in the afternoon, they're pretty quick. If you go later than 7 or 8 pm, they're a lot slower. They're also out of this-or-that food pretty regularly (this was routine pre-pandemic, too). The staff is nice enough, but for whatever reason, the place seems to struggle with speed, and keeping their food properly stocked. I go there because it's close.

name: KFC
address: KFC, 100 Northside Dr, Bennington, VT 05201
text: I had to give them a star (in order to post this)...I wouldn't give them any!!! Went for the $20 fill up bucket and they didn't have mac & cheese or cole slaw for sides....then they tell me they don't even have enough chicken.....How do you not have enough chicken at 3 pm on a Sunday??? The place is filthy and walls & floors covered in crud...GROSS

name: KFC
address: KFC, 100 Northside Dr, Bennington, VT 05201
text: Get here before 7 pm, otherwise they don't have any chicken. I have never heard of a specialty fast food restaurant run out of their main menu item.

name: Windsor Pet Dental
address: Windsor Pet Dental, 2326 U.S. Rte 5 N, Windsor, VT 05089
text: Never answered my message when I inquired about the place on July 7th (2 weeks at this point). At least they could have responded and said we cannot answer that question online.

name: Piecemeal Pies
address: Piecemeal Pies, 5 S Main St, White River Junction, VT 05001
category: ['Cafe', 'Bakery', 'Bar', 'Brunch restaurant', 'Cider bar', 'Espresso bar', 'Lunch restaurant', 'Takeout Restaurant', 'Pie shop']
text: I love this place - especially their soups, salads and sides - oh, and their chocolate pudding. This guy is great with salads. I have two wishes: more vegan options and that they would stay open till at least 7:00 PM. Please, please, please.

name: Upper Valley Honda
address: Upper Valley Honda, 63 Ralph Lehman Dr, White River Junction, VT 05001
category: ['Honda dealer', 'Auto repair shop', 'Car dealer', 'Tire shop', 'Used car dealer']
text: Both my husband and I cannot thank Mr. Loriston Fennell enough for helping us find our dream car for the 2nd year in a row. He is a class act and super accommodating, given our short notice in searching, financing, and purchasing our new Honda Accord Sport! I am completely in love with it and will continue to be a loyal customer/client @Upper Valley Honda for years to come! Thanks for making this picky girl's dream come true.

name: Upper Valley Honda
address: Upper Valley Honda, 63 Ralph Lehman Dr, White River Junction, VT 05001
category: ['Honda dealer', 'Auto repair shop', 'Car dealer', 'Tire shop', 'Used car dealer']
text: DOWN HILL SINCE UPPER VALLEY I am going to preface this message by stating; I once, used to change my own oil, have ALWAYS changed my own windshield wipers and even changed the entire arm out when I snapped it off of a10 year old camry, amongst other small jobs on cars I have had in the past. I certainly am not stupid or inexperienced when it comes to vehicles. I now get my oil changed by the dealership out of pure convenience and as a luxury because I no longer have to save every penny. The last time I was in was Monday, 3/19/2019. While changing my oil, I was told my wipers needed to be changed ( I knew this, my next stop was going to be autozone buy some and do it, but the price was inexpensive at Upper Valley so I agreed to it. Let me make it clear my rear windshield wiper was still clearing, minus a small section where the rubber had fallen off. On the 21st of March in the morning, there was pollen/dirt on the back so I sprayed it and the windshield wiper completely went over the window, did not touch it all. So, I went in and told them about it and was told there was not enough pressure from the windshield wiper due to corrosion on the arm. I obviously found it extremely hard to believe that was the case and listed off 2 other possibilities and stated "prior to my coming in on Monday, there was contact made to the windshield and now magically there is no contact, corrosion was not identified on Monday.. also my Honda has 83 k ish miles on it.. I find that hard to believe." So after attempting to speak to another manager ( of course in a meeting) I am suppose to go in on 3/22 at 2pm to speak to the manager, which I now longer have to do. I went out, as I should have in the first place and took a better look it, and one of the speculations I listed to the advisor was apparent, the arm was bent up, I simply bent it back. and magic it clears! So in all, I don't appreciate being called a liar or taken as someone who is an idiot about cars. I do my research, I buy Hondas and Toyotas ( and have had then for 10+ yrs.. no corrosion, ever anywhere). This is the second oil change I have had with an extremely long wait and very poor overall service. Again, I don't appreciate being called a liar and attempted to being taken for a ride. If anyone knows, the arms for the wipers are hardly cheap , so why try to tell me sell me something that I don't need and pass blame on not changing something as simple as wiper

name: Oil N' Go
address: Oil N' Go, 1691 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Oil change service', 'Air conditioning repair service', 'Auto repair shop', 'Brake shop', 'Radiator shop', 'Tire shop']
text: Fantastic service. Highly recommend them. I used to go to the Essex location, more often, but I'm living closer to Shelburne Rd. now. I came in with a different vehicle and address and Amanda did a great job updating my information. Carlos Ramos, the manager, handled my vehicle. I came in at 11:30 and was back doing my numerous errands, by noon. The price was great and there are $8 coupons, in several various newspapers around Burlington. He put my mind at ease about my vehicle possibly burning oil, but did recommend a power steering flush, since my vehicle was needing the power steering fluid topped off. I'm back here, at 4 pm, to get it done. I do not just get things done and have said no thanks, to various suggestions, in the past, but I do know cars and this repair is very reasonable and needed. And they are speedy. Carlos is a good technician and honest as the day is long. Great waiting area and super clean bathroom, too. You won't be sorry, if you get your car serviced at Oil n Go.

name: The Fire Tower Restaurant & Tavern
address: The Fire Tower Restaurant & Tavern, 6E Village Square, Stratton, VT 05360
text: It's about the time to post my opinion about this establishment. I can't believe how one of my favorite restaurants at Stratton Mountain become the most disgusting and horrible place on the whole mountain! Let's start than: From outside all looks OK may be except some teenagers sitting on the porch and spitting in one of the fire pits, who cares ? The staff was friendly however they have no clue about the menu or food they serve, they did't even ask if something was wrong when we left most of the food untouched! The food was simply NOT FRESH and probably prepared days in advance! My fish was smelling so bad I couldn't take one bite. I don't know who is in charge of cleaning ? Sticky tables! cloudy and greasy glassware! The floor leading to the kitchen covered in food and grease! The bathroom is like from horror movie, missing tiles,spider webs, mold, sh..t everywhere!!! please do not attempt to use it without hazmat suit! I guess the Health Department would shout this place down after experiencing what I did. I would give zero stars. Message to "chef" Max : Shame on you and your staff!

name: Gardener's Supply Company
address: Gardener's Supply Company, 128 Intervale Rd, Burlington, VT 05401
text: I placed a large online order and will never order from Gardener's Supply again. Parts of the shipped order were damaged and were missing pieces, specifically, the self watering pot conversion kits. Can't communicate with customer service as they do not reply to emails and don't answer their phones. Sent 2 emails with no reply. Called twice. First time I was on hold for 30 minutes and then I gave up. Second time I was on hold for one hour and 15 minutes at the end of which I got a voice message saying that they couldn't process my call and to try again. Apparently they were closing down for the day and just dropped me after I waited on hold for 75 minutes. They also don't reply to requests from the credit card company. Ironically, I purchased two items from them that were made in India and there they know how to package items so they arrived intact. But the locals who dumped all my stuff into one box were negligent and careless. I first tried them after PayPal sent out a blast email they had negotiated with Gardener's Supply, which apparently Gardener's Supply wasn't up to the task. We're now three weeks past my order and still no resolution.

name: Antonicci's Barber Shop
address: Antonicci's Barber Shop, 10 Gosse Ct, Burlington, VT 05408
text: OPEN. Hours of operation are Tuesday - Friday 8:00 am - 5:00 pm, Saturday 8:00 am 1:00 pm. Great Shop!

name: The Lookout Tavern
address: The Lookout Tavern, 2910 Killington Rd, Killington, VT 05751
text: What a nice surprise. After spending the afternoon at @KillingtonAdventureCenter , we stopped by The Lookout Tavern. Daily happy hour specials, 3-6 pm, (i think) are worth going anyday.Everyday is different. We got the Sunday 1/2 price nachos & 1/2 price wings. And nake sure you lookout! Cannot believe the great view of Killington Superstar & Peak Lodge. But even better, we had the best time w fab server, Cassie. We will be back for sure!

name: La Casa Loco Bar & Grill

name: Stowe Mountain Resort
address: Stowe Mountain Resort, 5781 Mountain Rd, Stowe, VT 05672
category: ['Ski resort', 'Day care center', 'Outdoor clothing and equipment shop', 'Ski rental service', 'Ski school', 'Ski shop', 'Summer camp', 'Wedding venue']
text: Stowe Mtn will always have a place in my heart, but after today, I wonder if fairly recent new owner, Vail Resorts, is putting the financial screws to Stowe. Today, Stowe reported a nice 24 hr snowfall of 6 inches... with a few inches after last night close. Read that as a fresh powder morning. The main lot was largely full by 930. AND much much emptier by 1130. WHY? Three out of its four main lifts were "on hold" The Gondola, Sunny, and Sensation, never opened. Effectively cutting off more than half of the skiable acres. Management will likely say it was for our safety, as a light freezing drizzle was falling. However, being a former lift operator there under previous ownership, those lifts operated under much much more adverse conditions. Heck, its an east coast winter... ice is the norm. Wind was our biggest concern and winds were light today. I fear the other lifts were closed to save payroll (may not be fact, but it sure looked like it). I wouldnt go to cost containment so quickly, but the ski rental Demo Center is now closed on Tuesdays and Wednesdays. I found this out the hard way. After renting skis online (I now live in the Rockies) and ordering from the Demo center, I arrive there, confirmred with staff that the Demo Center was still at the base of the quad to pick up rentals, and walked there only to find a message in the window... Closed on Tues/Wed until further notice. Back to Mansfield base where staff apologized for sending me there and off to Spruce center (a long way away) for a limited selection of Demos. The demo center had to be closed for cost reasons, in my opinion. STOWE (or is it Vail?).. The snow is great. The trails are in great shape. You are a destination resort. Don't short change your guests. I love Stowe mountain and becsuse I'm no longer local to you, can't visit as often as I'd like... you can do better.

name: McDonald's

name: Jezebel's Eatery
address: Jezebel's Eatery, 28 W Main St, Wilmington, VT 05363
text: I went to Jezebel's during a Saturday afternoon with my girlfriend and my girlfriends mother. We decided to sit in the newly renovated bar that looked like it would be a nice place to warm up. Everything ran normally smooth until it came down for us to order our meals. I ordered my sandwich and asked for lettuce, tomato, and onion (which did not come on the sandwich)... My first mistake.. The bartender with an attitude said " UHH, it's a hot sandwich!" so I politely ordered it on the side. She actually grunted and rolled her eyes at me because of this. All three of us were kind of taken back. When the meals came she practically tossed it to the point where french fries came off my plate. Right then I made my second mistake.... I asked if I could possibly get a pickle... The bartender answered with a scowl on her face " We don't do pickles. That would be too common." At this point lunch has now officially became awkward for us. We finished our meals trying to ignore the elephant in the room. When the bartender brought over the check she said to my girlfriend and girlfriends mother "Have a great day ladies." completely acting like I didn't exist. My girlfriends mother even said "and gentleman." The bartender then turned around and said "Oh, I thought you would relay the message." I have never gotten so much heat in my life over lettuce, tomato, pickles and onions. I will never return nor suggest to eat here. The food was just ok, definitely not worth going through the scrutiny for slight alterations.. Plenty of better places to eat around Mount Snow.

text: Placed order over the phone at 8:27 PM on a Friday. I was told it would be 20 min. Went in to pick up the order after 20 min to find out the two cold grinders hadn’t been made yet, and that the steak/cheese/peppers/onions grinder had only the steak put through the oven. It was not busy at all.... it took ANOTHER 10 min for them to make the three grinders while I stood and waited . All of this, only to find that the steak grinder had NO peppers, and raw onions, and one of the other grinders no mayo. They had ONE job to do......

text: Just another day to not miss 2020 ,team part of warp speed team ,disorganized ,untrained ,clueless ,had 6.15 reservation ,we were seated @ 6ish got drinks in good time soup and salad not to bad ,635pm ,than we started watching room no one was eating ,we tried to be patient after 2 hrs asked to see mgr ,no show ! asked again to see mgr ! finally showed as we were leaving @ 8.50 pm ,told mgr she should be more attentive to dining room if kitchen is failing ,she stood in front like a deer in headlights with no comment ,nothing ,great news year dinner ,not glad to see 2020 go !!!!!! no stars !!!

name: J Morgan's Steakhouse
address: J Morgan's Steakhouse, 100 State St, Montpelier, VT 05602
text: So first off, I want to say, my husband and I have never been disappointed with the food here. The food really is delicious. But my most recent experience with the staff was not as nice, so unfortunately for that reason alone I am giving it 3 stars. I'd love to some how just let the general managers know of what happened, so this is the best way for me to inform them. So last night I ordered take out, Cajun Shrimp Entree and the Millionaires Baked Potato. The lady on the telephone said my Entree comes with a salad, she asked, would you like the House Salad, Ceasar Salad or the Cobb Salad. So I asked her what the last one was, so she started describing it and said it came with bacon, I immediately said yes because who doesn't like bacon on their salad?? So when I got to the restaurant to pick up my order, I left with a small take out bag. I thought it seemed small but just gave it the benefit of the doubt. I then dove all the way home (25 minutes) and realized when I got home that the Cobb salad I was supposed to get wasn't in the bag. Then I got my phone to call and realized the restaurant left a message. A manager named Trevor called and told me the "house salad" was at the restaurant still. He was very nice about it. So I called him back and he made sure I would be able to pick up a new one the next day. (At this point I didn't know there was a difference between the House salad and the Cobb salad, I thought he just meant the salad that came with my meal, the Cobb I was expecting). Anyways to make a long story short... I called around 3 today like I said I would, and asked for a manager. The lady that answered the phone (Emily) said she was a manager. So I explained the situation, that the girl the night before told me I would get a Cobb salad with my meal but it was never in the bag. So Trevor said I could get it tomorrow. No matter how much I tried to explain that the girl said I would get a Cobb salad, Emily refused to give me one, she said I was never charged for a Cobb salad and that they don't come with entrees, but I was supposed to just get a small House salad.... That is not the point, if you already mess up an order by not giving someone a salad when they are supposed to, don't give them the wrong salad even if they weren't charged for it! If that's what they ordered, then give it to them... And to top it off, she never even said "have a nice day" to me and just whisked me away when I came to pick up the house sale, which, looks pretty pitiful... I am pretty disappointed with how it was handled. Because I really wanted that Cobb salad I thought I was supposed to get! I'm sorry, I know it's just a salad, but it still means something.

name: UVM Medical Center
address: UVM Medical Center, 111 Colchester Ave, Burlington, VT 05401
hours: [['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: Last week l underwent a complete hip surgery at the University of Vermont Medical Center. Everything about the experience was stellar ! The various staff members of all levels : Dr. Campbell and his team, the nursing staff , the physical therapy team, the cleaning staff and the food department were kind, competent, exceedingly thorough and professional . There was a definite sense of a consistency amongst the staff giving the message that myself (and all of us as patients ) were in "good hands". Pain management rational and decisions were shared with the patient and the experience of undergoing major surgery was more manageable and less traumatic due to the wonderful competence and compassion of the nursing staff and the physical therapist assigned to me. When l realized that going home was not a good option for me and that l needed to go to rehab - this change of plans midstream was handled graciously and seamlessly by the office staff. Would it help to know that the food offered on the menus was comparable to a five-star restaurant?! It sounded like it would be delicious and l was not disappointed - it was ! The physical plant of the hospital was kept meticulously clean , which added to the overall experience of being in a hospital where pride was taken its being sanitary. Physical therapy was amazing. I really could not have asked for more compassionate and expert care from my physical therapist. The University of Vermont Medical Center has top rating in my book. I have experienced emergency room visits there as well as now this major hip surgery -and l cannot say enough excellent things about this fine hospital.

text: Outstanding!!! My husband and I called for take out at 8:06 PM. This was our first time ordering from Kismayo, so we didn’t know they closed at 8. The owner answered the phone and insisted he take care of us, in a way that made us feel special. Not only was the Philly steak sandwich the best we’ve EVER had, but the tea (that the owner gave to us as a courtesy) was AMAZING! It was exactly what we needed on a cold night. I have never been so impressed with customer service! Thank you Kismayo Kitchen! [raising hands light skin tone]

name: Five Guys
address: Five Guys, 49 Church St, Burlington, VT 05401
category: ['Hamburger restaurant', 'American restaurant', 'Fast food restaurant', 'Hot dog restaurant', 'Hot dog stand', 'Restaurant']
text: I want to personally congratulate everyone who was on shift April 18 at around 245 pm. We were met with nothing but friendly, personable employees who exemplified teamwork and excellent customer service. While waiting at the cash register to order, and deciding on our meals, the employee there apologized for the wait while attending to someone else and offered a complimentary milkshake because he couldn’t help us immediately. We then waited an appropriate amount of time for our burgers to be made fresh, and upon receiving our order the line employee apologized for the ‘wait’. Withou us having complained, said ‘I already included extra fries in the bag for you’. Regardless of us not perceiving to have waited long at all for our meals, your chain is AHEAD of customer service by putting the customer first always. What we also observed was none of the 18-20 year old employees spending time on their phones, or talking about the party last night, but talking with each other about work. They shared the work load by alternating through various roles in the restaurant, taking turns doing garbage and straightening out items, ensuring the restaurant appeared clean and tidy. They were extremely friendly and kind. Working in a customer service industry myself, I was beyond impressed by these employees and want to ensure they are aware that their hard work does not go unnoticed. Please pass along sincere thanks and appreciation- it may be a part time job, and it may just be a burger (albeit a damn good one ;))but when you do such a phenomenally AMAZING good job, it makes a difference! These skills will stay with you and translate into so many aspects of your future careers!

Partly because she was having a full blown conversation with the person ahead of me but says 2 words to me. I used to work at a Subway when I was younger. The inefficiency today was rediculous.

name: Tire Warehouse
address: Tire Warehouse, 919 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: I dropped my car off yesterday morning expecting to have my winter tires changed. My tires were in the trunk, and I spoke to someone last week who assured me that it would get done at some point during the day, despite not having an appointment. These guys have always been fantastic, so I had no reason to doubt that. I called after 4pm to check in, because I hadn't heard from anyone. The guy I spoke to said that he was staying late and would put my car on next and would call me to come pick it up a little later, which I really appreciated. 3 hours later and still no call. I tried calling the store at 7, but of course it didn't ring because the store was closed. So now I'm stuck without a car all day and overnight. I left a message which wasn't returned, and came to pick up my car this morning, hoping that the tires had been changed and they just forgot to call me. Of course the tires hadn't been changed, and the woman I spoke to at the front desk was rude, dismissive, and disinterested. She **wasn't wearing a mask**, or standing behind the plexiglass partition. She made no effort whatsoever to rectify the situation, explain or apologize, and said that they didn't have any appointments available for 3 weeks, without even checking the computer. She said they *might* be able to get to it if I waited in the store for an hour. I can't miss work for a maybe. I work in healthcare and drive a lot for work, I need my tires changed. If they had told me they weren't going to be able to do it yesterday, everything would have been fine. Instead I wasted an entire day and $30 in uber fees for absolutely nothing. 0/10 would not recommend.

text: One of the first times going there, I ended up paying for a wash but the truck in front of me was having issues and ended up triggering my wash to start with him in the bay. I was called promptly Monday morning and was left a message (I missed the call) informing me they watched the tapes and had seen what had happened, and asked for my card so they could refund the wash to me. Not only a great wash I received but they made my day by correcting the annoyance from the day prior. I would highly recommend [thumbs up]

name: Family Table

text: I'll begin with the only good part; the food - once it finally arrived - was very good! That is where the positives end. I imagine the following experience could be attributed to us arriving at 8:05 pm when they close at 9pm, but otherwise there is no excuse for this poor experience. Don't get me wrong, the waitresses were very friendly, but it took 10 minutes before our waitress even introduced herself, she never asked for our drink order, then didn't come back to take our food order for 15 minutes!! In addition, they didn't have a main dish, admitted it would take 30 minutes to make the fried chicken, but STILL took 20 minutes to bring out the food. We didn't get our food until 9:05 pm...but it did taste good. Nevertheless, I will never go back!

name: Humane Society Of Chittenden County
address: Humane Society Of Chittenden County, 142 Kindness Ct, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: Went in a while back to help my sister looks at some dogs for adoption. We went in at 5 pm on a weeknight because that is when we were out of work. They didnt close till 6. When we got there we were told we weren't going to be able to see any of the dogs, but we could see pictures of them. We were told there wasn't enough staff to bring the dogs up to see us and that was why. While we were being told this we saw 2 staff members leave for the night. We were incredibly disappointed as we had driven all the way there from Huntington, and we couldn't understand why they would be understaffed when there was still an hour till closing at presumably one of their busiest times. Needless to say we went elsewhere and adopted.
