name: The Blue Stone
address: The Blue Stone, 13 Stowe St, Waterbury Village Historic District, VT 05676
text: We come here a lot when we're here on vacation. Just know that this place is busy - not just at dinner time but 2:30 pm on a Tuesday afternoon. And there's a reason for it - the pizza is really tasty. There are specialty pizzas on the board - but you can design your own and just have what you want on it. The staff and management are laid back (this is Vermont) but we've always had good to excellent service. We bring all our guests to Blue Stone because its always been a good experience.

name: Moe's Southwest Grill
address: Moe's Southwest Grill, 85 Retail Way, Williston, VT 05495
text: Ate there at 830 pm... food was cold service was extremely slow three people there only one person doing anything, and he couldn't roll mine or my wifes burrito which is smaller than it used to be but yet costs more money...they both came out about 3 inches long and three inches wide...due to placing all the ingredients in the center...like come on man spread the ingredients out so it looks like a burrito not a ball...we took a few bites each tossed the rest and three hours later were both sharing a toilet as all the food I've ever eaten violently projects out of my body...they need to be checked by the health inspector...

name: McDonald's
address: McDonald's, 71 Upper Main St, Essex Junction, VT 05452
category: ['Fast food restaurant', 'Breakfast restaurant', 'Coffee shop', 'Hamburger restaurant', 'Restaurant', 'Sandwich shop']
text: We were at this Location last night 01/12/2020 at approx 7:30 pm and there was only one customer at the counter waiting for her order we stood there and the clerk working kept putting the lady at counter order together and then gave it to her and then went back. And filled up French fries and we stood there for about 3 to 4 minutes and the clerk never acknowledged us then finished what he was doing then came over to us and asked what we wanted and my wife asked if the Fish sandwich was still 2 for $5.00 he said yes so we ordered 2 fish Sandwich’s and large Fry and Coffee and I asked for 2 creams and my wife asked for a cup of Hot water so we paid $10.99 for what we ordered so they gave us a number we went sat down and waited at least another 5 minutes for our order and it came from the person in back that was cooking and did not get any cream for my coffee and it was cold tasted like they Ran it twice threw the Machine so I went up to counter and the person still did not acknowledge me so I went sat down and my wife went up and had to speak out at the person and the food was not very hot and another person came up to counter and had to speak out his order was short 2 Happy meals the clerk just grab the Happy meals and handed them to the person no apology for not giving them to customer and there were mor customers there now will be a long time before we go to that McDonalds again They should go to Milton for Lessons keep up good job Milton Andy C

name: Carriage House Cafe & Grill
address: Carriage House Cafe & Grill, 27 Water St, Orleans, VT 05860
text: I give it five stars because it is the best place to eat. the service is good. the food is really good and the enviorment is calm and relaxed this is the best place in the world to eat if I could give the food a rating it would be a 100000000000 out of 5 and if I could give the people service a rating it would be a 5 out of 5 so if u are in the area stop in and say hi and I am sure that u will go again.

name: Everest Indian-Nepali Restaurant
address: Everest Indian-Nepali Restaurant, 1208 Williston Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: This was my first time getting food from this place. Amazing food and very hospitable people. I got off work at 11 p.m and went there to get Chicken Bryani because they are open until 11:30 pm. Try it and you won't regret it. Delicious food!

name: Everest Indian-Nepali Restaurant
address: Everest Indian-Nepali Restaurant, 1208 Williston Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
text: I called them at 8.43 pm and their restaurant shows it closes at 9.30 pm. The person who’s taking order said they’re closed! 45 minutes before! Will never order from here again. So unprofessional.

name: Pot Belly Pub
address: Pot Belly Pub, 130 Main St, Ludlow, VT 05149
text: Nice place for a bar burger. In 2018-2019 they were not open and then open again. Unreliable. Burger was good though. Shoutout to Bill.[beaming face with smiling eyes]

name: CubeSmart Self Storage
address: CubeSmart Self Storage, 62 Old Ferry Rd, Brattleboro, VT 05301
category: ['Self-storage facility', 'Moving and storage service', 'Moving supply store', 'Storage facility']
text: This is Wayne Bauer. Unit Z03. People are very personable and courteous, especially Angie Johnson. Angie is an asset to this company, knowledgeable and very friendly. My email is waynebauer7@gmail.com

name: Shear Designs Hair Studio & Tanning
address: Shear Designs Hair Studio & Tanning, 735 Putney Rd, Brattleboro, VT 05301
text: the only reason I give this place two stars is due to the friendliness of the staff. Otherwise it was overall a poor performance . booked two pedicures for son's wedding . I was told we could have them done at the same time and it would take one hr. When we got there we were waiting for 20 mins before we were sent up for the pedicures. There was one staff there . The nail polish selection was sad , lack of any variety of colors. Things were not prepped to start us. My daughter had to stand and wait for her chair to be available. I did not see anyone clean the foot bucket between clients and even after she got seated, she had to wait at least 10 more mins if not longer for another staff to arrive to help. The supposed hour was almost up and she had not even started soaking her feet. My pedicure was poorly done, very little cleaning under the nails and there was NO clipping done on my nails. Then I had a mini manicure . At the last minute, after the clear polish was applied the woman finally thought of cleaning under my nails. I had to file them smooth on my own later as they were left irregularly shaped. While it was fun talking with both of the staff and they were very pleasant , each time the one taking care of me had something to say, she literally stopped what she was doing while she was talking ! We got there for 11 am appointments that were going to take about one hour and we left there a little BEFORE 1:00 PM ! And , to add insult to injury, the next day the polish on both feet had smudged and I had been wearing flip flops from Friday night through wedding Saturday . Despite this I gave a waaaayyy too large tip to each because everyone needs to make a living BUT maybe something can be learned from this POOR review !

name: Burger King
address: Burger King, 548 Canal St, Brattleboro, VT 05301
text: Very convenient off the first I-91 exit in Vermont. The extended drive through hours (through midnight) make this one of the few places to get something to eat after 9 PM in this part of New England. These guys probably can't wait for the Pandemic to end. This BK location closed in February 2020 for "remodel.". They actually razed the entire structure and completely rebuilt on the footprint of the older Building. The new dining room looks great, but it has yet to be used. Drive-through service is very fast and friendly.

name: Sticky Fingers Bakery
address: Sticky Fingers Bakery, 210 VT-100, West Dover, VT 05356
text: The worst customer service in Vermont ! If you need bread or baguette at 8:30 am in the morning , definitely not the right place to shop as bread won't be ready till 11 am .... and they close at 4 pm . The owner / manager / employee with a read beard is the one you do not want to deal with ... so rude .... there are places in mount snow which deserves my $ but definitely not this one . Croissants are even nicer at 7 eleven . And for Baguette go shop at Snow mountain market on route 100 . Sticky fingers is not the place to shop for sure .

name: Mimmo's Pizzeria & Restaurant - Essex
address: Mimmo's Pizzeria & Restaurant - Essex, 4 Carmichael St #102, Essex Junction, VT 05452
text: We really like the food at this restaurant and we continue to go and order take out but we question why. Many times when we arrive home the food is cold and many times the order is wrong. My husband literally just waited an hour for our take out order . He finally got home at 8 PM so we could eat. If they could just tighten up their customer service we’d go more often and order more often.

name: Mimmo's Pizzeria & Restaurant - Essex
address: Mimmo's Pizzeria & Restaurant - Essex, 4 Carmichael St #102, Essex Junction, VT 05452
text: June 2017- I've decided to move on from this restaurant. I'm tired of stray hairs in my food and I'm tired of getting someone else's pizza home only to discover that they gave me two much less expensive cheese and a pepperoni pizza's. I was a regular here, but no more. I called them and instead of pulling up my account and saying we will comp you or better yet deliver you the correct pizzas they just said you can bring those back and will cook you new ones. How can you tell kids it will be another hour (it's already 7 pm) .? If this was the first time it happened I wouldn't write this, but I am tired of the cooks and preparers not wearing hats to catch their hairs and tired of the wrong pizza. Edit...Nov. 2, 2017 @5:45 We decided to stop in because we were without power and they were close. Big Mistake! We were seated over looking the sandwich prep area . One girl was using gloves on both hands , but the other was wearing one glove and when the owner was near she only used that hand to fix the sandwich. As soon as he walked away she scratched her ear and head and moved lettuce onto the sandwich with the bare hand that she was scratching with. Needless to say this is gross. My club soda had a small fly in it. At first I thought it was a black crumb, but I removed it and discovered it resembled a flea, but I'm not sure it was. I just know it was a bug. My food was hot so I'm sure it would kill off any bad things, but my kids pizza had a hair in the pizza. It wasn't very long and I think it was a mans hair. My kids are blond and this was black. We are finally done here-power or not.

name: Seward Family Restaurant
address: Seward Family Restaurant, 224 N Main St, Rutland, VT 05701
text: Don't eat there! My wife and I went in to order out at 8:30 pm...the waitress Linda was very kind, but the cook (who turned out later to be Mr. Seward the owner!) looked agitated that he had to cook a scallop dinner so late and was slamming things around, he even put his bare hands in the fries to place in the fryulator The scallops and fries were melted into the styrofoam and the coleslaw was rancid! Worst food ever, we didn't eat it and the dog even turned his nose away

name: Price Chopper
address: Price Chopper, 170 Swanton Rd. Rte, 7, St. Albans Town, VT 05478
text: Visited Price Chopper tonight after a long day of work. Was ordering a butterfly shrimp meal at the seafood department. The women that was cooking it had told me it was going to be a little bit for it. I said ok and waited a little while for it while I watched her do tons of orders by herself. She seemed frustrated and upset. Order after order, finally I see her working on mine. Patiently I watched her and she came over to say she put a couple extra shrimp in my dinner because I waited so patiently. Then we spoke about our long hour shifts and how she is 63 and still doing 3 am rises and 3 PM closes if not later some days. She handed me my dinner and said "Here you go hun, have a great night." What I'm getting at is... it meant a lot to see someone like her having such a rough night but yet still giving great customer service. She saw a customer waiting for awhile and she did such a nice thing to cheer me up. It did not go unnoticed that I saw how thoughtful and kind she was. I will be back just because of this women. Pricechopper is now my go to store all because of this women.

name: Vermont Teddy Bear Factory
address: Vermont Teddy Bear Factory, 6655 Shelburne Rd, Shelburne, VT 05482
text: The teddy bears are super expensive cause they’re hand made locally. There’s also a station to make your own teddy bear. When we visited they hosted “passion for paws” outside and had a lot of dogs and puppies up for adoption which was pretty cool. The tours are every half hour during summer and on the hour all year long. Last tour at 3:30 pm so make sure you’re there before that. All Vermonters under the age of 4 get a free teddy, which is pretty cool. (There’s a procedure you can look up online)

name: Sidehill Farm
address: Sidehill Farm, 22 Browne Ct, Brattleboro, VT 05301
text: First tasted in Vermont @Shelburne Farms... Love the Mango Habanero, but the Hot Red Pepper is my favorite. The extra spicy and sweet make my taste buds rock. More that a Jam to me... Use it in my oatmeal as a sweetener... Give scramble eggs an extra kick!

name: Vermont Board of Nursing
address: Vermont Board of Nursing, 89 Main St 3rd Floor, Montpelier, VT 05620
text: I was looking to renew my VT nursing RN license after leaving in NY for a while. I had a question and I called the VT board of Nursing. An outgoing VM stated that it was Monday and that she would be at meetings all day and that I should leave a message. First of all it was Thursday and I felt that leaving a message would be useless, since she is at"meetings all day". What a poor excuse for an important State agency. I am adding another review,,I finally got my license renewed. But the problem is that VT only had the clerk and the director working there. Only 2 people for a state agency The one that I finally did speak with was nice to me and did her best to get my paperwork through. Mine was a more complex case

name: Taste of India
address: Taste of India, 1 Bakery Ln, Middlebury, VT 05753
text: Have been ordering here all year 2020-2021. They are consistent and delicious. We haven't had anything we didn't love. Great food all around.

name: Taste of India
address: Taste of India, 1 Bakery Ln, Middlebury, VT 05753
text: Food is good. Definitely recommend to a friend. Also, if you will be reaching after 2 PM recommend calling the restaurant ahead of your arrival.

name: Quarterstaff Games
address: Quarterstaff Games, 152 Church St, Burlington, VT 05401
text: Great selection. Knowledgeable, and helpful staff. Gaming and demo area. Daily events. I was planning a surprise D&D game for my husbands birthday, and had no idea what I was doing. I got superior guidance from Jason, and he even put me in touch with the go-to DM in the area for special events. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

name: Canteen Creemee Company
address: Canteen Creemee Company, 5123 Main St, Waitsfield, VT 05673
category: ['Takeout Restaurant', 'Fried chicken takeaway', 'Hamburger restaurant', 'Ice cream shop', 'Restaurant']
text: The creemee was excellent but girl who took our order was not. She needs to pay attention to the order she's taking. Photo credit @pathway photography

name: Norwich Farmers Market
address: Norwich Farmers Market, 281 Route 5 South, Norwich, VT 05055
text: Oh ya, this is one of the best farmers markets in VT. (My other fave is in Burlington.) Plenty of vendors to browse including food, veggies, honey, meats, pickles, jams, baked goods and syrup. Artists and some crafts. Wow, it's all there. Eat it there or take it home. Say Hi to Bill at On the Edge Farm and grass fed meats for me. Every Saturday morning til 1 pm. Go!

name: Laughing Moon Chocolates
address: Laughing Moon Chocolates, 78 S Main St, Stowe, VT 05672
text: The lights were on and the door said closing at 6pm. It is currently 4:16 pm and I went around 410pm. Lady inside saw me. She was sooo close to the door organizing the chocolates but completely ignored and looked away. She did this 3X or more. I figured maybe she doesn’t work here but ... anyways. She eventually came by the door and said “we’re closed” and she shut the door on my face with 0 care to what the door said. Horrible customer service. I wouldn’t go back if I could.

name: Laughing Moon Chocolates
address: Laughing Moon Chocolates, 78 S Main St, Stowe, VT 05672
text: Oh My Dogs!!! This place is a chocolate lover's paradise!!! The Buttercrunch with Pecans is incredible as are the other barks - the truffles are amazing - AND THE FUDGE!!!!! They give demonstrations at about 2 pm daily - and if you even remotely love chocolate you will walk out with many fine treats! For those traveling through and/or staying in Stowe - this is a great place to spend some time! And if you like what you try - they have a great online service so you can re order for yourself and send to your friends for holidays and special occasions! A great place!!!

name: Pick & Shovel
address: Pick & Shovel, 54 Coventry St, Newport, VT 05855
category: ['Department store', 'Clothing store', 'Hardware store', 'Ice cream shop', 'Laundromat', 'Pet store', 'Shoe store', 'Souvenir store', 'Swimming pool supply store', 'Toy store']
text: Greg hammond one of the owners is very unprofessional I returned a time he didnt get the proper message called me up calling me a divk head and I tried to resolve the issue he called me names and said some messed up stuff. Wouldnt recolmend a place that condones that behavior froma owner

name: Four Corners of the Earth
address: Four Corners of the Earth, 310 Pine St, Burlington, VT 05401
text: I went here a bit late (5:40 pm) and the owner was amazing. He was happy to help and our sandwiches were amazing. I'm from NC so things here in VT are a bit pricey for me. It was about 30 bucks for two people to eat but the food was amazing.

name: Planet Fitness
address: Planet Fitness, 30 Community Dr, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Gym', 'Fitness center', 'Personal trainer', 'Spa and health club', 'Tanning salon']
hours: [['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: My wife and I have been members for over a year now, and we have ZERO complaints! The staff is always friendly and accommodating; there is plenty of equipment to use, outside of the end of day (4 to 7 pm) rush hour during wintertime; the equipment is kept clean and sparkly; and you can't beat the price! Now the men's room is a bit small, and can be a hassle during those winter peak hours, but hey, it's not Caesar's Palace, am I right? Kudos to Shawna and staff!

name: Planet Fitness
address: Planet Fitness, 30 Community Dr, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Gym', 'Fitness center', 'Personal trainer', 'Spa and health club', 'Tanning salon']
hours: [['Monday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Tuesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Wednesday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Thursday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Friday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Saturday', 'Open 24 hours'], ['Sunday', 'Open 24 hours']]
text: I had really unpleasant experience today at PF South Burlington VT location. Apparently one of the staff members, Ericka, told manager how I went behind front desk and started hydromassage bed by myself while she was away doing errands (few weeks ago). So manager pulled me on a side today soon as I got to the gym and with very mean attitude told me 'If you do that again, I will cancel your membership.' I was blindsided, didn't even had a chance to think of what happened. I remember saying 'I would never go behind front desk and do such thing.' I was very shocked with manager's attitude. Last thing I need to hear after long working day is someone blame me for something I didn't do. I challenge manager / district manager / owner of this franchise to check camera footage and find out who is telling truth, me or Ericka, staff member. Why would Ericka do such thing? I assume because I asked her nicely to refill paper towel dispenser twice in last couple weeks and maybe she didn't feel like doing it. If so, I apologize for bringing that up, I will never ever mention something like that again. I thought message: 'At Planet Fitness, we're here to provide a unique environment in which anyone – and we mean anyone – can be comfortable...' is true. What I experienced today from manager (and obviously Ericka) is far from that! I am member of this gym for a long time and no one ever threaten me before or made me feel unwanted. What happened with 'Thumb up' policy PF has?!? This goes beyond words! Message to the owner of this franchise - if you find me on cameras behind front desk, I am offering to pay fine in the amount equal to anual black card membership (which I have), as an apology for what I did! If you find out I've been accused for something I didn't do, I am asking for manager to resign from her position, become regular staff and have assistant manager take over her managing duties. Cause manager should NEVER accuse member without having proof 100% - even then, I am still MEMBER, there HAS to be way to solve things peacefully. At the end, without us, members, this gym wouldn't exist! If manager simply asked me if I did it or not, instead of treatening me with canceling membership, I might had chance explain her that hydromassage bed was 'paused' when I got there, all I did is hit 'play' button on bed screen itself.

name: Alderman's Chevrolet Buick GMC
address: Alderman's Chevrolet Buick GMC, 65 Windcrest Rd, Rutland, VT 05701
category: ['Chevrolet dealer', 'Car dealer', 'Car repair and maintenance', 'Used car dealer']
text: Have a week long scheduled appointment. This was my FIRST time bringing my vehicle I. For maintenance with this company. I woke up an hour early to go into work early so I could leave to bring my car there on time for 8:00 am i tell the guy I’m out of work at 2:30pm and I will be there by 2:45 to pick it up. So I drove my car into the bay and I’m told everything will be done and to look out for a text for a estimated price. 11:30 rolls around that day and I still have yet to receive anything so I text the number and I was told my vehicle has NOT been touched because of walk in tire exchanges... now I know for a fact anywhere else the scheduled appointments are always first in line. I get told it isn’t under his control that one guy is the one who calls the shots. I’m irritated at this point and the guy knew it so he decides to offer me a loaner vehicle that they DIDNT have available... well that just put the icing on top so as I’m struggling to figure out what I am going to do I was offered by my mother to use a vehicle of hers for the time being. So I get to the dealership and I tell him that and to keep my car so that it can be looked at when he gets a chance because he said to me he was the one specifically going to be working on my car... well the next day rolls around and I get a text message with a video from some random guy in the shop telling me my car needs this needs that needs this and that... so my level of frustration goes up... I specifically told this guy I wanted 3 things done to it. And when they quoted me the price of 2800$ Not including tax and not including the 120$ diagnostic fee that NOBODY decided to tell me about KNOWING that I was a first timer here! So that put a cherry on top of the icing.... I asked to speak to a manager I get told they spoke to one and they cut the fee in half for me... that’s not what I had asked... I asked again to speak to a manager face to face when I pick up my vehicle because I don’t want them touching my car at this point! I get told ok I’ll let him know. Then I get told that there’s always been a fee for diagnostic... well if only that were mentioned to me the 4 times they had the chance too twice in person and twice through text! Plus I went in telling them what I WANTED done and in that case there shouldn’t have been any diagnostic happening it should’ve been accepted and taken care of and if anything else were to happen or they see something while fixing then tell the customer. I’m so frustrated with my first time going there that I don’t even want to purchase a vehicle from aldermans and I was sure thinking too before this ever happened to me. I will not recommend anyone here as for everyone I have told this story too seems to have a negative opinion about this company anyways so CLEARLY THINGS NEED TO CHANGE! I won’t be bringing my business back here what so ever. Oh by the way I still never got the chance to speak with a manager.

name: Alderman's Chevrolet Buick GMC
address: Alderman's Chevrolet Buick GMC, 65 Windcrest Rd, Rutland, VT 05701
category: ['Chevrolet dealer', 'Car dealer', 'Car repair and maintenance', 'Used car dealer']
text: Everything went smoothly start to finish. Sent an online message. Received a response from a sales rep by the next morning (I sent it late at night so only a few hours). Afterwards, the sales person, Walt, searches for a few trucks for me and then ultimately helped me buy a truck. All of this happened within a few days of initially reaching out. Walt and team made everything go very smoothly. Very happy with our new truck.

name: Alderman's Chevrolet Buick GMC
address: Alderman's Chevrolet Buick GMC, 65 Windcrest Rd, Rutland, VT 05701
category: ['Chevrolet dealer', 'Car dealer', 'Car repair and maintenance', 'Used car dealer']
text: Read the message I sent to you though your customer service website. I have yet to hear back from anyone. For those owners of 2013 Duramax Diesel who may need NOx sensors, shop around as, unfortunately I did not, I was charged $360 for a sensor that can be purchased from other sources for under $160 for the same AC-Delco part number. This is a shameful markup on parts. Caveat Emptor!!

name: The Alchemist Stowe
address: The Alchemist Stowe, 100 Cottage Club Rd, Stowe, VT 05672
text: The Alchemist Stowe is open to the public. Retail hours are 11 AM - 7 PM Tuesday through Saturday. The Waterbury location on Crossroad is no longer open to the public. The Prohibition Pig is now located in the original Alchemist Pub & Brewery on Main Street in Waterbury.

name: The White Cottage Snack Bar
address: The White Cottage Snack Bar, 863 W Woodstock Rd, Woodstock, VT 05091
category: ['Fast food restaurant', 'Hamburger restaurant', 'Ice cream shop', 'Seafood restaurant']
text: The only place for a quick dinner at 9 pm. Service quick. Food like made at home. Very clean.

name: Myer's Bagel Bakery
address: Myer's Bagel Bakery, 377 Pine St, Burlington, VT 05401
text: Local favorite off Pine Street. A bit hard to find, so just look for the clapboard sign posted on the West side of the street at the entrance. The bakery is hidden off the road but parking is plentiful. Great Montreal bagels, as well as a wide selection of other flavors and cream cheese. Cozy tables. Sorry, no pets allowed. Staff is friendly and fast with orders, but call ahead a couple days for party orders and before holidays (ask about holiday hours). Highly recommended! Hours 4am - 4 pm.

name: Kevin's
address: Kevin's, 27 Main St, North Bennington, VT 05257
text: Don't let the sport bar atmosphere fool you. The food is excellent, and they are open late. Where else in Bennington at 9:00 pm are you going to find first rate seafood? The next evening, I had better veal ossobuco than I prepare at home. The prices are fair; the staff is friendly and prompt. Definitely worth a visit.

name: McDonald's
address: McDonald's, 180 Depot St, Manchester, VT 05255
category: ['Fast food restaurant', 'Breakfast restaurant', 'Coffee shop', 'Hamburger restaurant', 'Restaurant', 'Sandwich shop']
text: This McDonalds has terrible customer service, you must always check and make sure what you purchased is in your bag and that it is correct. Just last weekend I waited 17 minutes for 2 happy meals and only 1 car in front of me at 7:45 pm. My boys fries were cold and we live 10 minutes away and when we got home and I opened them one only had 3 of the 4 piece nugget we ordered. I then had a 5 year old and a 3 year old arguing and upset because I do not get it that often for them. I called they told me they would replace the order at my next visit, I went to do so 2 days later and only to be told they could not do so!! Ugh. Another instance, just this Saturday evening my fiance and I felt like a late night snack and I drove to Manchester at 11:20 pm arrived at 11:30 (the drive thru is open until 12am Friday & Saturday) to sit at the speaker and have no one answer, I drove around d front got out walled around knocking on the doors and also calling the store several times to only have the employees hiding in the store. All lights on inside & outside and their two cars parked in the parking lot. So terrible, just simply terrible!!

name: Frazer's Place
address: Frazer's Place, 2066 VT-12, Windsor, VT 05089
text: Not a great burger or onion rings. The maple soft serve was awesome. Just average and no thought or creativity here. Just simple so so beef either frozen patties or grocery store hamburg. People were friendly enough but food was only so so. Update on 09-27-2020 Got an awesome awesome double bacon cheeseburger on Sunday night. Lettuce, tomatoes, onion, extra pickle and mayo, ketchup, mustard. Burger was out of this world awesome. They certainly have stepped it up in the kitchen thats for sure!!

name: Fairlee Diner
address: Fairlee Diner, Main St, Fairlee, VT 05045
text: Excellent breakfasts! Quick service! Get here before they close @ 2:00 PM. I asked that my toast be burnt so it looked like my black coffee & it was. Just the way I like it. Omelet was excellent. Will return!

name: McDonald's
address: McDonald's, 1125 Shelburne Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
category: ['Fast food restaurant', 'Breakfast restaurant', 'Coffee shop', 'Hamburger restaurant', 'Restaurant', 'Sandwich shop']
text: Six cars in front of me.3:05 pm. 20 minutes. Wow!! It was always my understanding if the order is going to take a long time they ask the customer to park and they bring the order to them when done. Not at this McDonalds. I realize there has been a big push not to have food waiting under the heat lamps for hours but 20 minutes for an iced coffee? This service takes the fast food out of the equation. Most people stop at McDonalds because they don't have the time to wait. They need to figure something out.

name: Simon Pearce
address: Simon Pearce, 1760 Quechee Main St, Quechee, VT 05059
text: I love this place! It's been one of my favorite restaurants to visit for the past 10+ years. It's a 2 - 3 hr drive from my hometown but it's always worth the drive! I prefer their lunch menu purely because of their homemade mini scones - I'm addicted to them! Make sure you arrive at least 1 hour before they close for lunch (2:30 pm). They don't except reservations for lunch and there's almost always a wait... if it's really busy, they are forced to stop taking names for the wait list. Multiple times I've had to wait 30-60 minutes for a table but no complaints from me; I'll gladly wait. You don't want to miss out on their delicious food, locally inspired cocktails, beautiful scenery and of course their famous glass blowing artwork and more!

name: Simon Pearce
address: Simon Pearce, 1760 Quechee Main St, Quechee, VT 05059
text: 6 empty seats at the bar and were told we would not be seated because it was too busy. Horrible delivery on that message too!
